analyzed: gihi sahāyo ti gihi kālataḥ paṭṭhāya sahāyo paccakkhāto ti yena ākārena paccakkhānā tam

analyzed: dassetum paccakkhāmi itiādi vuttam  uddissāti satthukāra bhāvena uddissāti ayam ettha adhippāyaḥ ti tam dassentaḥ bhagavā

original: 14. Paripubbo dahita-saddo vatthanivāsanaṃ vadatīti āha “paridahito nivatthavattho”ti.
analyzed: paripubbaḥ dahita saddaḥ vattha nivāsanam vadati iti āha paridahitaḥ nivattha vatthaḥ ti

analyzed: mayā ñāṇa vādena saddhim atikkamma gacchato ti upaḍḍha bhāgena paricchinnam padesam  atikkamitvā iddhi pāṭihāriyam kātum gacchataḥ kim pana ayam acelaḥ pāthika putto attanaḥ  pamāṇam na jānāti iti no na jānāti yadi evam kasmai sukkha gajjitam gajji iti eva aham
translated: Going beyond: going to perform the miracle of supernormal power after passing beyond the place defined by the half-yojana.🔽But does not this naked ascetic know his own

original: Paṭṭhapetvāti yugaggāhaṃ ārabhitvā.

original: 16. Hīnajjhāsayattā…pe… udapādi. Vuttañhetaṃ “hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttike eva satte sevanti bhajanti payirupāsantī”ti.

translated: Because of their low aspirations … arose. For this is said: “Beings of low aspiration frequent, associate with, and attend upon beings of low aspiration” .

translated: 20. The word nicayo is derived from the verb nicayaṃ, which means “to accumulate” . The word necayikā is derived from the noun nicayo . The word gahapatinecayikā is a compound of the words gahapatī and necayikā . The word sahassehi is used in the sense of “many” .

original: sakalasarīre lomānaṃ haṭṭhabhāvo, so pana tesaṃ bhittiyaṃ nāgadantānaṃ viya uddhaṃmukhatāti
analyzed: sakala sarīre lomānam haṭṭha bhāvo saḥ pana tesam bhittiyam nāga dantānam viya uddhaṃmukha tā ati
translated: . The word cittutrāsabhayaṃ is a compound of the words citta , uttrāsabhayaṃ . The word uttrāsabhayaṃ is a compound of the words uttrāsā and bhayaṃ . The word chambhitatta is a compound of the words chambhitā and atta . The word lomahaṃso is a compound of the words loma and haṃso . The word lomāni is used in the sense of “the hairs of the body” . The word haṃso is used in the sense of “the hairs standing on end” .

original: āha “lomānaṃ uddhaggabhāvo”ti. Antantena āvijjhitvāti attano nisīdanatthaṃ nigūḷhaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: āha lomānam uddhagga bhāvaḥ ti antantena āvijjhitvā iti attanaḥ nisīdana attham nigūḷha ṭṭhānam

original: upaparikkhanto paribbājakārāmaṃ pariyantena anusaṃyāyitvā, kassacideva sunakkhattassa
analyzed: upaparikkhantaḥ paribbājaka ārāmam pariyantena anusaṃyāyitvā kassacid eva sunakkhattassa
translated: Having pierced it with the end: having searched for the place concealed by his sitting cloth for the purpose of sitting down,🔽having gone round to the end of the monastery of the wanderers, to some one or other like Sunakkhatta,

analyzed: vā sunakkhatta sadisassa vā sabbaññu paṭiññam a pahāya satthu sammukhībhāve sattadhā

original: tassa muddhāphalanaṃ dhammatā. Tena vuttaṃ “mā nassatu bālo”tiādi.
analyzed: tassa muddhāphalanam dhamma tā tena vuttam mā nassatu bālaḥ ti ādi
translated: in accordance with the law. Therefore it was said: “Let not the fool perish.”

original: 22. Saṃsappatīti tattheva pāsāṇaphalake bāladārako viya uṭṭhātuṃ asakkonto avasīdanavasena
analyzed: saṃsappati iti tattha iva pāsāṇa phalake bāla dārako viya uṭṭhātum a sakkontaḥ avasīdana vasena
translated: He writhes: unable to rise up like a foolish child on a stone slab, he writhes to and fro by falling down,

analyzed: itas citas ca saṃsappati tena āha osīdati iti tattha iva sañcarati iti tasmin yeva pāsāṇe

analyzed: sañcalanam nisajja vasena iva sañcarati na uṭṭhāya padasā

original: 23. Vinaṭṭharūpoti sambhāvanāya vināsena, lābhassa vināsena ca vinaṭṭhasabhāvo.
analyzed: vinaṭṭha rūpo ti sambhāvanāya vināsena lābhassa vināsena ca vinaṭṭha sabhāvaḥ
translated: His appearance is destroyed: his nature is destroyed by the destruction of his reputation and by the destruction of his gain.

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā

original: 25. Goyuttehīti balavantabalībaddayojitehi.
analyzed: go yuttehi iti
translated: ‘With yoked teams of strong bulls’ means with teams of strong bulls yoked together.

analyzed: tiṭṭhatu tāva pāṭihāriyaṃpe parājayaḥ bhavissati iti  tiṇa sīhaḥ iti tiṇa sadisa harita vaṇṇaḥ sīhaḥ kāḷa sīhaḥ iti kāḷa vaṇṇaḥ sīhaḥ paṇḍu sīhaḥ iti

analyzed: ettha miga saddo kiñca api pasada kuruṅga ādīsu kesucid eva catuppadesu niruḷhaḥ idha pana

translated: ‘lion’s roar’ because of enduring afflictions, and because of opposing

original: ca hananato “sīho”ti laddhanāmassa migādhipassa ghosaṃ, so pana tena yasmā kutocipi🔽abhītabhāvena pavattīyati, tasmā vuttaṃ “abhītanāda”nti. Tattha tattha tāsu tāsu
analyzed: ca hananataḥ sīhaḥ iti laddha nāmassa miga adhipassa ghosam saḥ pana tena yasmā kutocipi  abhīta bhāvena pavattīyati tasmā vuttam abhīta nādanti tattha tattha tāsu tāsu
translated: and the lion, who had got his name because of his jaw, was roaring. And since he was roaring without fear from anywhere,

original: disāsu gantvā caritabbatāya bhakkhitabbatāya gocaro ghāsoti āha “gocarāyāti āhāratthāyā”ti.
analyzed: disāsu gantvā caritabba tāya bhakkhitabba tāya gocaraḥ ghāsaḥ iti āha gocarāya ati āhāra atthāya ati
translated: it was said, “a fearless roar.” Herein, since he went and roamed and grazed in this and that direction, his grazing-ground was his “pasture” . So it was said, “For the sake of food” .

original: Varaṃ varanti migasaṅghe migasamūhe mudumaṃsatāya varaṃ varaṃ mahiṃsavanavarāhādiṃ
analyzed: varam varanti miga saṅghe miga samūhe mudumaṃsatāya varam varam mahiṃsa vana varāha ādim
translated: He killed the best of the herd, the best of the herd of deer, the best of the best, the buffalo, the wild boar, etc., because of their tender flesh.

original: vadhitvāti yojanā. Tenāha “thūlaṃ thūla”nti. Varavarabhāvena hi tassa varabhāvo icchito.🔽Sūrabhāvaṃ sannissitaṃ sūrabhāvasannissitaṃ, tena. Sūrabhāvenāpi hi “kiṃ ime pāṇake
analyzed: vadhitvā iti yojanā tena āha thūlam thūlanti vara vara bhāvena hi tassa vara bhāvaḥ icchito  sūra bhāvam sannissitam sūra bhāva sannissitam tena sūra bhāvena api hi kim ime pāṇake
translated: This is how the construction should be understood here. Hence it was said above, “The best of the best” . For his excellence is intended as the best of the best.

original: dubbale hantvā”ti appathāmesu pāṇesu kāruññaṃ upatiṭṭhati.
analyzed: dubbale hantvā iti appathāmesu pāṇesu kāruññam upatiṭṭhati
translated: Dependent on the state of being fragrant: dependent on the state of being fragrant. For even by the state of being fragrant compassion is established in him towards creatures who are not to be eaten, thinking, “Why should I kill these weak creatures?”

original: 28. Vighāsoti parassa bhakkhitasesatāya virūpo ghāso vighāso, ucchiṭṭhaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: vighāsaḥ ti parassa bhakkhita sesa tāya virūpaḥ ghāsaḥ vighāsaḥ ucchiṭṭham tena āha
translated: A remnant: a deformed piece of food left over from another’s meal, a scrap. That is why it was said above, “A remnant of another’s meal” .

original: “bhakkhitātirittamaṃsa”nti, tasmiṃ vighāse, vighāsanimittanti attho. Asmimānadosenāti🔽asmimānadosahetu, ahaṃkāranimittanti attho. So panassa asmimāno yathā uppajji, taṃ
analyzed: tasmin vighāse vighāsa nimittanti attho asmimāna dosena ati  asmimāna dosa hetu ahaṃkāra nimittanti attho so panassa asmimānaḥ yathā uppajji tam
translated: “The flesh of a slaughtered animal” : the meaning is: the occasion of the slaughter, the reason for the slaughter. “Because of the taint of self-identification” :

original: dassetuṃ “tatrāya”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dassetum tatra āyan ti ādi vuttam
translated: the reason is the cause of the taint of self-identification, the reason is the cause of the conceit “I am.” The following is stated in order to show how that conceit of “I am” arose.

original: “Segālakaṃyevā”tipi pāṭho, yathāvuttova attho. Bheraṇḍakaṃyevāti bheraṇḍasakuṇaravasadisaṃyeva,
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ yathā vuttaḥ uva atthaḥ bheraṇḍakaṃya iva ati bheraṇḍa sakuṇa rava sadisaṃya iva
translated: “Only the sound of a dog barking” : this is the reading in the text. The meaning is as stated above. “Only the sound of a jackal” : the sound of a jackal.

original: bheraṇḍo nāma eko pakkhī dvimukho, tassa kira saddo ativiya virūpo amanāpo. Tenāha🔽“appiyaamanāpasaddamevā”ti. Sammāpaṭipattiyā visesato suṭṭhu gatāti sugatā, sammāsambuddhā.🔽Te apadāyanti sodhenti sattasantānaṃ etehīti sugatāpadānāni, tisso sikkhā. Yasmā
analyzed: bheraṇḍaḥ nāma ekaḥ pakkhī dvi mukhaḥ tassa kira saddaḥ ativiya virūpaḥ amanāpaḥ tena āha  appiya amanāpa saddam evā ti sammā paṭipattiyā visesato suṭṭhu gatā ati sugatā sammāsambuddhā  te apadāyanti sodhenti satta santānam etehi iti sugata apadānāni tissaḥ sikkhāḥ yasmā
translated: A jackal is a bird with two heads. The sound it makes is extremely ugly and unpleasant. Therefore it is said:🔽“Only an unpleasant and unpleasant sound.” “The well-gone ones” : they have gone well by means of right practice. They are the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.🔽“The well-gone ones’ steps” : the three trainings are called “the well-gone ones’ steps” because they lead beings to the state of well-gone ones.

original: tāhi te “sugatā”ti lakkhīyanti, tā ca tesaṃ ovādabhūtā, tasmā “sugatalakkhaṇesū”tiādi
analyzed: tāhi te sugatā ati lakkhīyanti tā ca tesam ovāda bhūtā tasmā sugata lakkhaṇesu utiādi
translated: “The well-gone ones’ characteristics” : the three trainings are called “the well-gone ones” because of them.

original: vuttaṃ. Yadi tā sugatassa lakkhaṇabhūtā, sāsanabhūtā ca, kathaṃ panesa pāthikaputto
analyzed: vuttam yadi tā sugatassa lakkhaṇa bhūtā sāsana bhūtā ca katham pana esa pāthikaputto
translated: If they are the characteristics and the dispensation of the Sugata, how is it that this Pāṭika Putta

original: tattha tāsu sikkhāsu jīvati, ko tassa tāhi sambandhoti āha “etassa hī”tiādi. Sambuddhānaṃ
analyzed: tattha tāsu sikkhāsu jīvati kaḥ tassa tāhi sambandhaḥ ti āha etassa hi itiādi sambuddhānam
translated: lives by them? What is his connection with them? “For this reason,” etc.🔽The meaning intended is that she gave the gift with the perception of a Buddha.

original: demāti dentīti buddhasaññāya dentīti adhippāyo. Tena esa…pe… jīvati nāma na sugatanvayaajjhupagamanato.🔽“Tathāgate”tiādi ekatte puthuvacananti āha “tathāgata”ntiādi. Bahuvacanaṃ eva garusmiṃ
analyzed: dema ati denti iti buddha saññāya denti iti adhippāyo tena esape jīvati nāma na sugata nvaya ajjhupagamanato  tathāgata itiādi ekatte puthuvacana iti āha tathāgata ntiādi bahuvacanam eva
translated: Therefore this Pāṭika Putta, etc.🔽“In the Tathāgata,” etc. The plural is used for the singular.

original: ekasmimpi bahuvacanappayogato ekavacanaṃ viya vuttaṃ vacanavipallāsena.🔽29. Samekkhitvāti samaṃ katvā micchādassanena apekkhitvā, taṃ pana apekkhanaṃ tathā
analyzed: ekasmin pi bahuvacana ppayogato ekavacanam viya vuttam vacana vipallāsena  samekkhitvā ti samam katvā micchādassanena apekkhitvā tam pana apekkhanam tathā
translated: The plural is used for the singular in the expression “in the Tathāgata, in the Arahant, in the Perfectly Enlightened One” in the sense of a respectful form of address.🔽“Having looked at”: having looked at equally, having looked with wrong view. But that looking is itself a conceiving.

original: maññanamevāti āha “maññitvā”ti. Pubbe vuttaṃ samekkhanampi maññanaṃ evāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: maññanam eva ti āha maññitvā iti pubbe vuttam samekkhanam pi maññanam eva ati vuttam
translated: Therefore he said “having conceived.” The looking mentioned earlier is also a conceiving.

original: “amaññīti puna amaññitthā”ti, tena aparāparaṃ tassa maññanappavattiṃ dasseti. Bheraṇḍakaravaṃ
analyzed: amaññi iti puna amaññittha ati tena apara aparam tassa maññana ppavattim dasseti bheraṇḍaka ravam
translated: Therefore he said “having conceived, he conceived again.” He shows the occurrence of conceiving in him by the repetition.🔽The Bheraṇḍa bird

original: kosati vikkosatīti kotthu.
analyzed: kosati vikkosati iti kotthu
translated: He is a kotthu because he is a kotthu in the sense of one who kotthati , who vikotthati .

original: 30. Te te pāṇe byāpādento ghasatīti byagghoti iminā nibbacanena “byaggho”ti migarājassapi
analyzed: te te pāṇe byāpādentaḥ ghasati iti iminā nibbacanena miga rājassa api
translated: He is a byaggha because he byagghati , he ghasati , in the sense of one who destroys living beings.🔽The word byaggha is also used figuratively of the king of beasts, the lion.

original: siyā nāmanti āha “byagghoti maññatīti sīhohamasmīti maññatī”ti. Yadipi yathāvuttanibbacanavasena
analyzed: siyā nāman ti āha byagghaḥ ti maññati iti sīhā uham asmi iti maññati iti yadi pi yathāvutta nibbacana vasena
translated: The lion is called byaggha because he thinks “I am a byaggha” .🔽Although the lion is also called byaggha in the sense stated,

original: sīhopi “byaggho”ti vattabbataṃ arahati, byaggha-saddo pana migarāje eva niruḷhoti
analyzed: sīhaḥ api byagghaḥ ti vattabbatam arahati byaggha saddo pana miga rāje eva niruḷho ti
translated: the word byaggha is well known as a name for the king of beasts.

original: dassento “sīhena vā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sīhena vāti ādim āha
translated: To show this he says “or byaggha” .

original: 31. Sīhena vicaritavane saṃvaḍḍhattā vuttaṃ “mahāvane suññavane vivaḍḍho”ti.
analyzed: sīhena vicaritavane saṃvaḍḍhattā vuttam mahā vane suñña vane vivaḍḍhaḥ ti
translated: He is called “grown in the great forest, the empty forest” because he grew up in the forest frequented by lions.

original: 34. Kilesabandhanāti taṇhābandhanato. Taṇhābandhanañhi thiraṃ daḷhabandhanaṃ dummocanīyaṃ. Yathāha –
analyzed: taṇhā bandhanā ti taṇhā bandhanāt taṇhā bandhanam hi thiram daḷha bandhanam dummocanīyam yathā āha
translated: The fetter of defilement is the fetter of craving. For the fetter of craving is a firm, strong, tough fetter, hard to loosen. As it is said:

original: “Sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu,🔽Puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā;🔽Etaṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanamāhu dhīrā,
analyzed: sāratta rattāḥ maṇi kuṇḍalesu  puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā  etam daḷham bandhanam āhu dhīrā
translated: “The wise declare this to be a strong fetter,🔽Hard to break, dragging one down, and loose,🔽This craving for jewels and ornaments,

original: Ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñca”nti. ;
analyzed: ohārinam sithilam duppamuñcanti
translated: This hankering after sons and cattle and wives” .

original: Kilesabandhanāti vā dasavidhasaṃyojanato. Mahāviduggaṃ nāma cattāro oghā mahantaṃ jalaviduggaṃ viya anupacitakusalasambhārehi duggamaṭṭhena.
analyzed: vā dasavidha saṃyojanataḥ mahāviduggam nāma cattāro oghāḥ mahantam jala viduggam viya anupacita kusala sambhārehi duggam aṭṭhena
translated: The ‘ great deep ’ is the four floods , which are hard to cross for those who have not accumulated the requisites of merit, as a great expanse of water is for those who have no boat.

original: Aggaññapaññattikathāvaṇṇanā🔽36. Imassa padassa. Idaṃ nāma lokassa agganti jānitabbaṃ, taṃ aggaññaṃ, so pana lokassa
analyzed: aggañña paññatti kathā vaṇṇanā  imassa padassa idam nāma lokassa agganti jānitabbam tam aggaññam so pana lokassa
translated: The Description of the Discussion of the Beginning of the World

original: uppattikkamo pavatti paveṇī cāti āha “lokuppatticariyavaṃsa”nti. Sammāsambodhito🔽uttaritaraṃ nāma kiñci natthi pajānitabbesu, taṃ pana koṭiṃ katvā dassento “yāva
analyzed: uppatti kkamaḥ pavatti paveṇī ca āti āha sammāsambodhito  uttaritaram nāma kiñci na atthi pajānitabbesu tam pana koṭim katvā dassento yāva
translated: The meaning of this term should be understood as follows. What is to be known as the world’s beginning is the beginning, the origin, of the world. But that is the order of arising of the world, the order of its occurrence, the order of its continuity.🔽There is nothing to be known that is higher or more supreme than the knowledge of omniscience. Showing that he has reached the limit by knowing that, he said: “I know as far as the knowledge of omniscience.”

original: sabbaññutaññāṇā pajānāmī”ti āha. “Mama pajānanā”ti assādento taṇhāvasena, “ahaṃ pajānāmī”ti
analyzed: sabbaññu taññāṇā pajānāmi iti āha mama pajānanā ati assādentaḥ taṇhā vasena aham pajānāmi iti
translated: Taking delight in his own knowledge by way of craving, he said: “I know.”🔽Taking a stand by way of views, he said: “I know well.”

original: abhinivisanto diṭṭhivasena, “suṭṭhu pajānāmi sammā pajānāmī”ti paggaṇhanto mānavasena
analyzed: abhinivisantaḥ diṭṭhi vasena suṭṭhu pajānāmi sammā pajānāmi iti paggaṇhantaḥ māna vasena
translated: Taking a stand by way of conceit, he said: “I know correctly.”

original: na parāmasāmīti yojanā. “Paccattaññevā”ti padaṃ “nibbuti viditā”ti padadvayenāpi
analyzed: na parāmasāmi iti yojanā paccattaññā eva ati padam viditā iti pada dvayena api
translated: The term “for himself alone” is connected with the two terms “extinction” and “is known.”

original: yojetabbaṃ “paccattaṃyeva uppāditā nibbuti ca paccattaṃyeva viditā”ti, sayambhuñāṇena🔽nibbattitā nibbuti sayameva viditāti attho. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “paccatta”nti padaṃ
analyzed: yojetabbam paccattaṃ yeva uppāditā ca paccattaṃ yeva viditā ati sayambhu ñāṇena  nibbattitā nibbuti sayam eva viditā ati attho aṭṭhakathāyam pana paccattam ti padam
translated: “Nibbāna is to be realized by oneself” means that nibbāna is to be realized by oneself alone.

original: vividhavibhattikaṃ hutvā āvuttinayena āvattatīti dassetuṃ “attanāyeva attanī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vividha vibhattikam hutvā āvutti nayena āvattati iti dassetum attanāya iva attani iti vuttam
translated: The meaning is that nibbāna is to be realized by one’s own knowledge. But in the commentary the word “paccatta” is repeated in different cases and in different ways in order to show how it is repeated in the text.🔽“Nibbāna is not to be realized by oneself” means that nibbāna is not to be realized by oneself because of wrong practice.

original: Aviditanibbānāti appaṭiladdhanibbānā micchāpaṭipannattā. Pajānanampi hi tadadhigamavaseneva
analyzed: avidita nibbānā ti ap paṭiladdha nibbānā micchā paṭipanna ttā pajānanam pi hi tad adhigama vasena iva
translated: For even the knowledge of nibbāna should be understood as the attainment of it.

original: veditabbaṃ. Eti iṭṭhabhāvena pavattatīti ayo, sukhaṃ. Tappaṭikkhepena anayo, dukkhaṃ.
analyzed: veditabbam eti iṭṭha bhāvena pavattati iti ayaḥ sukham tad paṭikkhepena anayaḥ dukkham
translated: “Ayo” is pleasure, which occurs in the sense of what is wished for. “Anayo” is pain, which is the opposite of that.

original: Tadeva hitasukhassa byasanato byasanaṃ.
analyzed: tat eva hita sukhassa byasanataḥ byasanam
translated: That is the “disaster” because it is the destruction of what is beneficial and pleasurable.

original: 37. Taṃ dassentoti bhagavāpi “aññatitthiyo tattha sārasaññī”ti taṃ dassento. Ādhipaccabhāvenāti
analyzed: tam dassento ti bhagavā api añña titthiyaḥ tattha sāra saññī iti tam dassento ādhipacca bhāvena ati
translated: “Showing that”: the Blessed One also shows that the ascetics of other sects are “therein possessed of perception of self.”

original: ādhipaccasabhāvena. Yassa ācariyavādassa vasena puriso “ācariyo”ti vuccati, so ācariyavādo
analyzed: ādhipacca sabhāvena yassa ācariya vādassa vasena puriso ācariyo ti vuccati saḥ ācariya vādo
translated: “By the nature of the condition”: by the nature of the condition of predominance. The teacher’s doctrine according to which a person is called a “teacher”

original: ācariyabhāvoti āha “ācariyabhāvaṃ ācariyavāda”nti. Etthāti ācariyavāde. Iti katvāti
analyzed: ācariya bhāvo ti āha ācariya bhāvam ettha ati ācariya vāde iti katvā iti
translated: The state of teacher: the teacher’s doctrine. There: in the teacher’s doctrine. Having done so:

original: iminā kāraṇena. Soti ācariyavādo. “Aggaññaṃ” tveva vutto aggaññavisayattā. Kena vihitanti
analyzed: iminā kāraṇena saḥ ti ācariya vādaḥ aggaññam tu eva vuttaḥ aggañña visaya ttā kena vihitan ti
translated: for this reason. That: the teacher’s doctrine. “The beginning” is so called because it has the beginning as its domain. By what means:

original: kena pakārena vihitaṃ. Tenāha “kena vihitaṃ kinti vihita”nti. Brahmajāleti brahmajālasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ.
analyzed: kena pakārena vihitam tena āha kena vihitam brahmajāla iti brahmajāla saṃvaṇṇanāyam
translated: by what method was it made? Therefore he said: “By what means? How was it made?” In the Brahmajāla: in the commentary on the Brahmajāla.

original: Tattha hi vitthārato vuttavidhiṃ idha atidisati, pāḷi pana tattha ceva idha ca ekasadisā vāti.
analyzed: tattha hi vitthārataḥ vutta vidhim idha atidisati pana tattha ca iva idha ca eka sadisā vāti
translated: For there the method stated in detail is referred to here, but the text is the same there and here.

original: 41. Khiḍḍā padosikā mūlabhūtā ettha santīti khiḍḍāpadosikaṃ, ācariyakaṃ. Tenevāha “khiḍḍāpadosikamūlaka”nti. Manopadosikanti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: khiḍḍā padosikāḥ mūla bhūtāḥ ettha santi iti khiḍḍāpadosikam ācariyakam tena iva āha khiḍḍāpadosika mūlakanti manaḥ padosikanti ettha api esa iva nayo
translated: It is called “the one based on play and on faults” because play and faults based on it are present here. It is the one based on teachers. Therefore he said “based on play and on faults.” The one based on the mind: here too the method is the same.

original: 47. Yena vacanena abbhācikkhanti, tassa avijjamānatā nāma atthavasenevāti āha “asaṃvijjamānaṭṭhenā”ti.
analyzed: yena vacanena abbhācikkhanti tassa avijjamāna tā nāma attha vasena iva ati āha a saṃvijjamāna aṭṭhena ati
translated: By what means they misrepresent, that is non-existent only in the sense of meaning, therefore he said “in the sense of non-existence of meaning.”

original: Tucchā, musāti ca karaṇatthe paccattavacananti āha “tucchena, musāvādenā”ti. Vacanassa
analyzed: tucchā musā iti ca karaṇa atthe paccatta vacananti āha tucchena musā vādena ati vacanassa
translated: “Empty” and “false” are words in the instrumental case, therefore he said “by an empty, false statement.” The statement

original: antosāraṃ nāma aviparīto atthoti tadabhāvenāha “antosāravirahitenā”ti. Abhiācikkhantīti
analyzed: antosāram nāma aviparītaḥ attho ti tad abhāvena āha antosāra virahitena ati abhiācikkhanti iti
translated: “Without inner core” means without undistorted meaning.🔽“They would misrepresent him” means they would speak to him, hitting out at him, reviling him.

original: abhibhavitvā ghaṭṭentā kathenti, akkosantīti attho. Viparītasaññoti ayāthāvasañño.
analyzed: abhibhavitvā ghaṭṭentā kathenti akkosanti iti attho viparīta sañño ti a yāthāva sañño
translated: “With perverted perception” means with wrong perception.

original: Subhaṃ vimokkhanti “subha”nti vuttavimokkhaṃ. Vaṇṇakasiṇanti sunīlakasupītakādivaṇṇakasiṇaṃ.
analyzed: subham vimokkhanti subham ti vutta vimokkham vaṇṇa kasiṇam ti su nīlaka su pītaka ādi vaṇṇa kasiṇam
translated: “The pleasant deliverance” is the deliverance spoken of as “pleasant.” “The color kasiṇa” is the kasiṇa of blue, yellow, and so on.🔽“All” means all that is pleasant and unpleasant and the color kasiṇa.

original: Sabbanti yaṃ subhaṃ, asubhañca vaṇṇakasiṇaṃ, tañca sabbaṃ. Na asubhanti asubhampi
analyzed: sabbanti yam subham asubham ca vaṇṇa kasiṇam tat ca sabbam na asubhanti asubham pi
translated: “He would not perceive the unpleasant” means

original: “asubha”nti tasmiṃ samaye na sañjānāti, atha kho “subhaṃ” tveva sañjānātīti attho.
analyzed: tasmin samaye na sañjānāti atha kho subham tu eva sañjānāti iti attho
translated: he would not perceive the unpleasant as “unpleasant” at that time, but rather he would perceive it as “pleasant.”

original: Viparītā ayāthāvagāhitāya, ayāthāvavāditāya ca.
analyzed: viparītāḥ a yāthāvagāhitāya a yāthāvavāditāya ca
translated: “Perverted” because of wrong understanding and wrong teaching.

original: 48. Yasmā so paribbājako avissaṭṭhamicchāgāhitāya sammā appaṭipajjitukāmo sammāpaṭipannaṃ
analyzed: yasmā saḥ paribbājakaḥ a vissaṭṭham icchāgāhitāya sammā a paṭipajjitu kāmo sammāpaṭipannam
translated: Since the wanderer was desirous of practicing wrongly because of his wrong grasping,

original: viya maṃ samaṇo gotamo, bhikkhavo ca sañjānantūti adhippāyena “tathā dhammaṃ desetu”ntiādimāha,
analyzed: viya mam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ bhikkhavaḥ ca sañjānantu iti adhippāyena tathā dhammam desetuṃ ti ādim āha
translated: with the intention of making the recluse Gotama and his disciples think that he was practicing rightly, he said, “Teach me the Dhamma in such a way that I may know how to conduct myself thus.”

original: tasmā vuttaṃ “mayā etassa…pe… vaṭṭatī”ti. Mammanti mammappadesaṃ pīḷājananaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā vuttam mayā etassape vaṭṭati iti mammanti mamma padesam pīḷā janana ṭhānam
translated: Therefore it was said: “I have given him … permission.” “To me” : to the place where he is to be afflicted.

original: Suṭṭhūti sakkaccaṃ. Yathā na vinassati, evaṃ anurakkha.
analyzed: suṭṭhu uti sakkaccam yathā na vinassati evam anurakkha
translated: “Carefully” : attentively. “Protect” : guard so that he will not die.

original: Vāsanāyāti kilesakkhayāvahāya paṭipattiyā vāsanāya. Sesaṃ suviññeyyamevāti.🔽Pāthikasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.
analyzed: vāsanāya āti kilesa khaya āvahāya paṭipattiyā vāsanāya sesam su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: “By means of the practice” : by means of the practice that leads to the destruction of the defilements. The rest is easy to understand.🔽The elucidation of the literal meaning is finished.

original: 2. Udumbarikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: udumbarika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Pāṭika-sutta is finished.

original: Nigrodhaparibbājakavatthuvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nigrodha paribbājaka vatthu vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nigrodha paribbājaka story is finished.

original: 49. Udumbarikāyāti sambandhe sāmivacananti āha “udumbarikāya deviyā santake paribbājakārāme”ti.
analyzed: udumbarikāya iti sambandhe sāmi vacanan ti āha udumbarikāya deviyā santake paribbājaka ārāme ti
translated: “In the paribbājakas’ monastery belonging to the queen” : the word “belonging to” is in the genitive case in the sense of relation.

original: “Udumbarikāya”nti vā pāṭho, tathā sati adhikaraṇe etaṃ bhummaṃ. Ayañhettha attho🔽udumbarikāya rañño deviyā nibbattito ārāmo udumbarikā, tassaṃ udumbarikāyaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: vā tathā sati adhikaraṇe etam bhummam ayam ha ittha attho  udumbarikāya raññaḥ deviyā nibbattitaḥ ārāmaḥ udumbarikā tassam udumbarikāyam tena āha
translated: Or the reading is “udumbarikāya” , in which case the locative case is used in the sense of location. The meaning here is this:🔽The monastery built by Queen Udumbarikā of King Udena is “belonging to Udumbarikā.” Therefore it was said:

original: “udumbarikāya deviyā santake”ti. Tāya hi nibbattito tassā santako. Varaṇādipāṭhavasena
analyzed: udumbarikāya deviyā santaka iti tāya hi nibbattitaḥ tassā santakaḥ varaṇa ādi pāṭha vasena
translated: “In the paribbājakas’ monastery belonging to the queen.” For it was built by her, and so it belongs to her.🔽The reading “udumbarikāya” is also possible, for it is found in the old manuscripts.

original: cettha nibbattatthabodhakassa saddassa adassanaṃ. Sandhānoti bhinnānampi tesaṃ sandhāpanena
analyzed: ca ittha nibbatta attha bodhakassa saddassa adassanam sandhānā uti bhinnānam pi tesam sandhāpanena
translated: “Conjoining” is the name given to the conjoining of those that are separate.

original: “sandhāno”ti evaṃ laddhanāmo. Saṃvaṇṇitoti pasaṃsito. Iriyatīti pavattati. Ariyena🔽ñāṇenāti kilesehi ārakattā ariyena lokuttarena ñāṇena. Ariyāya vimuttiyāti suvisuddhāya
analyzed: sandhāno ti evam laddha nāmo saṃvaṇṇito ti pasaṃsito iriyati iti pavattati ariyena  ñāṇena ati kilesehi ārakattā ariyena lokuttarena ñāṇena ariyāya vimuttiyā ati su visuddhāya
translated: “Praised” means “commended.” “It occurs” means “it is found.”

original: lokuttaraphalavimuttiyā.
analyzed: lokuttara phala vimuttiyā
translated: “By the noble knowledge” means by the noble supramundane knowledge, because it is far removed from the defilements. “By the noble liberation” means by the supramundane path-fruit liberation, which is very pure.

original: Divā-saddo dina-saddo viya divasapariyāyo, tassa visesanabhāvena vuccamāno divā-saddo
analyzed: divā saddaḥ dina saddaḥ viya divasa pariyāyaḥ tassa visesana bhāvena vuccamānaḥ divā saddaḥ
translated: The word “day” is a synonym for “daytime,” like the word “day” is a synonym for “daytime.” The word “day” is said to have a distinguishing feature when it illuminates the daytime with its distinction.

original: savisesaṃ divasabhāgaṃ dīpetīti āha “divasassa divā”tiādi. Yasmā samāpannassa cittaṃ
analyzed: sa visesam divasa bhāgam dīpeti iti āha divasassa divā atiādi yasmā samāpannassa cittam
translated: Therefore it is said, “day of the day,” etc. Because the mind of one who has attained jhāna is withdrawn from various objects,

original: nānārammaṇato paṭisaṃhataṃ hoti, jhānasamaṅgī ca pavivekūpagamanena saṅgaṇikābhāvato
analyzed: nānā ārammaṇato paṭisaṃhatam hoti jhāna samaṅgī ca pa viveka upagamanena saṅgaṇikā bhāvato
translated: and because one who possesses jhāna, by going to a secluded place, is as if hidden in solitude due to the absence of company,

original: ekākiyāya nilīno viya hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “tato tato…pe… gato”ti. Mano bhavanti manaso
analyzed: ekākiyāya nilīnaḥ viya hoti tasmā vuttam tatas tatas upe gato ti manaḥ bhavanti manasaḥ
translated: therefore it is said, “gone away from that place,” etc. “The mind is in the mind” means

original: vivaṭṭanissitaṃ vaḍḍhiṃ āvahantīti manobhāvaniyāti āha “manavaḍḍhakāna”ntiādi. Unnamati
analyzed: vivaṭṭa nissitam vaḍḍhim āvahanti iti manaḥ bhāva niyāti āha unnamati
translated: “The growth that is dependent on the opening up of the mind” is the growth of the mind.

original: na saṅkucati, alīnañca hotīti attho.
analyzed: na saṅkucati a līnam ca hoti iti attho
translated: It is “not contracted” : it is not contracted, not depressed.🔽“As many” : the meaning here is “as many as there are.”

original: 51. Yāvatāti yāvantoti ayamettha atthoti āha “yattakā”ti. Tesanti niddhāraṇe sāmivacanaṃ.🔽Niddhāraṇañca kenaci visesena icchitabbaṃ. Yehi ca guṇavisesehi samannāgatā bhagavato
analyzed: yāvatā iti yāvanto ti ayam ettha attho ti āha niddhāraṇe sāmi vacanam  niddhāraṇam ca kenacid visesena icchitabbam yehi ca guṇa visesehi samannāgatāḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: “Of them” is the genitive case.🔽And the specification must be desired by some distinction.

original: sāvakā upāsakā rājagahe paṭivasanti, ayañca tehi samannāgatoti imaṃ visesaṃ dīpetuṃ
analyzed: sāvakāḥ upāsakāḥ rājagahe paṭivasanti ayam ca tehi samannāgataḥ ti imam visesam dīpetum
translated: And since the Blessed One’s disciples, the lay followers, who dwell in Rājagaha are endowed with certain special qualities, and since this lay follower is endowed with those same qualities,

original: “tesaṃ abbhantaro”ti vuttaṃ. Tenāha “bhagavato kirā”tiādi.
analyzed: tesam abbhantaro ti vuttam tena āha bhagavataḥ kirāti ādi
translated: the specification is made by saying “one of them.”

original: 52. Tesanti paribbājakānaṃ. Kathāyāti tiracchānakathāya. Dassanenāti diṭṭhidassanena.
analyzed: tesam ti paribbājakānam kathāya ati tiracchāna kathāya dassanena ati diṭṭhi dassanena
translated: “Of them” : of the wanderers. “By talk” : by animal talk. “By view” : by the view of individuality.

original: Ākappenāti vesena. Kuttenāti kiriyāya. Ācārenāti aññamaññasmiṃ ācaritabbaācārena.
analyzed: ākappena ati vesena kuttena ati kiriyāya ācārena ati aññamaññasmin ācaritabba ācārena
translated: “By gain” : by gain. “By work” : by action. “By conduct” : by conduct that should be observed towards each other.

original: Vihārenāti rattindivaṃ viharitabbaviharaṇena. Iriyāpathenāti ṭhānādiiriyāpathena.
analyzed: vihārena ati rattindivam viharitabba viharaṇena iriyāpathena ati ṭhāna ādi iriyāpathena
translated: “By life” : by the life that should be lived day and night. “By manner” : by the manner of standing, etc.

original: Aññākāratāya aññatitthe niyuttāti aññatitthiyā. Saṅgantvā samāgantvā rāsī hutvā parehi🔽nisinnaṭṭhāne. Araññāni ca tāni vanapatthāni cāti araññavanapatthāni. Tattha yaṃ
analyzed: añña ākāra tāya añña titthe niyuttā ati añña titthiyā saṅgantvā samāgantvā rāsī hutvā parehi  nisinna ṭṭhāne araññāni ca tāni vana patthāni ca ati arañña vana patthāni tattha yam
translated: Having come together, having met together, having become a heap, in the place where others are sitting down.

original: araññakaṅganipphādakaṃ āraññakānaṃ, taṃ “arañña”nti veditabbaṃ. Vanapatthanti gāmantaṃ
analyzed: araññaka aṅga nipphādakam āraññakānam tam araññanti veditabbam vana patthanti gāmantam
translated: And they are wilderness and they are groves, thus they are wilderness-groves. Herein, what is productive of the wilderness-dweller’s quality should be understood as “wilderness” .

original: atikkamitvā manussānaṃ anupacāraṭṭhānaṃ, yattha na kasīyati na vappīyati. Vuttañhetaṃ
analyzed: atikkamitvā manussānam an upacāra ṭṭhānam yattha na kasīyati na vappīyati vuttam ha etam
translated: A grove is the place beyond the village where people do not go about, where there is no ploughing with the ploughshare and goad. For this is said:🔽“A grove: this is a term for a remote lodging” .

original: “vanapatthanti dūrānametaṃ senāsanānaṃ adhivacana”nti “vanapatthanti vanasaṇḍānametaṃ
analyzed: vana patthanti dūrānam etam senāsanānam adhivacananti vana patthanti vana saṇḍānam etam
translated: “A grove: this is a term for a lodging in a forest thicket” .🔽“A grove: this is a term for a frightening lodging” .🔽“A grove: this is a term for a lodging with no sound” .

original: senāsanānaṃ, vanapatthanti bhīsanakānametaṃ, vanapatthanti salomahaṃsānametaṃ, vanapatthanti
analyzed: senāsanānam vana patthanti bhīsanakānam etam vana patthanti sa lomahaṃsānam etam vana patthanti
translated: “A grove: this is a term for a lodging at the outskirts” .

original: pariyantānametaṃ vanapatthanti na manussūpacārānametaṃ senāsanānaṃ adhivacana”nti.
analyzed: pariyantānam etam na manussu upacārānam etam senāsanānam adhivacananti
translated: “A grove: this is a term for a lodging not frequented by people” .🔽That is why it is said above “freed from the vicinity of villages” .

original: Tena vuttaṃ “gāmūpacārato muttānī”tiādi. Pantānīti pariyantāni atidūrāni. Tenāha
analyzed: tena vuttam gāmu upacārataḥ muttāni itiādi pantāni iti pariyantāni atidūrāni tena āha
translated: They are remote, thus they are outskirts .

original: “dūratarānī”tiādi. Vihārūpacārenāti vihārassa upacārappadesena. Addhikajanassāti
analyzed: dūratarāni itiādi vihāra upacārena ati vihārassa upacāra ppadesena addhika janassa ati
translated: “Farther away” and so on. “In the vicinity of the monastery”: in the vicinity of the monastery as a place of access. “Crowded with people”:

original: maggagāmino janassa. Mandasaddānīti uccāsaddamahāsaddābhāvato tanusaddāni. Manussehi
analyzed: magga gāminaḥ janassa manda saddāni iti uccāsadda mahāsadda abhāvataḥ tanu saddāni manussehi
translated: with people traveling on the road. “With little noise”: with little sound, because of the absence of loud sounds. “With little sound of human beings”:

original: samāgamma ekajjhaṃ pavattitasaddo nigghoso, tassa yasmā attho dubbibhāvito hoti,
analyzed: samāgamma ekajjham pavattita saddaḥ nigghoso tassa yasmai atthaḥ dubbibhāvitaḥ hoti
translated: with the sound of human beings that has arisen by their coming together and occurring in one place. Since the meaning of that is not well distinguished,

original: tasmā vuttaṃ “avibhāvitatthena nigghosenā”ti. Vigatavātānīti vigatasaddāni. “Rahassa
analyzed: tasmā vuttam a vibhāvita atthena nigghosena ati vigata vātāni iti vigata saddāni rahassa
translated: therefore it is said, “with the sound of human beings whose meaning is not well distinguished.” “With little wind”: with little sound. “Suitable for making a declaration”:

original: karaṇassa yuttānī”ti imināpi tesaṃ ṭhānānaṃ araññalakkhaṇayuttataṃ, janavivittataṃ,
analyzed: karaṇassa yuttāni iti iminā api tesam ṭhānānam arañña lakkhaṇa yutta tam jana vivitta tam
translated: by this it is also distinguished that those places are suitable for the characteristic of a forest, for seclusion from people,

original: vanavivittameva ca vibhāveti, tathā “ekībhāvassa anurūpānī”ti iminā.
analyzed: vana vivittam eva ca vibhāveti tathā ekībhāvassa anurūpāni iti iminā
translated: and for seclusion from the forest, as well as by “suitable for solitude.”

original: 53. Kenāti hetumhi, sahayoge ca karaṇavacananti āha “kena kāraṇena kena puggalena saddhi”nti. Ekopi hi vibhattiniddeso anekatthavibhāvano hoti, tathā taddhitatthapadasamāhāreti.
analyzed: kena ati hetumhi saha yoge ca karaṇa vacananti āha kena kāraṇena kena puggalena saddhinti ekaḥ api hi vibhatti niddesaḥ aneka attha vibhāvanaḥ hoti tathā taddhita ttha pada samāhāre ti
translated: “By what”: in the sense of reason, and in the sense of companion, it is said, “by what reason, by what person.” For one demonstrative pronoun can have the function of distinguishing many meanings, as in the case of the words for the nominal bases.

original: Saṃsandananti ālāpasallāpavasena kathāsaṃsandanaṃ. Ñāṇabyattabhāvanti byattañāṇabhāvaṃ,
analyzed: saṃsandana nti ālāpa sallāpa vasena kathā saṃsandanam ñāṇa byatta bhāvanti byatta ñāṇa bhāvam
translated: “Discussion” is the discussion of talk by way of conversation. “The manifestation of knowledge” is the state of being of manifest knowledge.

original: so pana parassa vacane uttaradānavasena, parena vā vuttauttare paccuttaradānavasena
analyzed: saḥ pana parassa vacane uttara dāna vasena parena vā vutta auttare paccuttara dāna vasena
translated: But that is by way of giving an answer to another’s statement or by way of giving a counter-answer to an answer given by another.

original: siyāti āha “uttarapaccuttaranayenā”ti. Yo hi parassa vacanaṃ tipukkhalena nayena
analyzed: siyā iti āha uttara paccuttara nayena ati yaḥ hi parassa vacanam tipukkhalena nayena
translated: “By the method of counter-answer” is what is said. For he who moulds another’s statement by the method of the three propositions

original: rūpeti, tathā parassa rūpanavacanaṃ jātibhāvaṃ āpādeti, tassa tādisaṃ vacanasabhāvaṃ🔽ñāṇaveyyattiyaṃ vibhāveti pākaṭaṃ karotīti. Suññāgāresu naṭṭhāti suññāgāresu nivāsesu🔽naṭṭhā vinaṭṭhā abhāvaṃ gatā. Nāssa paññā nasseyya tehi tehi katapucchanapaṭipucchananimittaṃ
analyzed: rūpa iti tathā parassa rūpana vacanam jāti bhāvam āpādeti tassa tādisam vacana sabhāvam  ñāṇa veyyattiyam vibhāveti pākaṭam karoti iti suñña āgāresu naṭṭhā ati suñña āgāresu nivāsesu  naṭṭhā vinaṭṭhā abhāvam gatā na assa paññā na sseyya tehi tehi kata pucchana paṭipucchana nimittam
translated: and moulds his own statement by the method of the three propositions, he makes manifest, he makes clear, the state of being of such a statement🔽by the manifestation of knowledge. “In empty houses” means in empty houses for living in.

original: nānāpaṭibhānuppattiyā visāramāpannaṃ pucchitaṃ pañhaṃ vissajjetuṃ asamatthatāya.
analyzed: nānā paṭibhā anuppattiyāḥ visāram āpannam pucchitam pañham vissajjetum a samattha tāya
translated: “Are destroyed” means are lost, are ruined, are gone. “His wisdom would not be lost” means that his wisdom, which has become confident by the occurrence of various replies to questions asked by way of the questions and counter-questions he has made, would not be incapable of answering the question that has been asked.

original: Orodheyyāmāti nirussāhaṃ viya karontā avarodheyyāma, taṃ parassa orodhanaṃ vādajālena
analyzed: orodheyyāma ati nirussāham viya karontāḥ avarodheyyāma tam parassa orodhanam vāda jālena
translated: “We would be defeated” means we would be defeated as if without courage. That defeat of another by way of a net of argument

original: vinandhanaṃ viya hotīti āha “vinandheyyāmā”ti. Tadatthaṃ tena tucchakumbhinidassanaṃ
analyzed: vinandhanam viya hoti iti āha tad attham tena tuccha kumbhi nidassanam
translated: “I would praise it” : he said this because it would be like praising a pot that is empty.🔽The illustration of the empty pot was given to show the meaning of that.

original: kataṃ, taṃ byatirekamukhena dassetuṃ “pūritaghaṭo hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Balaṃ dīpentoti abhūtameva attano ñāṇabalaṃ pakāsento. Asambhinnanti jātisambhedābhāvena
analyzed: katam tam byatireka mukhena dassetum pūrita ghaṭaḥ hi itiādi vuttam  balam dīpento ti abhūtam eva attanaḥ ñāṇa balam pakāsentaḥ asambhinnanti jāti sambheda abhāvena
translated: “A filled pot, however, is not like that” is said to show it by way of a contrast.🔽“Showing his own power of knowledge” : showing his own power of knowledge, which is not real.🔽“Unmixed” : unmixed because there is no difference in kind.

original: asambhinnaṃ. Aññajātisambhede sati assatarassa assassa jātabhāvo viya sīhassapi sīhathāmābhāvo
analyzed: a sambhinnam añña jāti sambhede sati assatarassa assassa jāta bhāvaḥ viya sīhassa api
translated: If there were a difference in kind, then just as the ass-colt would not be a horse because of the difference in kind, so the lion would not be a lion because of the difference in kind.

original: siyāti āha “asambhinnakesarasīha”nti. Ṭhānaso vāti taṅkhaṇe eva.
analyzed: āha asambhinna kesarasīhanti ṭhānasaḥ vāti eva
translated: Therefore he said “unmixed lion with the mane.”🔽“On the spot” : at that very moment.🔽“The river named Sumāgadhā” : some say this, but that is wrong.

original: 54. “Sumāgadhā nāma nadī”ti keci, taṃ micchāti dassento “sumāgadhā nāma pokkharaṇī”ti
analyzed: sumāgadhā nāma nadī iti keci tam micchā ati dassento sumāgadhā nāma pokkharaṇī iti
translated: To show this, he said “the lotus pond named Sumāgadhā.”

original: vatvā tassā pokkharaṇibhāvassa suttantare āgatataṃ dassetuṃ “yassā tīre”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vatvā tassā pokkharaṇi bhāvassa sutta antare āgata tam dassetuṃ yassā tīra itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: “On the bank of which” is said to show the existence of that lotus pond in another sutta.

original: Morānaṃ nivāpo etthāti moranivāpo. Byadhikaraṇānampi hi padānaṃ bāhiratthasamāso
analyzed: morānam nivāpaḥ ettha ati mora nivāpaḥ byadhikaraṇānam pi hi padānam bāhirattha samāsaḥ
translated: “The abode of peacocks” : the abode of peacocks is there.

original: hotiyeva yathā “urasilomo”ti. Atha vā nivutthaṃ etthāti nivāpo, morānaṃ nivāpo moranivāpo,
analyzed: yathā yathā atha vā ettha ati nivāpaḥ morānam nivāpaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, it is a store because it is stored there, a store of peacocks is a peacock store,🔽a place where peacocks are given and stored. Hence he said “where peacocks are stored” and so on.

original: morānaṃ nivāpadinnaṭṭhānaṃ. Tenāha “yattha morāna”ntiādi. Yasmā nigrodho tapojigucchavādo,
analyzed: nivāpa dinna ṭṭhānam tena āha nigrodho tapaḥ jiguccha vādo
translated: Since the Nigrodha tree is a preacher of self-mortification,🔽and since he sees that in the Dispensation the bhikkhus, having abandoned the practice of self-mortification,

original: sāsane ca bhikkhū attakilamathānuyogaṃ vajjetvā bhāvanānuyogena paramassāsappatte
analyzed: sāsane ca bhikkhū atta kilamatha anuyogam vajjetvā bhāvanā anuyogena parama ssāsa ppatte
translated: live by the practice of meditation and have attained the highest bliss,

original: viharante passati, tasmā “kathaṃ nu kho samaṇo gotamo kāyakilamathena vināva sāvake
analyzed: viharante passati tasmā katham nu kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ kāya kilamathena vinā ava sāvake
translated: he is doubtful as to how the recluse Gotama trains his disciples in virtue without self-mortification of the body.🔽He asks the Blessed One the question beginning “What, friend, is that?” with the thought “What is that?”🔽The word assāso is derived from the verb assasati in the sense of “he breathes in” with the suffix sa .

original: vinetī”ti sañjātasandeho “ko nāma so”tiādinā bhagavantaṃ pucchi. Assasati anusaṅkitaparisaṅkito🔽hoti etenāti assāso, pītisomanassanti āha “assāsappattāti tuṭṭhippattā somanassappattā”ti.
analyzed: vinā iti sañjāta sandehaḥ kaḥ nāma so ti ādinā bhagavantam pucchi assasati anusaṅkita parisaṅkito  hoti etena ati assāsaḥ pīti somanassanti āha assāsa ppattā ati tuṭṭhi ppattā somanassa ppattā ati

original: Adhiko seṭṭho āsayo nissayo ajjhāsayoti āha “uttamanissayabhūta”nti. Ādibhūtaṃ purātanaṃ
analyzed: adhikaḥ seṭṭhaḥ āsayaḥ nissayaḥ ajjhāsayaḥ ti āha uttama nissaya bhūtam ti ādi bhūtam purātanam
