original: seṭṭhacariyaṃ ādibrahmacariyaṃ, lokuttaramagganti attho. Tathā hesa sabbabuddhapaccekabuddhasāvakehi🔽teneva ākārena adhigato. Tenāha “purāṇa…pe… ariyamagga”nti. Tathā hi taṃ bhagavā🔽“addasa purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇamañjasa”nti avoca. Pūretvā bhāvanāpāripūrivasena. “Pūretvā”ti🔽vā idaṃ “ajjhāsayaṃ ādibrahmacariya”nti ettha pāṭhasesoti vadanti. “Ajjhāsayaṃ ādibrahmacariyaṃ
analyzed: seṭṭha cariyam ādi brahmacariyam lokuttara maggan ti attho tathā ha esa sabba buddha paccekabuddha sāvakehi  tena iva ākārena adhigataḥ tena āha purāṇape tathā hi tam bhagavā  addasa purāṇam maggam avoca pūretvā bhāvanā pāripūri vasena pūretvā ati  vā idam ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti ettha vadanti ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: the noble way, the beginning of the spiritual life, the supramundane path is what is meant. For it is this that is reached by all Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and disciples🔽in this way. That is why it is said: “The ancient path, the ancient road travelled by the Perfect Ones of old to reach Nibbana.” For the Blessed One said:🔽“I have seen the ancient path, the ancient road travelled by the Perfect Ones of old” . “Having fulfilled”: by fulfilling the development. Or else, they say that “having fulfilled” is a variant reading for “the beginning of the spiritual life” in the phrase “the beginning of the spiritual life, the ancient path” . “The beginning of the spiritual life”:🔽🔽

original: paṭijānanti assāsappattā”ti evaṃ vā ettha yojanā.
analyzed: paṭijānanti assāsa pattā iti evam vai ettha yojanā
translated: The meaning is: the noble way of practice, the beginning of the holy life, the supramundane path. For it is this that is reached by all Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and disciples in this way. That is why it is said: “The ancient path, the ancient way, the path followed by the Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past.” For the Blessed One said: “I have seen the ancient path, the ancient road followed by Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past” . “Having fulfilled”: having fulfilled it by perfecting the development. Or else, they say that the reading should be “having fulfilled the beginning of the holy life” . The construction is: “They claim to have attained satisfaction in the beginning of the holy life, which is their intention.”

original: Tapojigucchāvādavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tapojigucchā vāda vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the doctrine of austerity and self-mortification

original: 55. Pakatā hutvā vicchinnā vippakatāti āha “aniṭṭhitāva hutvā ṭhitā”ti.🔽56. Vīriyena pāpajigucchanavādoti lūkhapaṭipattisādhanena vīriyena attataṇhāvinodanavasena
analyzed: pakatā hutvā vicchinnā vippakatā iti āha aniṭṭhitā ava hutvā ṭhitā iti  vīriyena pāpa jigucchana vādaḥ ti lūkha paṭipatti sādhanena vīriyena atta taṇhā vinodana vasena
translated: . Having become ordinary men, they are interrupted, and so he says: “They are interrupted, having failed to complete it.”🔽The doctrine of self-mortification through energy

original: pāpakassa jigucchanavādo. Jigucchatīti jiguccho, tabbhāvo jegucchaṃ, adhikaṃ jegucchaṃ
analyzed: pāpakassa jigucchana vādaḥ jigucchati iti jigucchaḥ tad bhāvaḥ jeguccham adhikam jeguccham
translated: . The doctrine of self-mortification through energy is the doctrine of self-mortification through the energy of austere practice, which is the shaking off of craving for self. “He self-mortifies” is jigucchati . The state of that is jegucchitā . The excess of that is jegucchitatta .

original: adhijegucchaṃ, ativiya pāpajigucchanaṃ, tasmiṃ adhijegucche. Kāyadaḷhībahulaṃ tapatīti🔽tapo, attakilamathānuyogavasena pavattaṃ vīriyaṃ, tena kāyadaḷhībahulatānimittassa🔽pāpassa jigucchanaṃ, virajjanampi tapojigucchāti āha “vīriyena pāpajigucchā”ti. Ghāsacchādanasenāsanataṇhāvinodanamukhena🔽attasnehavirajjananti attho. Upari vuccamānesu nānākāresu acelakādivatesu ekajjhaṃ🔽samādinnānaṃ parisodhanamevettha pāripūraṇaṃ, na sabbesaṃ anavasesato samādānaṃ tassa
analyzed: adhijeguccham pāpa jigucchanam tasmin adhijegucche kāya daḷhī bahulam tapati iti  tapo atta kilamatha anuyoga vasena pavattam vīriyam tena kāya daḷhī bahula tā nimittassa  pāpassa jigucchanam virajjanam pi tapaḥ jiguccha ati āha vīriyena pāpa jiguccha ati ghāsa chādana senāsana taṇhā vinodana mukhena  atta sneha virajjanam ti atthaḥ upari vuccamānesu nānā ākāresu ekajjham  samādinnānam parisodhanam eva ittha pāripūraṇam na sabbesam anavasesato samādānam tassa
translated: “Disgust” is disgust with what is evil. “In that” means in that disgust. “He mortifies” means he mortifies himself by means of the practice of mortifying the body. “By energy” means by energy that occurs by way of the practice of mortifying oneself. “Disgust with evil” means disgust with evil that has the characteristic of mortifying the body by means of energy. “Disgust with passion” means the absence of passion for oneself. The meaning is: the absence of affection for oneself by way of the removal of craving for food, clothing, and shelter. “In the various kinds of asceticism” refers to the various kinds of asceticism such as the naked ascetic, etc., mentioned above. “The fulfillment of his undertaking” means the purification of what has been undertaken by him as a whole. It is not the undertaking of all without exception.

original: asambhavatoti āha “paripuṇṇāti parisuddhā”ti. Parisodhanañca nesaṃ sakasamayasiddhena🔽nayena paṭipajjanameva. Vipariyāyena aparisuddhatā veditabbā.
analyzed: āha paripuṇṇā ati parisuddhā ati parisodhanam ca saka samaya siddhena  nayena paṭipajjanam eva vipariyāyena aparisuddha tā veditabbā
translated: In the sense of disgust with what is vile, in the sense of disgust with what is very vile.  In the sense of austerity, in the sense of energy that occurs in the form of self-mortification.  In the sense of disgust with austerity, in the sense of disgust with what is vile that has the characteristic of the abundance of bodily firmness.  In the sense of the removal of craving for food, clothing, and resting place, in the sense of the removal of self-love.  In the sense of fulfilment, in the sense of the fulfilment of the purification of what is undertaken by the various kinds of ascetics such as the naked ascetics, etc., mentioned above.  The fulfilment here is not the undertaking of all of them without remainder, because that is impossible.  That is why it is said, “Fulfilment is purification” .  And the fulfilment of them is the practice in the way that is successful for oneself.  The opposite of this is to be understood as non-purification.

original: 57. “Ekaṃ pañhampi na kathetī”ti paṭhamaṃ attanā pucchitapañhassa akathitattā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekam pañham pi na katheti iti paṭhamam attanā pucchita pañhassa a kathita ttā vuttam
translated: “He does not answer even one question” is said because he does not answer the question he was asked.

original: Tapanissitakoti attakilamathānuyogasaṅkhātaṃ tapaṃ nissāya samādāya vattanako. Sīhanādeti
analyzed: tapanissitakaḥ ti atta kilamatha anuyoga saṅkhātam tapam nissāya samādāya vattanako sīhanādeti
translated: “One who is devoted to mortification”: one who devotes himself to, undertakes, and practices mortification consisting in the pursuit of self-mortification. “The lion’s roar”:

original: sīhanādasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ. Yasmā tattha vitthāritanayena veditabbāni, tasmā tassā atthappakāsanāya
analyzed: sīhanāda sutta vaṇṇanāyam yasmā tattha vitthārita nayena veditabbāni tasmā tassāḥ attha ppakāsanāya
translated: in the commentary to the Sīhanāda Sutta. Since they should be understood in detail there,

original: vuttanayenapi veditabbāni.
analyzed: vutta nayena api veditabbāni
translated: they should be understood in the way stated there.

original: Upakkilesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: upakkilesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the defilements

original: 58. “Sammā ādiyatī”ti vatvā sammā ādiyanañcassa daḷhaggāho evāti āha “daḷhaṃ gaṇhātī”ti.
analyzed: sammā ādiyati iti vatvā daḷhaggāhaḥ eva ati āha daḷham gaṇhāti iti
translated: . Having said “he undertakes correctly,” he says “he grasps firmly” because the correct undertaking is his firm grasping.

original: “Sāsanāvacarenāpi dīpetabba”nti vatvā taṃ dassetuṃ “ekacco hī”tiādi vuttaṃ, tena
analyzed: sāsanāvacarena api dīpetabban ti vatvā tam dassetum ekaccaḥ hi itiādi vuttam tena
translated: Having said “it should be shown by one who is a follower of the Dispensation,” he says “One, for instance,” in order to demonstrate it. Therefore

original: dhutaṅgadharatāmattena attamanatā, paripuṇṇasaṅkappatā sammāpaṭipattiyā upakkilesoti
analyzed: dhutaṅga dhara tā mattena atta mana tā paripuṇṇa saṅkappa tā sammā paṭipattiyā upakkileso ti
translated: he shows this meaning: “The fact that he is satisfied with the mere wearing of the ascetic qualities, the fact that he is fully satisfied with the mere undertaking of the ascetic qualities, is a defilement of right practice.”

original: imamatthaṃ dasseti, na yathāvuttatapasamādānadhutaṅgadharatānaṃ satipi aniyyānikatte
analyzed: imam attham dasseti na yathā vutta tapa samādāna dhutaṅga dhara tānam satipi
translated: But it should not be regarded as similar to the fact that, although the undertaking of mortification is not conducive to emancipation,

original: sadisatanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam
translated: it is a defilement of right practice.

original: “Duvidhassāpīti ‘attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo’ti ca evaṃ upakkilesabhedena vuttassa
analyzed: duvidhassa api iti atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappaḥ ti ca evam upakkilesa bhedena vuttassa
translated: “Although it is of two kinds”: although it is stated as being of two kinds, as “he is satisfied and fully satisfied,”

original: duvidhassāpi tapassino”ti keci. Yasmā pana aṭṭhakathāyaṃ sāsanikavasenāpi attho dīpito,
analyzed: duvidhassa api tapassinaḥ ti keci yasmā pana aṭṭhakathā ayam sāsanika vasena api atthaḥ dīpito
translated: But since the commentary shows the meaning as that of the insider,

original: tasmā bāhirakassa, sāsanikassa cāti evaṃ duvidhassāpi tapassinoti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: tasmā bāhirakassa sāsanikassa ca ati evam duvidhassa api tapassinaḥ ti atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: the meaning should be understood as “of the two kinds of austerity, that of the outsider and that of the insider.”🔽For he will explain the meaning in this way above too.

original: Tathā ceva hi uparipi atthavaṇṇanaṃ vakkhatīti. Ettāvatāti yadidaṃ “ko añño mayā
analyzed: tathā ca iva hi upari pi attha vaṇṇanam vakkhati iti ettāvatā ati yat idam kaḥ aññaḥ mayā
translated: “To this extent”: to the extent that there is the arising of the conceit “Who is there equal to me?”

original: sadiso”ti evaṃ atimānassa, aniṭṭhitakiccasseva ca “alamettāvatā”ti evaṃ atimānassa🔽ca uppādanaṃ, ettāvatā.🔽Ukkaṃsatīti ukkaṭṭhaṃ karoti. Ukkhipatīti aññesaṃ upari khipati, paggaṇhātīti attho.
analyzed: sadisaḥ ti evam atimānassa aniṭṭhita kiccassa iva ca alam ettāvatā ati evam atimānassa  ca uppādanam ettāvatā  ukkaṃsati iti ukkaṭṭham karoti ukkhipati iti aññesam upari khipati paggaṇhāti iti attho
translated: and the conceit “This much is enough” in one who has not completed his task.🔽“He exalts himself”: he makes himself high. “He exalts himself above others”: he throws himself above others; he elevates himself, is the meaning.

original: Paraṃ saṃhāretīti paraṃ saṃharaṃ nihīnaṃ karoti. Avakkhipatīti adho khipati, avamaññatīti attho.
analyzed: param saṃhāreti iti param saṃharam nihīnam karoti avakkhipati iti adhas khipati avamaññati iti attho
translated: “He disparages others”: he disparages others, he makes others low. “He looks down upon others”: he throws himself down upon others; he despises others, is the meaning.

original: Mānamadakaraṇenāti mānasaṅkhātassa madassa karaṇena uppādanena. Mucchito hotīti mucchāpanno
analyzed: māna mada karaṇena ati māna saṅkhātassa madassa karaṇena uppādanena mucchitaḥ hoti iti mucchā āpannaḥ
translated: “By the production of conceit called intoxication”: by the production, by the arising, of intoxication called conceit. “He is overcome by intoxication”: he is overcome by intoxication.

original: hoti, sā pana mucchāpatti abhijjhāsīlabbataparāmāsakāyaganthehi gadhitacittatā, tattha
analyzed: hoti sā pana mucchā āpatti abhijjhā sīlabbata parāmāsa kāya ganthehi gadhita citta tā tattha
translated: But that is a kind of fainting, and it is a state of mind that is tied by greed for sense desires, by rules and observances, and by the shackle of the body, and it is an excessive attachment to that.

original: ca atilaggabhāvoti āha “gadhito ajjhosanno”ti. Pamajjanañcettha pamajjanamevāti āha🔽“pamādamāpajjatī”ti. Kevalaṃ dhutaṅgasuddhiko hutvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ ananuyuñjanto tāya
analyzed: ca ati lagga bhāvaḥ iti āha gadhitaḥ ajjhosanno ti pamajjanam ca ittha pamajjanam eva ati āha  pamādam āpajjati iti kevalam dhutaṅga suddhikaḥ hutvā kammaṭṭhānam an anuyuñjantaḥ tāya
translated: So it is said, “Tied, fastened” . Here, the meaning of “to be negligent” is just “to be negligent” . So it is said, “He is negligent” .

original: eva dhutaṅgasuddhikatāya attukkaṃsanādivasena pavatteyyāti dassetuṃ “sāsane”tiādi
analyzed: eva dhutaṅga suddhika tāya attukkaṃsana ādi vasena pavatteyya iti dassetum sāsana itiādi
translated: Having become one who is pure in the ascetic practices only, and not applying himself to the meditation subject, he might go on to boast about his purity in the ascetic practices in this way and that.

original: vuttaṃ. Tenāha “dhutaṅgameva…pe… paccetī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam tena āha dhutaṅgam evape pacceti iti
translated: In order to show this, “in the Dispensation” is said. Consequently it is said, “He extols the ascetic practices” .🔽. The same three conditions.

original: 59. Teyeva paccayā. Suṭṭhu katvā paṭisaṅkharitvā laddhāti ādaragāravayogena sakkaccaṃ
analyzed: teyeva paccayā suṭṭhu katvā paṭisaṅkharitvā laddhā ati ādara gārava yogena sakkaccam
translated: Well-performed: well-done, well-prepared.🔽By means of the giving: by means of the offering.🔽By means of the bringing: by means of the leading.

original: abhisaṅkharitvā dānavasena upanayavasena laddhā. Vaṇṇabhaṇananti guṇakittanaṃ. Assāti tapassino.
analyzed: abhisaṅkharitvā dāna vasena upanaya vasena laddhā vaṇṇa bhaṇanan ti guṇa kittanam assa ti tapassinaḥ
translated: By means of the praise: by means of the glorification.🔽The ascetics: the ascetics.

original: 60. Vodāsanti byāsanaṃ, vibhajjananti attho. Taṃ panettha vibhajjanaṃ dvidhā icchitanti
analyzed: vodāsanti byāsanam vibhajjananti tam pana ittha vibhajjanam dvidhā
translated: The distribution: the distribution, the analysis, is the meaning. But the analysis here is wanted in two ways.

original: āha “dvebhāgaṃ āpajjatī”ti. Dve bhāge karoti ruccanāruccanavasena. Gedhajātoti sañjātagedho.🔽Mucchanaṃ nāma sativippavāseneva hoti, na satiyā satīti āha “samuṭṭhassatī”ti. Ādīnavamattampīti
analyzed: āha dvebhāgam āpajjati iti dve bhāge karoti gedha jātaḥ iti sañjāta gedhaḥ  mucchanam nāma sati vippavāsena iva hoti na satiyā satī iti āha samuṭṭhaḥ sati iti ādīnava mattam pi iti
translated: He said, “He falls into two parts,” that is, he makes two parts of it by way of the chewed and the unchewed. “One who has a goitre” is one who has a goitre.

original: gadhitādibhāvena paribhoge ādīnavamattampi na passati. Mattaññutāti paribhoge mattaññutā.
analyzed: gadhita ādi bhāvena paribhoge ādīnava mattam pi na passati mattaññu tā ati paribhoge mattaññu tā
translated: “Vomiting” is the expulsion of the food by the mouth, not by the bowels. “He has lost his mindfulness” means that he has lost his mindfulness by not being mindful. “He does not see even the danger” means that he does not see even the danger in the enjoyment of the food by way of greed, etc. “He knows the right amount” means that he knows the right amount in the enjoyment of the food.

original: Paccavekkhaṇaparibhogamattampīti paccavekkhaṇamattena paribhogampi ekavāraṃ paccavekkhitvāpi
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa paribhoga mattam pi iti paccavekkhaṇa mattena paribhogam pi eka vāram paccavekkhitvā api
translated: “He does not enjoy even the enjoyment of reflection” means that he does not enjoy even the enjoyment of reflection by reflecting once.

original: paribhuñjanampi na karoti.🔽61. Vicakkasaṇṭhānāti vipulatamacakkasaṇṭhānā. Sabbassa bhuñjanato ayokūṭasadisā
analyzed: paribhuñjanam pi na karoti  vicakka saṇṭhānā ati vipulatama cakka saṇṭhānā sabbassa bhuñjanataḥ ayokūṭa sadisā
translated: He does not enjoy the food by reflecting on it again and again.🔽“The shape of a saw” means the shape of a saw with its teeth. “Like an iron spike” means like an iron spike.

original: dantā eva dantakūṭaṃ. Apasādetīti pasādeti. Acelakādivasenāti acelakavatādivasena.
analyzed: dantāḥ eva dantakūṭam apasāda iti iti pasāda iti acelaka ādi vasena ati acelakavatā ādi vasena
translated: “His teeth are the spike” means that his teeth are the spike. “He is satisfied” means that he is satisfied. “By way of the naked ascetics, etc.” means by way of the naked ascetics, etc.

original: Lūkhājīvinti sallekhapaṭipattiyā lūkhajīvikaṃ.
analyzed: lūkhājīvin ti sallekha paṭipattiyā lūkha jīvikam
translated: “He has a hard life” means that he has a hard life by way of the practice of austerity.

original: 62. Tapaṃ karotīti bhāvanāmanasikāralakkhaṇaṃ tapaṃ carati caranto viya hoti. Caṅkamaṃ otarati bhāvanaṃ anuyuñjanto viya. Vihāraṅgaṇaṃ sammajjati vattapaṭipattiṃ pūrento viya.
analyzed: tapam karoti iti bhāvanā manasikāra lakkhaṇam tapam carati carantaḥ viya hoti caṅkamam otarati bhāvanam anuyuñjantaḥ viya vihāra aṅgaṇam sammajjati vatta paṭipattim pūrentaḥ viya
translated: He does the ascetic practice: he practices the ascetic practice characterized by the attention of development, as if he were a monk who was practicing it. He descends into the walking place: he engages in development, as if he were a monk who was doing so. He sweeps the courtyard of the monastery: he fulfills the practice of duties, as if he were a monk who was doing so.

original: “Ādassayamāno”ti vā pāṭho.
analyzed: vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: Or the reading is “ādassayamāno” .

original: Kiñci vajjanti kiñci kāyikaṃ vā vācasikaṃ vā dosaṃ. Diṭṭhigatanti viparītadassanaṃ.🔽Aruccamānanti attano siddhante paṭikkhittabhāvena aruccamānaṃ. Ruccati meti “kappati
analyzed: kiñci vajjanti kiñci kāyikam vā vācasikam vā dosam diṭṭhi gatam ti viparīta dassanam  a ruccamānam ti attanaḥ siddhante paṭikkhitta bhāvena a ruccamānam ruccati mā iti kappati
translated: Any offense: any offense of body or speech. View: distorted seeing.🔽Disapproving: disapproving of it as something to be rejected in his own established doctrine. He approves of it: he says, “It is allowable for me.”

original: me”ti vadati. Anujānitabbanti tacchāviparītabhūtabhāvena “evameta”nti anujānitabbaṃ.
analyzed: mā iti vadati anujānitabbam ti tad chāyā viparīta bhūta bhāvena evam etat iti anujānitabbam
translated: He should be agreed with: he should be agreed with in the sense of “So it is” in the sense of the truth of the opposite of his wrong view.

original: Savanamanohāritāya “sādhu suṭṭhū”ti anumoditabbaṃ.
analyzed: savana manohāritāya sādhu suṭṭhu iti anumoditabbam
translated: He should be congratulated: he should be congratulated with the words “Good, good” in order to please his mind.

original: 63. Kujjhanasīlatāya kodhano. Vuttalakkhaṇo upanāho etassa atthīti upanāhī. Evaṃbhūto ca taṃsamaṅgī hotīti “samannāgato hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Esa nayo ito paresupi.
analyzed: kujjhana sīla tāya kodhanaḥ vutta lakkhaṇo upanāhaḥ etassa atthi iti upanāhī evaṃbhūto ca tad samaṅgī hoti iti samannāgataḥ hoti iti vuttam esa nayaḥ itas paresu pi
translated: He is irritable: he has the nature of being angry. He has resentment: he has the characteristic of resentment. He is one who has that: he is one who has that as a component.

original: Ayaṃ pana viseso – issati usūyatīti ussukī. Saṭhanaṃ asantaguṇasambhāvanaṃ saṭho,
analyzed: ayam pana visesaḥ issati usūyati iti ussukī saṭhanam asanta guṇa sambhāvanam saṭhaḥ
translated: But the difference is this. He is called a schemer who schemes, who is bent on scheming; he is called a deceiver who deceives, who is bent on deceiving;

original: so etassa atthīti saṭho. Santadosapaṭicchādanasabhāvā māyā, māyā etassa atthīti māyāvī.
analyzed: saḥ etassa atthi iti saṭho santa dosa paṭicchādana sabhāvā māyā māyā etassa atthi iti māyāvī
translated: But there is this difference: one who is ussukī is so in the sense of being ussita and usūyati ; one who is saṭho is so in the sense of saṭhana, the feigning of pretended qualities ;

original: Garuṭṭhāniyānampi paṇipātākaraṇalakkhaṇaṃ thambhanaṃ thaddhaṃ, tamettha atthīti thaddho.
analyzed: garuṭṭhā niyānam pi paṇipāta akaraṇa lakkhaṇam thambhanam thaddham tam ettha atthi iti thaddhaḥ
translated: one who is thaddho is so in the sense of thambhana, the concealing of one’s real feelings,

original: Guṇehi samānaṃ, adhikañca atikkamitvā nihīnaṃ katvā maññanasīlatāya atimānī. Asantaguṇasambhāvanatthikatāsaṅkhātā
analyzed: guṇehi samānam adhikam ca atikkamitvā nihīnam katvā maññana sīla tāya atimānī asanta guṇa sambhāvanatthika tā saṅkhātā
translated: one who is atimānī is so in the sense of atimāno, the habit of thinking oneself equal to or superior to one’s betters;

original: pāpā lāmakā icchā etassāti pāpiccho. Micchā viparītā diṭṭhi etassāti micchādiṭṭhiko.🔽“Idameva saccaṃ, moghamañña”nti evaṃ attanā attābhiniviṭṭhatāya satā diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi,
analyzed: pāpā lāmakā icchā etassa ati pāpicchaḥ micchā viparītā diṭṭhi etassa ati micchādiṭṭhikaḥ  idam eva saccam mogham aññanti evam attanā attā abhiniviṭṭha tāya satā diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhi
translated: one who is pāpiccho is so in the sense of pāpikā icchā, evil, sordid desires; one who is micchādiṭṭhiko is so in the sense of micchā diṭṭhi, wrong, perverted views;🔽one who is sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī is so in the sense of sandiṭṭhi and parāmāsā. Sandiṭṭhi is the view that one’s own view is true and all others false.

original: tameva parāmasatīti sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “sayaṃ diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhī”ti
analyzed: tam eva parāmasati iti sandiṭṭhi parāmāsī aṭṭhakathā ayam pana sayam diṭṭhi sandiṭṭhī iti
translated: Parāmāsā is the clinging to that view. In the commentary the word is analyzed as saṃdiṭṭhi and parāmāsā.

original: vatthuvasena attho vutto. Ā bāḷhaṃ viya dhīyatīti ādhānanti āha “daḷhaṃ suṭṭhu ṭhapita”nti.
analyzed: vatthu vasena atthaḥ vuttaḥ ā bāḷham viya dhīyati iti ādhānan ti āha daḷham suṭṭhu ṭhapitanti
translated: The meaning is stated by way of the basis. It is firmly placed, as it were, by the mind, thus it is a basis . He says, “firmly and well placed.”

original: Yathāgahitaṃ gāhaṃ paṭinissajjanasīlo paṭinissaggī, tappaṭikkhepena duppaṭinissaggī.
analyzed: yathā gahitam gāham paṭinissajjana sīlaḥ paṭinissaggī tad paṭikkhepena duppaṭinissaggī
translated: One who has the habit of relinquishing the grasping as it arises is a relinquisher ; by the denial of that he is a non-relinquisher.

original: Paṭisedhattho hi ayaṃ du-saddo yathā “duppañño, dussīlo”ti ca.
analyzed: paṭisedha atthaḥ hi ayam du saddaḥ yathā duppaññaḥ dussīlaḥ ti ca
translated: For the prefix du- has the meaning of denial, as in “dull” and “unvirtuous.”

original: Parisuddhapapaṭikappattakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the purity of virtue.

original: 64. Idha nigrodha tapassīti yathānukkantaṃ purimapāḷiṃ nigamanavasena ekadesena dasseti.
analyzed: idha nigrodha tapassi iti yathā anukkantam purima pāḷim nigamana vasena ekadesena dasseti
translated: Here the Blessed One shows the ascetic Nigrodha by way of one part of the passage quoted in the way it occurs in the sutta.

original: Tenāha “evaṃ bhagavā”tiādi. Gahitaladdhinti “acelakādibhāvo seyyo, tena ca saṃsārasuddhi
analyzed: tena āha evam tena ca saṃsāra suddhi
translated: Therefore he says, “Thus the Blessed One,” and so on. The view he had grasped: the view that “the state of a naked ascetic, etc., is better, and through it the purification of the round of rebirths is accomplished.”

original: hotī”ti evaṃ gahitaladdhiṃ. Rakkhitaṃ tapanti tāya laddhiyā samādiyitvā rakkhitaṃ
analyzed: hoti iti evam gahita laddhim rakkhitam tapanti tāya laddhiyā samādiyitvā rakkhitam
translated: The austerity he had observed: the austerity of a naked ascetic, etc., that he had observed by undertaking that view.

original: acelakavatāditapaṃ. “Sabbameva saṃkiliṭṭha”nti iminā yaṃ vakkhati parisuddhapāḷivaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: sabbam eva iminā yam vakkhati
translated: “Everything is defiled”: by this he shows the purity of the text in the explanation.

original: “lūkhatapassino ceva dhutaṅgadharassa ca vasena yojanā veditabbā”ti, tassa parikappitarūpassa
analyzed: lūkhatapassino ca iva dhutaṅgadharassa ca vasena yojanā veditabbā ati tassa parikappita rūpassa
translated: “The interpretation should be understood as ‘harsh’ and ‘ascetic’ in the sense of one who bears the ascetic practices.”

original: lūkhassa tapassinoti ayamettha adhippāyoti dasseti. “Parisuddhapāḷidassanattha”nti
analyzed: lūkhassa tapassino ti ayam ettha adhippāyaḥ ti dasseti parisuddha pāḷi dassana attham
translated: He shows that the intended meaning here is this: “harsh” in the sense of “harshness” and “ascetic” in the sense of “one who bears the ascetic practices.”🔽And by the words “in order to show the purity of the text”

original: ca iminā titthiyānaṃ vasena pāḷi yevettha labbhati, na pana tadatthoti dasseti. Vuttavipakkhavasenāti
analyzed: ca iminā titthiyānam vasena pāḷi yā iva ittha labbhati na pana tad atthaḥ ti dasseti vutta vipakkha vasena ati
translated: he shows that only the text is available here in the sense of the sectarians, not its meaning.🔽In the sense of the opposite of what is stated:

original: vuttassa atthassa paṭipakkhavasena, paṭikkhepavasenāti attho. Tasmiṃ ṭhāneti hetuatthe
analyzed: vuttassa atthassa paṭipakkha vasena paṭikkhepa vasena ati atthaḥ tasmim ṭhāne iti hetu atthe
translated: in the sense of the opposite of the meaning stated, in the sense of the prohibition.🔽In that case: in the sense of reason.

original: bhummanti tassa hetuatthena karaṇavacanena atthaṃ dassento “evaṃ so tenā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: bhumman ti tassa hetu atthena karaṇa vacanena attham dassentaḥ evam saḥ tena ati ādim āha
translated: The ground: showing the meaning by the instrumental case in the sense of reason, he says “thus he by that.”

original: Uttari vāyamamānoti yathāsamādinnehi dhutadhammehi aparituṭṭho, apariyositasaṅkappo
analyzed: uttari vā āyamamānaḥ ti yathā samādinnehi dhuta dhammehi a parituṭṭhaḥ a pariyosita saṅkappo
translated: Or striving further: not satisfied with the ascetic practices as undertaken, not having completed his intention,

original: ca hutvā upari bhāvanānuyogavasena sammāvāyāmaṃ karonto.
analyzed: ca hutvā upari bhāvanā anuyoga vasena sammāvāyāmam karonto
translated: he is striving rightly by undertaking the practice of meditation.🔽From here on: after the method stated thus.

original: 69. Ito paranti ito yathāvuttanayato paraṃ. Aggabhāvaṃ vā sārabhāvaṃ vāti tapojigucchāya
analyzed: itas paranti itas yathā vutta nayataḥ param agga bhāvam vā sāra bhāvam vā ati tapaḥ jigucchāya
translated: The state of the foremost or the state of the essence: in the sense of austerity and disgust.

original: aggabhāvaṃ vā sārabhāvaṃ vā ajānanto. “Ayamevassa aggabhāvo sārabhāvo”ti maññamāno
analyzed: agga bhāvam vā sāra bhāvam vā a jānantaḥ ayam eva assa agga bhāvaḥ sāra bhāvaḥ ti maññamāno
translated: not knowing what is the best or the essence. Thinking, “This is the best, this is the essence,”

original: “aggappattā, sārappattā cā”ti āha.
analyzed: agga ppattā sāra ppattā ca ati āha
translated: he said, “They have attained the best, they have attained the essence.”

original: Parisuddhatacappattādikathāvaṇṇanā🔽70. Yamanaṃ saṃyamanaṃ yāmo, hiṃsādīnaṃ akaraṇavasena catubbidho yāmova cātuyāmo,
analyzed: parisuddha taca ppatta ādi kathā vaṇṇanā  yamanam saṃyamanam yāmaḥ hiṃsā ādīnam akaraṇa vasena catubbidhaḥ yāmaḥ uva cātuyāmaḥ
translated: The explanation of the section on “having reached the purity of the true Dhamma” and so on.🔽The fourfold restraint by way of not doing harm, etc., is the fourfold restraint.

original: so eva saṃvaro, tena saṃvuto guttasabbadvāro cātuyāmasaṃvarasaṃvuto. Tenāha “catubbidhena
analyzed: so eva saṃvaraḥ tena saṃvutaḥ gutta sabba dvāro cātuyāma saṃvara saṃvutaḥ tena āha catubbidhena
translated: That itself is the restraint, and he who is restrained by that, who has guarded the six doors of sense, is “restrained by the fourfold restraint.” Therefore it is said: “He is restrained by the fourfold restraint.”

original: saṃvarena pihito”ti. Atipātanaṃ hiṃsananti āha “pāṇaṃ na hanatī”ti. Lobhacittena🔽bhāvitaṃ sambhāvitanti katvā bhāvitaṃ nāma pañca kāmaguṇā. Ayañca tesu tesaṃyeva
analyzed: saṃvarena pihitā iti atipātanam hiṃsanam iti āha pāṇam na hanati iti lobha cittena  bhāvitam sambhāvitanti katvā bhāvitam nāma pañca kāmaguṇāḥ ayam ca tesu tesaṃyeva
translated: He does not kill living beings, he does not take what is not given, he does not tell lies, he does not drink strong drink.🔽The five strands of sense pleasure are called “developed” because they are developed by the mind of greed.

original: samudācāro maggoṭṭhāpakaṃ viyāti āha “tesaṃ saññāyā”ti.
analyzed: samudācāraḥ maggoṭṭhāpakam viya āti āha tesam saññāya iti
translated: And this is the manifestation of them. Therefore it is said: “By the perception of them.”

original: Etanti abhiharaṇaṃ, hīnāya anāvattanañca. Tenāha “so abhiharatīti ādilakkhaṇa”nti.
analyzed: etat ti abhiharaṇam hīnāya anāvattanam ca tena āha saḥ abhiharati iti ādi lakkhaṇam ti
translated: The meaning of “he does not transgress” is the meaning of “he does not overstep.” Therefore it is said: “The characteristic of it is not overstepping.”

original: Abhiharatīti abhibuddhiṃ neti. Tenāha “uparūpari vaḍḍhetī”ti. Cakkavattināpi pabbajitassa
analyzed: abhiharati iti abhibuddhim na iti tena āha uparu upari vaḍḍheti iti cakkavattinā api pabbajitassa
translated: Even a world monarch does homage to one gone forth.

original: abhivādanādi karīyatevāti pabbajjā seṭṭhā guṇavisesayogato, dosavirahitato ca, yato
analyzed: abhivādana ādi pabbajjā seṭṭhā guṇa visesa yogataḥ dosa virahitataḥ ca yatas
translated: Therefore, because of the possession of special qualities and because of the absence of faults,

original: sā paṇḍitapaññattā vuttā. Gihibhāvo pana nihīno tadubhayābhāvatoti āha “hīnāya gihibhāvatthāyā”ti.
analyzed: sā paṇḍita paññattā vuttā gihi bhāvaḥ pana nihīnaḥ tad ubhaya abhāvato ti āha hīnāya gihi bhāva atthāya ati
translated: it is said that the going forth is the best, as declared by the wise. But the state of a house- dweller is low, because of the absence of both of these. Therefore it is said, “for the sake of the low state of a house-dweller.”

original: 71. Tacappattāti tacaṃ pattā, tacasadisā hotīti attho.
analyzed: tacappattā iti tacam pattā taca sadisā hoti iti attho
translated: “Has attained the skin” : has attained the skin, i.e., is like the skin.

original: 74. Titthiyānaṃ vasenāti titthiyānaṃ samayavasena. Nesanti titthiyānaṃ. Tanti dibbacakkhuṃ.
analyzed: titthiyānam vasena ati titthiyānam samaya vasena nesanti titthiyānam dibba cakkhum
translated: “According to the views of the sectarians” : according to the doctrines of the sectarians. “They claim” : the sectarians claim. “The divine eye” : the divine eye.

original: Sīlasampadāti sabbākārasampannaṃ catupārisuddhisīlaṃ. Tacasārasampattitoti tacatapojigucchāyāsārasampattito.
analyzed: sīla sampadā ti sabba ākāra sampannam catu pārisuddhi sīlam taca sāra sampattitaḥ ti taca tapaḥ jigucchāyā sāra sampattitaḥ
translated: “The perfection of virtue” : the virtue of the fourfold purity in all its aspects. “The perfection of the essence of the skin” : the perfection of the essence of the skin, austerity, and shame.

original: Visesabhāvanti visesasabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: visesa bhāvanti visesa sabhāvam
translated: “The special nature” : the special essence.

original: Acelakapāḷimattampīti acelakapāḷiāgatatthamattampi natthi, tasmā mayaṃ anassāma vinaṭṭhāti
analyzed: a celaka pāḷi mattam pi iti na atthi tasmā mayam anassāma vinaṭṭhāti
translated: “Not even the mere skin of the naked ascetics” : there is not even the mere skin of the naked ascetics, as stated in the Kapathika Sutta. Therefore we will not be ruined.

original: attho. A-kāro vā nipātamattaṃ, nassāmāti vinassāma. Kuto parisuddhapāḷīti kuto eva
analyzed: atthaḥ akāraḥ vā nipāta mattam nassāma ati vinassāma kutas parisuddha pāḷī iti kutas eva
translated: Attho. A-kāro vā nipātamattaṃ, nassāmāti vinassāma. Kuto parisuddhapāḷīti kuto eva

original: amhesu parisuddhapāḷiāgatapaṭipatti. Esa nayo sesesupi. Sutivasenāpīti sotapathāgamanamattenāpi na jānāma.
analyzed: amhesu esa nayo sesesu pi suti vasena api iti na jānāma
translated: amhesu parisuddhapāḷiāgatapaṭipatti. Esa nayo sesesupi. Sutivasenāpīti sotapathāgamanamattenāpi na jānāma.

original: Nigrodhassapajjhāyanavaṇṇanā
translated: Nigrodhassapajjhāyanavaṇṇanā

original: 75. Assāti sandhānassa gahapatissa. Kakkhaḷanti pharusaṃ. Durāsadavacananti avattabbavacanaṃ.
analyzed: assa ati sandhānassa gahapatissa kakkhaḷanti pharusam durāsada vacanam ti avattabba vacanam
translated: . Assāti sandhānassa gahapatissa. Kakkhaḷanti pharusaṃ. Durāsadavacananti avattabbavacanaṃ.

original: Yasmā pharusavacanaṃ yaṃ uddissa payuttaṃ, tasmiṃ khamāpite khamāpakassa paṭipākatikaṃ
analyzed: yasmā pharusa vacanam yam uddissa payuttam tasmin khamāpite khamāpakassa paṭipākatikam
translated: Yasmā pharusavacanaṃ yaṃ uddissa payuttaṃ, tasmiṃ khamāpite khamāpakassa paṭipākatikaṃ

original: hoti, tasmā “ayaṃ mayī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: hoti tasmai ayam mayi itiādi vuttam
translated: hoti, tasmā “ayaṃ mayī”tiādi vuttaṃ.

original: 76. Bodhatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na attano buddhabhāvaghosanatthāya. Vādatthāyāti
analyzed: bodha tthāya dhammam deseti na attanaḥ buddha bhāva ghosana tthāya vāda tthāya ati
translated: . Bodhatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na attano buddhabhāvaghosanatthāya. Vādatthāyāti🔽paravādabhañjanavādatthāya. Rāgādisamanatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.

original: paravādabhañjanavādatthāya. Rāgādisamanatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.
analyzed: paravāda bhañjana vāda tthāya rāga ādi samana tthāya dhammam deseti na antevāsi kamyatāya
translated: Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.🔽Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya.

original: Oghanittharaṇatthāyāti caturoghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti sabbaso orapārātiṇṇamāvahattā
analyzed: ogha nittharaṇa tthāya ati catur ogha nittharaṇa tthāya dhammam deseti sabbaso
translated: Oghanittharaṇatthāya dhammaṃ deseti, na antevāsikamyatāya

original: desanāya. Sabbakilesaparinibbānatthāya dhammaṃ deseti kilesānaṃ lesenapi desanāya aparāmaṭṭhabhāvato.
analyzed: desanāya sabba kilesa parinibbāna atthāya dhammam deseti kilesānam lesena api desanāya a parāmaṭṭha bhāvato
translated: for the destruction of all cankers. He teaches the Dhamma for the destruction of the cankers, because the teaching is not clung to by the cankers.

original: Brahmacariyapariyosānādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: brahmacariya pariyosāna ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the culmination of the holy life, etc.🔽All this, from the words “for seven years” to the words “for seven days,”

original: 77. Idaṃ sabbampīti sattavassato paṭṭhāya yāva “sattāha”nti padaṃ, idaṃ sabbampi
analyzed: idam sabbam pi iti satta vassataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva satta ahanti padam idam sabbam pi
translated: is what is called “all this speech.”

original: vacanaṃ. Asaṭho pana amāyāvī ujujātiko tikkhapañño ugghaṭitaññūti adhippāyo. So hi
analyzed: vacanam asaṭhaḥ pana amāyāvī uju jātiko tikkha pañño ugghaṭita ññū ti adhippāyaḥ so hi
translated: The purport of the words “he is not deceitful or fraudulent, but straightforward, of candid nature, of penetrative wisdom, quick-witted” is that he will be able to attain arahatship in a single moment.

original: taṃmuhutteneva arahattaṃ pattuṃ sakkhissatīti. Vaṅkavaṅkoti kāyavaṅkādīhipi vaṅkehi
analyzed: tad muhuttena iva arahattam pattum sakkhissati iti kāya vaṅka ādīhi pi vaṅkehi
translated: “Crooked, twisted, warped” : crooked, twisted, warped by the crookedness, etc., of body, etc.

original: vaṅko jimho kuṭilo. “Saṭhaṃ panāhaṃ anusāsituṃ na sakkomī”ti na idaṃ bhagavā kilāsubhāveneva🔽vadati, atha kho tassa abhājanabhāveneva.🔽78. Pakatiyā ācariyoti yo eva tumhākaṃ ito pubbe pakatiyā ācariyo ahosi, so eva idānipi
analyzed: vaṅkaḥ jimhaḥ kuṭilo saṭham pana aham anusāsitum na sakkomi iti naḥ idam bhagavā kilāsu bhāvena iva  vadati atha kho tassa a bhājana bhāvena iva  pakatiyā ācariyo ti yaḥ eva tumhākam itas pubbe pakatiyā ācariyo ahosi so eva idāni pi
translated: “I cannot advise a deceitful person” : the Exalted One does not say this because of the ascetic’s ugliness, but because he is an unfit vessel.

original: pubbāciṇṇavasena ācariyo hotu, na mayaṃ tumhe antevāsike kātukāmāti adhippāyo. Na
analyzed: ācariyaḥ hotu na mayam tumhe antevāsike kātu kāmā ti adhippāyaḥ na
translated: “Let him be your teacher who was your teacher before” : the purport is this: “Let him be your teacher now, as he was your teacher before, out of respect for the former practice. We do not want you as pupils.”

original: mayaṃ tumhākaṃ uddesena atthikā, dhammatanti meva pana tumhe ñāpetukāmamhāti adhippāyo.🔽Ājīvatoti jīvikāya vuttito. Akusalāti koṭṭhāsaṃ pattāti akusalāti taṃ taṃ koṭṭhāsataṃyeva
analyzed: mayam tumhākam uddesena atthikāḥ dhamma tanti mā iva pana tumhe adhippāyo  ājīvato ti jīvikāya vuttitaḥ akusalā ati koṭṭhāsam pattā ati akusalā ati tam tam koṭṭhāsa taṃyeva
translated: “We are in need of you for the recitation. But we want you to declare the Dhamma.”🔽“For livelihood” means for the means of living. “Unwholesome” means “having gone to the parts” .

original: upagatā. Kilesadarathasampayuttāti kilesadarathasahitā taṃsambandhanato. Jātijarāmaraṇānaṃ
analyzed: upagatā kilesada ratha sampayuttā ati kilesada ratha sahitā tad sambandhanataḥ

translated: The meaning is: “We know his Dhamma.” In order to know it, they thought, “We will lead the holy life.”🔽But their thought arose only once, on the day they went forth. original: Sakavādasamussāpananti sakavādapaggaṇhanaṃ. Vāsanāyāti saccasampaṭivedhavāsanāya.🔽Nesanti ca pakaraṇavasena vuttaṃ. Tadaññesampi hi bhagavato sammukhā, paramparāya🔽ca devamanussānaṃ suṇantānaṃ vāsanāya paccayo evāti. Yaṃ panettha atthato na vibhattaṃ,🔽taṃ suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: saka vāda samussāpanam ti saka vāda paggaṇhanam vāsanāya ati sacca sampaṭivedha vāsanāya  na isanti ca pakaraṇa vasena vuttam tat aññesam pi hi bhagavato sammukhā paramparāya  ca deva manussānam suṇantānam vāsanāya paccayaḥ eva ati yam pana ittha atthataḥ na vibhattam  tam su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: The meaning is: “We know his Dhamma.” In order to know it, they thought, “We will lead the holy life under him.” But their thought did not arise even once in a day. But what could they do if they were told to wait seven days? The construction is this: “We will fulfil the holy life for seven days” or “we will fulfil the seven days by means of the holy life.” The meaning is: “We will fulfil the seven days by means of the holy life.” “To break the opponent’s doctrine”: to crush the opponent’s doctrine. “To exalt one’s own doctrine”: to exalt one’s own doctrine. “By means of the influence”: by means of the influence of the penetration of the truths. “They will not”: this is said by way of the text. For other people, too, who hear the Blessed One’s word either directly or by a succession of teachers, the influence is a condition. But what has not been analyzed here in the meaning can be understood easily enough.

original: yattha pubbe lāpo ṭhito, tattheva leḍḍumhi. Uranti attano urappadesaṃ. Paccatāḷesīti
analyzed: yattha pubbe lāpaḥ ṭhitaḥ tattha iva leḍḍumhi uranti attanaḥ ura ppadesam paccatāḷesi iti
translated: and the place where the quarrel had been going on was the same as the place where the clod was. They were “bouncing” on their chests.🔽“They struck back” means that they went quickly with violence and struck back, thus they “struck back” .

original: pati atāḷesi sārambhavasena vegena gantvā paharaṇato vidhārentī patāḷesi. Ārammaṇanti
analyzed: atāḷesi sārambha vasena vegena gantvā paharaṇataḥ vidhārentī patāḷesi
translated: “Object” means condition.

original: paccayaṃ. “Avasara”nti keci.
analyzed: paccayam avasaranti keci
translated: “Opportunity” is said by some.

original: “Kusalāna”nti evaṃ pavattāya desanāya ko anusandhi? Yathāanusandhi eva. Ādito hi
analyzed: evam pavattāya desanāya kaḥ anusandhi yathāanusandhi eva āditaḥ hi
translated: What is the connection with the teaching that proceeds thus, “The profitable”? The connection is just as it is. For in the first place,

original: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharathā”tiādinā yeva attadhammapariyāyena lokiyalokuttaradhammā
analyzed: atta dīpāḥ bhikkhave viharatha ati ādinā yeva atta dhamma pariyāyena lokiya lokuttara dhammā
translated: the mundane and supramundane states of the profitable have already been included by the “self-as-a-subject-of-experience triad” in the way beginning, “Bhikkhus, be islands unto yourselves” ,

original: gahitā, te yevettha kusalaggahaṇena gahitāti. Anavajjalakkhaṇānanti avajjapaṭipakkhasabhāvānaṃ.
analyzed: gahitā te yā iva itthā kusala ggahaṇena gahitā ati anavajja lakkhaṇānam ti avajja paṭipakkha sabhāvānam
translated: and they are included again here by the word “profitable.” “Having the characteristic of being blameless” : having the nature opposite to that of what is blameworthy.

original: “Avajjarahitasabhāvāna”nti keci. Tattha purime atthavikappe vipākadhammadhammā eva
analyzed: avajja rahita sabhāvānam ti keci tattha purime attha vikappe vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ eva
translated: “Having the nature of being free from what is blameworthy” is said by some. Herein, in the first interpretation of the meaning, only states that are ideas consisting in potentialities are included,

original: gahitā, dutiye pana vipākadhammāpi. Yadi evaṃ, kathaṃ tesaṃ samādāya vattananti?
analyzed: gahitāḥ dutiye pana vipāka dhammā api yadi evam katham tesam samādāya
translated: but in the second interpretation of the meaning, states that are ideas consisting in potentialities and states that are ideas consisting in ripening are included. If that is so, then how is it that they are included in the “self-as-a-subject-of-experience triad”?

original: Na kho panetaṃ evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ “vipākadhammā sīlādi viya samādāya vattitabbā”ti.
analyzed: na kho pana etat evam daṭṭhabbam vipāka dhammā sīla ādi viya samādāya vattitabbā ati
translated: But it should not be regarded as “to be undertaken” in the way that virtue, etc., are.

original: Samādānanti pana attano santāne sammā ādānaṃ paccayavasena pavatti yevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Vipākadhammā hi paccayavisesehi sattasantāne sammadeva āhitā āyuādisampattivisesabhūtā
analyzed: samādānam ti pana attano santāne sammā ādānam paccaya vasena pavatti yeva āti daṭṭhabbaṃ  vipāka dhammāḥ hi paccaya visesehi satta santāne sammat eva āhitā āyu ādi sampatti visesa bhūtā
translated: “Undertaken” should be understood as the occurrence by way of conditions of the right taking up in one’s own continuity.

original: uparūparikusalavisesuppattiyā upanissayā hontīti vadanti. Puññaṃ pavaḍḍhatīti ettha
analyzed: upari upari kusala visesa uppattiyā upanissayāḥ honti iti vadanti puññam pavaḍḍhati iti ettha
translated: For they say that states to be experienced in some future existence, when rightly taken up in one’s continuity by means of special conditions, become the support for the arising of the special excellence of life span, etc., and for the arising of the special excellence of successively higher profitable states in the future.

original: puññanti uttarapadalopenāyaṃ niddesoti āha “puññaphalaṃ vaḍḍhatī”ti. Puññaphalanti
analyzed: puññanti uttara pada lopena ayam niddeso ti āha puñña phalam vaḍḍhati iti puñña phalanti
translated: “Merit increases” : here, merit is the demonstrative pronoun in the sense of the latter part of the compound, merit’s fruit . Thus he said, “merit’s fruit increases.”

original: ca ekadesasarūpekasesena vuttaṃ “puññañca puññaphalañca puññaphala”nti āha “uparūpari
analyzed: ca eka desa sarūpa ikasesena vuttam puññam ca puñña phalam ca puñña phalam ti āha upari upari
translated: And merit’s fruit is said in the sense of a part of the whole, a portion of the whole. Thus he said, “merit and merit’s fruit.”

original: puññampi puññavipākopi veditabbo”ti.
analyzed: puñam pi puñña vipākaḥ api veditabbaḥ ti
translated: And he said, “merit should be understood as merit’s ripening.”

original: “Mātāpitūna”ntiādi nidassanamattaṃ, tasmā aññampi evarūpaṃ hetūpanissayaṃ kusalaṃ
analyzed: mātā pitūn anti ādi nidassana mattam tasmai aññam pi evarūpam hetu upanissayam kusalam
translated: The words “mother and father” are merely an illustration. Therefore any such cause and support for profitable states should be understood.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sinehavasenāti upanissayabhūtassa sinehassa vasena, na sampayuttassa.🔽Na hi sinehasampayuttaṃ nāma kusalaṃ atthi. Mudumaddavacittanti mettāvasena ativiya
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam sineha vasena ati upanissaya bhūtassa sinehassa vasena na sampayuttassa  na hi sineha sampayuttam nāma kusalam atthi mudumat dava cittam ti mettā vasena
translated: and should be seen. By way of affection: by way of the affection that is a condition, not by way of the affection that is a conascent factor.🔽For there is no profitable that is conascent with affection. With a mind that is soft and malleable: with a mind that is very soft and malleable by means of loving-kindness.

original: maddavantaṃ cittaṃ. Yathā matthakappattaṃ vaṭṭagāmikusalaṃ dassetuṃ “mātāpitūnaṃ🔽…pe… mudumaddavacitta”nti vuttaṃ, evaṃ matthakappattameva vivaṭṭagāmikusalaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: maddavantam cittam yathā matthaka ppattam vaṭṭa gāmi kusalam dassetum mātā pitūnam  pe mudu mad dava cittan ti vuttam evam matthaka ppattam eva vivaṭṭa gāmi kusalam dassetuṃ
translated: Just as “with a mind that is soft and malleable” is said in order to show the profitable that is the end of the round of rebirths,

original: “cattāro sati…pe… bodhipakkhiyadhammā”ti vuttaṃ. Tadaññepi pana dānasīlādidhammā
analyzed: cattāro satipe bodhi pakkhiya dhammā ti vuttam tad aññe api pana dāna sīla ādi dhammā
translated: so “the four foundations of mindfulness … the things that are aids to enlightenment” is said in order to show the profitable that is the end of the round of rebirths.🔽But other ideas such as giving, virtue, etc.,

original: vaṭṭassa upanissayabhūtā vaṭṭagāmikusalaṃ vivaṭṭassa upanissayabhūtā vivaṭṭagāmikusalanti
analyzed: vaṭṭassa upanissaya bhūtā vaṭṭa gāmi kusalam vivaṭṭassa upanissaya bhūtā vivaṭṭa gāmi kusalanti
translated: should be understood as the profitable that is the end of the round of rebirths and the profitable that is the end of the round of rebirth respectively, since they are conditions for the round of rebirths and for the end of the round of rebirths.

original: veditabbā. Pariyosānanti phalavisesāvahatāya phaladāya koṭi sikhāppatti, devaloke
analyzed: veditabbā pariyosānanti phala visesa āvahatāya phala dāya deva loke
translated: The end: the end is the attainment of the peak, the fruit, which brings about the distinction of the fruit, and the distinction of the glory of existence in the world of the gods.

original: ca pavattisirivibhavoti pariyosānaṃ “manussaloke”ti visesitaṃ, manussalokavaseneva
analyzed: ca pavatti siri vibhavaḥ ti pariyosānam manussa loka iti visesitam manussa loka vasena iva
translated: “In the human world” is specified because the end is reached by means of the human world.

original: cāyaṃ desanā āgatāti. Maggaphalanibbānasampatti pariyosānanti yojanā. Vivaṭṭagāmikusalassa
analyzed: ca ayam desanā āgatā ati magga phala nibbāna sampatti pariyosānanti yojanā vivaṭṭa gāmi kusalassa
translated: and this is the way the teaching comes in. The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the path, fruition, and extinction is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.

original: vipākaṃ suttapariyosāne dassissati “atha kho, bhikkhave, saṅkho nāma rājā”tiādinā.
analyzed: vipākam sutta pariyosāne dassissati atha kho bhikkhave saṅkhaḥ nāma rājā ati ādinā
translated: The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.

original: Daḷhanemicakkavattirājakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.

original: 81. Idhāti imasmiṃ “kusalānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammāna”ntiādinā suttadesanāya āraddhaṭṭhāne
analyzed: idha ti imasmim kusalānam bhikkhave dhammānam ti ādinā sutta desanāyaḥ āraddha ṭṭhāne
translated: The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.

original: vaṭṭavivaṭṭagāmibhāvena sādhāraṇe kusalaggahaṇe. Tattha vaṭṭagāmikusalānusandhivasena🔽“bhūtapubbaṃ bhikkhave”ti desanaṃ ārabhi, ārabhanto ca desiyamānamattaṃ. Dhammapaṭiggāhakānaṃ🔽bhikkhūnaṃ saṅkhepato evaṃ dīpetvā ārabhīti dassetuṃ “bhikkhave”tiādi vuttaṃ, paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa gāmi bhāvena sādhāraṇe kusala ggahaṇe tattha vaṭṭa gāmi kusala anusandhi vasena  bhūta pubbam bhikkhave iti desanam ārabhi ārabhanto ca desiyamāna mattam dhamma paṭiggāhakānam  bhikkhūnam saṅkhepataḥ evam dīpetvā ārabhi iti dassetum bhikkhava itiādi vuttam paṭhamam
translated: The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.

original: tathā adīpentopi bhagavā atthato dīpeti viyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: tathā a dīpentaḥ api bhagavā atthataḥ dīpeti viyā ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The Thread’s meaning is construable as ‘The success of the one going on the round and the one going off the round is the culmination ’.🔽The Thread’

original: 82. Īsakampīti appamattakampi. Avasakkitanti ogatabhaṭṭhaṃ. Nemiabhimukhanti nemippadesassa
analyzed: īsa kampi iti appamatta kampi avasakkitam ti ogata bhaṭṭham nemi abhimukham ti nemi ppadesassa
translated: ‘Even a little’: even a very little. ‘Slipped’: slipped down. ‘Facing the rim’: facing the rim’s place.

original: sammukhā. Bandhiṃsu cakkaratanassa osakkitānosakkitabhāvaṃ jānituṃ. Tadetanti yathāvuttaṭṭhānā
analyzed: sammukhāḥ bandhiṃsu cakkaratanassa osakkita anosakkita bhāvam jānitum tat etat ti yathāvutta ṭṭhānā
translated: ‘They bound it’: they bound it in order to know whether the Wheel-Jewel had slipped or not. ‘That’: the death as already described.

original: cavanaṃ. Atibalavadoseti rañño balavati anatthe upaṭṭhite sati.
analyzed: cavanam ati balava dose iti raññaḥ balavati anatthe upaṭṭhite sati
translated: ‘A very powerful misfortune’: when a very powerful misfortune had arisen for the King.

original: Appamattoti rañño āṇāya pamādaṃ akaronto.
analyzed: appamatto ti raññaḥ āṇāya pamādam a karontaḥ
translated: ‘Attentively’: not being negligent by the King’s order.

original: Ekasamuddapariyantamevāti jambudīpameva sandhāya vadati. So uttarato assakaṇṇapabbatena🔽paricchinnaṃ hutvā attānaṃ parikkhipitvā ṭhitaekasamuddapariyanto. Puññiddhivasenāti
analyzed: eka samudda pariyantam evā ti jambudīpam eva sandhāya vadati saḥ uttaratas assakaṇṇa pabbatena  paricchinnam hutvā attānam parikkhipitvā ṭhita eka samudda pariyantaḥ puññiddhi vasena ati
translated: ‘As far as the ocean’s shore’: he speaks with reference to Jambudīpa alone. That is surrounded by the Assakaṇṇa mountain in the north,

original: cakkavattibhāvāvahāya puññiddhiyā vasena.
analyzed: cakkavatti bhāva āvahāya puññiddhiyāḥ vasena
translated: and it is the shore of the ocean that is surrounded by itself. ‘By the power of merit’: by the power of merit that brings about the state of a Wheel-Turning Monarch.

original: 83. Evaṃ katvāti kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā. Sukataṃ kammanti dasakusalakammapathameva vadati.
analyzed: evam katvā ati kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā su katam kammanti dasa kusala kamma patham eva vadati
translated: ‘Having done thus’: having put on the yellow robes. ‘Well-done deed’: he speaks of the ten courses of wholesome kamma.

original: “Dasavidhaṃ, dvādasavidha”nti ca vuttavibhāgo parato āgamissati. Pūrentenevāti pūretvā
analyzed: dasavidham dvādasavidhanti ca vutta vibhāgo paratas āgamissati pūrentena iva ati pūretvā
translated: ‘Tenfold, twelvefold’ will be the analysis that will come later. ‘By fulfilling’: having fulfilled.

original: ṭhiteneva. Niddoseti cakkavattivattassa paṭipakkhabhūtānaṃ dosānaṃ apagamane niddose.
analyzed: ṭhitena iva niddose iti cakkavatti vattassa paṭipakkha bhūtānam dosānaṃ apagamane niddose
translated: and he did so while standing. He removed the faults: he removed the faults that are the opposites of the wheel-turning monarch’s conduct.

original: Cakkavattīnaṃ vatteti cakkavattirājūhi vattitabbavatte. Bhāvini bhūte viya hi upacāro
analyzed: cakkavattīnam vattā iti cakkavatti rājūhi vattitabba vatte bhāvini bhūte viya hi upacāraḥ
translated: He conducted himself in the conduct of wheel-turning monarchs: the conduct that should be conducted by wheel-turning monarch kings. The usage is as if it were in the future,

original: yathā “agamā rājagahaṃ buddho”ti. Adhigatacakkavattibhāvāpi hi te tattha vattantevāti tathā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yathā agamā rājagaham buddhaḥ ti adhigata cakkavatti bhāvā api hi te tattha vattante iva ati tathā vuttam
translated: just as it is said, “The Enlightened One came to Rājagaha” . And although they have attained the state of wheel-turning monarchs, they conduct themselves there, thus it is said.

original: Cakkavattiariyavattavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cakkavatti ariyavatta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Noble One’s conduct of a wheel-turning monarch.🔽That Dhamma which does not allow him to conduct himself otherwise is the basis of that, thus it is the basis of that.

original: 84. Aññathā vattituṃ adento so dhammo adhiṭṭhānaṃ etassāti tadadhiṭṭhānaṃ, tena tadadhiṭṭhānena🔽cetasā. Sakkarontoti ādarakiriyāvasena karonto. Tenāha “yathā”tiādi. Garuṃ karontoti
analyzed: aññathā vattitum a dento so dhammaḥ adhiṭṭhānam etassa ati tat adhiṭṭhānam tena tad adhiṭṭhānena  cetasā sakkaronto iti ādara kiriyā vasena karonto tena āha yathā atiādi garum karonto iti
translated: With that basis in his cognizance: making it,

original: pāsāṇacchattaṃ viya garukaraṇavasena garuṃ karonto. Tenevāha “tasmiṃ gāravuppattiyā”ti.
analyzed: pāsāṇa chattam viya garu karaṇa vasena garum karontaḥ tena iva āha tasmin gārava uppattiyā iti
translated: Honouring: making it by way of doing reverence. Hence he said ‘as if it were’ and so on. Respecting: respecting it by way of respect as if it were a stone umbrella. Hence he said ‘in the occurrence of that respect.’

original: Mānentoti sambhāvanāvasena manena piyāyanto. Tenāha “tamevā”tiādi. Evaṃ pūjayato
analyzed: mānentaḥ iti sambhāvanā vasena tena āha tam eva atiādi evam pūjayataḥ
translated: Honouring: honouring it by way of esteeming it, loving it, with the mind, by way of esteem. Hence he said ‘that itself’ and so on. Worshipping it thus,

original: apacāyato evañca yathāvuttasakkārādisambhavoti taṃ dassetuṃ “taṃ apadisitvā”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. “Dhammādhipatibhūto āgatabhāvenā”ti iminā yathāvuttadhammassa jeṭṭhakabhāvena🔽purimapurimataraattabhāvesu sakkacca samupacitabhāvaṃ dasseti. “Dhammavaseneva sabbakiriyānaṃ
analyzed: apacāyataḥ evam ca yathā vutta sakkāra ādi sambhavaḥ ti tam dassetum tam apadisitvā atiādi  vuttam dhamma adhipati bhūtaḥ āgata bhāvena ati iminā yathā vutta dhammassa jeṭṭhaka bhāvena  purima purimatara atta bhāvesu sakkacca samupacita bhāvam dasseti dhamma vasena iva sabba kiriyānam
translated: And the occurrence of the respect, etc., mentioned above is due to the fact that he has been served. In order to show this, it is said: “Having served him” .🔽By the words “having become the lord of the Dhamma” he shows that the Dhamma is the most important thing, and that he has accumulated it with effort in his previous lives.

original: karaṇenā”ti etena ṭhānanisajjādīsu yathāvuttadhammaninnapoṇapabbhārabhāvaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: karaṇena iti etena ṭhāna nisajja ādīsu yathāvutta dhamma ninna poṇa pabbhāra bhāvam dasseti
translated: By the words “by the power of the Dhamma” he shows that he is inclined, inclined, and inclined towards the Dhamma in all his activities, such as standing, sitting, etc.

original: Assāti rakkhāvaraṇaguttiyā. Paraṃ rakkhanto aññaṃ diṭṭhadhammikādianatthato rakkhanto🔽teneva paratthasādhanena khantiādiguṇena attānaṃ tato eva rakkhati. Mettacittatāti🔽mettacittatāya. Nivāsanapārupanagehādīnaṃ sītuṇhādipaṭibāhanena āvaraṇaṃ. Anto janasminti
analyzed: assa ati rakkhā āvaraṇa guttiyā param rakkhantaḥ aññam diṭṭhadhammika ādi anatthataḥ rakkhantaḥ  tena iva parattha sādhanena khanti ādi guṇena attānam tatas eva rakkhati metta citta tā ti  nivāsana pārupana geha ādīnam sītuṇha ādi paṭibāhanena āvaraṇam antar janasmin ti
translated: “He protects others”: by guarding, watching over, and protecting others, by protecting them from harm in this very life,

original: abbhantarabhūte puttadārādijane.
analyzed: abbhantara bhūte putta dāra ādi jane
translated: he protects himself by the same means of accomplishing the welfare of others, namely, by the virtue of patience, etc. “By the state of loving-kindness”: by the state of loving-kindness. “By the protection”: by the protection of the robe, alms food, etc., by warding off cold, heat, etc. “Among the people within”: among the people who are within, such as sons, wife, etc.

original: “Sīlasaṃvare patiṭṭhāpehī”ti iminā rakkhaṃ dasseti, “vatthagandhamālādīni dehī”ti🔽iminā āvaraṇaṃ, itarena guttiṃ. Bhattavetanasampadānenapīti pi-saddena sīlasaṃvare
analyzed: sīla saṃvare patiṭṭhāpehi iti iminā rakkham dasseti vattha gandha mālā ādīni dehi iti  iminā āvaraṇam itarena guttim bhatta vetana sampadānena api iti pi saddena sīla saṃvare
translated: “Establish him in the restraint of virtue” shows protection; “Give him perfumes, garlands, etc.,”

original: patiṭṭhāpanādīni sampiṇḍeti. Eseva nayo ito paresupi pi-saddaggahaṇesu. Nigamo nivāso
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpana ādīni sampiṇḍeti esa iva nayaḥ itas paresu pi nigamaḥ nivāsaḥ
translated: shows concealment; and the other shows guarding. By the word “and” he includes the establishment in the restraint of virtue, etc., in the “perfection of giving gifts.” The same method of interpretation applies to the other uses of the word “and.”

original: etesanti negamā, evaṃ jānapadāti āha “nigamavāsino”tiādi.
analyzed: negamāḥ evam āha nigama vāsinaḥ utiādi
translated: Those who have villages as their abode are called “villagers.”

original: Navavidhā mānamadāti “seyyohamasmī”tiādi nayappavattiyā navavidhā mānasaṅkhātā madā.
analyzed: navavidhā māna madā ati seyyā uham asmi itiādi naya ppavattiyā navavidhāḥ māna saṅkhātāḥ madā
translated: The intoxication called conceit is of nine kinds, occurring in the mode “I am superior,” etc.

original: Māno eva hettha pamajjanākārena pavattiyā mānamado. Sobhane kāyikavācasikakamme ratoti🔽sūrato u-kārassa dīghaṃ katvā, tassa bhāvo soraccaṃ, kāyikavācasiko avītikkamo, sabbaṃ
analyzed: mānaḥ eva ha ittha pamajjana ākārena pavattiyā māna madaḥ sobhane kāyika vācasika kamme rato ti  sūrataḥ ukārassa dīgham katvā tassa bhāvaḥ soraccam kāyika vācasikaḥ a vītikkamaḥ sabbam
translated: Herein, conceit itself, occurring in the mode of infatuation, is conceit-intoxication. One who delights in beautiful bodily and verbal action is a delight-in-beauty.

original: vā kāyavacīsucaritaṃ. Suṭṭhu oratoti sorato, tassa bhāvo soraccaṃ, yathāvuttameva
analyzed: vā kāya vacī su caritam suṭṭhu oratas ti soratas tassa bhāvo soraccam yathāvuttam eva
translated: The state of that is delight-in-beauty. Or all good bodily and verbal conduct is delight-in-beauty.🔽One who is well-disposed is a delight-in-goodness. The state of that is delight-in-goodness.

original: sucaritaṃ. Rāgādīnanti rāgadosamohamānādīnaṃ. Damanādīhīti damanasamanaparinibbāpanehi.
analyzed: su caritam rāga ādīnam ti rāga dosa moha māna ādīnam damana ādīhi iti damana samana parinibbāpanehi
translated: “Good conduct” : the conduct of the three kinds of good conduct. “Rāga, etc.” : greed, hatred, delusion, conceit, etc. “By taming, etc.” : by taming, by controlling, by completely destroying.

original: Ekamattānanti ekaṃ cittaṃ, ekaccaṃ attano cittanti attho. Rāgādīnañhi pubbabhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: ekam attānam ti ekam cittam ekaccam attanaḥ cittam ti atthaḥ rāga ādīnam hi pubbabhāgiyam
translated: “By oneself alone” : by one’s own mind, by one’s own self. For in the earlier stage of practice,

original: damanādipaccekaṃ icchitabbaṃ, na maggakkhaṇe viya ekajjhaṃ paṭisaṅkhānamukhena pajahanato.
analyzed: damana ādi paccekam icchitabbam na magga kkhaṇe viya ekajjham paṭisaṅkhāna mukhena pajahanataḥ
translated: taming, etc., should be desired separately, not by way of the single act of reflection as at the moment of the path.

original: Ekamattānanti vā vivekavasena ekaṃ ekākinaṃ attānaṃ. Kāle kāleti tesaṃ santikaṃ upasaṅkamitabbe kāle kāle.
analyzed: ekam attānam ti vā viveka vasena ekam ekākinam attānam kāle kāle iti tesam santikam upasaṅkamitabbe kāle kāle
translated: Or “by oneself alone” may be taken to mean “by one’s own self in solitude.” “At the proper time” : at the time when one should approach them.

original: Idha ṭhatvāti “idaṃ kho, tāta, ta”nti evaṃ nigamanavasena vuttaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā. Vattanti
analyzed: idha ṭhatvā iti idam kho tāta evam nigamana vasena vutta ṭṭhāne ṭhatvā vattanti
translated: “Standing here” : standing in the place stated by the words “Here, dear Sir, is your share.” “One should practice” :

original: ariyacakkavattivattaṃ. Samānetabbanti “dasavidhaṃ, dvādasavidha”nti ca heṭṭhā vuttagaṇanāya
analyzed: ariya cakkavatti vattam samānetabbanti dasavidham dvādasavidham ti ca heṭṭhā vutta gaṇanāya
translated: the practice of a noble wheel-turning monarch. “In the same way” : in the same way as stated below in the enumeration of ten and twelve kinds.

original: ca samānaṃ kātabbaṃ anūnaṃ anadhikaṃ katvā dassetabbaṃ. Adhammarāgassāti ayuttaṭṭhāne
analyzed: ca samānam kātabbam anūnam anadhikam katvā dassetabbam adhamma rāgassa ati ayutta ṭṭhāne
translated: “One should show” : one should show without deficiency or excess. “In a place not fit” : in a place not fit for the performance of the rite.

original: rāgassa. Visamalobhassāti yuttaṭṭhānepi ativiya balavabhāvena pavattalobhassa.
analyzed: rāgassa visama lobhassa ati yutta ṭṭhāne pi balava bhāvena pavatta lobhassa
translated: and of lust. Of covetousness that is not equal : of covetousness that occurs with excessive strength even in a suitable object.

original: Cakkaratanapātubhāvavaṇṇanā🔽85. Vattamānassāti paripuṇṇe cakkavattivatte vattamānassa, no aparipuṇṇeti āha “pūretvā🔽vattamānassā”ti. Kittāvatā panassa pāripūrī hotīti? Tattha “katādhikārassa tāva heṭṭhimaparicchedena
analyzed: vattamānassa ati paripuṇṇe cakkavatti vatte vattamānassa no a paripuṇṇā iti āha pūretvā  vattamānassa ati kittāvatā panassa pāripūrī hoti iti tattha kata adhikārassa tāva heṭṭhima paricchedena
translated: The appearance of the Wheel Treasure

original: dvādasahipi saṃvaccharehi pūrati, pañcavīsatiyā, paññāsāya vā saṃvaccharehi. Ayañca
analyzed: saṃvaccharehi pūrati pañcavīsatiyā paññāsāya vā saṃvaccharehi
translated: When he is living : when he is living in the completed state of a Wheel-turning Monarch, not in the incomplete state, is what is meant. He says ‘when he is living in the completed state’ . But in what way is it completed? Herein, they say that it is completed for one who has the requisite merit in twelve years at the most, or in twenty-five or fifty years.

original: bhedo dhammacchandassapi tikkhamajjhamudutāvasena, itarassa tato bhiyyopī”ti vadanti.
analyzed: bhedaḥ dhammacchandassa api itarassa tatas bhiyyas api iti vadanti
translated: And this distinction is according to the keen, medium, and low order of the Wheel-turning Monarch’s zeal for the True Idea, and it is even more than that for the other .

original: Dutiyādicakkavattikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya ādi cakkavatti kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the second and subsequent Wheel-turning Monarchs

original: 90. Attano matiyāti paramparāgataṃ purāṇaṃ tantiṃ paveṇiṃ laṅghitvā attano icchitākārena. Tenāha “porāṇaka”ntiādi.
analyzed: attano matiyā ati paramparā gatam purāṇam tantim paveṇim laṅghitvā icchita ākārena tena āha porāṇa kanti ādi
translated: According to his own opinion : disregarding the ancient tradition handed down by the succession of teachers, according to his own desired interpretation. That is why he said ‘the ancient’ , and so on.

original: Na pabbantīti samiddhiyā na pūrenti, phītā na hontīti attho. Tenāha “na vaḍḍhantī”ti.
analyzed: na pabbanti iti samiddhiyā na pūrenti phītāḥ na honti iti attho tena āha na vaḍḍhanti iti
translated: Do not spread : do not reach completion by being fulfilled; the meaning is that they do not become full. That is why he said ‘do not increase’ .

original: Tathā cāha “katthaci suññā hontī”ti. Tattha tattha rājakicce raññā amā saha vattantīti🔽amaccā, yehi vinā rājakiccaṃ nappavattati. Paramparāgatā hutvā rañño parisāya bhavāti
analyzed: tathā ca āha katthaci suññāḥ honti iti tattha tattha rāja kicce raññā amā saha vattanti iti  amaccāḥ yehi vinā rāja kiccam na ppavattati paramparā gatāḥ hutvā rañño parisāya bhavāti
translated: They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.

original: pārisajjā. Tenāha “parisāvacarā”ti. Tasmiṃ ṭhānantare ṭhapitā hutvā rañño āyaṃ, vayañca🔽yāthāvato gaṇentīti gaṇakā. Jātikulasutācārādivasena puthuttaṃ gatattā mahatī mattā
analyzed: pārisajjā tena āha tasmin hutvā  yāthāvataḥ gaṇenti iti gaṇakāḥ jāti kula suta ācāra ādi vasena puthuttam mahatī mattā
translated: They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.

original: etesanti mahāmattā, te pana mahānubhāvā amaccā evāti āha “mahāamaccā”ti. Ye rañño🔽hatthānīkādīsu avaṭṭhitā, te anīkaṭṭhāti āha “hatthiācariyādayo”ti. Mantaṃ paññaṃ
analyzed: tesanti mahā mattā te pana mahā anubhāvāḥ amaccāḥ evā ti āha mahā amaccā ati ye rañño  hattha anīka ādīsu avaṭṭhitā te anīkaṭṭhā ti āha hatthi ācariya ādayo ti mantam paññam
translated: They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.

original: asitā hutvā jīvantīti mantassājīvino, matisajīvāti attho, ye tattha tattha rājakicce🔽upadesadāyino. Tenāha “mantā vuccati paññā”tiādi.
analyzed: asitāḥ hutvā jīvanti iti atthaḥ ye tattha tattha rāja kicce  tena āha mantā vuccati paññāti ādi
translated: They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.🔽They are the councilors who are born into the royal family and who are appointed to the highest offices of state.

original: Āyuvaṇṇādiparihānikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: āyu vaṇṇa ādi parihāni kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: They

original: 91. Balavalobhattāti “imasmiṃ loke idāni daliddamanussā nāma bahū, tesaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: imasmin loke idāni dalidda manussāḥ nāma bahū tesam sabbesam
translated: 91. Because of the greed for wealth and power: because of the greed for wealth and power that arises thus: “In this world now there are many poor people.

original: dhane anuppadiyamāne mayhaṃ kosassa parikkhayo hotī”ti evaṃ uppannabalavalobhattā.🔽Uparūparibhūmīsūti chakāmasaggasaṅkhātāsu uparūparikāmabhūmīsu. Kammassa phalaṃ aggaṃ
analyzed: dhane an uppadiyamāne mayham kosassa parikkhayaḥ hoti iti evam uppanna bala vala ubhattā  upari upari bhūmīsu iti cha kāmasagga saṅkhātāsu upari upari kāmabhūmīsu kammassa phalam aggam
translated: If wealth were to be distributed among them all, my wealth would be exhausted.”🔽In the higher and higher realms: in the higher and higher sense-desire realms called the six sense-desire heavens.

original: nāma, taṃ panettha uddhagāmīti āha “uddhaṃ aggaṃ assā”ti. Sagge niyuttā, saggappayojanāti
analyzed: nāma tam pana itthā uddha gāmi iti āha uddham aggam assa ati sagge niyuttā sagga ppayojanā ti
translated: The fruit of kamma is called “the best.” But here it is said to be “going upwards” because it goes upwards to the best.🔽It is “bound for heaven” because it is directed towards heaven.

original: vā sovaggikā. Dasannaṃ visesānanti dibbaāyuvaṇṇayasasukhaādhipateyyānañceva dibbarūpādīnañca
analyzed: vā sovaggikāḥ dasannam visesānanti dibba āyu vaṇṇa yasa sukha ādhipateyyānam ca iva dibba rūpa ādīnam ca
translated: The ten distinctions: the distinctions in the fruits of divine life span, beauty, glory, happiness, and sovereignty, and in divine form, etc.

original: phalavisesānaṃ. Vaṇṇaggahaṇena cettha sako attabhāvavaṇṇo gahito, rūpaggahaṇena bahiddhā rūpārammaṇaṃ.
analyzed: phala visesānam vaṇṇa ggahaṇena ca ittha sakaḥ atta bhāva vaṇṇaḥ gahitaḥ rūpa ggahaṇena bahiddhā rūpa ārammaṇam
translated: By the word “beauty” here one’s own bodily beauty is included, and by the word “form” external visible objects are included.🔽Well restrained: well restrained by thoroughly restraining it so that it cannot take what is not given through this existence.

original: 92. Suṭṭhu nisiddhanti yathāyaṃ iminā attabhāvena adinnaṃ ādātuṃ na sakkoti, evaṃ sammadeva tato nisedhitaṃ katvā. Mūlahatanti jīvitā voropanena mūle eva hataṃ.
analyzed: suṭṭhu nisiddhanti yathā ayam iminā atta bhāvena adinnam ādātum na sakkoti evam sammat eva tatas nisedhitam katvā mūla hatanti jīvitā voropanena mūle eva hatam
translated: Root-cut: killed at the root by depriving it of life.

original: 96. Rāgavasena caraṇaṃ carittaṃ, carittameva cārittaṃ, methunanti adhippāyo, taṃ pana “paresaṃ dāresū”ti vuttattā “micchācāra”nti āha.
analyzed: rāga vasena caraṇam carittam carittam eva cārittam methunanti adhippāyo tam pana paresam dāresu iti vutta ttā micchācāram ti āha
translated: The meaning of the word caraṇa is “practice” . The meaning of the word cāritta is “sexual intercourse” , but because of the words “in the wives of others” , he says “misconduct” .

original: 100. Paccanīkadiṭṭhīti “atthi dinna”ntiādikāya sammādiṭṭhiyā paṭipakkhabhūtā diṭṭhi.
analyzed: paccanīka diṭṭhī ti atthi dinna nti ādikāya sammādiṭṭhiyā paṭipakkha bhūtā diṭṭhi
translated: The view contrary to the right view that there is giving, etc., is the wrong view.

original: 101. Mātucchādikā upari sayameva vakkhati. Atibalavalobhoti ativiya balavā bahalakileso,
analyzed: mātucchādikā upari sayam eva vakkhati ati balava lobho ti ati viya balavā bahala kileso
translated: The meaning of the word atibalavalobho is “a very strong greed” ,

original: yena akāle, adese ca pavattati. Micchādhammoti micchā viparīto avisabhāgavatthuko
analyzed: yena akāle adese ca pavattati micchādhammaḥ ti micchā viparītaḥ a visa bhāga vatthuko
translated: by which one acts at the wrong time and in the wrong place. The meaning of the word micchādhammo is “a wrong, perverse, unfitting state of greed” .

original: lobhadhammo. Tenāha “purisāna”ntiādi.🔽Tassa bhāvoti yena mettākaruṇāpubbaṅgamena cittena puggalo “matteyyo”ti vuccati,
analyzed: tena āha  tassa bhāvaḥ ti yena mettā karuṇā pubbaṅgamena cittena puggalaḥ matteyyaḥ ti vuccati
translated: Therefore he says “in men” , etc.🔽The meaning of the word bhāvo is “the state of being a mother” , etc.,🔽which is the state of mind that is preceded by loving-kindness and compassion, by which a person is called “a mother” ,

original: so tassa yathāvuttacittuppādo, taṃsamuṭṭhānā ca kiriyā matteyyatā. Tenāha “mātari
analyzed: so tassa yathā vutta cittuppādo tad samuṭṭhānā ca kiriyā matteyya tā tena āha mātari
translated: “a father” , etc. The meaning of the word matteyyatā is “the state of being a mother” , etc., which is the arising of that state of mind and the action issuing from it. Therefore he says “in a mother” , etc.

original: sammā paṭipattiyā etaṃ nāma”nti. Yā sammā pajjitabbe sammā appaṭipatti, sopi doso
analyzed: sammā paṭipattiyāḥ etam nāman ti yā sammā pajjitabbe sammā appaṭipatti saḥ api dosaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word doso is “the state of being a wrong practice” , which is the wrong practice in what should be rightly practiced.

original: agāravakiriyādibhāvato. Vippaṭipattiyaṃ pana vattabbameva natthīti āha “tassā abhāvo
analyzed: agārava kiriyā ādi bhāvataḥ vippaṭipattiyam pana vattabbam eva natthi iti āha tassāḥ abhāvaḥ
translated: and by way of the absence of respectfulness, etc. But there is nothing to be said about the opposite of that, namely, the absence of disrespectfulness, etc., so he says, “The absence of that and the opposite of that are not-honouring.”

original: ceva tappaṭipakkhatā ca amatteyyatā”ti. Kule jeṭṭhānanti attano kule vuddhānaṃ mahāpitucūḷapitujeṭṭhakabhātikādīnaṃ.
analyzed: ca iva tad paṭipakkha tā ca amatteyya tā ati kule jeṭṭhānam ti attanaḥ kule vuddhānam mahāpitu cūḷa pitu jeṭṭhaka bhātika ādīnam
translated: In one’s own family: among the elders in one’s own family, such as one’s great-grandfather, grandfather, father, elder brother, etc.

original: Dasavassāyukasamayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dasa vassa āyuka samaya vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the time when people lived for ten thousand years.

original: 103. “Ya”nti iminā samayo āmaṭṭho, bhummatthe cetaṃ paccattavacananti āha “yasmiṃ
analyzed: yanti iminā samayaḥ āmaṭṭhaḥ bhumma tthe ca itam paccatta vacananti āha yasmin
translated: By the word “ya” the time is referred to. And this is a reflexive pronoun in the sense of “place,” so he says, “at the time when.”🔽Worthy of offerings: worthy of being offered.

original: samaye”ti. Alaṃ patinoti alaṃpateyyā. Tassā pariyattatā bhariyābhāvenāti āha “dātuṃ
analyzed: samayā iti alam tassā pariyatta tā bhariyā bhāvena ati āha dātum
translated: The state of being his wife: the state of being his wife by means of the marriage rite.

original: yuttā”ti. Aggarasānīti madhurabhāvena, bhesajjabhāvena ca aggabhūtarasāni.
analyzed: agga rasāni iti madhura bhāvena bhesajja bhāvena ca agga bhūta rasāni
translated: The best of tastes: the best in the sense of sweetness and in the sense of medicinal value.🔽They will shine: they will shine forth by way of their opposite. Hence he says, “there will be no such thing as profitable.”

original: Dippissantīti paṭipakkhabhāvena samujjalissanti. Tenāha “kusalantipi na bhavissatī”ti. Aho purisoti mātādīsupi īdiso, aññesaṃ kesaṃ kiṃ vissajjessati, aho tejavapurisoti.
analyzed: dippissanti iti paṭipakkha bhāvena samujjalissanti tena āha kusalam tipi na bhavissati iti aho puriso ti mātā ādīsu pi īdisaḥ aññesam kesam kim vissajjessati aho tejava puriso ti
translated: What a man! : such a one among one’s mother, etc., to whom else will he give? What a splendid man!

original: Gehe mātugāmaṃ viyāti attano gehe dāsibhariyābhūtamātugāmaṃ viya. Missībhāvanti mātādīsu bhariyāya viya cārittasaṅkaraṃ.🔽Balavakopoti hantukāmatāvasena uppattiyā balavakopo. Āghātetīti āhanati, attano kakkhaḷapharusabhāvena
analyzed: gehe mātu gāmam viya ati attanaḥ gehe dāsi bhariyā bhūta mātu gāmam viya missībhāvanti mātā ādīsu bhariyāya viya cāritta saṅkaram  balava kopaḥ iti hantu kāma tā vasena uppattiyā balava kopaḥ āghāteti iti attano kakkhaḷa pharusa bhāvena
translated: “Strong hate”: strong hate that arises through the wish to kill. “He hates”: he strikes,🔽the meaning is that he disturbs his mind with his own hard and cruel nature.🔽For hate is the juice of the burning of dependence. “He persecutes”: he destroys, because of the defilement of the mind,

original: cittaṃ vibādhatīti attho. Nissayadahanaraso hi doso. Byāpādetīti vināseti, manopadūsanato🔽manassa pakopanato. Tibbanti tikkhaṃ, sā panassa tikkhatā sarīre avahantepi sinehavatthuṃ
analyzed: cittam vibādhati iti atthaḥ nissaya dahana rasaḥ hi dosaḥ byāpādeti iti manaḥ upadūsanato  manassa pakopanato tibbanti tikkham sā pana assa tikkha tā sarīre avahante pi sineha vatthum
translated: because of the disturbance of the mind. “Intense”: sharp. But its sharpness should be understood as occurring even when the moisture in the body is not yet exhausted,

original: laṅghitvāpi pavattiyā veditabbāti āha “piyamānassapī”tiādi.
analyzed: laṅghitvā api pavattiyā veditabbā ti āha piyamānassa pi itiādi
