translated: even when it has not yet reached the stage of putrescence. Hence he said: “Even in what is pleasant, etc.”

original: 104. Kappavināso kappo uttarapadalopena, antarāva kappo antarakappo. Taṇhādibhedo
analyzed: kappa vināsaḥ kappo uttara pada lopena kappo antara kappo taṇhā ādi bhedo
translated: “The destruction of an aeon” is a contraction of “the destruction of an aeon” . “An intermediate aeon” is a contraction of “an aeon in the interval” . He has the destruction of an aeon, etc., because of the classification of craving, etc.,🔽as an aeon. Hence he said: “The destruction of the world in the interval” .

original: kappo etassa atthīti kappo, sattalokoti āha “antarāva lokavināso”ti. Svāyaṃ antarakappo
analyzed: kappo etassa atthi iti kappo satta loko ti āha antarā ava loka vināso iti svāyam antara kappo
translated: This intermediate aeon is called an “aeon” because it is a long period of time.

original: katividho, kathañcassa sambhavo, kiṃ gatikoti antogadhaṃ codanaṃ sandhāyāha “antarakappo
analyzed: katividhaḥ katham ca assa sambhavaḥ kim gatikaḥ iti antogadham codanam sandhāya āha antara kappo
translated: How many kinds? How does it come about? What is its destiny? ” He said, “The eon-in-between is called … ”

original: ca nāmā”tiādi. Lobhussadāyāti lobhādhikāya pajāya vattamānāya.
analyzed: ca nāma atiādi lobhussadāya ati lobha adhikāya pajāya vattamānāya
translated: “When beings are greedy” : when beings are greedy by nature.

original: Evaṃ cintayiṃsūti pubbe yathānussavānussaraṇena, attano ca āyuvisesassa labhanato.🔽Gumbalatādīhi gahanaṃ ṭhānanti gumbalatādīhi sañchannatāya gahanabhūtaṃ ṭhānaṃ. Rukkhehi🔽gahananti rukkhehi nirantaranicitehi gahanabhūtaṃ. Nadīvidugganti chinnataṭāhi nadīhi🔽orato, pārato ca viduggaṃ. Tenāha “nadīna”ntiādi. Pabbatehi visamaṃ pabbatantaraṃ.🔽Pabbatesu vā chinnataṭesu durārohaṃ visamaṭṭhānaṃ. Sabhāgeti jīvanavasena samānabhāge sadise karissanti.
analyzed: evam cintayiṃsu iti pubbe yathā anussava anussaraṇena attano ca āyu visesassa labhanato  gumba latā ādīhi gahanam ṭhānam ti gumba latā ādīhi sañchanna tāya gahana bhūtam ṭhānam rukkhehi  gahanam ti rukkhehi nirantara nicitehi gahana bhūtam nadīviduggam ti chinna taṭāhi nadīhi  oratas pāratas ca viduggam tena āha pabbatehi visamam pabbatantaram  pabbatesu vā chinna taṭesu durāroham visama ṭṭhānam sabhāge iti jīvana vasena samāna bhāge sadise karissanti
translated: “They thought thus” : by recollecting the past in the way they had heard it told, and by their own special longevity.

original: Āyuvaṇṇādivaḍḍhanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: āyu vaṇṇa ādi vaḍḍhana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: “A place overgrown with gumbali grass, etc.,” : a place overgrown with gumbali grass, etc., and thus made impassable. “A place overgrown with trees” : a place made impassable by trees standing close together. “A river difficult to cross” : a river difficult to cross on the near and far sides because of its steep banks. Therefore he said “rivers,” etc. “A mountain difficult to traverse” : a mountain difficult to traverse because of its uneven terrain. “A place of the same kind” : a place of the same kind in terms of livelihood.

original: 105. Āyatanti vā dīghaṃ cirakālikaṃ. Maraṇavasena hi ñātikkhayo āyato apunarāvattanato,
analyzed: vā dīgham cirakālikam maraṇa vasena hi ñāti khayaḥ āyataḥ a punarāvattanataḥ
translated: Long: either far, because of the time taken, or long, because of the time taken. For the loss of relatives is long because of the time taken to die,

original: na rājabhayādinā ukkamanavasena punarāvattiyāpi tassa labbhanato. Osakkeyyāmāti orameyyāma.
analyzed: na rāja bhaya ādinā ukkamana vasena punarāvattiyā api tassa labbhanato osakkeyyāma ati orameyyāma
translated: and it is long because of the time taken to return, since it is possible to return from the fear of kings, etc., by going away. We would escape: we would get away.

original: Viramaṇampi atthato pajahanameva pariccajanabhāvatoti āha “pajaheyyāmāti attho”ti.🔽Sīlagabbhe vaḍḍhitattāti mātu, pitu ca sīlavantatāya tadavayavabhūte gabbhe vaḍḍhi
analyzed: viramaṇam pi atthataḥ pajahanam eva pariccajana bhāvato ti āha pajaheyyāma ati attho ti  mātu pitu ca sīlavanta tāya tad avayava bhūte gabbhe vaḍḍhi
translated: Cessation is in fact abandonment, since it is the state of letting go.

original: “sīlagabbhe vaḍḍhitā”ti vuttā, etena utuāhārassa viya tadaññassāpi bāhirassa paccayassa
analyzed: sīlagabbhe vaḍḍhitā ati vuttā etena utu āhārassa viya tad aññassa api bāhirassa paccayassa
translated: She was brought up in the womb of virtue: she was called “brought up in the womb of virtue” because of the growth in the womb, which is a part of the mother and father, due to their virtue.🔽This shows that the development of a being’s continuum is due to external conditions as well as to temperature and nutriment.

original: vasena sattasantānassa visesādhānaṃ hotīti dasseti. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ brahmajālaṭīkāyaṃ
analyzed: vasena satta santānassa visesa ādhānam hoti iti dasseti yam pana ittha vattabbam tam brahmajālaṭīkāyam
translated: But what should be said here has already been said in the Brahmajāla Commentary.🔽By the purification of the field: by the purification of the site that was the basis of the resolution.

original: vuttameva. Khettavisuddhiyāti adhiṭṭhānabhūtavatthuvisuddhiyā. Nanu ca taṃ visesādhānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam eva khetta visuddhiyā ti adhiṭṭhāna bhūta vatthu visuddhiyā nanu ca tam visesa ādhānam
translated: But is not that development of the continuum

original: jāyamānaṃ rūpasantatiyā eva bhaveyyāti? Saccametaṃ, rūpasantatiyā pana tathā āhitavisesāya
analyzed: jāyamānam rūpa santatiyā eva bhaveyya ati saccam etam rūpa santatiyā pana tathā āhita visesāya
translated: and it would be only the material continuity that would be born? It is true, but the immaterial continuity too is helped by the material continuity, which has thus been specialized,

original: arūpasantatipi laddhūpakārā eva hoti tappaṭibaddhavuttibhāvato. Yathā kabaḷīkārāhārena🔽upatthambhite rūpakāye sabbopi attabhāvo anuggahito eva nāma hoti, yathā pana rañño
analyzed: laddha upakārā eva tad paṭibaddha vutti bhāvataḥ yathā kabaḷīkāra āhārena  upatthambhite rūpakāye sabbaḥ api atta bhāvaḥ anuggahitaḥ eva nāma hoti yathā pana raññaḥ
translated: because the immaterial continuity is bound up with the material continuity in its occurrence. Just as when the material body is maintained by material food

original: cakkavattino puññavisesaṃ upanissāya tassa itthiratanādīnaṃ anaññasādhāraṇā te te
analyzed: cakkavattino puñña visesam upanissāya tassa itthi ratana ādīnam anañña sādhāraṇā te te
translated: all the other kinds of being are helped too, so too, when the special merit of a universal monarch is the cause, the special qualities of his precious wheel, etc.,

original: visesā sambhavanti tabbhāve bhāvato, tadabhāve ca abhāvato, evameva tasmiṃ kāle mātāpitūnaṃ🔽yathāvuttapuññavisesaṃ upanissāya tesaṃ puttānaṃ jāyamānānaṃ dīghāyukatā khettavisuddhiyāva
analyzed: visesāḥ sambhavanti tad bhāve bhāvataḥ tad abhāve ca abhāvataḥ evam eva tasmin kāle mātā pitūnam  yathā vutta puñña visesam upanissāya tesam puttānam jāyamānānam dīgha āyuka tā khetta visuddhiyā vā
translated: which are not shared by others, come into existence, and when that ceases they cease too. So too, at that time, owing to the special merit of the parents,🔽the long life, the purity of the fields, and so on, of the children born are due to the special merit of the parents.

original: hotīti veditabbā saṃvegadhammachandādisamupabrūhitāya tadā tesaṃ kusalacetanāya tathā
analyzed: hoti iti veditabbā saṃvega dhamma chanda ādi samupabrūhitāya tadā tesam kusala cetanāya tathā
translated: It should be understood that this is so because the profitable volition of the parents, which is accompanied by the special qualities of the Dhamma such as non-remorse, etc.,

original: uḷārabhāvena samuppajjanato. Etthāti imasmiṃ manussaloke, tatthāti yathāvuttaṃ kusaladhammaṃ🔽samādāya vattamāne sattanikāye. Tatthevāti tasmiṃyeva sattanikāye. “Attanova sīlasampattiyā”ti🔽vuttaṃ sasantatipariyāpannassa dhammassa tattha visesappaccayabhāvato. Khettavisuddhipi
analyzed: uḷāra bhāvena samuppajjanataḥ ettha ati imasmin manussa loke tattha ati yathā vuttam kusala dhammam  samādāya vattamāne satta nikāye tattha iva ati tasmin yeva satta nikāye attanā uva sīla sampattiyā ati  vuttam sa santati pariyāpannassa dhammassa tattha visesa ppaccaya bhāvato
translated: because they arise through the greatness of the field. ‘There’ means in this human world. ‘Therein’ means in the world of beings who are living by undertaking the profitable kinds of action as stated. ‘There itself’ means in that same world of beings. ‘The perfection of virtue in oneself’ is said because the state of being a condition there is due to a state of dhammas belonging to one’s own continuity. The purification of the field is

original: pana idhāpi paṭikkhipituṃ na sakkā.
analyzed: pana idha api paṭikkhipitum na sakkā
translated: because they arise through the greatness of the cause. Here means in this human world. There means in the world of beings who are living by undertaking the wholesome states mentioned above. There itself means in that very world of beings. The expression “the perfection of virtue in oneself” is used because the state of being a condition for the distinction of a phenomenon belonging to one’s own continuity is there. The purification of the field cannot be rejected here.

original: Koṭṭhāsāti cattārīsavassāyukātiādayo asītivassasahassāyukapariyosānā ekādasa koṭṭhāsā.
analyzed: koṭṭhāsā ati cattārīsa vassa āyuka ati ādayaḥ asīti vassa sahassa āyuka pariyosānāḥ ekādasa koṭṭhāsā
translated: Parts means the eleven parts beginning with a life-span of forty years and ending with a life-span of eighty thousand years.

original: Adinnādānādīhīti ādi-saddena kule jeṭṭhāpacāyikāpariyosānānaṃ dasannaṃ pāpakoṭṭhāsānaṃ gahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: adinnādāna ādīhi iti ādi saddena kule dasannam pāpa koṭṭhāsānam gahaṇaṃ
translated: Stealing, etc. The word “etc.” includes the ten evil parts beginning with disrespect for mother and father.

original: Saṅkharājauppattivaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the arising of the king of formations

original: 106. Evaṃ uppajjanakataṇhāti evaṃ vacībhedaṃ pāpanavasena pavattā bhuñjitukāmatā.
analyzed: evam uppajjanaka taṇhā ati evam vacī bhedam pāpana vasena pavattā bhuñjitu kāma tā
translated: Thus arisen craving means the desire to eat which occurs in the form of verbal expressions.

original: Anasananti kāyikakiriyāasamatthatāhetubhūto sarīrasaṅkoco. Tenāha “avipphārikabhāvo”tiādi.
analyzed: kāyika kiriyā asamattha tā hetu bhūto sarīra saṅkoco tena āha avipphārika bhāva itiādi
translated: Inappetence means the contraction of the body which is the cause for the inability to perform bodily functions. Therefore he says “the state of non-penetration,” etc.

original: Ghananivāsatanti gāmanigamarājadhānīnaṃ ghananiviṭṭhataṃ aññamaññassa nātidūravattitaṃ.
analyzed: ghana nivāsa tanti gāma nigama rājadhānīnam ghana niviṭṭha tanti aññamaññassa na ati dūra vatti tanti
translated: “Densely populated” : the villages, towns and royal cities are densely populated, not too far apart.

original: Nirantarapūritoti nirantaraṃ viya puṇṇo tatrupagānaṃ sattānaṃ bahubhāvato.
analyzed: nirantara pūritaḥ iti nirantaram viya puṇṇaḥ sattānam bahu bhāvataḥ
translated: “Filled up” : filled up as if without interstice, because of the multitude of beings living there.

original: Metteyyabuddhuppādavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the appearance of Metteyya Buddha

original: 107. Kiñcāpi pubbe vaḍḍhamānakavasena desanā āgataṃ, idaṃ pana na vaḍḍhamānakavasena
analyzed: kiñca api pubbe vaḍḍhamānaka vasena desanā āgatam idam pana na vaḍḍhamānaka vasena
translated: Although the teaching has come down in the manner of the growth of the Vaddha tree, this is not stated in the manner of the growth of the Vaddha tree.

original: vuttaṃ. Kasmāti ce āha “na hī”tiādi. Sattānaṃ vaḍḍhamānāyukakāle buddhā na nibbattanti
analyzed: vuttam kasmā iti ce āha na hi itiādi sattānam vaḍḍhamāna āyuka kāle buddhāḥ na nibbattanti
translated: If it be asked, “Why?” he says, “For the Buddhas do not appear” and so on. When the life-span of beings is increasing, the Buddhas do not appear

original: saṃsāre saṃvegassa dubbibhāvanīyattā. Tato vassasatasahassato orameva buddhuppādakālo.
analyzed: saṃsāre saṃvegassa dubbibhāvanīya ttā tatas vassa sata sahassataḥ orama eva buddhuppāda kālo
translated: because of the difficulty of arousing disgust with the round of rebirths. Therefore the time of the appearance of the Buddha is only a hundred thousand years before the life-span reaches eighty thousand years.

original: 108. Samussitaṭṭhena yūpo viyāti yūpo, yūpanti ettha sattā anekabhūmikūṭāgārovarakādivantatāyāti
analyzed: samussita ṭṭhena yūpaḥ viyāti yūpaḥ ettha sattā aneka bhūmi kūṭāgāra uvaraka ādivanta tāya āti
translated: “A monument” : a monument is like a monument in the sense of being piled up. Here the beings are a monument because of their having many storeys, gables, etc.

original: yūpo, pāsādo. Rañño hetubhūtenāti hetuatthe karaṇavacanantidassetiussāhasampattiādinā.
analyzed: yūpaḥ pāsādaḥ raññaḥ hetu bhūtena ati hetu atthe
translated: “A palace” : a palace is a monument. “For the King” : he shows that the instrumental case is used in the sense of cause, with the words “the perfection of heroism, etc.”

original: Mahatā rājānubhāvena, mahatā ca kittisaddena samannāgatattā catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi
analyzed: mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā ca kitti saddena samannāgata ttā catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi
translated: Because he was endowed with great royal majesty and with great fame and renown, and because he delighted the people with the four means of gathering people to him,

original: mahājanassa rañjanato mahāpanādo nāma rājā jāto. Jātaketi mahāpanādajātake.
analyzed: mahājanassa rañjanataḥ mahāpanādaḥ nāma rājā jātaḥ jātake iti mahāpanāda jātake
translated: he became known as King Mahāpanāda. In the Jātaka, in the Mahāpanāda Jātaka.

original: Panādo nāma so rājāti “atīte panādo nāma so rājā assosī”ti attabhāvantaratāya attānaṃ
analyzed: panādaḥ nāma saḥ rājā ati atīte panādaḥ nāma saḥ rājā assosi iti atta bhāvantaratāya attānam
translated: “That king was named Panāda” means that in the past that king was named Panāda. By changing his existence, he shows himself

original: paraṃ viya niddisati. Āyasmā hi bhaddajitthero attanā ajjhāvutthapubbaṃ suvaṇṇapāsādaṃ
analyzed: param viya niddisati āyasmā hi bhaddaji thero attanā ajjhāvuttha pubbam suvaṇṇa pāsādam
translated: as if he were another. For the venerable elder Bhaddajit, having shown the golden palace which he had previously inhabited,

original: dassetvā evamāha. Yassa yūpo suvaṇṇayoti yassa rañño ayaṃ yūpo pāsādo suvaṇṇayo suvaṇṇamayo.🔽Tiriyaṃ soḷasubbedhoti vitthārato soḷasasarapātappamāṇo, so pana aḍḍhayojanappamāṇo
analyzed: dassetvā evam āha yassa yūpo suvaṇṇayo ti yassa raññaḥ ayam yūpo pāsādaḥ suvaṇṇayo suvaṇṇa mayaḥ  tiriyam soḷasa ubbedhaḥ ti vitthārato soḷasa sara pāta ppamāṇo so pana aḍḍha yojana ppamāṇo
translated: said thus. “Whose golden sacrificial post” means whose sacrificial post, palace, was golden, made of gold.🔽“Sixteen cubits in breadth” means sixteen cubits in breadth, sixteen sarapāras in breadth. But it was half a league in breadth.

original: hoti. Ubbhamāhu sahassadhāti ubbhaṃ uccabhāvaṃ assa pāsādassa sahassadhā sahassakaṇḍappamāṇaṃ
analyzed: hoti ubbham āhu sahassadhā ati ubbham ucca bhāvam assa pāsādassa sahassadhā sahassa kaṇḍa ppamāṇam
translated: “They say its height is a thousand” means they say its height, its height, is a thousand, a thousand sections in height.

original: āhu, so pana yojanato pañcavīsatiyojanappamāṇo hoti. Keci panettha gāthāsukhatthaṃ
analyzed: āhu saḥ pana yojanataḥ pañcavīsati yojana ppamāṇaḥ hoti keci pana ittha gāthā sukha attham
translated: But it was twenty-five leagues in height. But some, for the sake of the ease of the verse,

original: “āhū”ti dīghaṃ kataṃ, ahu ahosīti atthaṃ vadanti.
analyzed: āhu iti dīgham katam ahu ahosi iti attham vadanti
translated: “Āhū” is said to be long, and they say the meaning is “it was.”

original: Sahassakaṇḍoti sahassabhūmiko, “sahassakhaṇḍo” tipi pāṭho, so eva attho. Satageṇḍūti
analyzed: sahassa kaṇḍo ti sahassa bhūmikaḥ sahassa khaṇḍo tipi pāṭho saḥ eva attho satageṇḍu iti
translated: “A thousand-sectioned”: having a thousand stories. The reading “a thousand-sectioned” is the same in meaning. “A hundred-gated”:

original: anekasataniyūhako. Dhajālūti tattha tattha niyūhasikharādīsu patiṭṭhapitehi sattidhajavīraṅgadhajādīhi
analyzed: aneka sata niyūhakaḥ tattha tattha niyūha sikhara ādīsu patiṭṭhapitehi satti dhaja vīraṅga dhaja ādīhi
translated: having many hundreds of entrances. “With banners”: having banners set up here and there on the peaks of the entrances, etc., with banners of swords, heroes, etc.

original: dhajehi sampanno. Haritāmayoti cāmīkarasuvaṇṇamayo. Keci pana haritāmayoti “haritamaṇiparikkhaṭo”ti
analyzed: sampanno harita āmayo ti cāmīkara suvaṇṇa mayo keci pana harita āmayo ti harita maṇi parikkhaṭo ti
translated: “Made of gold”: made of gold from the Jambu River. But some say “made of gold” means “surrounded by gold.”

original: vadanti. Gandhabbāti naṭā. Chasahassāni sattadhāti chamattāni gandhabbasahassāni
analyzed: vadanti gandhabbā ati naṭā cha sahassāni sattadhā ati cha mattāni gandhabba sahassāni
translated: “Gandhabbas”: actors. “Six thousand”: six thousand gandhabbas

original: sattadhā tassa pāsādassa sattasu ṭhānesu rañño abhiramāpanatthaṃ nacciṃsūti attho.
analyzed: sattadhā tassa pāsādassa sattasu ṭhānesu raññaḥ abhiramāpana tham attho
translated: danced in seven ways in seven places on the palace for the king’s enjoyment.

original: Te evaṃ naccantāpi kira rājānaṃ hāsetuṃ nāsakkhiṃsu. Atha sakko devarājā devanaṭaṃ
analyzed: te evam naccantā api kira rājānam hāsetum na asakkhiṃsu atha sakkaḥ devarājā devanaṭam
translated: But even as they danced they were unable to make the king laugh. Then Sakka, king of the gods,

original: pesetvā samajjaṃ kāresi, tadā rājā hasīti.
analyzed: pesetvā sa majjam kāresi tadā rājā hasi iti
translated: sent a divine actor, and a festival was held. Then the king laughed.

original: Koṭigāmo nāma māpito. Vatthūti bhaddajittherassa vatthu. Taṃ theragāthāvaṇṇanāyaṃ vitthārato āgatameva. Itarassāti naḷakāradevaputtassa. Ānubhāvāti puññānubhāvanimittaṃ.
analyzed: koṭigāmaḥ nāma māpitaḥ vatthu uti bhaddaji therassa vatthu tat thera gāthā vaṇṇanāyam vitthārataḥ āgatam eva itarassa āti naḷakāradeva puttassa ānubhāvā ti puñña anubhāva nimittam
translated: Koṭigāma is a village called Māpita. The story is that of the Elder Bhaddajit. It is given in detail in the commentary on the Elder’s verses . The other is that of the deity Nāḷāgiri. The influence is the sign of the influence of merit.

original: Dānavasena datvāti taṃ pāsādaṃ attano pariggahabhāvaviyojanena dānamukhe niyojetvā.🔽Vissajjetvāti citteneva pariccajanavasena datvā puna dakkhiṇeyyānaṃ santakabhāvakaraṇena🔽nirapekkhapariccāgavasena vissajjetvā. Ettakenāti “bhūtapubbaṃ bhikkhave”ti ādiṃ
analyzed: dāna vasena tam pāsādam attano pariggaha bhāva viyojanena dāna mukhe niyojetvā  vissajjetvā iti cittena iva pariccajana vasena da tvā puna dakkhiṇeyyānam santaka bhāva karaṇena  nirapekkha pariccāga vasena vissajjetvā ettakena ati bhūta pubbam bhikkhave ti ādim
translated: Having given by way of giving: having given by way of giving after removing it from his own ownership of the palace.

original: katvā yāva “pabbajissatī”ti padaṃ ettakena desanāmaggena.
analyzed: katvā yāva pabbajissati iti padam ettakena desanā maggena
translated: Having relinquished: having given by way of relinquishing with the mind, and then having relinquished by way of giving without regard for it, making it the property of those worthy of offerings. This much: this much of the method of teaching, beginning with “Bhikkhus, in the past” and ending with “he will go forth.”

original: Bhikkhuno āyuvaṇṇādivaḍḍhanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhikkhuno āyu vaṇṇa ādi vaḍḍhana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the story of the bhikkhu’s increase in life span, beauty, etc.

original: 110. Idaṃ bhikkhuno āyusminti āyusmiṃ sādhetabbe idaṃ bhikkhuno icchitabbaṃ cirajīvitāya hetubhāvatoti. Tenāha “idaṃ āyukāraṇa”nti.
analyzed: idam bhikkhuno āyusmin ti āyusmim sādhetabbe idam bhikkhuno icchitabbam cira jīvitāya hetu bhāvato ti tena āha idam āyu kāraṇam ti
translated: This is what is to be desired by a bhikkhu in the matter of life span: this is what is to be desired by a bhikkhu for the sake of a long life span in the matter of life span that is to be accomplished. Therefore it is said: “This is the cause for life span.”

original: Sampannasīlassa avippaṭisārapāmojjapītipassaddhisukhasamādhiyathābhūtañāṇādisambhavato
analyzed: sampanna sīlassa a vippaṭisāra pāmojja pīti passaddhi sukha samādhi yathābhūta ñāṇa ādi sambhavato
translated: Because of the presence of non-remorse, gladness, rapture, tranquillity, happiness, concentration, knowledge of things as they are, etc., in one whose virtue is fulfilled,

original: taṃsamuṭṭhānapaṇītarūpehi kāyassa phuṭattā sarīre vaṇṇadhātu vippasannā hoti, kalyāṇo
analyzed: tad samuṭṭhāna paṇīta rūpehi kāyassa phuṭa ttā sarīre vaṇṇa dhātu vippasannā hoti kalyāṇaḥ
translated: the element of beauty in the body becomes clear because of the presence of the beautiful form of the virtue that is its origin.

original: ca kittisaddo abbhuggacchatīti āha “sīlavato hī”tiādi.
analyzed: ca kitti saddaḥ abbhut gacchati iti āha sīlavataḥ hi itiādi
translated: And a good report spreads about him.

original: Vivekajaṃ pītisukhādīti ādi-saddena samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ, apītijaṃ kāyasukhaṃ, satipārisuddhijaṃ upekkhāsukhañca saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: viveka jam pīti sukha ādi iti ādi saddena samādhi jam pīti sukham apīti jam kāya sukham sati pārisuddhi jam upekkhā sukham ca saṅgaṇhāti
translated: The words “joy and happiness born of seclusion” include the joy and happiness born of concentration and the bodily happiness born of equanimity that arises with the purification of mindfulness.

original: Appaṭikkūlatāvahoti appamāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ, attano ca tesu appaṭikkūlabhāvato. Hitūpasaṃhārādivasena pavattiyā sabbadisāsu pharaṇaappamāṇavasena sabbadisāsu vipphārikatā.
analyzed: appaṭikkūla tā vaho ti appamāṇānam sattānam attano ca tesu appaṭikkūla bhāvataḥ hitu upasaṃhāra ādi vasena pavattiyā sabba disāsu pharaṇa appamāṇa vasena sabba disāsu vipphārika tā
translated: “The state of being immeasurable” is the state of pervading all directions by the immeasurability of the occurrence of the immeasurables in the sense of non-aversion towards immeasurable beings and in the sense of one’s own non-aversion towards them.

original: “Arahattaphalasaṅkhātaṃ bala”nti vuttaṃ tassa akuppadhammatāya kenaci anabhibhavanīyabhāvato.
analyzed: arahatta phala saṅkhātam balanti vuttam tassa akuppa dhamma tāya kenaci an abhibhavanīya bhāvato
translated: “The strength called the fruit of arahantship” is so called because it cannot be overcome by anyone owing to its unshakable nature.

original: “Loke”ti idaṃ yathā “ekabalampī”ti iminā sambandhīyati, evaṃ “duppasahaṃ durabhisambhava”nti🔽imehipi sambandhitabbaṃ. Lokapariyāpanneheva hi dhammehi tesaṃ balassa duppasahatā,
analyzed: loka iti idam yathā evam duppasaham durabhisambhavanti  imehi pi sambandhitabbam loka pariyāpannehi iva hi dhammehi tesam balassa duppasaha tā
translated: “In the world” is to be construed with “even a single power” as above, and also with “invincible, hard to overcome” .🔽For it is only by supramundane states that they are invincible and hard to overcome, not by mundane states.

original: durabhisambhavatā, na lokuttarehīti. Etthevāti etasmiṃ arahattaphale eva, tadatthanti attho.
analyzed: durabhisambhava tā na lokuttarehi iti etthā iva ati etasmin arahatta phale eva tat attham iti
translated: “In this very” : in this very state of Arahantship, that is the meaning.

original: Lokuttarapuññampīti lokuttarapuññampi puññaphalampi. Yāva āsavakkhayā pavaḍḍhati
analyzed: lokuttara puññam pi iti lokuttara puññam pi puñña phalam pi yāva āsava kkhayā pavaḍḍhati
translated: “Even the supramundane merit” : even the supramundane merit, the fruit of merit, increases up to the exhaustion of taints.

original: vivaṭṭagāmikusaladhammānaṃ samādānahetūti yojanā. Amatapānaṃ piviṃsu heṭṭhimamaggaphalasamadhigamavasenāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vivaṭṭa gāmi kusala dhammānam samādāna hetū ti yojanā amata pānam piviṃsu heṭṭhima magga phala samadhigama vasena ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The construction is: by way of the cause of undertaking the wholesome states that lead to the turning away . The intention is: they drank the drink of the deathless by way of the attainment of the lower paths and fruits.

original: Cakkavattisuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.🔽4. Aggaññasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aggañña sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “Līna” in the Cakkavatti Sutta.🔽The explanation of the Aggañña Sutta.

original: Vāseṭṭhabhāradvājavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vāseṭṭha bhāradvāja vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja Sutta.

original: 111. Etthāti “pubbārāme, migāramātupāsāde”ti etasmiṃ padadvaye. Koyaṃ pubbārāmo,
analyzed: ettha ati pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde iti etasmim pada dvaye ko yam pubbārāmaḥ
translated: “Here” : in the two words “in the Eastern Park, in the Palace of Migāra’s Mother” . What is this Eastern Park?

original: kathañca pubbārāmo, kā ca migāramātā, kathañcassā pāsādo ahosīti etasmiṃ antolīne
analyzed: katham ca pubbārāmaḥ kā ca migāra mātā katham ca assā pāsādaḥ ahosi iti etasmin antolīne
translated: How was there a former park? Who was Migara’s mother? How was there a palace? This is the sequence of the question.

original: anuyoge. Ayaṃ idāni vuccamānā anupubbikathā ādito paṭṭhāya saṅkhepeneva anupubbikathā.
analyzed: anuyoge ayam idāni vuccamānā anupubbi kathā āditaḥ paṭṭhāya saṅkhepena iva anupubbi kathā
translated: This is the sequence of the story, which is being told now, from the beginning in brief.

original: Padumuttaraṃ bhagavantaṃ ekaṃ upāsikaṃ aggupaṭṭhāyikaṭṭhāne ṭhapentiṃ disvāna tattha
analyzed: padumuttaram bhagavantam ekam upāsikam aggupaṭṭhāyika ṭṭhāne ṭhapentim disvāna tattha
translated: Having seen the Blessed One Padumuttara place one lay devotee in the position of chief attendant,

original: sañjātagāravabahumānā tamevatthaṃ purakkhatvā bhagavantaṃ nimantetvā. Meṇḍakaputtassāti
analyzed: sañjāta gārava bahu mānā tam evattham purakkhatvā bhagavantam nimantetvā meṇḍakaputtassa ati
translated: having generated respect and esteem for that very matter, having invited the Blessed One,

original: meṇḍakaseṭṭhiputtassa. Sotāpannā ahosi tathā katādhikārattā.
analyzed: meṇḍaka seṭṭhi puttassa sotāpannā ahosi tathā kata adhikāra ttā
translated: Meṇḍaka’s son: the son of the merchant Meṇḍaka. She became a Stream-Enterer because of the maturity of her deeds in that way.

original: Mātuṭṭhāne ṭhapesi attano sīlācārasampattiyā garuṭṭhāniyattā. Upayoganti tattha tattha
analyzed: mātuṭṭhāne ṭhapesi attano sīla ācāra sampattiyā tattha tattha
translated: She placed her in the position of mother because of her worthiness of respect due to her own virtue and conduct. The application: in the various places

original: appetabbaṭṭhāne appanāvasena viniyogaṃ agamaṃsu. Aññehi ca veḷuriyalohitaṅkamasāragallādīhi.
analyzed: appetabba ṭṭhāne appanā vasena viniyogam agamaṃsu aññehi ca veḷuriya lohitaṅkama sāragalla ādīhi
translated: where she was to be applied, she was applied by means of absorption. With other precious stones such as cat’s-eye, ruby, sapphire, coral,

original: Bhassatīti otarati. Suddhapāsādova na sobhatīti kevalo ekapāsādo eva vihāro na sobhati.
analyzed: bhassati iti otarati suddha pāsādaḥ uva na sobhati iti kevalaḥ eka pāsādaḥ eva vihāraḥ na sobhati
translated: and so on. It flows: it descends. A palace: a dwelling-place consisting of a single palace alone does not shine.

original: Niyūhāni bahūni nīharitvā kattabbasenāsanāni “duvaḍḍhagehānī”ti vadanti. Majjhe gabbho
analyzed: niyūhāni bahūni nīharitvā kattabba senāsanāni duvaḍḍha gehāni iti vadanti majjhe gabbhaḥ
translated: The beds and benches which are made after removing many of the obstructions are called “double-storeyed buildings.”🔽The middle room

original: samantato anupariyāyatoti evaṃ dvikkhattuṃ vaḍḍhetvā katasenāsanāni duvaḍḍhagehāni.
analyzed: samantataḥ anupariyāyato ti evam dvi khattum vaḍḍhetvā kata senāsanāni duvaḍḍha gehāni
translated: The beds and benches which are made after doubling the building in this way are called “double-storeyed buildings.”

original: Cūḷapāsādāti khuddakapāsādā.
analyzed: cūḷa pāsādā ati khuddaka pāsādā
translated: Small stilt houses: small stilt houses.

original: Uttaradevīvihāro nāma nagarassa pācīnadvārasamīpe katavihāro.
analyzed: uttaradevīvihāraḥ nāma nagarassa pācīna dvāra samīpe kata vihāraḥ
translated: The Uttaradevi Monastery is a monastery built near the eastern gate of the city.

original: Titthiyaliṅgassa aggahitattā neva titthiyaparivāsaṃ vasanti. Anupasampannabhāvato
analyzed: titthiya liṅgassa agga hita ttā na iva titthiya parivāsam vasanti anupasampanna bhāvataḥ
translated: Because they have not taken up the marks of sectarians, they do not live the life of a sectarian. Because they are not fully ordained,

original: āpattiyā āpannāya abhāvato na āpattiparivāsaṃ vasanti. Bhikkhubhāvanti upasampadaṃ.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ āpannāya abhāvataḥ na āpatti parivāsam vasanti bhikkhu bhāvanti upasampadam
translated: they do not live the life of probation for offenses because they have not committed any offense. Ordination: full ordination.

original: Tevijjasuttanti imasmiṃ dīghanikāye tevijjasuttaṃ sutvā.
analyzed: tevijja suttam ti imasmin dīgha nikāye tevijja suttam sutvā
translated: The Tevijja Sutta: the Tevijja Sutta in this Dīgha Nikāya.

original: 113. Anuvattamānā caṅkamiṃsu ananucaṅkamane yathādhippetassa atthassa pucchanādīnaṃ
analyzed: anuvattamānā caṅkamiṃsu an anucaṅkamane yathā adhippetassa atthassa pucchanā ādīnam
translated: And they walked about, not walking about in the place where the questions were asked, etc.,

original: asakkuṇeyyattā. Tesanti tesaṃ dvinnaṃ. Tenāha “paṇḍitataro”ti. Atthāti bhavattha.
analyzed: tesan ti tesam dvinnam tena āha paṇḍitataro ti attha ati bhavattha
translated: because they were unable to do so. Them: those two. Therefore it is said “more wise.” Meaning: the meaning of existence.

original: Kulasampannāti sampannakulā uditodite brāhmaṇakule uppannā. Brāhmaṇakulāti kenaci
analyzed: kula sampannā ati sampanna kulā udita udite brāhmaṇa kule uppannā brāhmaṇa kulā ati kenacid
translated: Born in a good family: born in a high family, in a high and distinguished brahmin family.

original: pārijuññena anupaddutā eva brāhmaṇakulā. Tenāha “bhogādisampanna”ntiādi. Ime brāhmaṇā
analyzed: pārijuññena an upaddutā eva brāhmaṇa kulā tena āha ime brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: “Well-born” : born in a good family, in a high family, in the high-born brahmin family. “Brahmin family” : a family of brahmins not tainted by any kind of defilement. Hence it is said: “endowed with wealth, etc.” These brahmins,

original: uccā hutvā “imaṃ vasalaṃ pabbajjaṃ pabbajiṃsū”tiādinā jātiādīni ghaṭṭentā akkosanti.
analyzed: uccā hutvā imam vasalam pabbajjam pabbajiṃsu iti ādinā jāti ādīni ghaṭṭentāḥ akkosanti
translated: thinking “They have gone forth into this lowly going-forth,” insult them by referring to their birth, etc.

original: Paribhāsantīti paribhavitvā bhāsanti. Attano anurūpāyāti attano ajjhāsayassa anurūpāya.
analyzed: paribhāsanti iti paribhavitvā bhāsanti attanaḥ anurūpāya ati attanaḥ ajjhāsayassa anurūpāya
translated: “They revile them” : they speak revilingly. “In a manner appropriate to themselves” : in a manner corresponding to their own ideas.

original: Antarantarā vicchijja pavattiyamānā paribhāsā paripuṇṇā nāma na hoti khaṇḍabhāvato,
analyzed: antarantarā vicchijja pavattiyamānā paribhāsā paripuṇṇā nāma na hoti khaṇḍa bhāvato
translated: A reviling that is interrupted and occurs intermittently is not complete, because it is broken.

original: tabbipariyāyato paripuṇṇā nāma hotīti āha “antarā”tiādi.
analyzed: tad vipariyāyataḥ paripuṇṇā nāma hoti iti āha antarā ati ādi
translated: It is complete in the opposite sense. Hence it is said: “If it is not continuous, etc.”

original: Appatiṭṭhatāyāti apassayarahitattā. Vibhinnoti vinaṭṭho.
analyzed: appatiṭṭha tāya āti a passaya rahita ttā vibhinnaḥ ti vinaṭṭhaḥ
translated: “Without foundation” : without a basis in fact. “Destroyed” : ruined.

original: Itare tayo vaṇṇāti khattiyādayo vaṇṇā hīnā. Nanu khattiyāva seṭṭhā vaṇṇā yathā buddhā
analyzed: itare tayaḥ khattiya ādayaḥ vaṇṇāḥ hīnāḥ nanu khattiyā ava seṭṭhāḥ vaṇṇāḥ yathā buddhā
translated: “The other three castes” : the warrior-nobles, etc., are low castes. Are not the warrior-nobles the highest caste, just as the Buddhas🔽are the highest among human beings?

original: etarahi khattiyakule eva uppannāti? Saccametaṃ, te pana attano micchābhimānena, micchāgāhena
analyzed: etarahi khattiya kule eva uppannā ati saccam etam te pana attanaḥ micchā abhimānena micchā gāhena
translated: and now only in the khattiya clan?”🔽“That is true, but they say ‘Only the brahmin class is the highest class’ because of their own wrong conceit and wrong grasping.

original: ca “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo”ti vadanti, taṃ tesaṃ vacanamattaṃ. “Sujjhantīti suddhā🔽honti, na nindaṃ garahaṃ pāpuṇantī”ti vadanti. Sujjhanti vā saṃsārato sujjhanti,
analyzed: ca brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇo ti vadanti tam tesam vacana mattam sujjhanti iti suddhā  honti na nindam garaham pāpuṇanti iti vadanti sujjhanti vā saṃsārataḥ sujjhanti
translated: That is just their word. They say ‘They are purified, they are not subject to blame or censure.’ They are purified, they are purified from the round of rebirths,🔽not the other classes, because they are not of the same class as the brahmins, and because they do not possess the knowledge of the brahmins.

original: na sesā vaṇṇā asukkajātikattā, mantajjhenābhāvato cāti. Brahmuno mukhato jātā vedavacanato
analyzed: na sesāḥ vaṇṇāḥ asukka jātikattāḥ ca ati brahmunaḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ veda vacanataḥ
translated: They are born from the mouth, born from the mouth of Brahmā, because of the words of the Vedas.🔽They are born from the words of Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, therefore they are born from the mouth.

original: jātāti mukhato jātā. Tato eva brahmuno mahābrahmuno vedavacanato vijātāti brahmajā.
analyzed: jātā ati mukhataḥ jātā tatas eva brahmunaḥ mahābrahmunaḥ veda vacanataḥ vijātā ati brahma jā
translated: Therefore they are born from the mouth of Brahmā. They are born from the words of Brahmā, therefore they are born from Brahmā.🔽They are created by the two kinds of creation, therefore they are created by Brahmā.

original: Tena duvidhenāpi nimmitāti brahmanimmitā. Vedavedaṅgādibrahmadāyajjaṃ arahantīti🔽brahmadāyādā. Muṇḍake samaṇaketi ettha ka-kāro garahāyanti āha “nindantā jigucchantā
analyzed: tena duvidhena api brahma nimmitā ati brahma nimmitā arahanti iti  brahma dāyādā muṇḍake samaṇaka iti ettha kakāraḥ āha nindantā jigucchantā
translated: They are worthy of the gift of Brahmā, the Vedas, the Vedāṅgas, etc., therefore they are heirs of Brahmā.🔽As for ‘the shaven-headed ascetics,’ here the -ka- is a term of contempt. Therefore it is said, ‘They say this, despising and disparaging them.’

original: vadantī”ti. Ibbheti sudde, te pana gharabandhanena baddhā nihīnatarāti āha “gahapatike”ti.
analyzed: vadanti iti ibbha iti sudde te pana ghara bandhanena baddhāḥ nihīnatarā iti āha gahapatika iti
translated: As for ‘the low-born,’ they are low because they are bound by the fetters of the household life. Therefore it is said, ‘the householders.’

original: Kaṇheti kaṇhajātike. Bandhanaṭṭhena bandhu, kassa pana bandhūti āha “mārassa bandhubhūte”ti.
analyzed: kaṇha iti kaṇha jātike bandhana ṭṭhena bandhu kassa pana bandhu iti āha mārassa bandhu bhūta iti
translated: In the sense of binding, a kinsman. Whose kinsman? The kinsman of Mara.

original: Pādāpacceti pādato jātāpacce. Ayaṃ kira brāhmaṇānaṃ laddhi “brāhmaṇā brahmuno mukhato
analyzed: pādāpacca iti pādataḥ ayam kira brāhmaṇānam laddhi brāhmaṇāḥ brahmunaḥ mukhataḥ
translated: Born from the feet: born from the feet. This is the belief of the brahmins: “The brahmins are born from Brahma’s mouth,

original: jātā, khattiyā urato, ūrūhi vessā, pādato suddā”ti.
analyzed: jātā khattiyā urataḥ ūrūhi vessā pādataḥ
translated: the nobles from his arm, the merchants from his thigh, and the workers from his feet.”

original: 114. Yasmā paṭhamakappikakāle catuvaṇṇavavatthānaṃ natthi, sabbeva sattā ekasadisā,
analyzed: yasmā paṭhama kappika kāle catu vaṇṇa vavatthānam na atthi sabbe eva sattāḥ eka sadisāḥ
translated: Since in the first aeon there was no distinction of the four castes, all beings were alike,🔽but later on the distinction arose through the difference in their occupations.

original: aparabhāge pana tesaṃ payogabhedavasena ahosi, tasmā vuttaṃ “porāṇaṃ…pe… ajānantā”ti.🔽Laddhibhindanatthāyāti “brāhmaṇā brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā”ti evaṃ pavattāya🔽laddhiyā viniveṭhanatthaṃ. Puttappaṭilābhatthāyāti “evaṃ mayaṃ pettikaṃ iṇaṃ sodhessāmā”ti
analyzed: aparabhāge pana tesam payoga bheda vasena ahosi tasmā vuttam ajānantā ti  laddhi bhindana tthāya ati brāhmaṇāḥ puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ ati evam pavattāya  laddhiyāḥ viniveṭhana attham putta paṭilābha atthāya ati evam mayam pettikam iṇam sodhessāma ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “not knowing the ancient … “🔽In order to break the belief: in order to refute the belief that “the brahmins are the sons of Brahma, born from his mouth, born of his womb.”

original: laddhiyaṃ ṭhatvā puttappaṭilābhāya. Ayañhettha dhammikānaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ ajjhāsayo.
analyzed: laddhiyam ṭhatvā putta ppaṭilābhāya ayam ha ittha dhammikānam brāhmaṇānam ajjhāsayo
translated: In order to obtain sons: in order to obtain sons, thinking “thus we shall pay off our ancestral debt.” This is the intention of the righteous brahmins.

original: Sañjātapupphāti rajassalā. Itthīnañhi kumāribhāvappattito paṭṭhāya pacchimavayato
analyzed: sañjāta pupphā ti rajassalā itthīnam hi kumāri bhāva pattitaḥ paṭṭhāya pacchima vayataḥ
translated: “Flower-born” : “rajassala” . For from the time when women attain the state of maidenhood until the last stage of life,

original: oraṃ asati vibandhe aṭṭhame aṭṭhame sattāhe gabbhāsayasaññite tatiye āvatte katipayā
analyzed: oraṃ asati vibandhe aṭṭhame aṭṭhame sattāhe gabbha saya saññite tatiye āvatte katipayā
translated: every eight days, in the third watch of the night,

original: lohitapīḷakā saṇṭhahitvā aggahitapupphā eva bhijjanti, tato lohitaṃ paggharati, tattha🔽utusamaññā, pupphasamaññā ca. Nesanti brāhmaṇānaṃ. Saccavacanaṃ siyāti “brahmuno
analyzed: lohita pīḷakā saṇṭhahitvā aggahita pupphāḥ eva bhijjanti tatas lohitam paggharati tattha  utu samaññā puppha samaññā ca na isanti brāhmaṇānam sacca vacanam siyāti brahmunaḥ
translated: a few blood-drops are formed in the womb, which then burst open and are discharged. Then the menstrual flow occurs.🔽The menstrual flow is called “season” and “flower” .

original: puttā”tiādivacanaṃ saccaṃ yadi siyā, brāhmaṇīnaṃ…pe… mukhaṃ bhaveyya, na cetaṃ atthi.🔽Catuvaṇṇasuddhivaṇṇanā
analyzed: putta ati ādi vacanam saccam yadi siyā mukham bhaveyya na ca itam atthi  catuvaṇṇa suddhi vaṇṇanā
translated: “They are the sons of Brahmā” : if the statement “the brahmins are the sons of Brahmā” were true, the face of the brahmin women would be the same as the face of Brahmā. But this is not so.🔽The brahmin women are the daughters of Brahmā.

original: 115. Mukhacchedakavādanti “brāhmaṇā mahābrahmuno mukhato jātā”ti vādassa chedakavādaṃ.
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ mahābrahmunaḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ ati vādassa chedaka vādaṃ
translated: “The mouth-cutter doctrine” : the doctrine that cuts the mouth of the statement “the brahmins are born from the mouth of Brahmā.”

original: Ariyabhāve asamatthāti anariyabhāvāvahā. Pakatikāḷakāti sabhāveneva na suddhā. Kaṇhoti
analyzed: ariya bhāve asamatthā ati anariya bhāva āvahā pakati kāḷakā ati sabhāvena iva na suddhā kaṇhā iti
translated: “Not fit for the noble state” : conducive to the state of the ignoble. “Naturally black” : not pure by nature. “Black” :

original: kiliṭṭho upatāpako. Tenāha “dukkhoti attho”ti.
analyzed: kiliṭṭhaḥ upatāpakaḥ tena āha dukkhaḥ ti attho ti
translated: defiled, tormenting. Hence the meaning is “painful.”

original: Sukkabhāvo nāma parisuddhatāti āha “nikkilesabhāvena paṇḍarā”ti. Sukkoti na kiliṭṭho anupatāpakoti vuttaṃ “sukhoti attho”ti.
analyzed: sukka bhāvaḥ nāma parisuddha tā ti āha nikkilesa bhāvena paṇḍarā ti sukkaḥ ti na kiliṭṭhaḥ anupatāpakaḥ ti vuttam sukhaḥ iti attho ti
translated: “The state of being bright” is the state of being pure. That is why he said “white by way of being stainless.” “Bright” means unsoiled, not tormenting. That is why he said “the meaning is pleasant.”

original: 116. Ubhayavokiṇṇeti vacanavipallāsena vuttanti āha “ubhayesu vokiṇṇesū”ti. Missībhūtesūti🔽“kadāci kaṇhā dhammā, kadāci sukkā dhammā”ti evaṃ ekasmiṃ santāne, ekasmiṃyeva ca
analyzed: ubhaya vokiṇṇa iti vacana vipallāsena vuttanti āha ubhayesu vokiṇṇesu iti missībhūtesu iti  kadāci kaṇhāḥ dhammā kadāci sukkāḥ dhammā ati evam ekasmin santāne ekasmiṃyeva ca
translated: “Mixed in both” is said by a reversal of the words. That is why he said “mixed in both.”🔽“Mixed in the occurrence” means in the occurrence of the two in one continuity, in one individual,

original: attabhāve pavattiyā missībhūtesu, na pana ekajjhaṃ pavattiyā. Etthāti anantaravuttadhammāva
analyzed: attabhāve pavattiyā missībhūtesu na pana ekajjham pavattiyā ettha ati anantara vutta dhammā
translated: in the way stated thus: “Sometimes there are dark states, sometimes there are bright states.” But they are not mixed in the occurrence in one place.🔽“Here” refers to the states just mentioned.

original: anvādhiṭṭhāti āha “kaṇhasukkadhammesū”ti. Yasmā ca te brāhmaṇā na ceva te dhamme🔽atikkantā, yāya ca paṭipadāya atikkameyyuṃ, sāpi tesaṃ paṭipadā natthi, tasmā vuttaṃ
analyzed: āha kaṇha sukka dhammesu iti yasmai ca te brāhmaṇāḥ na ca iva te dhamme  atikkantāḥ yāya ca paṭipadāya atikkameyyum sā api tesam paṭipadā na atthi tasmā vuttam
translated: He concludes: “in dark and bright states.”🔽And since those brahmans have not transcended those states, and since they have no way of transcending them,🔽it is said: “though they occur.” They do not admit that they occur, because they do not speak in accordance with reality.

original: “vattamānāpī”ti. Nānujānanti ayathābhuccavādabhāvato. Anujānanañca nāma abbhanumodananti
analyzed: vattamānā api iti na anujānanti ayathābhucca vāda bhāvataḥ anujānanam ca nāma
translated: And “admitting” is approving.

original: tadabhāvaṃ dassentena “nānumodanti, na pasaṃsantī”ti vuttaṃ. Catunnaṃ vaṇṇānanti
analyzed: tad abhāvam dassentena na anumodanti na pasaṃsanti iti vuttam catunnam vaṇṇānam ti
translated: The words “they do not rejoice, they do not applaud” are said to show the absence of that .

original: niddhāraṇe sāmivacanaṃ. Tesanti pana sambandhepi vā sāmivacanaṃ. Te ca brāhmaṇā na
analyzed: niddhāraṇe sāmivacanam sambandhe pi vā sāmivacanam te ca brāhmaṇāḥ na
translated: The words “of the four castes” are the genitive of separation. The words “they” are the genitive of relationship.

original: evarūpā na edisā, yādiso arahā ekadesenāpi tena tesaṃ sadisatābhāvato, tasmā tena🔽kāraṇena nesaṃ brāhmaṇānaṃ “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo”ti vādaṃ viññū yathābhūtavādino
analyzed: evarūpāḥ na edisāḥ yādisaḥ arahāḥ eka desena api tena tesam sadisa tā bhāvataḥ tasmā tena  kāraṇena na īsam brāhmaṇānam brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇoti vādam viññū yathābhūta vādinaḥ
translated: But those brahmins are not like that, are not of that kind, since they do not have even a fraction of the qualities of an arahant. Therefore,

original: buddhādayo ariyā nānujānanti.🔽Ārakattādīhīti ettha kilesānaṃ ārakattā pahīnabhāvato dūrattā arahaṃ, kilesārīnaṃ
analyzed: buddha ādayaḥ ariyāḥ na anujānanti  ārakatta ādīhi iti ettha kilesānam ārakattā pahīna bhāvataḥ araham
translated: for that reason, the wise, who speak in accordance with reality, the Noble Ones, the Buddhas, etc., do not approve the brahmins’ claim that “only the brahmin caste is the highest caste.”

original: hatattā arahaṃ, saṃsāracakkassa arānaṃ hatattā arahaṃ, paccayādīnaṃ arahattā arahaṃ,
analyzed: hatattā araham saṃsāra cakkassa arānam hatattā araham paccaya ādīnam arahattā araham
translated: As to “because of remoteness, etc.”: he is an arahant because of the remoteness of defilements, because of their being abandoned; because of distance from them; because of the slaying of the enemies, defilements; because of the slaying of the spokes, i.e., of the round of rebirths; because of the worthiness of being worshipped with requisites, etc.;

original: pāpakaraṇe rahābhāvena arahanti evamattho veditabbo. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro
analyzed: pāpa karaṇe raha abhāvena arahanti evamatthaḥ veditabbaḥ ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ
translated: because of the absence of a secret place for doing evil. This is the meaning to be understood. This is the brief treatment here. The extended

original: pana visuddhimagge, taṃ saṃvaṇṇanāsu ca vuttanayena veditabbo. Āsavānaṃ khīṇattāti
analyzed: pana visuddhi magge tam saṃvaṇṇanāsu ca vutta nayena veditabbaḥ āsavānam khīṇa ttā ti
translated: treatment, however, should be understood according to the method stated in the Visuddhimagga and in the commentaries. As to “because of the destruction of the taints”:

original: catunnampi āsavānaṃ anavasesato pahīnattā. Brahmacariyavāsanti maggabrahmacariyavāsaṃ.
analyzed: catunnam pi āsavānam anavasesataḥ pahīna ttā brahmacariya vāsanti magga brahmacariya vāsam
translated: The living of the holy life: the living of the holy life consisting in the path.

original: Tassa vāsassa pariyositattā vutthavāso, dasannampi vā ariyavāsānaṃ vutthattā vutthavāso. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: tassa vāsassa pariyosita ttā vutthavāsaḥ dasannam pi vā ariya vāsānam vutthattā vutthavāsaḥ vuttam ha etam
translated: He has completed that living of the holy life, thus he is one who has lived the holy life. Or alternatively, he has lived the ten holy lives, thus he is one who has lived the holy life. For this is said:

original: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, ariyāvāsā, yadariyā āvasiṃsu vā āvasanti vā āvasissanti vā.
analyzed: dasa yime bhikkhave ariya āvāsāḥ yat ariyāḥ āvasiṃsu vā āvasanti vā āvasissanti vā
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these ten holy lives. Holy ones have lived these, are living these, and will live these.

original: Katame dasa? Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti chaḷaṅgasamannāgato🔽ekārakkho caturāpasseno panuṇṇapaccekasacco samavayasaṭhesano anāvilasaṅkappo passaddhakāyasaṅkhāro
analyzed: katame dasa idha bhikkhave bhikkhu pañcaṅga vippahīnaḥ hoti chaḍaṅga samannāgataḥ  eka ārakkhaḥ catur āpassenaḥ panuṇṇa paccekasacco sama vaya saṭhesanaḥ anāvila saṅkappo passaddha kāya saṅkhāro
translated: What ten? Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu has abandoned five factors, is endowed with six factors,

original: suvimuttacitto suvimuttapañño. Ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa ariyāvāsā”ti.
analyzed: su vimutta cittaḥ su vimutta pañño ime kho bhikkhave dasa ariya āvāsā ti
translated: guards one factor, has four factors well established, has eliminated personal indulgence and resentment, and his thoughts do not waver. His body is tranquil and his mind is tranquil. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has stood face to face with the Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has penetrated the Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has confidence in the Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who does not depend on others for the Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who is not led by others in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who is confident in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has attained security from bondage in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has attained the bliss of peace in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has attained the fruit of True Knowledge in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has attained the realization of the fruit of True Knowledge in the True Dhamma. He has attained the summit of the wisdom of one who has attained the destruction of the taints in the True Dhamma. These are the ten holy lives” .

original: Vussatīti vā vusitaṃ, ariyamaggo, ariyaphalañca, taṃ etassa atthīti atisayavacanicchāvasena
analyzed: vussati iti vā vusitam ariya maggaḥ ariya phalam ca tam etassa atthi iti atisayavacana icchā vasena
translated: Or alternatively, it is lived by the noble ones, thus it is a holy life ; the noble path and the noble fruition are what is meant. He has that, thus he is a holy life-liver ; the meaning is that he has the noble path and the noble fruition.

original: arahā “vusitavā”ti vutto. Karaṇīyaṃ nāma pariññāpahānasacchikiriyābhāvanā dukkhassantaṃ
analyzed: arahā vusitavā ti vuttaḥ karaṇīyam nāma pariññā apahāna sacchikiriyā bhāvanā dukkhaṃ santam
translated: The Arahant is called “one who has lived the life” . The “task” is the task of full understanding, abandoning, realizing, and developing, which must be done entirely by those who want to make an end of suffering.

original: kātukāmehi ekantato kattabbattā, taṃ pana yasmā catūhi maggehi paccekaṃ catūsu saccesu
analyzed: kātu kāmehi ekantataḥ kattabba ttā tam pana yasmā catūhi maggehi paccekam catūsu saccesu
translated: But since that task is done in the four truths by means of the four paths respectively,

original: kātabbaṃ kataṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ “catūhi…pe… katakaraṇīyo”ti. Osīdāpanaṭṭhena bhārā viyāti
analyzed: kātabbam katam tasmā vuttam catūhipe kata karaṇīyaḥ ti osīdāpana ṭṭhena bhārā viyāti
translated: it is said, “By the four paths he has done the task in the four truths.”🔽The defilements and the aggregates are “burdens” in the sense of oppressing,

original: bhārā, kilesā, khandhā ca. Vuttañhi “bhārā have pañcakkhandhā”ti ohāritoti apanīto.
analyzed: bhārā kilesā khandhā ca vuttam hi bhārā have pañca khandhā ti ohāritaḥ ti apanītaḥ
translated: like a load. “He has put down the burden” means he has removed it.

original: Sako attho sadatthoti ettha da-kāro padasandhikaro. Kāmaṃ diṭṭhiādayopi saṃyojanāni
analyzed: sakaḥ attho sat atthaḥ ti ettha dakāro pada sandhi karaḥ kāmam diṭṭhi ādayaḥ api saṃyojanāni
translated: The meaning of “his own” is “beneficial to himself.” Here the syllable da is a particle for linking the words.🔽Although views, etc., are also fetters, still the meaning of “fetter” is more applicable to craving in the sense of fettering to becoming.

original: eva, tathāpi taṇhāya bhavasaṃyojanaṭṭho sātisayo. Yathāha “avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: eva tathā api taṇhāya bhava saṃyojana ṭṭho sa atisayaḥ yathā āha avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam
translated: For it is said, “Beings hindered by ignorance, fettered by craving” .

original: taṇhāsaṃyojanāna”nti. tato sā eva sutte samudayasaccabhāvena vuttā, tasmā vuttaṃ
analyzed: taṇhā saṃyojana ananti sā eva sutte samudaya sacca bhāvena vuttā tasmā vuttam
translated: Therefore it is craving that is called “the fetter of becoming” in the sutta, which speaks of it as the truth of the origin.

original: “bhavasaṃyojanaṃ vuccati taṇhā”ti. Sammadaññā vimuttoti sammā aññāya jānanabhūtāya
analyzed: bhava saṃyojanam vuccati taṇhā ati sammadaññā vimutto ti sammā aññāya jānana bhūtāya
translated: “Freed by sound understanding” .

original: aggamaggapaññāya sammā yathābhūtaṃ yaṃ yathā jānitabbaṃ, taṃ tathā jānitvā vimutto.
analyzed: agga magga paññāya sammā yathābhūtam yam yathā jānitabbam tam tathā jānitvā vimuttaḥ
translated: He is liberated by knowing and seeing as it really is that which should be known and seen by the knowledge of the path to the foremost state.

original: Imasmiṃ loketi imasmiṃ sattaloke. Idhattabhāveti imasmiṃ attabhāve, parattabhāveti
analyzed: imasmin loke iti imasmin satta loke idhatta bhāva iti imasmin atta bhāve paratta bhāva iti
translated: In this world: in this world of beings. In this selfhood: in this selfhood of mine. In another’s selfhood:

original: parasmiṃ attabhāve, idhaloke, paraloke cāti attho.
analyzed: parasmin atta bhāve idha loke para loke ca ati
translated: in another’s selfhood. The meaning is: in this world and in the next world.🔽Free from division: free from discrimination. Hence he said “equal to himself in birth.”

original: 117. Antaravirahitāti vibhāgavirahitā. Tenāha “attano kulena sadisā”ti. Anuyantīti anuyantā, anuyantā eva ānuyantā, anuvattakā. Tenāha “vasavattino”ti.
analyzed: antara virahitā ati vibhāga virahitā tena āha kulena sadisā iti anuyantī iti anuyantā anuyantā eva ānuyantā anuvattakā tena āha vasa vattinā iti
translated: Followers: followers of the same clan. Hence he said “subject to his control.”

original: 118. Niviṭṭhāti saddheyyavatthusmiṃ anupavisanavasena niviṭṭhā. Tato eva tasmiṃ adhikaṃ nivisanato abhiniviṭṭhā. Acalaṭṭhitāti acalabhāve ṭhitā.
analyzed: niviṭṭhā ati saddheyya vatthusmim an upavisana vasena niviṭṭhā tatas eva tasmin adhikam nivisanataḥ abhiniviṭṭhā acala ṭṭhitā ati acala bhāve ṭhitā
translated: Established: established by way of not penetrating the basis for confidence. Hence he said “penetrated.” Established in immobility: established in the state of immobility.

original: Yanti yaṃ kathetabbadhammaṃ anupadhāretvā, tadatthañca appaccakkhaṃ katvā kathanaṃ,
analyzed: yanti yam kathetabba dhammam an upadhāretvā tad attham ca appaccakkham katvā kathanam
translated: They go: they go by not considering the Dhamma that should be spoken about and by not seeing its meaning.

original: etaṃ aṭṭhānaṃ akāraṇaṃ tassa bodhimūleyeva samucchinnattā. Vicchindajananatthanti
analyzed: etam aṭṭhānam akāraṇam tassa bodhi mūlā iya iva vicchinda janana ttham
translated: This is impossible, for that was cut off at the foot of the Bodhi Tree. For the purpose of cutting off:

original: ratanattayasaddhāya vicchindassa uppādanatthaṃ, aññathattāyāti attho. Soti māro.
analyzed: ratanattaya saddhāya vicchindassa uppādana attham aññathattāya ati attho saḥ ti māro
translated: “To break faith with the Triple Gem” means “to break faith with the Triple Gem for the sake of producing faith in it in others.”

original: Musāvādaṃ kātuṃ nāsakkhīti āgataphalassa ariyasāvakassa purato musā vattuṃ na visahi,🔽tasmā āma mārosmīti paṭijāni. Silāpathaviyanti ratanamayasilāpathaviyaṃ. Sineruṃ
analyzed: musāvādam kātum na asakkhi iti āgata phalassa ariya sāvakassa puratas musā vattum na visahi  tasmai mārosmi iti paṭijāni silāpatha viyanti ratana maya silāpatha viyam sinerum
translated: “He could not lie” means that he could not lie in the presence of a noble disciple who had attained the fruit of stream-entry.🔽Therefore he confessed: “I am Mara.”

original: kira parivāretvā ṭhito bhūmippadeso sattaratanamayo, “suvaṇṇamayo”ti keci, sā vitthārato,
analyzed: kira parivāretvā ṭhitaḥ bhūmi ppadesaḥ satta ratana mayo suvaṇṇa mayaḥ ti keci sā vitthārato
translated: “On the jeweled floor” means on the floor made of jewels. It is said that the ground surrounding Mount Sineru is made of seven precious substances.🔽Some say it is made of gold. It is many thousands of leagues in extent,

original: ubbedhato anekayojanasahassaparimāṇā ativiya niccalā. Kiṃ tvaṃ etthāti kiṃ kāraṇā🔽tvaṃ ettha. “Ṭhito”ti accharaṃ pahari. Ṭhātuṃ asakkontoti ariyasāvakassa purato ṭhātuṃ🔽asakkonto. Ayañhi ariyadhammādhigamassa ānubhāvo, yaṃ māropi nāma mahānubhāvo ujukaṃ
analyzed: ubbedhataḥ aneka yojana sahassa parimāṇā niccalā kim tvam ettha ati kim kāraṇā  tvam ettha ṭhitaḥ ti accharam pahari ṭhātum a sakkonto ti ariya sāvakassa puratas ṭhātum  a sakkontaḥ ayam hi ariya dhamma adhigamassa ānubhāvaḥ yam mā āropi nāma mahā anubhāvaḥ ujukam
translated: and it is extremely firm. “Why do you stand there?” means “for what reason do you stand there?”🔽“Strike the cymbal” means “strike the cymbal.”🔽“Unable to stand” means unable to stand in the presence of a noble disciple.

original: paṭipparituṃ na sakkoti.
analyzed: paṭipparitum na sakkoti
translated: For this is the power of the noble Dhamma, that even Mara, though so powerful, is unable to stand upright.

original: Maggo eva mūlaṃ maggamūlaṃ, tassa. Sañjātattā uppannattā. Tena maggamūlena patiṭṭhitasantāne
analyzed: maggaḥ eva mūlam magga mūlam tassa sañjāta ttā uppanna ttā tena magga mūlena patiṭṭhita santāne
translated: In the continuum of consciousness in which he was established by that root of the path,

original: laddhapatiṭṭhā. Bhagavato desanādhammaṃ nissāya ariyāya jātiyā jāto “bhagavantaṃ🔽nissāya ariyabhūmiyaṃ jāto”ti vutto. “Ure vasitvā”ti idaṃ dhammaghosassa urato samuṭṭhānatāya
analyzed: laddha patiṭṭhāḥ bhagavataḥ desanā dhammam nissāya ariyāya jātiyā jātaḥ bhagavantam  nissāya ariya bhūmiyam jātaḥ ti vutto ure vasitvā ti idam dhammaghosassa uratas samuṭṭhāna tāya
translated: he was born with the support of the Dhamma taught by the Exalted One. He was born in the Noble Birth which is based on the Dhamma of the Exalted One. He was born in the Noble Plane which is based on the Exalted One.🔽“Having dwelt in the womb” is said because the Dhamma-sound arose from the womb. Or he was born from the womb, from the breast, from the mouth. He was born from the mouth.

original: vuttaṃ. Ure vāyāmajanitābhijātitāya vā oraso. Mukhato jātena jāto “mukhato jāto”ti🔽vutto. Kāraṇakāraṇepi hi kāraṇe viya vohāro hoti “tiṇehi bhattaṃ siddha”nti. Keci
analyzed: vuttam vāyāma janita abhijāti tāya vai orasaḥ mukhataḥ jātena jātaḥ mukhataḥ jātaḥ iti  vuttaḥ kāraṇa kāraṇe api hi kāraṇe viya vohāraḥ hoti tiṇehi bhattam siddhanti keci
translated: “Born from the mouth” is said because he was born from the mouth. The usage is like that of “cooked rice from the grain” .

original: pana “vimokkhamukhassa vasena jātattā mukhato jāto”ti vadanti, tatthāpi vuttanayeneva🔽attho veditabbo. Purimenatthena yonijo, sedajo, mukhajoti tīsu sambandhesu mukhajena
analyzed: pana vimokkha mukhassa vasena jāta ttā mukhataḥ jātaḥ ti vadanti tattha api vutta nayena iva  atthaḥ veditabbaḥ purimena atthena yoni jaḥ seda jaḥ mukha jaḥ iti tīsu sambandhesu mukha jena
translated: But some say: “He was born from the mouth because he was born by way of the door of deliverance.” In that case, too, the meaning should be understood in the way stated above.

original: sambandhena bhagavato puttabhāvo vibhāvito. Atthadvayenāpi dhammajabhāvoyeva dīpito.
analyzed: sambandhena bhagavato putta bhāvaḥ vibhāvitaḥ attha dvayena api dīpito
translated: In the first sense, the Exalted One’s sonship is distinguished by the womb-born, the moisture-born, and the apparitionally-born relationships. In both senses, the Exalted One’s sonship by the Dhamma is shown.

original: Ariyadhammappattito laddhaviseso hutvā pavatto taduttarakāliko khandhasantāno “ariyadhammato🔽jāto”ti veditabbo, ariyadhammaṃ vā maggaphalaṃ nissāya, upanissāya ca jāto sabbopi
analyzed: ariya dhamma ppattitaḥ laddha visesaḥ hutvā pavattaḥ tad uttara kālikaḥ khandha santānaḥ ariya dhammato  jātaḥ ti veditabbaḥ ariya dhammam vā magga phalam nissāya upanissāya ca jātaḥ sabbaḥ api
translated: The subsequent continuity of aggregates that occurs after the attainment of the noble Dhamma and is distinguished by the possession of the noble Dhamma should be understood as “born of the noble Dhamma.” Or all of it is “born of the noble Dhamma” since it is born with the noble Dhamma, the path and fruition, as its support and proximate cause.

original: dhammappabandho “ariyadhammato jāto”ti gahetabbo. Tesaṃ pana ariyadhammānaṃ apariyositakiccatāya
analyzed: dhamma ppabandhaḥ ariya dhammataḥ jātaḥ ti gahetabbo tesam pana ariya dhammānam a pariyosita kicca tāya
translated: The subsequent continuity of aggregates that occurs after the acquisition of distinction by the attainment of noble Dhamma should be understood as “born of noble Dhamma.” Or else, all the aggregates of Dhamma can be taken as “born of noble Dhamma” since they are born with the noble Dhamma, the path and fruit, as their support and proximate cause. But since the noble Dhamma has not yet completed its task,

original: ariyabhāvena abhinibbattimattaṃ upādāya “ariyadhammato jātattā”ti vuttaṃ. Pariyositakiccatāya
analyzed: ariya bhāvena abhinibbattimattam upādāya ariya dhammataḥ jāta ttā ti vuttam pariyosita kicca tāya
translated: it is said that “he is born of noble Dhamma” on the basis of the mere production of the noble state. Since it has completed its task,

original: tathā nibbattipāripūriṃ upādāya “nimmitattā”ti vuttaṃ, yato “dhammajo dhammanimmito”ti
analyzed: tathā nibbatti pāripūrim upādāya nimmita ttā iti vuttam yatas dhamma jaḥ dhamma nimmito ti
translated: it is said that “he is created by Dhamma” on the basis of the fulfilment of that production. Therefore it is said that “he is born of Dhamma, created by Dhamma.”🔽The reading is “he inherits the inheritance of the nine supramundane states of Dhamma.”

original: vuttaṃ. “Navalokuttaradhammadāyaṃ ādiyatīti dhammadāyādo” tipi pāṭho. Assāti “bhagavatomhiputto”tiādinā
analyzed: vuttam nava lokuttara dhamma dāyam ādiyati iti dhamma dāyādaḥ tipi pāṭhaḥ assa ti
translated: “Assa” is the vocative case of “bhagavā.”

original: vuttassa vākyassa. Atthaṃ dassentoti bhāvatthaṃ pakāsento. Tathāgatassa anaññasādhāraṇasīlādidhammakkhandhassa
analyzed: vuttassa vākyassa attham dassento ti bhāva attham pakāsento tathāgatassa anañña sādhāraṇa sīla ādi dhamma kkhandhassa
translated: “Showing the meaning”: revealing the meaning of the state.

original: samūhanivesavasena dhammakāyatāya na kiñci vattabbaṃ atthi, satthuṭṭhāniyassa pana
analyzed: samūha nivesa vasena dhamma kāya tāya na kiñci vattabbam atthi satthuṭṭhāniyassa pana
translated: As regards the body of ideas, nothing need be said about the Master’s own ideas,

original: dhammakāyataṃ dassetuṃ “kasmā tathāgato dhammakāyoti vutto”ti sayameva pucchaṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā🔽“tathāgato hī”tiādinā tamatthaṃ vissajjeti. Hadayena cintetvāti “imaṃ dhammaṃ imassa🔽desessāmī”ti tassa upagatassa veneyyajanassa bodhanatthaṃ cittena cintetvā. Vācāya🔽abhinīharīti saddhammadesanāvācāya karavīkarutamañjunā brahmassarena veneyyasantānābhimukhaṃ
analyzed: dhammakāya tam dassetum kasmā tathāgato dhamma kāyaḥ iti vuttaḥ ti sayam eva puccham samuṭṭhāpetvā  tathāgataḥ hi itiādinā tam attham vissajja iti hadayena cintetvā ati imam dhammam imassa  desessāmi iti tassa upagatassa veneyya janassa bodhana attham cittena cintetvā vācāya  abhinīharīti saddhamma desanā vācāya karavīka ruta mañjunā brahmassarena veneyya santāna abhimukham
translated: but in order to show the body of ideas of the Master’s doctrine, he raises the question himself, “Why is it said that the Tathāgata is a body of ideas?”

original: tadajjhāsayānurūpaṃ hitamatthaṃ nīhari upanesi. Tenāti tena kāraṇena evaṃsaddhammādhimuttibhāvena.
analyzed: tad ajjhāsayā anurūpam hitam attham nīhari upanesi tena ati tena kāraṇena evaṃsaddhamma adhimutti bhāvena
translated: and he answers it with the words “For the Tathāgata is … ” . He thinks with his heart: “I shall teach this idea to this person who has come to me” . He brings it out with his speech: he brings it out, he presents, the profitable meaning in conformity with the dispositions of those who are to be taught, facing their mind-continua, with the speech of the teaching of the True Idea, with the sweet sound of the Brahmā-faring voice that is like the sound of the cuckoo bird. For that reason: for that reason, namely, that he is thus a body of ideas by his devotion to the True Idea.

original: Assāti tathāgatassa. Dhammamayattāti dhammabhūtattā. Idhādhippetadhammo seṭṭhaṭṭhena
analyzed: assa ati tathāgatassa dhamma maya ttā ati dhamma bhūta ttā idha adhippeta dhammo seṭṭha aṭṭhena
translated: The Tathāgata’s: the Tathāgata’s. Body of ideas: his being an idea. The idea intended here is the best.

original: brahmabhūtoti āha “dhammakāyattā eva brahmakāyo”ti. Sabbaso adhammaṃ pajahitvā anavasesato
analyzed: brahma bhūtaḥ ti āha dhamma kāyattā eva brahma kāyo ti sabbasas adhammam pajahitvā anavasesato
translated: Having abandoned the non-idea entirely without remainder,

original: dhammo eva bhūtoti dhammabhūto. Tathārūpo ca yasmā sabhāvato dhammo evāti vattabbataṃ
analyzed: dhammo eva bhūtoti dhamma bhūto tathārūpo ca yasmā sabhāvataḥ dhammo eva ati
translated: he is the idea itself, thus he is the idea-become. And since he is of such a kind that he is the idea in the sense of the True Idea in the ultimate sense,

original: arahatīti āha “dhammasabhāvo”ti.
analyzed: arahati iti āha dhamma sabhāvaḥ ti
translated: he is said to be the True Idea’s own-nature.

original: 119. Seṭṭhacchedakavādanti “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo”ti evaṃ vuttaseṭṭhabhāvacchedakavādaṃ.
analyzed: seṭṭha chedaka vādam ti brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ evam vutta seṭṭha bhāva chedaka vādam
translated: The theory of the cutting off of the best: the theory stated thus “Only the brahmin class is the best class” is the theory of the cutting off of the best.

original: Aparenapi nayenāti yathāvuttaseṭṭhacchedakavādato aparenapi porāṇakalokuppattidassananayena.
analyzed: aparena api nayena ati yathā vutta seṭṭha chedaka vādataḥ aparena api porāṇaka loka uppatti dassana nayena
translated: By another method: by the method of showing the origin of the ancient quarrel.

original: Seṭṭhaccheda…pe… dassetunti sopi hi “brāhmaṇova seṭṭho vaṇṇo, hīnā aññe vaṇṇā”ti,
analyzed: seṭṭha chedape dassetunti saḥ api hi brāhmaṇaḥ uva seṭṭhaḥ vaṇṇaḥ hīnāḥ aññe vaṇṇāti
translated: The cutting off of the best …: this is said because he shows that the theory that only the brahmin class is the best class and the other classes are inferior,

original: “brāhmaṇā brahmuno puttā orasā mukhato jātā brahmajā”ti ca evaṃ pavattāya micchādiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ brahmuno puttāḥ orasāḥ mukhataḥ jātāḥ brahma jāti ca evam pavattāya micchādiṭṭhiyā
translated: and the theory that only the brahmin class is the son of Brahmā, born of his mouth, born of Brahmā, born of Brahmā’s ideas, born of Brahmā’s thought,

original: viniveṭhano jātibrāhmaṇānaṃ seṭṭhabhāvassa chedanato seṭṭhacchedanavādo nāma hotīti dassetunti attho.
analyzed: viniveṭhanaḥ jāti brāhmaṇānam seṭṭha bhāvassa chedanato seṭṭha chedana vādaḥ nāma hoti iti dassetun ti attho
translated: is a theory of the cutting off of the best since it is a turning away from the right view that the best is the class of those who have been born as brahmins and as noble ones. The meaning is that he shows that it is a theory of the cutting off of the best.

original: Itthabhāvanti imaṃ pakārataṃ manussabhāvaṃ. Sāmaññajotanā hi visese avatiṭṭhati,
analyzed: itthabhāvanti imam pakāratam manussa bhāvam sāmañña jotanā hi visese avatiṭṭhati
translated: “The state of being a woman” is the state of being of this kind, the human state. For the word “state” is used to denote a particular kind of being.🔽Or else the meaning can be regarded as limited by the context.

original: pakaraṇavasena vā ayamattho avacchinno daṭṭhabbo. Maneneva nibbattāti bāhirapaccayena🔽vinā kevalaṃ upacārajhānamanasāva nibbattā. Yāya upacārajjhānacetanāya te tattha
analyzed: pakaraṇa vasena vā ayam atthaḥ avacchinnaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ manena iva nibbattā ati bāhira paccayena  vinā kevalam nibbattāḥ yāya upacāra jhāna cetanāya te tattha
translated: “Created by the mind alone”: created by the mind of access concentration without any external conditions.🔽By the volition of access concentration that creates them there,

original: nibbattā, nīvaraṇavikkhambhanādinā uḷāro tassā pavattiviseso, tasmā jhānaphalakappo
analyzed: nibbattā nīvaraṇa vikkhambhana ādinā uḷāraḥ tassā pavatti viseso tasmā jhāna phala kappo
translated: a special kind of occurrence is generated, namely, the suppression of hindrances, etc., and so they are called “the special kind of occurrence of the access jhāna.”

original: tassā phalavisesoti āha “brahmaloke viyā”tiādi. “Sayaṃpabhā”ti padānaṃ tattha sūriyālokādīhi
analyzed: tassā phala visesaḥ ti āha brahmaloke viyā tiādi padānam tattha sūriyāloka ādīhi
translated: Therefore the stanza says, “In the Brahmā-world, etc.”🔽The words “self-luminous” mean that they shine by themselves without the need for the light of the sun, etc.,

original: vinā andhakāraṃ vidhamantā sayameva pabhāsantīti sayaṃpabhā, antalikkhe ākāse carantīti
analyzed: vinā andhakāram vidhamantā sayam eva pabhāsanti iti sayaṃpabhāḥ antalikkhe ākāse caranti iti
translated: and that they move about in the sky, in the firmament.

original: antalikkhacarā, tadaññakāmāvacarasattānaṃ viya sarīrassa vicaraṇaṭṭhānassa asubhatābhāvato
analyzed: antalikkha carā tad añña kāmāvacara sattānam viya sarīrassa vicaraṇa ṭṭhānassa asubha tā bhāvato
translated: They are “beautiful” because there is no ugliness in their bodies or in the places where they move about, as there is in the case of other sense-sphere beings.

original: subhaṃ, subheva tiṭṭhantīti subhaṭṭhāyinoti attho veditabbo.
analyzed: subham subhā iva tiṭṭhanti iti subha ṭṭhāyinaḥ ti atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning should be understood as follows: they are beautiful to live in.

original: Rasapathavipātubhāvavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Appearance of Taste and Earth

original: 120. Sabbaṃ cakkavāḷanti anavasesaṃ koṭisatasahassaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ. Samatanīti sañchādentī
analyzed: sabbam cakkavāḷanti anavasesam koṭi sata sahassam cakkavāḷam samatanīti sañchādentī
translated: 120. The entire world-sphere: the entire world-sphere of a hundred thousand world-spheres. It spread out: it spread out, it extended.

original: vipphari, sā pana tasmiṃ udake patiṭṭhitā ahosīti āha “patiṭṭhahī”ti. Vaṇṇena sampannāti
analyzed: vipphari sā pana tasmin udake patiṭṭhitā ahosi iti āha patiṭṭhahi iti vaṇṇena sampannā iti
translated: It was established in the water: it came to rest in the water. It was endowed with colour: it was endowed with beauty.

original: sampannavaṇṇā. Makkhikaṇḍakarahitanti makkhikāhi ca tāsaṃ aṇḍakehi ca rahitaṃ.
analyzed: sampanna vaṇṇāḥ makkhi kaṇḍaka rahitanti makkhikāhi ca tāsam aṇḍakehi ca rahitam
translated: Free from flies and maggots: free from flies and from the eggs of flies.

original: Atītānantarepi kappe loloyeva. Kasmā? Evaṃ ciraparicitalolatāvasena sabbapaṭhamaṃ🔽tathā akāsīti dasseti. Kimevidanti “vaṇṇato, gandhato ca tāva ñātaṃ, rasato pana
analyzed: atīta anantare pi kappe kasmai evam cira paricita lola tā vasena sabba paṭhamam  tathā akāsi iti dassa iti vaṇṇataḥ gandhato ca tāva ñātam rasato pana
translated: In the immediately preceding past world-sphere it was a creeper. Why? It shows that it was so in the past because it was a creeper for a long time.

original: kimevidaṃ bhavissatī”ti saṃsayajāto vadati. Tiṭṭhatīti aṭṭhāsi.🔽Candimasūriyādipātubhāvavaṇṇanā🔽121. Āluppakārakanti ettha ālopapariyāyo āluppa-saddoti āha “ālopaṃ katvā”ti. Paccakkhabhūtānampi🔽candimasūriyānaṃ pavattiyaṃ lokiyānaṃ sammoho hoti, taṃ vidhamituṃ “ko pana tesa”ntiādinā
analyzed: kim eva idam bhavissati iti saṃsaya jātaḥ vadati tiṭṭhati iti aṭṭhāsi 🔽          🔽āluppa kārakam ti ettha ālopa pariyāyaḥ āluppa saddo ti āha ālopam katvā iti paccakkha bhūtānam pi 🔽candima sūriyānam pavattiyam lokiyānam sammohaḥ hoti tam vidhamitum kaḥ pana tesanti ādinā
translated: What is this? He says this because he has doubts about the taste, thinking, “I know its colour and smell, but what is its taste?” It stood: it remained.

original: aṭṭha pañhāvissajjanāni gahitāni. Tattha tesanti candimasūriyānaṃ. Kasminti kasmiṃ🔽ṭhāne. “Ko uparī”ti eteneva ko heṭṭhāti ayamattho vuttoyeva. Tathā “ko sīghaṃ gacchatī”ti🔽iminā ko saṇikaṃ gacchatīti ayampi attho vuttoyeva. Vīthiyoti gamanavīthiyo. Ekatoti
analyzed: aṭṭha pañhā vissajjanāni gahitāni tattha tesanti candima sūriyānam kasmin ti kasmin  ṭhāne kaḥ upari iti etena iva kaḥ heṭṭhā ati ayam atthaḥ vuttaḥ yā iva tathā kaḥ sīgham gacchati iti  iminā kaḥ saṇikam gacchati iti ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ yā iva vīthiyāḥ ti gamana vīthiyaḥ ekatoti
translated: Eight questions and answers are included here. Herein, “Which?” refers to the moon and sun. “In what?” refers to in what place. “Which is above?” and “Which is below?” are the same as “Which is above?” “Which goes fast?” and “Which goes slow?” are the same as “Which goes fast?” “Path” refers to the paths of going. “One way” refers to one path.

original: ekasmiṃ khaṇe pātubhavanti. Sūriyamaṇḍale pana atthaṅgate candamaṇḍalaṃ paññāyittha.
analyzed: ekasmin khaṇe pātubhavanti sūriya maṇḍale pana atthaṅgate canda maṇḍalam paññāyittha
translated: Eight questions and answers are included here. Herein, “Theirs” is of the moon and sun. “In what” is in what place. By “Who is above?” the meaning of “Who is below?” is already stated. Likewise, by “Who goes fast?” the meaning of “Who goes slowly?” is already stated. “Path” is the paths of going. “Together” is in one moment. But when the sun’s orb has set, the moon’s orb appears.

original: Chandaṃ ñatvā vāti ruciṃ ñatvā viya.
analyzed: chandam ñatvā vāti rucim ñatvā
translated: “Having known the wish” is as if having known the desire.

original: Ubhayanti anto, bahi ca.
analyzed: ubhayanti antar bahi ca
translated: “Both” is inside and outside.

original: Ujukanti āyāmato, vitthārato, ubbedhato ca. Parimaṇḍalatoti parikkhepato.🔽Ujukaṃ saṇikaṃ gacchati amāvāsiyaṃ sūriyena saddhiṃ gacchanto divase divase thokaṃ
analyzed: ujukanti āyāmataḥ vitthārataḥ ubbedhato ca parimaṇḍalato ti parikkhepato  ujukam saṇikam gacchati amāvāsiyam sūriyena saddhim gacchantaḥ divase divase thokam
translated: “Straight” is in length, in breadth, and in height. “Round” is in circumference.

original: thokaṃ ohīyanto puṇṇamāsiyaṃ upaḍḍhamaggameva ohīyanato. Tiriyaṃ sīghaṃ gacchati
analyzed: thokam ohīyantaḥ puṇṇamāsiyam upaḍḍha maggam eva ohīyanataḥ tiriyam sīgham gacchati
translated: He goes straight and slowly. Going with the sun on the new-moon day, he goes a little less each day. On the full-moon day, he goes less than half the path. He goes fast across.

original: ekasmimpi māse kadāci dakkhiṇato, kadāci uttarato dassanato. “Dvīsu passesū”ti idaṃ
analyzed: ekasmim pi māse kadāci dakkhiṇatas kadāci uttaratas dassanataḥ dvīsu passesu iti idam
translated: Sometimes in the month it is seen to the south, sometimes to the north. “In two directions” is said

original: yebhuyyavasena vuttaṃ. Candassa purato, pacchato, samañca tārakā gacchantiyeva. Attano
analyzed: yebhuyya vasena vuttam candassa puratas pacchatas samañca tārakāḥ attano
translated: by way of the majority. The stars go in front of, behind, and together with the moon. Their

original: ṭhānanti attano gamanaṭṭhānaṃ. Na vijahanti attano vīthiyāva gacchanato. Sūriyassa🔽ujukaṃ gamanassa sīghatā candassa gamanaṃ upādāya veditabbā. Tiriyaṃ gamanaṃ dakkhiṇadisato
analyzed: ṭhānam ti attanaḥ gamana ṭṭhānam na vijahanti attanaḥ vīthiyā ava gacchanataḥ sūriyassa  ujukam gamanassa sīgha tā candassa gamanam upādāya veditabbā tiriyam gamanam dakkhiṇa disataḥ
translated: own place: their own course. They do not leave their own course, because they go in their own course.

original: uttaradisāya, uttaradisato ca dakkhiṇadisāya gamanaṃ dandhaṃ chahi chahi māsehi ijjhanato.
analyzed: uttara disāya uttara disatas ca dakkhiṇa disāya gamanam dandham chahi chahi māsehi ijjhanato
translated: The speed of the sun’s straight course should be understood by way of the moon’s course. The oblique course, from the south to the north and from the north to the south, is slow, because it is accomplished in six months each.🔽The sun: on the Uposatha day of the dark fortnight, having gone together with the moon,

original: Soti sūriyo. Kāḷapakkhauposathatoti kāḷapakkhe uposathe candena saheva gantvā tato
analyzed: saḥ iti sūriyaḥ kāḷapakkha auposathato ti kāḷapakkhe uposathe candena saha iva gantvā tatas
translated: after that,

original: paraṃ. Pāṭipadadivaseti sukkapakkhapāṭipadadivase. Ohāya gacchati attano sīghagāmitāya,
analyzed: param pāṭipada divase iti sukka pakkha pāṭipada divase ohāya gacchati attano sīghagāmi tāya
translated: on the day of the new moon, it goes away, because of its own speed,

original: tassa ca dandhagāmitāya. Lekhā viya paññāyati pacchimadisāyaṃ. Yāva uposathadivasāti
analyzed: tassa ca dandha gāmitāya lekhā viya paññāyati pacchima disā ayam yāva uposatha divasā ti
translated: and because of his slowness. It appears like a streak in the western direction. As far as the Uposatha day

original: yāva sukkapakkhauposathadivasā. “Cando anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā”ti idaṃ uparibhāgato🔽patitasūriyālokatāya heṭṭhato pavattāya sūriyassa dūrabhāvena divase divase anukkamena🔽parihāyamānāya attano chāyāya vasena anukkamena candamaṇḍalappadesassa vaḍḍhamānassa🔽viya dissamānatāya vuttaṃ, tasmā anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā viya. Uposathadivase puṇṇamāyaṃ🔽paripuṇṇo hoti, paripuṇṇamaṇḍalo hutvā dissatīti attho. Dhāvitvā gaṇhāti candassa
analyzed: yāva sukka pakkha auposatha divasā candaḥ anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā iti idam upari bhāgataḥ  patita sūriya āloka tāya heṭṭhatas pavattāya sūriyassa dūra bhāvena divase divase anukkamena  parihāyamānāya attano chāyāya vasena anukkamena canda maṇḍala ppadesassa vaḍḍhamānassa  viya dissamāna tāya vuttam tasmai anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā viya uposatha divase puṇṇamāyam  paripuṇṇaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa maṇḍalaḥ hutvā dissati iti atthaḥ dhāvitvā gaṇhāti candassa
translated: up to the full-moon Uposatha day in the bright fortnight. “The moon gradually increases” is said because it appears as if it were gradually increasing in size by the increase of its own shadow as it gradually decreases in diameter day by day by the light of the sun falling on it from above,🔽because of the sun’s distance from it as it moves below. Therefore it is said as if it were gradually increasing. On the Uposatha day of the full moon🔽it is full, the meaning is that it appears as a full disc. “It runs and seizes” the moon.

original: dandhagatitāya, attano ca sīghagatitāya. Anukkamena hāyitvāti ettha “anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā”ti🔽ettha vuttanayena attho veditabbo. Tattha pana chāyāya hāyamānatāya maṇḍalaṃ vaḍḍhamānaṃ🔽viya dissati, idha chāyāya vaḍḍhamānatāya maṇḍalaṃ hāyamānaṃ viya dissati.
analyzed: dandha gati tāya attano ca sīgha gati tāya anukkamena hāyitvā ati ettha anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā ati 🔽ettha vutta nayena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ tattha pana chāyāya hāyamāna tāya maṇḍalam vaḍḍhamānam 🔽viya dissati idha chāyāya vaḍḍhamāna tāya maṇḍalam hāyamānam viya dissati
translated: and so on up to the Uposatha day of the bright fortnight. “The moon gradually waxes”: this is said because the moon’s disk appears to wax gradually by reason of the gradual increase of its illuminated area. For the sun’s rays striking the far side of the moon gradually diminish the shadows on the moon’s disk. As the shadows gradually disappear, the moon’s disk appears to wax. Therefore it is said that the moon “gradually waxes.” On the Uposatha day of the full moon it is “full,” complete. Its disk appears full. “It is caught as it runs”: because the moon moves slowly and the sun quickly. “Gradually wanes”: the meaning should be understood in the way stated in the case of waxing. For there the disk appears to wax by reason of the gradual disappearance of the shadows; here it appears to wane by reason of the gradual disappearance of the illuminated area.
