original: Paracittañāṇasahagatā catutthajjhānapādakā tatiyacatutthamaggā tatiyacatutthadassanasamāpattiyoti.
analyzed: para citta ñāṇa sahagatā catuttha jjhāna pādakā tatiya catuttha maggā tatiya catuttha dassana samāpattiyā ti
translated: The third and fourth paths, which have the fourth jhāna with a mind-object as its proximate cause and are accompanied by knowledge of the penetration of minds, are the third and fourth kinds of direct-knowledge attainment.

original: Purisassa viññāṇapajānanaṃ panettha asammohavasena daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: purisassa viññāṇa pajānanam pana ittha asammoha vasena daṭṭhabbam
translated: But the man’s knowledge of consciousness should be understood here as non-delusion.

original: Puggalapaṇṇattidesanāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Teaching of the Ascertainment of the Person

original: 150. Puggalapaṇṇattīsūti puggalānaṃ paññāpanesu. Guṇavisesavasena aññamaññaṃ asaṅkarato🔽ṭhapanesu. Lokavohāravasenāti lokasammutivasena. Lokavohāro hesa, yadidaṃ “satto🔽puggalo”tiādi. Rūpādīsu sattavisattatāya satto. Tassa tassa sattanikāyassa pūraṇato🔽galanato, maraṇavasena patanato ca puggalo. Santatiyā nayanato naro. Attabhāvassa🔽posanato poso. Evaṃ paññāpetabbāsu voharitabbāsu. “Sabbametaṃ puggalo”ti imissā sādhāraṇapaññattiyā
analyzed: puggala paṇṇattīsu iti puggalānam paññāpanesu guṇa visesa vasena aññam aññam asaṅkarato  ṭhapanesu loka vohāra vasena ati loka sammuti vasena loka vohāraḥ ha isa yat idam satto  puggala iti ādi rūpa ādīsu satta visatta tāya satto tassa tassa satta nikāyassa pūraṇato  galanataḥ maraṇa vasena patanataḥ ca puggalo santatiyāḥ nayanataḥ naraḥ atta bhāvassa  posanataḥ posaḥ evam paññāpetabbāsu voharitabbāsu sabbam etam puggalo ti imissā sādhāraṇa paññattiyā
translated: ‘The Discourse on Description of Persons’: in the descriptions of persons. ‘By way of specific qualities’ means by way of the different qualities of each one, without confusion.🔽‘By way of mundane usage’: by way of what is accepted in the world. For this is the usage in the world, namely, ‘living being’, ‘person’, etc. ‘Living being’ because of the seven and twenty bases beginning with form.🔽‘Person’ because of filling up, i.e. completing, a certain class of living beings, and because of falling, i.e. dying, in a certain class of living beings. ‘Man’ because of conducting a continuity. ‘Being’ because of nourishing a selfhood.🔽‘Should be described’ means should be spoken of. ‘All this is a person’: this is the general description.

original: vibhāvanavasena vuttaṃ, na idhādhippetaasādhāraṇapaññattiyā, tasmā lokapaññattīsūti🔽sattalokagatapaññattīsu. Anuttaro hoti anaññasādhāraṇattā tassa paññāpanassa.🔽Dvīhi bhāgehīti kāraṇe, nissakke cetaṃ puthuvacanaṃ, āvuttiādivasena cāyamattho veditabboti
analyzed: vibhāvana vasena vuttam na idha adhippeta asādhāraṇa paññattiyā tasmā loka paññattīsu iti 🔽satta loka gata paññattīsu anuttaraḥ hoti an añña sādhāraṇa ttā tassa paññāpanassa 🔽dvīhi bhāgehi iti kāraṇe nissakke ca itam puthuvacanam āvutti ādi vasena ca ayam attho veditabbo ti
translated: ‘In the Puggalapannatti Sutta’: in the description of the person. ‘By way of the world’s description’: by way of the world’s approval. For this is the world’s description, namely, ‘a being’, ‘a person’, etc. He is a being because of the seven and the twenty. He is a person because he fills up and goes to each of the various kinds of birth, and because he goes by way of death. He is a man because he is led by continuity. He is a human being because he nourishes his self. He is to be described and spoken of thus. ‘All this is a person’: this is said by way of distinguishing the general description of the person, which is ‘a person’, not by way of the special description intended here. Therefore ‘in the world’s description’ should be understood as ‘in the description of the person in the world of beings’. ‘Unsurpassed’ because that description is not shared by anyone else. ‘By two factors’: this is a distributive expression, and the meaning should be understood by way of the occurrence of the two factors, etc.

original: āha “arūpasamāpattiyā”tiādi, etena “samāpattiyā vikkhambhanavimokkhena, maggena samucchedavimokkhena
analyzed: āha arūpa samāpattiyā atiādi etena samāpattiyā vikkhambhana vimokkhena maggena samuccheda vimokkhena
translated: He says “By the attainment of the formless states” and so on. By the deliverance of suppression through attainment, and by the deliverance of cutting off through the path,

original: vimuttattā ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti evaṃ pavatto tipiṭakacūḷanāgattheravādo, “nāmakāyato,
analyzed: vimutta ttā ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ iti evam pavattaḥ tipiṭaka cūḍa nāga tthera vādaḥ nāma kāyato
translated: He says, “By the attainment of the formless states,” etc. By this he includes the three kinds of Elder Brethren’s doctrines, namely, the Elder Brother Cullanāga of the Tripiṭaka, who says thus: “He is called ‘liberated in both ways’ because he is liberated by the liberation of suppression through attainment and by the liberation of cutting off through the path,”

original: rūpakāyato ca vimuttattā ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti evaṃ pavatto tipiṭakamahādhammarakkhitattheravādo,🔽“samāpattiyā vikkhambhanavimokkhena ekavāraṃ vimuttova maggena samucchedavimokkhena
analyzed: rūpa kāyato ca vimutta ttā ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ ti evam pavattaḥ tipiṭaka mahādhammarakkhita thera vādo  samāpattiyāḥ vikkhambhana vimokkhena eka vāram vimuttaḥ uva maggena samuccheda vimokkhena
translated: the Elder Brother Mahādhammarakkhita of the Tripiṭaka, who says thus: “He is called ‘liberated in both ways’ because he is liberated from the mental body and from the physical body,”

original: ekavāraṃ vimuttattā ubhatobhāgavimutto”ti evaṃ pavatto tipiṭakacūḷābhayattheravādo🔽cāti imesaṃ tiṇṇampi theravādānaṃ ekajjhaṃ saṅgaho katoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vimuttoti kilesehi
analyzed: eka vāram vimutta ttā ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ iti evam pavattaḥ tipiṭaka cūḍābhayatthera vādaḥ  ca ati imesam tiṇṇam pi thera vādānam ekajjham saṅgaho kato ti daṭṭhabbam vimuttaḥ ti kilesehi
translated: and the Elder Brother Cūḷābhaya of the Tripiṭaka, who says thus: “He is called ‘liberated in both ways’ because he is liberated once by the liberation of suppression through attainment and once by the liberation of cutting off through the path.”

original: vimutto, kilesavikkhambhanasamucchedanehi vā kāyadvayato vimuttoti attho. Arūpasamāpattīnanti
analyzed: vimuttaḥ kilesa vikkhambhana samucchedanehi vā kāya dvayataḥ vimuttaḥ ti attho arūpa samāpattīnam ti
translated: It should be understood that he includes these three kinds of Elder Brethren’s doctrines together. Liberated: liberated from defilements; or the meaning is that he is liberated from the two kinds of body by the suppression of defilements and by their cutting off. By the formless attainments:

original: niddhāraṇe sāmivacanaṃ. Arahattappattaanāgāminoti bhūtapubbagatiyā vuttaṃ. Na hi🔽arahattappatto anāgāmī nāma hoti. Pāḷīti puggalapaññattipāḷi. Aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena🔽phusitvāti aṭṭha samāpattiyo sahajātanāmakāyena paṭilabhitvā. Paññāya cassa disvā
analyzed: niddhāraṇe sāmi vacanam arahatta ppatta anāgāmino ti bhūta pubba gatiyā vuttam na hi  arahatta patto anāgāmī nāma hoti pāḷi iti puggala paññatti pāḷi aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena  phusitvā ti aṭṭha samāpattiyo sahajāta nāmakāyena paṭilabhitvā paññāya ca ssa disvā
translated: The word “his” is a possessive in the sense of a determinative. “A non-returner who has reached Arahantship” is said by way of his past destiny,

original: āsavā parikkhīṇā hontīti vipassanāpaññāya saṅkhāragataṃ, maggapaññāya cattāri saccāni🔽passitvā cattāropi āsavā parikkhīṇā honti. Disvāti dassanahetu. Na hi āsave paññāya
analyzed: āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti iti vipassanā paññāya saṅkhāra gatam magga paññāya cattāri saccāni  passitvā cattāro api āsavā parikkhīṇā honti disvā ati dassana hetu na hi āsave paññāya
translated: for one who has reached Arahantship is not called a non-returner. “The text” is the text of the Puggalapannatti. “Having attained the eight emancipations with the body” is having attained the eight attainments with the body that is called conascent. “Having seen with wisdom” is having seen the sphere of formations with insight wisdom and the four truths with path wisdom.

original: passanti, dassanakāraṇā pana parikkhīṇā “disvā parikkhīṇā”ti vuttā dassanāyattaparikkhīṇattā.
analyzed: passanti dassana kāraṇā pana parikkhīṇā disvā parikkhīṇā ati vuttā dassana āyatta parikkhīṇa ttā
translated: “His cankers are destroyed” is the destruction of the four cankers. “Having seen” is the cause of seeing. For the cankers are not seen by wisdom, but because of seeing they are destroyed. Therefore it is said: “Having seen, they are destroyed.” They are destroyed because of the dependence on seeing.

original: Evañhi dassanaṃ āsavānaṃ khayassa purimakiriyābhāvena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evam hi dassanam āsavānam khayassa purima kiriyā bhāvena vuttam
translated: Thus seeing is said to be the prior action for the destruction of the cankers.

original: Paññāya visesato muttoti paññāvimutto anavasesato āsavānaṃ parikkhīṇattā. Aṭṭhavimokkhapaṭikkhepavaseneva,
analyzed: paññāya visesataḥ muttoti paññā vimuttaḥ anavasesataḥ āsavānam parikkhīṇa ttā aṭṭha vimokkha paṭikkhepa vasena iva
translated: “Freed by the distinction of wisdom” is freed by wisdom-vimutti because of the destruction of the cankers without remainder.

original: na tadekadesabhūtarūpajjhānapaṭikkhepavasena. Evañhi arūpajjhānekadesābhāvepi aṭṭhavimokkhapaṭikkhepo🔽na hotīti siddhaṃ hoti. Arūpāvacarajjhānesu hi ekasmimpi sati ubhatobhāgavimuttoyeva
analyzed: na tad eka desa bhūta rūpa jjhāna paṭikkhepa vasena evam hi arūpa jjhāna eka desa abhāve pi aṭṭha vimokkha paṭikkhepo  na hoti iti siddham hoti arūpāvacara jhānesu hi ekasmin pi sati
translated: not by the mere fact of the absence of the jhāna of the fine-material sphere. For if it were, then the eight emancipations would not be contradicted by the absence of a part of the immaterial jhānas.🔽So it is established that it is by the mere fact of the absence of the immaterial jhānas that the eight emancipations are contradicted.

original: nāma hoti, na paññāvimuttoti.🔽Phuṭṭhantaṃ sacchikarotīti phuṭṭhānaṃ anto phuṭṭhanto, phuṭṭhānaṃ arūpajjhānānaṃ🔽anantaro kāloti adhippāyo, accantasaṃyoge cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ, phuṭṭhānantarakālameva
analyzed: nāma hoti na paññā vimutto ti  phuṭṭhantam sacchikaroti iti phuṭṭhānam antaḥ phuṭṭhantaḥ phuṭṭhānam arūpa jhānānam  anantaraḥ kālo ti adhippāyaḥ upayoga vacanam phuṭṭha anantara kālam eva
translated: For when any one of the immaterial jhānas is present, one is called “one liberated in both ways” and not “one liberated by understanding” .

original: sacchikātabbaṃ, sacchikato sacchikaraṇūpāyenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Tenāha “so jhānaphassa”ntiādi.
analyzed: sacchikātabbam sacchikataḥ sacchikaraṇa upāyena iti vuttam hoti tena āha saḥ jhāna phassa ntiādi
translated: He realizes the state of having reached by reaching the end of what is reached: the meaning is that he reaches the end of the time that is reached by the immaterial jhānas. And this is a locution of instrumentality in the sense of cause, for what is meant is that the state of having reached is to be reached by the time that is reached by the instrumentality of the realization. That is why he said, “The contact of jhāna” and so on.🔽Some defilements: the defilements that are abandoned by the three lower paths.

original: Ekacce āsavāti heṭṭhimamaggattayavajjhā āsavā. Yo hi arūpajjhānena rūpakāyato, nāmakāyekadesato
analyzed: ekacce āsavā ti heṭṭhima magga ttaya vajjhāḥ āsavāḥ yaḥ hi arūpa jhānena rūpa kāyataḥ nāma kāya ekadesato
translated: For one who is liberated by the liberation of the suppression of perception and feeling by the immaterial jhāna is liberated from the material body and from one part of the immaterial, namely, the associated formation of perception.

original: ca vikkhambhanavimokkhena vimutto, tena nirodhasaṅkhāto vimokkho ālocito pakāsito
analyzed: ca vikkhambhana vimokkhena vimuttaḥ tena nirodha saṅkhātaḥ vimokkhaḥ ālocitaḥ pakāsitaḥ
translated: By that he has “reached” the liberation called “cessation.” He has “illumined” it, made it evident.

original: viya hoti, na pana kāyena sacchikato. Nirodhaṃ pana ārammaṇaṃ katvā ekaccesu āsavesu
analyzed: viya hoti na pana kāyena sacchikataḥ nirodham pana ārammaṇam katvā ekaccesu āsavesu
translated: but not realized by the body. But when he has made cessation his object and has destroyed some of the defilements,

original: khepitesu tena sacchikato hoti, tasmā so sacchikātabbaṃ nirodhaṃ yathālocitaṃ nāmakāyena
analyzed: khepitesu tena sacchikataḥ hoti tasmā saḥ sacchikātabbam nirodham yathālocitam nāmakāyena
translated: it is realized by him. Therefore it is said that he realizes by the body, as it is seen, the cessation that should be realized.

original: sacchikarotīti kāyasakkhīti vuccati, na tu vimuttoti ekaccānaṃ āsavānaṃ aparikkhīṇattā.
analyzed: sacchikaroti iti kāya sakkhī iti vuccati na tu vimuttaḥ ti ekaccānam āsavānam a parikkhīṇa ttā
translated: He is called a body witness because of that, but he is not liberated because not all his defilements are exhausted.

original: Diṭṭhantaṃ pattoti dassanasaṅkhātassa sotāpattimaggañāṇassa anantaraṃ pattoti attho.🔽“Diṭṭhattā patto”tipi pāṭho, tena catusaccadassanasaṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyā nirodhassa
analyzed: diṭṭhantam patto ti dassana saṅkhātassa sotāpatti magga ñāṇassa anantaram patto ti attho  diṭṭha ttā patto tipi pāṭhaḥ tena catur acca dassana saṅkhātāya diṭṭhiyā nirodhassa
translated: He has attained the seen: the meaning is that he has attained immediately after the knowledge of the path of stream-entry called “seeing.”🔽There is also the reading “diṭṭhattā patto,” which means that he has attained cessation by means of the view called “seeing the four truths.” Hence he says “The formations are suffering,” etc.

original: pattataṃ dīpeti. Tenāha “dukkhā saṅkhārā”tiādi. Paṭhamaphalato paṭṭhāya yāva aggamaggā
analyzed: dīpeti tena āha dukkhā saṅkhārā tiādi paṭhama phalato paṭṭhāya yāva aggamaggā
translated: From the first fruition onwards up to the highest path

original: diṭṭhippattoti āha “esopi kāyasakkhī viya chabbidho hotī”ti. Idaṃ dukkhanti “idaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhi ppatto ti āha esaḥ api kāya sakkhī viya chabbidhaḥ hoti iti idam dukkham ti idam
translated: he is called a view-attainer. Therefore it is said that “he too is of six kinds like the body witness.”🔽He understands as it really is: “This is suffering,”

original: dukkhaṃ, ettakaṃ dukkhaṃ, na ito uddhaṃ dukkha”nti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti. Yasmā idaṃ
analyzed: dukkham ettakam dukkham na itas uddham dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti yasmai idam
translated: “This is the origin of suffering,” “This is the cessation of suffering,” “This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.”

original: yāthāvasarasato pajānāti, pajānanto ca ṭhapetvā taṇhaṃ pañcupādānakkhandhe “dukkhasacca”nti
analyzed: yāthāvasarasataḥ pajānāti pajānanto ca ṭhapetvā taṇham pañca upādāna khandhe dukkha saccanti
translated: He understands as it really is that, apart from craving, the five aggregates as objects of clinging are the truth of suffering.

original: pajānāti. Taṇhaṃ pana idaṃ dukkhaṃ ito samudeti, tasmā “ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo”ti yathābhūtaṃ🔽pajānāti. Yasmā idaṃ dukkhañca samudayo ca nibbānaṃ patvā nirujjhanti vūpasamanti🔽appavattiṃ gacchanti, tasmā taṃ “ayaṃ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti. Ariyo
analyzed: pajānāti taṇham pana idam dukkham itas samudeti tasmai ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti yathābhūtam  pajānāti yasmai idam dukkhañca samudayaḥ ca nibbānam patvā nirujjhanti vūpasamanti  appavattim gacchanti tasmā tam ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ariyaḥ
translated: But he understands as it really is that craving is the origin of this suffering,🔽and that this suffering ceases without remainder when that craving ceases and does not arise again.

original: pana aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo taṃ dukkhanirodhaṃ gacchati, tena taṃ “ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: pana aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo tam dukkha nirodham gacchati tena tam ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: He understands as it really is that the noble eightfold path is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: paṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti. Ettāvatā nānakkhaṇe saccavavatthānaṃ dassitaṃ.🔽Idāni taṃ ekakkhaṇe dassetuṃ “tathāgatappaveditā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tathāgatappaveditāti
analyzed: paṭipadā iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ettāvatā nānā khaṇe sacca vavatthānam dassitam  idāni tam eka khaṇe dassetum tathāgata paveditā atiādi vuttam tathāgata ppaveditā ati
translated: So far the exposition of the truths has been given in different moments.

original: tathāgatena bodhimaṇḍe paṭividdhā viditā pākaṭā katā. Dhammāti catusaccadhammā. Vodiṭṭhā
analyzed: tathāgatena bodhimaṇḍe paṭividdhā viditā pākaṭā katā dhammā ati catu sacca dhammā vodiṭṭhā
translated: Now, in order to show that in a single moment, the words “the Dhamma taught by the Tathāgata” are stated. The Dhamma taught by the Tathāgata is the four noble truths discovered by the Tathāgata at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: hontīti sudiṭṭhā honti. Vocaritāti sucaritā, tesu tena paññā suṭṭhu carāpitāti attho.
analyzed: honti iti su diṭṭhāḥ honti vocaritā ati su caritā tesu tena paññā suṭṭhu ati attho
translated: “They are well seen” means they are well seen as they are. “They are well practiced” means they are well practiced as they are. The meaning is: wisdom is well practiced in them.

original: Ayanti ayaṃ evarūpo puggalo “diṭṭhippatto”ti vuccati.
analyzed: ayam ti ayam evarūpaḥ puggalo diṭṭhi ppatto ti vuccati
translated: “He is called one who has reached by faith” means this kind of person is called one who has reached by faith.

original: Saddhāya vimuttoti saddahanavasena vimutto, etena sabbathā avimuttassapi saddhāmattena🔽vimuttabhāvaṃ dasseti. Saddhāvimuttoti vā saddhāya adhimuttoti attho. Vuttanayenevāti🔽kāyasakkhimhi vuttanayeneva. No ca kho yathā diṭṭhippattassāti yathā diṭṭhippattassa
analyzed: saddhāya vimuttaḥ ti saddahana vasena vimuttaḥ etena sabbathā a vimuttassa api saddhā mattena  vimutta bhāvam dasseti saddhā vimuttaḥ ti vā saddhāya adhimuttaḥ ti atthaḥ vutta nayena iva āti  kāyasakkhimhi vutta nayena iva no ca kho yathā diṭṭhippattassa ati yathā diṭṭhippattassa
translated: “Liberated by faith” means liberated by means of faith. By this he shows that one who is not liberated in every way is liberated by the mere fact of his faith.🔽Or the meaning is: one who is resolved on faith. “In the way already stated” means in the way stated in the case of the bodily witness. “But not in the way one who has reached by insight” means not in the way one who has reached by insight has destroyed the cankers. The meaning is: not in the way one who has reached by insight has destroyed the cankers.

original: āsavā parikkhīṇā, na evaṃ saddhāya vimuttassāti attho. Kiṃ pana nesaṃ kilesappahāne
analyzed: āsavā parikkhīṇā na evam saddhāya vimuttassa ati attho kim pana nesam kilesa ppahāne
translated: But is there any difference between them in the abandoning of defilements?🔽There is none. Then why does one liberated by faith not attain the state of one who has reached by insight?

original: nānattaṃ atthīti? Natthi. Atha kasmā saddhāvimutto diṭṭhippattaṃ na pāpuṇātīti? Āgamanīyanānattena.
analyzed: nānattam atthi iti natthi atha kasmā saddhā vimuttaḥ diṭṭhi ppattam na pāpuṇāti iti āgamanīya nānattena
translated: Because of the difference in their future course.

original: Diṭṭhippatto hi āgamanamhi kilese vikkhambhento appadukkhena, akilamanto ca sakkoti
analyzed: diṭṭhippattaḥ hi āgamanamhi kilese vikkhambhento appadukkhena a kilamanto ca sakkoti
translated: For one who has reached by insight, in his future course, is able to suppress defilements with little difficulty, without trouble,

original: vikkhambhetuṃ, saddhāvimutto dukkhena kilamanto vikkhambheti, tasmā diṭṭhippattaṃ
analyzed: vikkhambhetum saddhā vimuttaḥ dukkhena kilamantaḥ vikkhambheti tasmā diṭṭhi ppattam
translated: The faith-liberated one suppresses by painful practice; therefore the one attained-to-view

original: na pāpuṇāti. Tenāha “etesu hī”tiādi.
analyzed: na pāpuṇāti tena āha etesu hi itiādi
translated: He who is liberated by faith suppresses it with difficulty and with weariness. Therefore he does not reach the plane of the one who has attained to vision. Hence it is said: “In these two” , and so on.

original: Ārammaṇaṃ yāthāvato dhāreti avadhāretīti dhammo, paññā. Paññāpubbaṅgamanti paññāpadhānaṃ.🔽Paññaṃ vāhetīti paññāvāhī, paññaṃ sātisayaṃ pavattetīti attho. Paññā vā imaṃ puggalaṃ
analyzed: ārammaṇam yāthāvataḥ dhāreti avadhāreti iti dhammo paññā paññā pubbaṅgamanti paññā apadhānam  paññam vāheti iti paññāvāhī paññam sa atisayam pavatteti iti attho paññā vā imam puggalam
translated: The Dhamma is the understanding that holds and bears up the object as it really is. The Dhamma is the foremost for him who has understanding as his forerunner.

original: vāheti, nibbānābhimukhaṃ gametīti attho. Saddhānusāriniddesepi eseva nayo.
analyzed: vāheti nibbāna abhimukham gameti iti attho saddhānusāriniddese pi esā iva nayo
translated: He who has understanding as his forerunner is one who has understanding as his leader. The meaning is: he who causes understanding to proceed to a higher stage. Or the meaning is: he who is led by understanding, who is caused to go to Nibbāna. The same method of explanation applies to the description of the faith-follower.

original: Tasmāti visuddhimagge vuttattā, tato eva visuddhimagge, taṃ saṃvaṇṇanāsu vuttanayenettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: tasmā iti visuddhi magge vutta ttā tatas eva visuddhi magge tam saṃvaṇṇanāsu vutta nayena ittha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: Because it is stated in the Visuddhimagga, therefore, in the Visuddhimagga itself, the meaning should be understood here in the way stated in the commentary thereon.

original: Padhānadesanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: padhāna desanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the teaching of the practice

original: 151. Padahanavasenāti bhāvanānuyogavasena. Satta bojjhaṅgā padhānāti vuttā vivekanissitādibhāvena padahitabbato bhāvetabbato.
analyzed: padahana vasena ati bhāvanā anuyoga vasena satta bojjhaṅgā padhānā iti vuttā viveka nissita ādi bhāvena padahitabbataḥ bhāvetabbataḥ
translated: . By the practice: by the practice of development. The seven factors of enlightenment are called the practice because they should be practiced, should be developed, by being based upon seclusion, etc.

original: Paṭipadādesanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭipadā desanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the path

original: 152. Dukkhena kasirena samādhiṃ uppādentassāti pubbabhāge āgamanakāle kicchena dukkhena
analyzed: dukkhena kasirena samādhim uppādentassa ati pubba bhāge āgamana kāle kicchena dukkhena
translated: “With difficulty, with hardship, he arouses concentration”: in the earlier stage, at the time of coming to, with difficulty, with hardship,

original: sasaṅkhārena sappayogena kilamantassa kilese vikkhambhetvā lokuttarasamādhiṃ uppādentassa.🔽Dandhaṃ taṃ ṭhānaṃ abhijānantassāti vikkhambhitesu kilesesu vipassanāparivāse ciraṃ
analyzed: sa saṅkhārena sa payogena kilamantassa kilese vikkhambhetvā lokuttara samādhim uppādentassa  dandham tat ṭhānam abhijānantassa ati vikkhambhitesu kilesesu vipassanā parivāse ciram
translated: Who generates concentration with difficulty and slowly: who generates the supramundane concentration after abandoning the defilements with difficulty and slowly,🔽with effort and with difficulty,🔽who generates it with slow direct-knowledge: who penetrates, who realizes, who attains, that state called supramundane concentration after living long

original: vasitvā taṃ lokuttarasamādhisaṅkhātaṃ ṭhānaṃ dandhaṃ saṇikaṃ abhijānantassa paṭivijjhantassa,
analyzed: vasitvā tam lokuttara samādhi saṅkhātam ṭhānam dandham saṇikam abhijānantassa paṭivijjhantassa
translated: in the neighbourhood of insight after the defilements have been abandoned.

original: sacchikarontassa pāpuṇantassāti attho. Ayaṃ vuccatīti yā esā evaṃ uppajjati, ayaṃ
analyzed: sacchikarontassa pāpuṇantassa ati atthaḥ ayam vuccati iti yā esā evam uppajjati ayam
translated: This is called the “difficult-to-progress-and-slow-to-direct-knowledge” path: this understanding that arises thus,

original: kilesavikkhambhanapaṭipadāya dukkhattā, vipassanāparivāsapaññāya ca dandhattā maggakāle
analyzed: kilesa vikkhambhana paṭipadāya dukkha ttā vipassanā parivāsa paññāya ca dandha ttā magga kāle
translated: because of the difficulty of the progress of the abandoning of defilements and because of the slowness of the understanding consisting in the neighbourhood of insight,

original: ekacittakkhaṇe uppannāpi paññā āgamanavasena “dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāmā”ti
analyzed: eka citta kkhaṇe uppannā api paññā āgamana vasena dukkha paṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma ati
translated: is called the “difficult-to-progress-and-slow-to-direct-knowledge” path, though it arises in a single moment, because of the time taken over the progress.

original: vuccati. Upari tīsu padesupi imināva nayena attho veditabbo.
analyzed: vuccati upari tīsu padesu pi iminā ava nayena atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning should be understood in the same way in the case of the other three.

original: Bhassasamācārādidesanāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the teaching by way of speech, conduct, etc.

original: 153. Bhassasamācāreti vacīsamācāre. Ṭhitoti yathāraddhaṃ taṃ avicchedavasena kathento.
analyzed: bhassa samācāra iti vacī samācāre ṭhitaḥ iti yathā āraddham tam aviccheda vasena kathento
translated: 153. Speech-conduct: verbal conduct. Standing: speaking without interruption as he has begun.

original: Tenāha “kathāmaggaṃ anupacchinditvā kathento”ti. Musāvādūpasañhitanti antarantarā
analyzed: tena āha kathā maggam an upacchinditvā kathento iti antar antarā
translated: Hence he said: “Speaking without interrupting the line of talk.” Associated with lying: associated with lying by the insertion of a lie here and there.

original: pavattena musāvādena upasaṃhitaṃ. Vibhūti vuccati visuṃbhāvo, tattha niyuttanti vebhūtikaṃ,🔽tadeva vebhūtiyaṃ, pesuññaṃ. Tenāha “bhedakaravāca”nti. Karaṇuttariyalakkhaṇato sārambhato
analyzed: pavattena musāvādena upasaṃhitam vibhūti vuccati visuṃbhāvaḥ tattha vebhūtikam  tat eva vebhūtiyam pesuññam tena āha bheda kara vācanti karaṇa uttariya lakkhaṇato sa ārambhato
translated: Disruption is called disunity; one who is engaged in that is a disrupter.🔽That itself is a disunity. Slander is called disunity. Hence he said: “Talk that causes disunion.” Because it has the characteristic of being a means of doing harm, it is called “harmful.”

original: jātāti sārambhajā. Tassā pavattiākāradassanatthaṃ “tvaṃ dussīlo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bahiddhākathā
analyzed: jātā ati sa ārambha jā tassā pavatti ākāra dassana tham tvam dussīlaḥ tiādi vuttam bahiddhākathā
translated: It is born from that, thus it is born of harm. In order to show the mode of its occurrence, “You are immoral” and so on is said.

original: amanāpā, manāpāpi parassa cittavighātāvahattā karaṇuttariyapakkhiyamevāti dassento
analyzed: amanāpā manāpā api parassa citta vighāta āvahattā karaṇa uttariya pakkhiyam eva ti dassento
translated: Talk that is disagreeable outside, is agreeable inside, is also a means of doing harm because it causes mental pain to another.

original: “tuyha”ntiādimāha. Vikkhepakathāpavattanti vikkhepakathāvasena pavattaṃ. Jayapurekkhāro
analyzed: tuyhat tiādim āha vikkhepa kathā pavattanti vikkhepa kathā vasena pavattam jaya purekkhāro
translated: Showing that, he said: “Yours” and so on. Occurring as talk that causes distraction: occurring by way of talk that causes distraction.

original: hutvāti attano jayaṃ purakkhatvā. Yaṃ kiñci na bhāsatīti yojanā. “Mantā”ti vuccati
analyzed: hutvā iti attanaḥ jayam purakkhatvā yam kiñci na bhāsati iti yojanā mantā ati vuccati
translated: Having made victory the forerunner: having made his own victory the forerunner. The construction is: he does not say anything at all.🔽“Counsels” is said

original: paññā, mantanaṃ jānananti katvā. “Mantā”ti idaṃ “mantetvā”ti iminā samānatthaṃ nipātapadanti
analyzed: paññā mantanam jānananti katvā mantā ati idam mantetvā ati iminā samāna attham nipāta padanti
translated: “Ponderings” is a noun formed from the verb “to ponder” (mantetvā).🔽“Having pondered” is the same in meaning as “having pondered.”🔽“Having investigated” is said.

original: āha “upaparikkhitvā”ti. Yuttakathamevāti attano, suṇantassa ca yuttarūpameva kathaṃ.🔽Hadaye nidahitabbayuttanti atthasampattiyā, byañjanasampattiyā atthavedādipaṭilābhanimittattā
analyzed: āha upaparikkhitvā iti yutta katham eva ati attanaḥ suṇantassa ca yutta rūpam eva katham  hadaye attha sampattiyā byañjana sampattiyā attha veda ādi paṭilābha nimitta ttā
translated: “In a fitting way” means in a way that is suitable for oneself and for the listener.🔽“To be placed in the heart” means to be placed in the mind, because it is the cause for the attainment of the knowledge of the meaning, etc., through the perfection of the meaning and the perfection of the phrasing.

original: citte ṭhapetabbaṃ, vimuttāyatanabhāvena manasi kātabbanti attho. Sabbaṅgasampannāpi
analyzed: citte ṭhapetabbam vimutta āyatana bhāvena manasi kātabbanti attho sabba aṅga sampannā api
translated: The meaning is that it should be attended to as a field of liberation.🔽Even speech that is perfect in all its aspects, if spoken at the wrong time, is as if it had not been spoken.

original: vācā akāle bhāsitā abhājane bhāsitā viya na atthāvahāti āha “yuttapattakālenā”ti.
analyzed: vācā akāle bhāsitā abhājane bhāsitā viya na attha āvahā ati āha yutta patta kālena ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “at the right time, in a fitting way.”

original: Ayañca caturaṅgasamannāgatā subhāsitavācā saccasambodhāvahāditāya sattānaṃ mahiddhikā
analyzed: ayam ca catur aṅga samannāgatā su bhāsita vācā sacca sambodhā vaha āditāya sattānam mahiddhikā
translated: And this speech that is well spoken and endowed with the four factors, because it is the cause for the attainment of the enlightenment of truth, etc., is of great power🔽and of great benefit for beings.

original: mahānisaṃsāti dassetuṃ “evaṃ bhāsitā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: mahā nisaṃsā ti dassetum evam bhāsitā hi itiādi vuttam
translated: In order to show this, it is said: “For when such speech is spoken,” etc.

original: Sīlācāreti sīle ca ācāre ca parisuddhasīle ceva parisuddhamanosamācāre ca. Ṭhitoti
analyzed: sīla ācāra iti sīle ca ācāre ca parisuddha sīle ca iva parisuddha manaḥ samācāre ca
translated: “In virtue and conduct”: in virtue and in conduct. One who is perfect in virtue and perfect in mental conduct.

original: patiṭṭhahanto. Saccaṃ etassa atthīti saccoti āha “saccakatho”ti. Esa nayo saddhoti🔽etthāpi. Tenāha “saddhāsampanno”ti. “Nanu ca heṭṭhā saccaṃ kathitamevā”ti kasmā vuttaṃ?
analyzed: patiṭṭhahantaḥ saccam etassa atthi iti saccaḥ ti āha saccakathā iti esa nayo saddho ti  ettha api tena āha saddhā sampannaḥ iti nanu ca heṭṭhā saccam kathitam evā ati kasmai vuttam

original: Heṭṭhā hi vacīsamācāraṃ kathentena saccaṃ kathitaṃ, paṭipakkhapaṭikkhepavasena idha🔽sīlaṃ kathentena taṃ paripuṇṇaṃ katvā dassetuṃ saccaṃ sarūpeneva kathitaṃ. “Puggalādhiṭṭhānāya🔽kathāya ārabbhantarañcetaṃ, tathāpi saccaṃ vatvā anantarameva saccassa kathanaṃ punaruttaṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhā hi vacī samācāram kathentena saccam kathitam paṭipakkha paṭikkhepa vasena idha  sīlam kathentena tam paripuṇṇam katvā dassetum saccam sarūpena iva kathitam puggala adhiṭṭhānāya  kathāyaḥ tathā api saccam vatvā anantaram eva saccassa kathanam punar uttam
translated: and he is established in it. He has truth, thus he is truthful. He has faith, thus he is faithful. “But was not truth already mentioned above? ”—Yes, but it was mentioned there in the sense of verbal conduct. Here it is mentioned in the sense of virtue, making it complete by the exclusion of its opposite.

original: hotīti parassa codanāvasaro mā hotū”ti tattha parihāraṃ dātukāmo “idha kasmā puna
analyzed: hoti iti parassa codanā avasaraḥ mā hotu uti tattha parihāram dātu kāmaḥ idha kasmai puna
translated: This is a question based on a person’s statement. Still, since the mention of truth is immediately followed by the mention of virtue, it is as if the latter were a repetition of the former. Therefore, in order to avoid giving the other an opportunity to criticize, he asks, “Why is it mentioned again here? ”

original: vutta”nti āha. Heṭṭhā vācāsaccaṃ kathitaṃ caturaṅgasamannāgataṃ subhāsitavācaṃ dassentena.
analyzed: vuttam ti āha heṭṭhā vācā asaccam kathitam catur aṅga samannāgatam su bhāsita vācam dassentena
translated: Or else, the truth of speech mentioned above was in the sense of speech that is well-spoken and endowed with four factors.

original: Antamaso…pe… dassetuṃ idha vuttaṃ “evaṃ sīlaṃ suparisuddhaṃ hotī”ti. Imasmiṃ panatthe
analyzed: dassetum idha vuttam evam sīlam su parisuddham hoti iti imasmin pana atthe
translated: Here it is mentioned in order to show that virtue is well purified.

original: “evaṃ parittakaṃ kho, rāhula, tesaṃ sāmaññaṃ, yesaṃ natthi sampajānamusāvāde lajjā”tiādi
analyzed: evam parittakam kho rāhula tesam sāmaññam yesam na atthi sampajāna musāvāde lajjā atiādi
translated: “Rāhula, the life of those who are shameless about consciously lying is not even worth that” .

original: nayappavattaṃ rāhulovādasuttaṃ dassetabbaṃ.
analyzed: naya ppavattam rāhulovāda suttam dassetabbam
translated: The Rāhula Sutta should be quoted in detail.

original: Guttā satikavāṭena pidahitā dvārā etenāti guttadvāroti āha “chasu indriyesū”tiādi.
analyzed: guttā sati kavāṭena pidahitā dvārā etena ati guttadvārā iti āha chasu indriyesu itiādi
translated: “The doors are guarded by the enclosure of mindfulness” : the doors are guarded by this, thus it is “having guarded the doors of the sense faculties” .

original: Pariyesanapaṭiggaṇhanaparibhogavissajjanavasena bhojane mattaṃ jānātīti bhojane mattaññū.
analyzed: pariyesana paṭiggaṇhana paribhoga vissajjana vasena bhojane mattam jānāti iti bhojane mattaññū
translated: He knows the right amount in eating: he knows the right amount in seeking out, accepting, consuming, and expending food.

original: Samanti avisamaṃ. Samacāritā hi kāyavisamādīni pahāya kāyasamādipūraṇaṃ. Nisajjāyāti
analyzed: samanti avisamam sama cāritāḥ hi kāya visama ādīni pahāya kāya sama ādi pūraṇam
translated: Even: not uneven. For even conduct is the fulfilling of evenness of body, etc., after abandoning unevenness of body, etc.🔽As to sitting:

original: ettha iti-saddo ādiattho, tena “āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhetī”ti evamādiṃ
analyzed: ettha iti saddo ādi attho tena āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodheti iti evamādim
translated: here the word iti has the meaning of “etc.,” thus it includes what is said in the passage beginning, “He purifies his mind from obstacles” .

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Bhāvanāya cittaparisodhanañhi jāgariyānuyogo, na niddāvinodanamattaṃ.
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti bhāvanāya citta parisodhanam hi jāgariya anuyogaḥ na niddā vinodana mattam
translated: For the purification of the mind by development is the practice of wakefulness, not merely the avoidance of sleep.

original: Nittandīti vigatathinamiddho. Sā pana nittanditā kāyālasiyavigamane pākaṭā hotīti
analyzed: nittandī iti vigata thinamiddhaḥ sā pana nittanditā kāya alasiya vigamane pākaṭā hoti iti
translated: Free from drowsiness: free from sluggishness and torpor. But this freedom from drowsiness becomes evident in the abandoning of bodily lassitude.

original: vuttaṃ “kāyālasiyavirahito”ti. “Āraddhavīriyo”ti iminā duvidhopi vīriyārambho gahitoti🔽taṃ vibhajitvā dassetuṃ “kāyikavīriyenāpī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Saṅgamma gaṇavihāro sahavāso
analyzed: vuttam kāya alasiya virahito ti āraddha vīriyo ti iminā duvidhaḥ api vīriya ārambhaḥ gahito ti  tam vibhajitvā dassetum kāyika vīriyena api itiādi vuttam saṅgamma gaṇa vihāro sahavāso
translated: To show that, it is said, “With bodily energy” and so on.🔽“Association with a group” is living together in a community.

original: saṅgaṇikā, sā pana kilesehipi evaṃ hotīti tato visesetuṃ “gaṇasaṅgaṇika”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saṅgaṇikā sā pana kilesehi pi evam hoti iti tatas visesetum gaṇa saṅgaṇikam ti vuttam
translated: But that is also due to defilements, so to distinguish it, “association with a group” is said.🔽Association with a group is association with a community.

original: Gaṇena saṅgaṇikaṃ gaṇasaṅgaṇikanti. Ārambhavatthuvasenāti anadhigatavisesādhigamakāraṇavasena
analyzed: gaṇena saṅgaṇikam gaṇa saṅgaṇikam ti ārambha vatthu vasena ati anadhigata visesa adhigama kāraṇa vasena
translated: “As a basis for exertion” means as a cause for attaining a special quality not yet attained.🔽“He is a solitary dweller” means not only by way of unity but also by way of the other two kinds of solitude.

original: ekavihārī, na kevalaṃ ekībhāvavasena. Kilesasaṅgaṇikanti kilesasahitacittataṃ. Yathā
analyzed: ekavihārī na kevalam ekībhāva vasena yathā
translated: “Association with defilements” is the association of the mind with defilements.🔽“In whatever way” means by way of insight or by way of reflection.

original: tathāti vipassanāvasena, paṭisaṅkhānavasena vā. Samathavasena ārammaṇūpanijjhānaṃ.
analyzed: tathā ti vipassanā vasena paṭisaṅkhāna vasena vā samatha vasena ārammaṇa upanijjhānam
translated: By way of serenity it is the reflection on the object.

original: Vipassanāvasena lakkhaṇūpanijjhānaṃ.
analyzed: vipassanā vasena lakkhaṇa upanijjhānam
translated: By way of insight it is the reflection on the characteristics.

original: Kalyāṇapaṭibhānoti sundarapaṭibhāno, sā panassa paṭibhānasampadā vacanacāturiyasahitāva
analyzed: kalyāṇa paṭibhāno ti sundara paṭibhāno sā panassa paṭibhāna sampadā vacana cāturiya sahitā ava
translated: “He has a pleasant manner of speaking” means he has a beautiful manner of speaking. But his excellence in manner of speaking is accompanied by skill in speech.

original: icchitāti āha “vākkaraṇa…pe… sampanno cā”ti. “Paṭibhāna”nti hi ñāṇampi vuccati ñāṇassa
analyzed: icchitā iti āha sampannaḥ ca iti paṭibhānam ti hi ñāṇam pi vuccati ñāṇassa
translated: He is called “one who has the ability to speak” when he is endowed with the ability to speak.🔽“Ability to speak” is also called “knowledge” and also “the expression of knowledge.”

original: upaṭṭhitavacanampi. Tattha atthayuttaṃ kāraṇayuttaṃ paṭibhānamassāti yuttapaṭibhāno.
analyzed: upaṭṭhita vacanam pi tattha attha yuttam kāraṇa yuttam paṭibhānam assa ati yutta paṭibhānaḥ
translated: Herein, he is one who has the ability to speak when he has the ability to speak appropriately, with reasons.

original: Pucchitānantarameva sīghaṃ byākātuṃ asamatthatāya no muttapaṭibhānaṃ assāti no muttapaṭibhāno.🔽Idha pana vikiṇṇavāco muttapaṭibhāno adhippetoti adhippāyena “sīlasamācārasmiñhi
analyzed: pucchita anantaram eva sīgham byākātum asamattha tāya no mutta paṭibhānam assa ati no mutta paṭibhānaḥ  idha pana vikiṇṇa vācaḥ mutta paṭibhānaḥ adhippetaḥ ti adhippāyena sīla samācārasmin hi
translated: He is one who does not have the ability to speak when he is not able to answer immediately after being asked.

original: ṭhitabhikkhu muttapaṭibhāno na hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Gamanasamatthāyāti assutaṃ dhammaṃ🔽gametuṃ samatthāya. Dhāraṇasamatthāyāti sātisayaṃ sativīriyasahitatāya yathāsutaṃ
analyzed: ṭhita bhikkhu mutta paṭibhānaḥ na hoti iti vuttam gamana samatthāya ati assutam dhammaṃ  gametum samatthāya dhāraṇa samatthāya ati sa atisayam sati vīriya sahita tāya yathāsutam
translated: But here the one who speaks incoherently and does not have the ability to speak is intended. Therefore, with reference to him, it is said: “A bhikkhu who is established in virtue and good conduct does not have the ability to speak.”🔽For the purpose of going to what has not been heard: for the purpose of going to the Dhamma that has not been heard.

original: yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ dhāretuṃ samatthāya. Munanato anuminanato mutīti anumāna
analyzed: yathā pariyattam dhammam dhāretum samatthāya
translated: For the purpose of retaining: for the purpose of retaining the Dhamma as heard and as learned through the combination of mindfulness and energy.🔽Inference is a name for inferential knowledge.

original: paññāya nāmaṃ. Tīhi padehīti “gatimā dhitimā mutimā”ti tīhi padehi. Heṭṭhāti heṭṭhā
analyzed: paññāya nāmam tīhi padehi iti gatimā dhitimā mutimā ati tīhi padehi heṭṭhā ati heṭṭhā
translated: With the three terms: with the three terms “one who has gone,” “one who has stood,” and “one who has had enough.”🔽Below:

original: “āraddhavīriyo”ti vuttaṭṭhāne. Idhāti “dhitimā”ti vuttaṭṭhāne. Vīriyampi heṭṭhā guṇabhūtaṃ🔽gahitanti vuttovāyamattho. Heṭṭhāti “jāgariyānuyogamanuyutto, jhāyī”ti ettha vipassanāpaññā
analyzed: āraddha vīriyo ti vutta ṭṭhāne idha ati dhitimā ati vutta ṭṭhāne vīriyam pi heṭṭhā guṇa bhūtam  gahitanti vuttaḥ uva ayam atthaḥ heṭṭhā ti jāgariya anuyogam anuyuttaḥ jhāyī iti ettha vipassanā paññā
translated: in the place where it is said “energetic” . Here in the place where it is said “possessed of mindfulness” . For energy is also included as a quality below,🔽and so this meaning is stated. Below in the place where it is said “he is devoted to wakefulness, he is a meditator” ,

original: kathitā. Idhāti “dhitimā mutimā”ti ettha buddhavacanagaṇhanapaññā kathitā karaṇapubbāparakosallapaññādīpanato.
analyzed: kathitā idha ati dhitimā mutimā ti ettha buddha vacana gaṇhana paññā kathitā karaṇa pubba apara kosalla paññā dīpanato
translated: insight wisdom is stated. Here in the place where it is said “possessed of mindfulness, possessed of wisdom” , wisdom consisting in the retention of the word of the Buddha is stated, because it illustrates skill in the prior and subsequent order of the teaching.

original: Kilesakāmopi vatthukāmo viya yathāpavatto assādīyatīti vuttaṃ “vatthukāmakilesakāmesu agiddho”ti.
analyzed: kilesa kāmaḥ api vatthu kāmaḥ viya yathā pavattaḥ assādīyati iti vuttam vatthu kāma kilesa kāmesu agiddhaḥ ti
translated: And just as the object of sense desire is relished as it occurs, so too sense desire as defilement is relished. Hence it is said: “not greedy for objects of sense desire or for the sense desires as defilement” .

original: Anusāsanavidhādesanādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: anusāsana vidhā desanā ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the method of instruction, etc.🔽By his own means of attention: by the attention arisen in himself, by the attention of development.

original: 154. Attano upāyamanasikārenāti attani sambhūtena pathamanasikārena bhāvanāmanasikārena. Paṭipajjamānoti visuddhiṃ paṭipajjamāno.
analyzed: attanaḥ upāya manasikārena ati attani sambhūtena patha manasikārena bhāvanā manasikārena paṭipajjamānaḥ iti visuddhim paṭipajjamānaḥ
translated: Practising: practising purification.

original: 155. Kilesavimuttiñāṇeti kilesappahānajānane.🔽156. Pariyādiyamānoti paricchijja gaṇhantoti attho. Suddhakkhandheyeva anussarati
analyzed: kilesa vimutti ñāṇe iti kilesa ppahāna jānane 🔽pariyādiyamānaḥ iti paricchijja gaṇhanto ti attho suddha kkhandhe iya iva anussarati
translated: Knowledge of the deliverance from the defilements: knowledge of the abandoning of the defilements.🔽Comprehending: the meaning is, discerning by defining.

original: nāmagottaṃ pariyādiyituṃ asakkonto. Vuttamevatthaṃ vivarituṃ “eko hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nāma gottam a sakkontaḥ vuttam eva attham vivaritum ekaḥ hi itiādi vuttam
translated: unable to recollect his name and race. The rest is said to explain that.

original: Sakkoti pariyādiyituṃ. Asakkontassa vasena gahitaṃ, “amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo”tiādi vuttanti
analyzed: sakkoti pariyādiyitum a sakkontassa vasena gahitam amutra asim evaṃnāmā itiādi vuttanti
translated: he is able to recollect. The meaning is that it is stated in the way it is because of one who is unable to recollect.

original: attho. Asakkontassāti ca ārohane asakkontassa, orohane pana ñāṇassa thirabhūtattā.
analyzed: atthaḥ a sakkontassa ati ca ārohane a sakkontassa orohane pana ñāṇassa thira bhūta ttā
translated: And by “unable to recollect” is meant unable to recollect by way of the ascending order; for the knowledge of the descending order is firm.

original: Tenāha “suddhakkhandheyeva anussaranto”tiādi. Etanti pubbāparavirodhaṃ. Na sallakkhesi
analyzed: tena āha suddha kkhandheya iva anussarantaḥ tiādi etat ti pubba apara virodham na sallakkhesi
translated: Hence it is said, “recollecting only the pure aggregates.” The rest is as stated above.🔽He does not consider the contradiction of the former and latter statements.

original: diṭṭhābhinivesena kuṇṭhañāṇattā. Tenāha “diṭṭhigatikattā”ti. Ṭhānanti ekasmiṃ pakkhe
analyzed: diṭṭha abhinivesena kuṇṭha ñāṇa ttā tena āha diṭṭhigatika ttā ti ṭhānam ti ekasmin pakkhe
translated: because his knowledge is defective through attachment to his view. Hence it is said, “because he is a theorist.”🔽A position is a fixed opinion.

original: avaṭṭhānaṃ. Niyamoti vādaniyamo paṭiniyatavādatā. Tenāha “imaṃ gahetvā”tiādi.🔽157. Piṇḍagaṇanāyāti “ekaṃ dve”tiādinā agaṇetvā saṅkalanapaduppādanādinā piṇḍanavasena
analyzed: avaṭṭhānam niyamo ti vāda niyamo paṭiniyata vāda tā tena āha imam gahetvā atiādi  piṇḍa gaṇanāya ati ekam dve iti ādinā a gaṇetvā saṅkalana pad uppādana ādinā piṇḍana vasena
translated: A rule is a fixed statement. Hence it is said, “having taken up this position.”🔽By counting them as a mass: without counting them one by one, “one, two,” etc., by counting them as a mass by way of the production of a general concept through the combination of the aggregates.

original: gaṇanāya. Acchiddakavasenāti avicchindakagaṇanāvasena gaṇanā kamagaṇanaṃ muñcitvā
analyzed: gaṇanāya acchiddaka vasena ati avicchindaka gaṇanā vasena gaṇanā kama gaṇanam muñcitvā
translated: By way of unbroken continuity: without omitting any, without skipping over any.

original: “imasmiṃ rukkhe ettakāni paṇṇānī”ti vā “imasmiṃ jalāsaye ettakāni udakāḷhakānī”ti
analyzed: imasmin rukkhe ettakāni paṇṇāni iti vā imasmin jalāsaye ettakāni udaka āḷhakāni iti
translated: “There are so many leaves in this tree,” or “There are so many water-drops in this puddle,”

original: vā evaṃ gaṇetabbassa ekajjhampi piṇḍetvā gaṇanā. Kamagaṇanā hi antarantarā vicchijja🔽pavattiyā pacchindikā. Sā panesā gaṇanā savanantaraṃ anapekkhitvā manasāva gaṇetabbato
analyzed: vā evam gaṇetabbassa ekajjham pi piṇḍetvā gaṇanā kama gaṇanā hi antar antarā vicchijja  pavattiyā pacchindikā sā pana isā gaṇanā savanantaram an apekkhitvā manasā ava gaṇetabbato
translated: counting is the combining of what can be counted into one or more groups. For the counting of sexual intercourse is interrupted by the intervals between the acts.🔽But this counting is called “mental counting” because it can be done mentally without regard to the order of hearing.

original: “manogaṇanā”tipi vuccatīti āha “manogaṇanāyā”ti. Piṇḍagaṇanameva dasseti, na vibhāgagaṇanaṃ.
analyzed: manaḥ gaṇanā ati pi vuccati iti āha manaḥ gaṇanāya iti piṇḍa gaṇanam eva dasseti na vibhāga gaṇanam
translated: The Elder shows only the counting of groups, not the counting of divisions.

original: Saṅkhātuṃ na sakkā aññehi asaṅkhyeyyābhāvato. Paññāpāramiyā pūritabhāvaṃ dassento
analyzed: saṅkhātum na sakkā aññehi asaṅkhyeyya abhāvato paññāpāramiyā pūrita bhāvam dassento
translated: It cannot be counted by others because it is beyond counting. Showing the state of fulfillment of the perfection of wisdom,

original: itarāsaṃ pūraṇena vinā tassā pūraṇaṃ natthīti “dasannaṃ pāramīnaṃ pūritattā”ti āha.
analyzed: itarāsam pūraṇena vinā tassā pūraṇam natthi iti āha
translated: he says, “because the ten perfections were fulfilled,” since there is no fulfillment of that without the fulfillment of the others.🔽Therefore he says, “because the knowledge of omniscience was well penetrated.”

original: Tenāha “sabbaññutaññāṇassa suppaṭividdhattā”ti. Ettakanti dassethāti dīpeti thero.
analyzed: tena āha sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa suppaṭividdha ttā ati ettakam ti dassetha ati dīpeti theraḥ
translated: The Elder shows that “so much” is shown.

original: Yaṃ pana pāḷiyaṃ “sākāraṃ sauddesaṃ anussaratī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ tassa anussaraṇamattaṃ
analyzed: yam pana pāḷiyam sa ākāram sa uddesam anussarati iti vuttam tam tassa anussaraṇa mattam
translated: But what is said in the text, “he recollects the Dhamma as he has heard it,” is merely his recollection of the Dhamma as it is taught in the scriptures.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ, na āyuno vassādigaṇanāya paricchindanaṃ tassa avisayabhāvato.🔽158. Tumhākaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ yeva anuttarā anaññasādhāraṇattā. Idāni tassā desanāya
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam na āyunaḥ vassa ādi gaṇanāya paricchindanam tassa a visaya bhāvato  tumhākam sammāsambuddhānam yā iva anuttarā an añña sādhāraṇa ttā idāni tassā desanāya
translated: and the word “life” is used figuratively, not in the sense of a span of years, because that is not the province of the Buddhas.

original: majjhe bhinnasuvaṇṇassa viya vibhāgābhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “atītabuddhāpī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: majjhe bhinna suvaṇṇassa viya vibhāga abhāvam dassetum atīta buddhā api iti ādi vuttam
translated: “The Buddhas’ is the Buddhas’ alone, not shared by others. Now, in order to show that there is no division in the teaching of the Buddhas, as there is in the case of divided gold, the text says, “The Buddhas of the past, too” .

original: Imināpi kāraṇenāti anuttarabhāvena, aññehi buddhehi ekasadisabhāvena ca.
analyzed: iminā api kāraṇena ati anuttara bhāvena aññehi buddhehi eka sadisa bhāvena ca
translated: “For this reason” : because of its unsurpassedness, and because it is the same for all other Buddhas.🔽“With cankers” : they are with cankers in the sense of being their object. “With fetters” : they are with fetters in the sense of being clung to by them.

original: 159. Āsavānaṃ ārammaṇabhāvūpagamanena sāsavā. Upecca ādhīyantīti upādhī, dosāropanāni,
analyzed: āsavānaṃ ārammaṇa bhāva upagamanena sa āsavāḥ upecca ādhīyanti iti upādhī dosa āropanāni
translated: “With taints” : they are with taints in the sense of being associated with them. “With obsessions” : they are with obsessions in the sense of being clung to by them.🔽“With conflict” : for the unwholesome is called “with conflict” because it is the basis for the conflict of vexation, etc., and because it is the basis for the conflict of the defilements.

original: saha upādhīhīti saupādhikā. Anariyiddhiyañhi attano cittadosena ekacce upārambhaṃ🔽dadanti, svāyamattho kevaṭṭasuttena dīpetabbo. No “ariyā”ti vuccati sāsavabhāvato.
analyzed: saha upādhīhi iti saupādhikāḥ  dadanti svāyam atthaḥ kevaṭṭa suttena dīpetabbo no ariyā ti vuccati sa āsava bhāvato
translated: “Without conflict” : the wholesome is called “without conflict” because it is the opposite of the above.

original: Niddosehi khīṇāsavehi pavattetabbato niddosā dosehi saha appavattanato. Tato eva
analyzed: niddosehi khīṇāsavehi pavattetabbataḥ niddosāḥ dosehi saha a pavattanataḥ tatas eva
translated: “With effluents” : they are with effluents in the sense of being their object. “With fetters” : they are with fetters in the sense of being clung to by them.🔽“With taints” : they are with taints in the sense of being associated with them. “With obsessions” : they are with obsessions in the sense of being clung to by them.🔽“With conflict” : for the unwholesome is called “with conflict” because it is the basis for the conflict of vexation, etc., and because it is the basis for the conflict of the defilements.

original: anupārambhā. Ariyānaṃ iddhīti ariyiddhīti vuccati.
analyzed: an upārambhā ariyānam iddhi iti ariyiddhi iti vuccati
translated: “Without conflict” : the wholesome is called “without conflict” because it is the opposite of the above.

original: Appaṭikkūlasaññīti iṭṭhasaññī iṭṭhākārena pavattacitto. Paṭikkūleti amanuññe aniṭṭhe.
analyzed: appaṭikkūla saññī iti iṭṭha saññī iṭṭha ākārena pavatta citto paṭikkūle ti amanuññe aniṭṭhe
translated: He does not see what is unrepulsive: he sees what is agreeable, his mind being occupied with what is agreeable. What is repulsive: what is not allowed, what is disagreeable.🔽Perception of elements: perception of the elements. He directs: he applies, he adverts.🔽To a repulsive object:

original: Dhātusaññanti “dhātuyo”ti saññaṃ. Upasaṃharatīti upaneti pavatteti. Aniṭṭhasmiṃ vatthusminti🔽aniṭṭhe sattasaññite ārammaṇe. Mettāya vā pharatīti mettaṃ hitesitaṃ upasaṃharanto
analyzed: dhātu saññam ti dhātuyo ti saññam upasaṃharati iti upaneti pavatteti aniṭṭhasmim vatthusmin ti  aniṭṭhe satta saññite ārammaṇe mettāya vā pharati iti mettam hita īsitam upasaṃharantaḥ
translated: to a repulsive object consisting of a living being. He radiates: he directs, he applies.🔽Mettā: loving-kindness. Everywhere: in all places. He radiates it: he radiates it there.🔽From the elements: from the elements, by reviewing. He directs: he applies, he adverts.

original: sabbatthakameva taṃ tattha pharati. Dhātuto vā upasaṃharatīti dhammasabhāvacintanena🔽dhātuso, paccavekkhaṇāya dhātumanasikāraṃ vā tattha pavatteti. Appaṭikkūle satte🔽ñātimittādike yāthāvato dhammasabhāvacintanena aniccasaññāya visabhāgabhūte “kesādi🔽asucikoṭṭhāsamevā”ti asubhasaññaṃ pharati asubhamanasikāraṃ pavatteti. Chaḷaṅgupekkhāyāti
analyzed: sabbatthakam eva tam tattha pharati dhātutaḥ vā upasaṃharati iti dhamma sabhāva cintanena  paccavekkhaṇāya dhātu manasikāram vā tattha pavatteti a paṭikkūle satte  ñāti mitta ādike yāthāvataḥ dhamma sabhāva cintanena anicca saññāya visabhāga bhūte kesa ādi  asuci koṭṭhāsam eva ati asubha saññam pharati asubha manasikāram pavatteti chaḍḍaṅga upekkhāya ati
translated: To a repulsive object:🔽to a relative, a friend, etc., who is not in accordance with the contemplation of impermanence, etc., by the contemplation of the true nature of things, he radiates the perception of foulness, which is the opposite of the perception of beauty, by means of the perception of the foulness of the parts of the body, “This is a mere collection of bones smeared with …” . He directs: he applies, he adverts.

original: iṭṭhāniṭṭhachaḷārammaṇāpāthe parisuddhapakatibhāvāvijahanalakkhaṇāya chasu dvāresu
analyzed: iṭṭha aniṭṭha chaṭ ārammaṇa āpāthe parisuddha pakati bhāva avijahana lakkhaṇāya chasu dvāresu
translated: The six kinds of equanimity: equanimity that is purified of the six directions, that is, of the six kinds of objects consisting of the six pairs of relatives, etc., which are agreeable and disagreeable, and that is characterized by non-abandonment of natural reaction.

original: pavattanato “chaḷaṅgupekkhāyā”ti laddhanāmāya tatramajjhattupekkhāya.
analyzed: pavattanataḥ chaḷaṅgu pekkhāya ati laddha nāmāya tatram ajjhattupekkhāya
translated: and by occurrence it is called “equanimity about the six sense doors” .

original: Taṃ desananti taṃ dvīsu iddhividhāsu desanappakāraṃ desanāvidhiṃ. Asesaṃ sakalanti
analyzed: tam desananti tam dvīsu iddhi vidhāsu desana ppakāram desanā vidhim asesam sakalanti
translated: The teaching: the teaching method, the way of teaching, in the two kinds of direct-knowledge. He knows all, without exception, completely,

original: asesaṃ niravasesaṃ sampuṇṇaṃ abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena jānāti. Asesaṃ abhijānato tato🔽uttari abhiññeyyaṃ natthi. Itoti bhagavato abhiññātato. Añño paramatthavasena dhammo
analyzed: asesam niravasesam sampuṇṇam abhivisiṭṭhena ñāṇena jānāti asesam abhijānataḥ tatas  uttari abhiññeyyam na atthi itas ti bhagavataḥ abhiññātataḥ aññaḥ paramattha vasena dhammo
translated: by means of his special knowledge. Since he knows all without exception,🔽there is nothing further to be directly known. From this,🔽from the Blessed One’s direct knowledge, there is no other thing, either in the ultimate sense or in the conventional sense, that the Blessed One does not know.

original: vā paññattivasena puggalo vā ayaṃ nāma yaṃ bhagavā na jānātīti idaṃ natthi na upalabbhati
analyzed: vā paññatti vasena puggalaḥ vā ayam nāma yam bhagavā na jānāti iti idam natthi na upalabbhati
translated: This is not so, it is not found.🔽Because you have all directly known it completely and in every way.

original: sabbasseva sammadeva tumhehi abhiññātattā. Dvīsu iddhividhāsu abhijānane, desanāyañca
analyzed: sabbassa iva sammat eva tumhehi abhiññāta ttā dvīsu iddhi vidhāsu abhijānane desanāyan ca
translated: In the two kinds of direct-knowledge and in the teaching,🔽there is nothing higher than the Blessed One.

original: bhagavato uttaritaro natthi. Imināpīti pi-saddo na kevalaṃ vuttatthasamuccayattho,
analyzed: bhagavataḥ uttaritaraḥ natthi iminā api iti pi saddaḥ na kevalam vutta ttha samuccaya tthaḥ
translated: The word “too” in the words “He knows all, without exception, completely, too” does not only mean “and also”;

original: atha kho avuttatthasamuccayatthopi daṭṭhabbo. Yaṃ taṃ bhantetiādināpi hi bhagavato
analyzed: atha kho a vutta ttha samuccaya tthaḥ api daṭṭhabbaḥ yam tam bhanta iti ādinā api hi bhagavataḥ
translated: it should be regarded as meaning “as well as.” For by the words “What, venerable sir, is the Blessed One’s direct knowledge? What is the Blessed One’s seeing? ”

original: guṇadassanaṃ tasseva pasādassa kāraṇavibhāvanaṃ.
analyzed: guṇa dassanam tassa iva pasādassa kāraṇa vibhāvanam
translated: The seeing of the special qualities is the exposition of the cause of that confidence.

original: Aññathāsatthuguṇadassanādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the seeing of the special qualities of the Master in another way

original: 160. Pubbe “etadānuttariyaṃ bhante”tiādinā yathāvuttabuddhaguṇā dassitā, tato añño
analyzed: pubbe etat ānuttariyam bhante ti ādinā yathā vutta buddha guṇā dassitā tatas aññaḥ
translated: . The special qualities of the Buddha mentioned above in the passage beginning, “This is the unsurpassed teaching of the truth” , are shown in another way

original: evāyaṃ pakāro “yaṃ taṃ bhante”tiādinā āraddhoti āha “aparenāpi ākārenā”ti. Buddhānaṃ
analyzed: eva ayam pakāraḥ yam tam bhanta iti ādinā āraddhā uti āha aparena api ākārena ati
translated: beginning with the words, “What, venerable sir, is that other way?”

original: sammāsambodhiyā saddahanato visesato saddhā kulaputtā nāma bodhisattā, mahābodhisattāti
analyzed: sammāsambodhiyā saddahanataḥ visesataḥ saddhā kulaputtāḥ nāma bodhisattāḥ mahā bodhisattā ati
translated: The sons of good family who have confidence in the perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas are called bodhisattvas, great bodhisattvas,

original: adhippāyo. Te hi mahābhinīhārato paṭṭhāya mahābodhiyaṃ sattā āsattā laggā niyatabhāvūpagamanena
analyzed: adhippāyo te hi mahā abhinīhārato paṭṭhāya mahābodhiyam sattāḥ āsattāḥ laggāḥ niyata bhāva upagamanena
translated: with the intention that they are beings who are attached to, who are bound to, the great enlightenment by the necessity of reaching it.

original: kenaci asaṃhāriyabhāvato. Yato nesaṃ na kathañci tattha saddhāya aññathattaṃ hoti,
analyzed: kenaci asaṃhāriya bhāvataḥ yatas na īsam na kathañci tattha saddhāya aññathattam hoti
translated: For they are not to be led away from it by anyone in any way.

original: eteneva tesaṃ kammaphalaṃ saddhāyapi aññathattābhāvo dīpito daṭṭhabbo. Tasmāti yasmā
analyzed: etena iva tesam kamma phalam saddhāya api aññathattā bhāvaḥ dīpitaḥ daṭṭhabbo tasmā iti yasmā
translated: By this it is shown and should be understood that the fruit of their action is not otherwise for them because of their confidence.🔽Therefore, since they are desirous of the special qualities of the Buddhas,

original: atisayavacanicchāvasena, “anuppattaṃ taṃ bhagavatā”ti saddantarasannidhānena ca visiṭṭhavisayaṃ
analyzed: atisaya vacana icchā vasena anuppattam tam bhagavatā ati ca visiṭṭha visayam
translated: and since they are distinguished by the presence of a special kind of confidence, namely, “That has been attained by the Blessed One,”

original: “saddhena kulaputtenā”ti idaṃ padaṃ, tasmā. Lokuttaradhammasamadhigamamūlakattā sabbabuddhaguṇasamadhigamassa
analyzed: saddhena kula puttena ati idam padam tasmai lokuttara dhamma samadhigama mūlaka ttā sabba buddha guṇa samadhigamassa
translated: Therefore, since the acquisition of all the qualities of a Buddha is rooted in the acquisition of the supramundane Dhamma,🔽it is said that “the nine supramundane states” are the object of the aspiration.

original: “nava lokuttaradhammā”ti vuttaṃ. “Āraddhavīriyenā”tiādīsu samāsapadesu “vīriyaṃ thāmo”tiādīni
analyzed: nava lokuttara dhammā ti vuttam āraddha vīriyena atiādīsu samāsa padesu vīriyam thāma uti ādīni
translated: In the compound “one who has aroused energy,” etc., the words “energy,” “steadfastness,” etc.,

original: avayavapadāni. Ādi-saddena parakkamapadaṃ saṅgaṇhāti, na dhorayhapadaṃ. Na hi taṃ🔽vīriyavevacanaṃ, atha kho vīriyavantavācakaṃ. Dhurāya niyuttoti hi dhorayho. Tenāha
analyzed: avayava padāni ādi saddena parakkama padam saṅgaṇhāti na dhorayha padam na hi tam  vīriya vevacanam atha kho vīriyavanta vācakam dhurāya hi tena āha
translated: are the component words. The word “etc.” includes the word “endeavor” but not the word “burden.”🔽For the latter is not a synonym of “energy” but rather a word denoting one who has energy.🔽One who is engaged in a burden is a “burden-bearer.” Therefore it is said that “by one who is a great man in the sense of being able to bear that burden.”

original: “taṃ dhuraṃ vahanasamatthena mahāpurisenā”ti. Paggahitavīriyenāti asithilavīriyena.
analyzed: tam dhuram vahana samatthena mahā purisena ati paggahita vīriyena ati asithila vīriyena
translated: “One who has undertaken energy” : one whose energy is not slack.🔽“One whose energy is steadfast” : one whose energy has attained steadfastness by the acquisition of the state of being unbending.

original: Thiravīriyenāti ussoḷhībhāvūpagamanena thirabhāvappattavīriyena. Asamadhurehīti anaññasādhāraṇadhurehi.
analyzed: thira vīriyena ati ussoḷhībhāva upagamanena thira bhāva ppatta vīriyena asama dhurehi iti anañña sādhāraṇa dhurehi
translated: “By one whose burden is unequalled” : by one whose burden is not shared by others.

original: Paresaṃ asayhasahanā hi lokanāthā. Taṃ sabbaṃ acinteyyāparimeyyabhedaṃ buddhānaṃ
analyzed: paresam a sayha sahanāḥ hi lokanāthā tam sabbam a cinteyya a parimeyya bhedam buddhānam
translated: For the Lords of the World cannot be borne by others. All this, which is classified as inconceivable and immeasurable, is the object of the aspiration of the Buddhas.

original: guṇajātaṃ. Pāramitā, buddhaguṇā, veneyyasattāti yasmā idaṃ tayaṃ sabbesampi buddhānaṃ
analyzed: guṇa jātam pāramitā buddha guṇāḥ veneyya sattā ati yasmai idam sabbesam pi buddhānam
translated: “The aggregate of states” : the perfections, the qualities of a Buddha, and the beings to be trained. Since this is the same for all Buddhas,

original: samānameva, tasmā āha “atītānāgata…pe… ūno natthī”ti.
analyzed: samānam eva tasmai āha atīta anāgata pe ūnaḥ natthi iti
translated: he says, “There is no deficiency in the qualities of the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.”

original: Kāmasukhallikānuyoganti kāmasukhe allīnā hutvā anuyuñjanaṃ. Ko jānāti paralokaṃ “atthī”ti,
analyzed: kāma sukhe hutvā anuyuñjanam kaḥ jānāti para lokam atthi iti
translated: “Addiction to sensual pleasure” : being attached to sensual pleasure and addicted to it. “Who knows whether there is a world beyond?”

original: ettha “ko ekavisayoyaṃ indriyagocaro”ti evaṃdiṭṭhi hutvāti adhippāyo. Sukhoti iṭṭho🔽sukhāvaho. Paribbājikāyāti tāpasaparibbājikāya taruṇiyā. Mudukāyāti sukhumālāya.
analyzed: ettha kaḥ eka visayaḥ yaṃ indriya gocaro ti evaṃdiṭṭhi hutvā ati adhippāyo sukho ti iṭṭho  sukha āvahaḥ paribbājikāya ati tāpasa paribbājikāya taruṇiyā mudukāya ati sukhu mālāya
translated: Here the intention is that he has the view, “Who knows whether this is the domain of the senses?”🔽“Pleasure” : desirable,🔽conducive to pleasure. “A young female wanderer” : a young female ascetic. “Tender” : delicate.

original: Lomasāyāti taruṇamudulomavatiyā. Moḷibandhāhīti moḷiṃ katvā bandhakesāhi. Paricārentīti
analyzed: lomasāya ati moḷim katvā bandha kesāhi paricārenti iti
translated: “Downy” : having soft down. “With plaited hair” : with hair plaited into a braid. “He attended on her”

original: attano pāricārikaṃ karonti, indriyāni vā tattha parito cārenti. Lāmakanti paṭikiliṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: attano pāricārikam karonti indriyāni vā tattha paritas cārenti lāmakanti paṭikiliṭṭham
translated: means he made her his attendant, or he diverted his senses there. “Filthy” : soiled.

original: Gāmavāsīnaṃ bālānaṃ dhammaṃ. Puthujjanānamidanti pothujjanikaṃ. Yathā pana taṃ “puthujjanānamida”nti
analyzed: gāmavāsīnam bālānam dhammam puthujjanānam idanti pothujjanikam yathā pana tam puthujjanānam idanti
translated: “The doctrine of the foolish village-dwellers” . “Of the ordinary person” : of the ordinary man. But “of the ordinary person” is also

original: vattabbataṃ labhati, taṃ dassetuṃ “puthujjanehi sevitabba”nti āha. Anariyehi sevitabbanti
analyzed: vattabba tam labhati tam dassetum puthujjanehi sevitabban ti āha anariyehi sevitabban ti
translated: He says ‘to be practised by ordinary men’ in order to show that it is to be spoken of as ‘to be practised by ordinary men’. ‘To be practised by the ignoble’:

original: vā anariyaṃ. Yasmā pana niddosattho ariyattho, tasmā “anariyanti na niddosa”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā anariyam yasmā pana niddosa attho ariya ttho tasmā anariyanti na vuttam
translated: it is ignoble because it is not noble. But since the meaning of ‘noble’ is ‘free from hate’, he says ‘The ignoble is not free from hate’.

original: Anatthasaṃyuttanti diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikādivividhavipulānatthasañhitaṃ. Attakilamathānuyoganti
analyzed: anattha saṃyuttam ti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika ādi vividha vipula anattha sañhitam atta kilamatha anuyogam ti
translated: ‘Connected with harm’: associated with various kinds of great harm, such as that pertaining to this present existence and that pertaining to the future. ‘The pursuit of self-mortification’:

original: attano kilamathassa khedanassa anuyuñjanaṃ. Dukkhaṃ etassa atthīti dukkhaṃ. Dukkhamanaṃ etassāti dukkhamaṃ.🔽Ābhicetasikānanti abhiceto vuccati abhikkantaṃ visuddhaṃ cittaṃ, adhicittaṃ vā, tasmiṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ kilamathassa khedanassa anuyuñjanam dukkham etassa atthi iti dukkham dukkhamanaṃ etassa ati dukkhamam  ābhicetasikānam ti abhicetaḥ vuccati abhikkantam visuddham cittam adhicittam vā tasmin
translated: the pursuit of self-mortification, of tormenting oneself. ‘Painful’: it has pain, or it is painful.

original: abhicetasi jātānīti ābhicetasikāni, abhicetosannissitāni vā. Diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānanti
analyzed: abhicetasi jātāni iti ābhicetasikāni abhicetas sannissitāni vā diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra ananti
translated: ‘Mental’: the word ‘mental’ is a synonym for ‘of the mind’ . ‘Arisen from the mind’: they are born in the mind, or they are dependent on the mind. ‘Delight in dwelling happily here and now’:

original: diṭṭhadhamme sukhavihārānaṃ, diṭṭhadhammo vuccati paccakkho attabhāvo, tattha sukhavihārabhūtānanti
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamme sukha vihārānam diṭṭhadhammo vuccati paccakkhaḥ atta bhāvo tattha sukha vihāra bhūtānam ti
translated: delight in dwelling happily in this very existence. ‘This very existence’ is one’s own visible state of being. ‘They are’: they exist.

original: attho, rūpāvacarajhānānametaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tāni hi appetvā nisinnā jhāyino imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: atthaḥ rūpāvacara jhānānam etam adhivacanam tāni hi appetvā nisinnāḥ jhāyinaḥ imasmin yeva
translated: “Delight” is a term for the jhānas of the fine-material sphere. For meditators who have entered upon those jhānas find the bliss of renunciation in this very life,

original: attabhāve asaṃkiliṭṭhaṃ nekkhammasukhaṃ vindanti, tasmā “diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānī”ti
analyzed: atta bhāve asaṃkiliṭṭham nekkhamma sukham vindanti tasmai diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārāni iti
translated: unadulterated by sensual desires, and so they are called “dwellings in the here and now that are blissful abidings.”

original: vuccantīti. Kathitā “diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro”ti sappītikattā, lokuttaravipākasukhumasañhitattā
analyzed: vuccanti iti kathitā diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāraḥ ti sappītika ttā lokuttara vipāka sukhuma sañhita ttā
translated: The jhāna that is the basis for insight is called “a dwelling in the here and now that is blissful” because it is associated with the bliss of the supramundane fruition and because it is accompanied by happiness.

original: ca. Saha maggena vipassanāpādakajjhānaṃ kathitaṃ “cattārome cunda sukhallikānuyogā
analyzed: ca saha maggena vipassanā pādaka jjhānam kathitam cattāraḥ me cunda sukhallika anuyogā
translated: The jhāna that is the basis for insight together with the path is called “a dwelling in the here and now that is blissful” in the passage: “Cunda, there are these four kinds of delights in the here and now that are noble and not shared by ordinary people” ,

original: ekantanibbidāyā”tiādinā catutthajjhānikaphalasamāpattīti catutthajjhānikā phalasamāpatti
analyzed: ekanta nibbidāya ati ādinā catuttha jhānika phala samāpatti iti catuttha jhānikā phala samāpatti
translated: because it is a fruition attainment that is included in the fourth jhāna.

original: diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārabhāvena kathitā. Cattāri rūpāvacarāni “diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārajjhānānī”ti
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra bhāvena kathitā cattāri rūpāvacarāni diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra jhānāni iti
translated: The four fine-material jhānas are called “jhānas that are dwellings in the here and now that are blissful abidings” in the passage: “Bhikkhus, there are these four jhānas that are blissful abidings here and now” .

original: kathitānīti attho. Nikāmalābhīti nikāmena lābhī attano icchāvasena lābhī. Icchiticchitakkhaṇe
analyzed: kathitāni iti atthaḥ nikāma lābhī iti nikāmena lābhī attano icchā vasena lābhī icchiticchita khaṇe
translated: This is the meaning. “Obtains at will”: obtains according to his wish, according to his desire.

original: samāpajjituṃ samatthoti attho. Tenāha “yathākāmalābhī”ti. Adukkhalābhīti sukheneva
analyzed: samāpajjitum samatthaḥ ti atthaḥ tena āha yathā kāma lābhī iti adukkha lābhī iti sukhena iva
translated: the meaning is, he is able to attain it. Hence it is said, “he is a master of the attainment of the jhāna at will.”

original: paccanīkadhammānaṃ samucchinnattā samāpajjituṃ samattho. Akasiralābhīti akasirānaṃ🔽vipulānaṃ lābhī, yathāparicchedeneva vuṭṭhātuṃ samattho. Ekacco hi lābhīyeva hoti,
analyzed: paccanīka dhammānam samucchinna ttā samāpajjitum samatthaḥ a kasira lābhī iti  vipulānam lābhī yathā paricchedena iva vuṭṭhātum samatthaḥ ekaccaḥ hi lābhīya iva hoti
translated: He is able to attain it without pain because he has cut off the opposing states.🔽He is a master of the attainment of the jhāna without difficulty,

original: na pana sakkoti icchiticchitakkhaṇe samāpajjituṃ. Ekacco tathā samāpajjituṃ sakkoti,
analyzed: na pana sakkoti icchiti chita khaṇe samāpajjitum ekaccaḥ tathā samāpajjitum sakkoti
translated: for he is able to emerge from it whenever he wishes. For one person is a master of the attainment but is unable to emerge from it whenever he wishes;

original: pāribandhake pana kicchena vikkhambheti. Ekacco tathā ca samāpajjati, pāribandhake
analyzed: pāribandhake pana kicchena vikkhambheti ekaccaḥ tathā ca samāpajjati pāribandhake
translated: another is able to emerge from it whenever he wishes but finds difficulty in cutting off the hindrances and attaining the jhāna;

original: ca akiccheneva vikkhambheti, na sakkoti nāḷikayantaṃ viya yathāparicchede vuṭṭhātuṃ.🔽Bhagavā pana sabbaso samucchinnapāribandhakattā vasibhāvassa sammadeva samadhigatattā
analyzed: ca a kicchena iva vikkhambheti na sakkoti nāḷikayantam viya yathā paricchede vuṭṭhātum  bhagavā pana sabbaso samucchinna pāribandhaka ttā vasi bhāvassa sammat eva samadhigata ttā
translated: another is able to emerge from it whenever he wishes and to cut off the hindrances and attain the jhāna without difficulty, but he is unable to emerge from it at the time he chooses;

original: sabbametaṃ sammadeva sakkoti.
analyzed: sabbam etam sammat eva sakkoti
translated: but the Blessed One, having completely cut off all hindrances, has attained mastery in concentration, and so he is able to do all these things properly.

original: Anuyogadānappakāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: anuyoga dāna ppakāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the giving of the opportunity is finished.

original: 161. Dasasahassilokadhātuyāti imāya lokadhātuyā saddhiṃ imaṃ lokadhātuṃ parivāretvā🔽ṭhitāya dasasahassilokadhātuyā. Jātikhettabhāvena hi taṃ ekajjhaṃ gahetvā “ekissā
analyzed: dasa sahassi lokadhātuyā ati imāya lokadhātuyā saddhim imam lokadhātum parivāretvā  ṭhitāya dasa sahassi lokadhātuyā jāti khetta bhāvena hi tam ekajjham gahetvā ekissā
translated: In the ten-thousandfold world-element: together with this world-sphere, the ten-thousandfold world-sphere is surrounded by this world-sphere.

original: lokadhātuyā”ti vuttaṃ, tattakāya eva jātikhettabhāvo dhammatāvasena veditabbo. “Pariggahavasenā”ti
analyzed: lokadhātuyā iti vuttam tatta kāyaḥ eva jāti khetta bhāvaḥ dhamma tā vasena veditabbo pariggaha vasena āti
translated: For it is taken as one by way of the field of birth, and so it is said, “in one world-sphere.” The field of birth should be understood as a natural fact in that very world-sphere.🔽Some say that it is by way of ownership.

original: keci. Sabbesampi buddhānaṃ tattakaṃ eva jātikhettaṃ. “Tannivāsīnaṃyeva ca devānaṃ🔽dhammābhisamayo”ti vadanti. Pakampanadevatūpasaṅkamanādinā jātacakkavāḷena samānayogakkhamaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: sabbesam pi buddhānam eva jāti khettam tad nivāsīnam yeva ca devānam  dhamma abhisamayaḥ ti vadanti pakampana devatūpasaṅkamana ādinā jāta cakkavāḷena samāna yogakkhama ṭṭhānam
translated: For the field of birth is the same for all Buddhas. And they say that the penetration of the Dhamma is only for the gods who live there.🔽The field of birth is the place where the cakkavāḷa of birth is the same, by way of the going forth of the gods who shake the earth, etc. The field of command is the place where the going forth of the command is the same, by way of the going forth of the rays.

original: jātikhettaṃ. Saraseneva āṇāpavattanaṭṭhānaṃ āṇākhettaṃ. Buddhañāṇassa visayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: jāti khettam sa rasena iva āṇā pavattana ṭṭhānam āṇā khettam buddha ñāṇassa visaya bhūtam
translated: The field of the object is the place that is the domain of the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: ṭhānaṃ visayakhettaṃ. Okkamanādīnaṃ channameva gahaṇaṃ nidassanamattaṃ mahābhinīhārādikālepi
analyzed: ṭhānam visaya khettam okkamana ādīnam channam eva gahaṇam nidassana mattam mahā abhinīhāra ādi kāle pi
translated: The taking of the six steps, etc., is only an indication. At the time of the great aspiration, etc.,

original: tassa pakampanalabbhanato. Āṇākhettaṃ nāma, yaṃ ekaccaṃ saṃvaṭṭati, vivaṭṭati ca.
analyzed: tassa pakampana labbhanataḥ āṇākhettam nāma yam ekaccam saṃvaṭṭati vivaṭṭati ca
translated: The sphere of influence is that which is closed in and opened out.

original: Āṇā vattati tannivāsidevatānaṃ sirasā sampaṭicchanena, tañca kho kevalaṃ buddhānaṃ
analyzed: āṇā vattati tad nivāsi devatānam sirasā sampaṭicchanena tat ca kho kevalam buddhānam
translated: The influence of the Buddha extends to the deities who live there, and they accept it with bowed heads. But that is only by the Buddha’s power,

original: ānubhāveneva, na adhippāyavasena. “Yāvatā pana ākaṅkheyyā”ti vacanato tato parampi āṇā pavatteyyeva.
analyzed: ānubhāvena iva na adhippāya vasena yāvatā pana ākaṅkheyya ati vacanato tatas param pi āṇā pavatteyya iva
translated: not by his intention. And it would continue to extend beyond that if he wished it to.🔽“But it does not arise” means that the Blessed One, who said, “I have no teacher, for I am the chief, the leader of men to be trained,”

original: Nuppajjantīti pana atthīti “na me ācariyo atthi, sadiso me na vijjatī”ti imissā lokadhātuyā🔽ṭhatvā vadantena bhagavatā, imasmiṃyeva sutte “kiṃ panāvuso, sāriputta, atthetarahi
analyzed: nuppajjanti iti pana atthi iti na me ācariyaḥ atthi sadisaḥ me na vijjati iti imissā lokadhātuyā  ṭhatvā vadantena bhagavatā imasmiṃ yeva sutte kim pana āvuso sāriputta attha itarahi
translated: and who said, “There is no other ascetic or brahmin …” ,

original: añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā bhagavatā samasamo sambodhiya”nti evaṃ puṭṭho “ahaṃ bhante
analyzed: aññaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā bhagavatā samasamaḥ sambodhiyanti evam puṭṭhaḥ aham bhante
translated: when asked by the venerable Sariputta, “But, friend Sariputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin …” ,

original: noti vadeyya”nti vatvā tassa kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ “aṭṭhānametaṃ anavakāso, yaṃ ekissā
analyzed: no ti vadeyyan ti vatvā tassa kāraṇam dassetuṃ aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam ekissā
translated: said, “Venerable sir, I would not say that there is” , and when the venerable Sariputta said, “Why is that, friend?”🔽in order to show the reason, said, “It is impossible, venerable sir, it cannot happen that in one world-system two Supremely Enlightened Ones should arise …” ,

original: lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā”ti imaṃ suttaṃ dassentena dhammasenāpatinā
analyzed: lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā ti imam suttam dassentena dhammasenāpatinā
translated: and then quoted this sutta.

original: ca buddhakhettabhūtaṃ imaṃ lokadhātuṃ ṭhapetvā aññattha anuppatti vuttā hotīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: ca buddha khetta bhūtam imam lokadhātum ṭhapetvā aññattha anuppatti vuttā hoti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that it is said that he does not appear elsewhere except in this world-sphere which is the field of the Buddha.

original: Ekatoti saha, ekasmiṃ kāleti attho. So pana kālo kathaṃ paricchinnoti? Carimabhave
analyzed: ekato ti saha ekasmin kāle iti attho so pana kālo katham paricchinno ti carima bhave
translated: “Together” means “along with.” The meaning is: “in one place.” But how is that time delimited? From the moment of his conception

original: paṭisandhiggahaṇato paṭṭhāya yāva dhātuparinibbānanti dassento “tattha bodhipallaṅke”tiādimāha.🔽Nisinnakālato paṭṭhāyāti paṭilomakkamena vadati. Khettapariggaho katova hoti “idaṃ🔽buddhānaṃ jātikhetta”nti. Kena pana pariggaho kato? Uppajjamānena bodhisattena. Parinibbānato🔽paṭṭhāyāti anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbānato paṭṭhāya. Etthantareti carimabhave
analyzed: paṭisandhi ggahaṇataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva dhātu parinibbānanti dassentaḥ tattha bodhi pallaṅka iti ādim āha  nisinna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya ati paṭiloma kkamena vadati khetta pariggaho kataḥ va hoti idam  buddhānam jāti khettanti kena pana pariggahaḥ kataḥ uppajjamānena bodhisattena parinibbānato  paṭṭhāya ati anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbānataḥ paṭṭhāya etthantare iti carima bhave
translated: in his last birth up to the time of his Parinibbāna. Showing this, he says: “There, on the seat of enlightenment.”

original: bodhisattassa paṭisandhiggahaṇaṃ, dhātuparinibbānanti imehi dvīhi paricchinne etasmiṃ antare.
analyzed: bodhisattassa paṭisandhi ggahaṇam dhātu parinibbānan ti imehi dvīhi paricchinne etasmim antare
translated: “From the time of his sitting down” he says in the reverse order. The delimitation of the field has been made thus: “This is the field of the Buddhas’ births.” But by whom was the delimitation made? By the Bodhisatta who was appearing. “From the time of his Parinibbāna” means from the time of his Parinibbāna in the Nibbāna-element without residue remaining. “In between” means between the Bodhisatta’s conception in his last birth and his Parinibbāna in the Nibbāna-element without residue remaining.

original: Tipiṭakaantaradhānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: tipiṭaka antaradhāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Disappearance of the Three Baskets

original: “Na nivāritā”ti vatvā tattha kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ “tīṇi hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Paṭipattiantaradhānena
