analyzed: na nivāritā ati vatvā tattha kāraṇam dassetum tīṇi hi itiādi vuttam paṭipatti antaradhānena
translated: “Not prohibited” : in order to show the reason for that, it is said: “Three things are lost” .🔽The disappearance of the practice

original: sāsanassa osakkitattā aparassa uppatti laddhāvasarā hoti. Paṭipadāti paṭivedhāvahā pubbabhāgapaṭipadā.
analyzed: sāsanassa osakkita ttā aparassa uppatti laddha avasarā hoti paṭipadā ati paṭivedha āvahā pubbabhāga paṭipadā
translated: gives an opportunity for the arising of the other. “Practice” : the preliminary practice that leads to penetration.

original: “Pariyatti pamāṇa”nti vatvā tamatthaṃ bodhisattaṃ nidassanaṃ katvā dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi🔽vuttaṃ. Tayidaṃ hīnaṃ nidassanaṃ katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Niyyānikadhammassa hi ṭhitiṃ
analyzed: pariyatti pamāṇam ti vatvā tam attham bodhisattam nidassanam katvā dassetum yathā iti ādi  vuttam tayā idam hīnam nidassanam katan ti daṭṭhabbam niyyānika dhammassa hi ṭhitim
translated: “The learning is lost” : in order to show the meaning of that by means of an illustration of the Bodhisatta, it is said: “Just as” .

original: dassento aniyyānikadhammaṃ nidasseti.
analyzed: dassentaḥ aniyyānika dhammam nidasseti
translated: This inferior illustration should be understood as given. For by showing the duration of the Teaching that leads out , he shows the disappearance of the Teaching that does not lead out .

original: Mātikāya antarahitāyāti “yo pana bhikkhū”tiādi nayappavattāya sikkhāpadapāḷimātikāya
analyzed: mātikāya antarahitāya ati yaḥ pana bhikkhu uti ādi naya ppavattāya sikkhāpada pāḷi mātikāya
translated: “The list is lost” : when the list of rules of training, which is set forth in the way beginning: “If a bhikkhu” ,

original: antarahitāya. Nidānuddesasaṅkhāte pātimokkhe, pabbajjāupasampadākammesu ca sāsanaṃ
analyzed: antara hitāya nidāna uddesa saṅkhāte pātimokkhe pabbajjā upasampadā kammesu ca sāsanam
translated: is lost. The Teaching remains in the Pāṭimokkha called the Nidāna uddesa , and in the ceremonies of pabbajjā and upasampadā ordination.

original: tiṭṭhati. Yathā vā pātimokkhe dharante eva pabbajjā upasampadā ca, evaṃ sati eva
analyzed: tiṭṭhati yathā vā pātimokkhe dharante eva pabbajjā upasampadā ca evam sati eva
translated: Or just as pabbajjā and upasampadā exist only when the Pāṭimokkha exists, so too🔽the Teaching remains only as long as the practice exists.

original: tadubhaye pātimokkhaṃ tadubhayābhāve pātimokkhābhāvato. Tasmā tayidaṃ tayaṃ sāsanassa🔽ṭhitihetūti āha “pātimokkhapabbajjāupasampadāsu ṭhitāsu sāsanaṃ tiṭṭhatī”ti. Yasmā
analyzed: tad ubhaye pātimokkham tad ubhaya abhāve pātimokkha abhāvato tasmā sāsanassa  ṭhiti hetū ti āha pātimokkha pabbajjā upasampadāsu ṭhitāsu sāsanam tiṭṭhati iti yasmā
translated: So this is the reason why the Dispensation stands.

original: vā upasampadādhīnaṃ pātimokkhaṃ anupasampannassa anicchitattā, upasampadā ca pabbajjādhīnā,
analyzed: vā upasampadā adhīnam pātimokkham an upasampannassa an icchita ttā upasampadā ca pabbajjā adhīnā
translated: Or alternatively, the Pātimokkha is dependent on the admission, and the admission is not allowed for one who has not gone forth,🔽and the going forth is dependent on the admission,

original: tasmā pātimokkhe, taṃ siddhiyā siddhāsu pabbajjupasampadāsu ca sāsanaṃ tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: tasmā pātimokkhe tam siddhiyā siddhāsu pabbajja upasampadāsu ca sāsanam tiṭṭhati
translated: so the Dispensation stands when the Pātimokkha stands and when the going forth and the admission stand.

original: Osakkitaṃ nāmāti pacchimakapaṭivedhasīlabhedadvayaṃ ekato katvā tato paraṃ vinaṭṭhaṃ🔽nāma hoti, pacchimakapaṭivedhato paraṃ paṭivedhasāsanaṃ, pacchimakasīlabhedato paraṃ
analyzed: osakkitam nāma ati pacchimaka paṭivedha sīlabheda dvayam ekatas katvā tatas param vinaṭṭham  nāma hoti pacchimaka paṭivedhato param paṭivedha sāsanam pacchimaka sīlabhedato param
translated: “The Dispensation is broken” means that the two, namely, the last kind of penetration and the last kind of virtue, are reckoned as one, and after that the Dispensation is destroyed.

original: paṭipattisāsanaṃ vinaṭṭhaṃ nāma hotīti attho.
analyzed: paṭipatti sāsanam vinaṭṭham nāma hoti iti attho
translated: The meaning is that after the last kind of penetration the Dispensation of penetration is destroyed, and after the last kind of virtue the Dispensation of practice is destroyed.

original: Sāsanaantarahitavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sāsana antara hita vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the disappearance of the Dispensation

original: Etena kāmaṃ “sāsanaṭṭhitiyā pariyatti pamāṇa”nti vuttaṃ, pariyatti pana paṭipattihetukāti
analyzed: etena kāmam sāsana ṭṭhitiyā pariyatti pamāṇanti vuttam pariyatti pana paṭipatti hetukā ti
translated: Although it is said that “the learning is the measure for the duration of the Dispensation,” the learning is a cause for the practice.

original: paṭipattiyā asati sā appatiṭṭhā hoti paṭivedho viya, tasmā paṭipattiantaradhānaṃ🔽sāsanosakkanassa visesakāraṇanti dassetvā tayidaṃ sāsanosakkanaṃ dhātuparinibbānosānanti
analyzed: paṭipattiyā asati sā appatiṭṭhā hoti paṭivedhaḥ viya tasmā paṭipatti antaradhānam  sāsana usakkanassa visesa kāraṇanti dassetvā tayidam sāsana usakkanam dhātu parinibbāna usānam
translated: If there is no practice, then the Dispensation has no footing, like penetration without a footing. Therefore the disappearance of the practice is

original: dassetuṃ “tīṇi parinibbānānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Dhātūnaṃ sannipātanādi buddhānaṃ adhiṭṭhānenevāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: dassetum tīṇi parinibbānāni itiādi vuttam dhātūnam sannipātana ādi buddhānam adhiṭṭhānena iva āti veditabbam
translated: the special cause of the disappearance of the Dispensation. After showing this, the Master said, “There are three kinds of final Nibbāna” in order to show that the disappearance of the Dispensation is the final Nibbāna of the elements. The bringing together of the elements, etc., should be understood as being due to the resolve of the Buddhas.

original: Tāti rasmiyo. Kāruññanti paridevanakāruññaṃ. Jambudīpe, dīpantaresu, devanāgabrahmalokesu🔽ca vippakiritvā ṭhitānaṃ dhātūnaṃ mahābodhipallaṅkaṭṭhāne ekajjhaṃ sannipātanaṃ,🔽rasmivissajjanaṃ, tattha tejodhātuyā uṭṭhānaṃ, ekajālibhāvo cāti sabbametaṃ satthu
analyzed: paridevana kāruññam jambudīpe dīpa antaresu deva nāga brahma lokesu  ca vippakiritvā ṭhitānam dhātūnam mahā bodhi pallaṅka ṭṭhāne ekajjham sannipātanam  rasmi vissajjanam tattha tejodhātuyāḥ uṭṭhānam eka jāli bhāvo ca ati sabbam etam satthu
translated: “That” refers to the rays. “Compassion” is the compassion of lamenting. The bringing together in one place of the elements that are scattered in the Rose-Apple Land, the other continents, and the worlds of the gods, nāgas, and Brahmās,

original: adhiṭṭhānavasenevāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna vasena iva ati veditabbam
translated: the sending forth of the rays, the arising of the fire element there, and the formation of a single network—all this should be understood as being due to the resolve of the Master.

original: Anacchariyattāti dvīsupi uppajjamānesu acchariyattābhāvadosatoti attho. Buddhā nāma
analyzed: an acchariyattā ti uppajjamānesu acchariyattā bhāva dosato ti attho buddhāḥ nāma
translated: “Not a marvel”: the meaning is that it is not a marvel because it occurs in both. Buddhas are not marvels

original: majjhe bhinnasuvaṇṇaṃ viya ekasadisāti tesaṃ desanāpi ekarasā evāti āha “desanāya🔽ca visesābhāvato”ti, etena ca anacchariyattameva sādheti. “Vivādabhāvato”ti etena
analyzed: majjhe bhinna suvaṇṇam viya eka sadisā ati tesam desanā api ekarasā evā ati āha desanāya  ca visesa abhāvatā iti etena ca sādhā iti vivāda bhāvatā iti etena
translated: and like a piece of gold in the middle of which there is a flaw, they are of one and the same taste. Thus he says: “and because there is no difference in the teaching.” And by this he establishes the fact that it is not wonderful. By the words “because there is no dispute” he shows that the teaching of the Buddha is not like the teaching of others, which is disputed by the wise.

original: vivādābhāvatthaṃ dve ekato na uppajjantīti dasseti.
analyzed: vivāda abhāva attham dve ekatas na uppajjanti iti dasseti
translated: and like a piece of gold in the middle of which there is a flaw, they are of one and the same taste. So he said, “and because there is no difference in the teaching.” And by this he shows that it is not a wonder. By “because there is no dispute” he shows that two do not arise together in order to avoid dispute.

original: Tatthāti milindapañhe. Ekuddesoti eko ekavidho abhinno uddeso. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo.🔽Ekaṃ eva buddhaṃ dhāretīti ekabuddhadhāraṇī, etena evaṃsabhāvā ete buddhaguṇā, yena
analyzed: tattha ati milinda pañhe eka uddeso ti ekaḥ ekavidhaḥ abhinnaḥ uddeso sesa padesu pi esa eva nayo  ekam eva buddham dhāreti iti eka buddha dhāraṇī etena evaṃsabhāvāḥ ete buddha guṇāḥ yena
translated: “There” means in the Milindapañha. “One statement” means one and the same, undivided, statement. The same method applies to the other terms.

original: dutiyaṃ buddhaguṇaṃ dhāretuṃ asamatthā ayaṃ lokadhātūti dasseti. Paccayavisesanipphannānañhi🔽dhammānaṃ sabhāvaviseso na sakkā nivāretunti. “Na dhāreyyā”ti vatvā tameva adhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: dutiyam buddha guṇam dhāretum asamatthā ayam lokadhātu iti dasseti paccaya visesa nipphannānam hi  dhammānam sabhāva visesaḥ na sakkā nivāretun ti na dhāreyya ati vatvā tam eva a dhāraṇam
translated: “One-Buddha-bearer” : it bears only one Buddha. By this he shows that the world-sphere is incapable of bearing a second Buddha, since the Buddha-qualities are of such a nature that they can be borne by only one Buddha. For it is impossible to prevent a difference in the specific nature of things produced by a difference in conditions.

original: pariyāyehi pakāsento “caleyyā”tiādimāha. Tattha caleyyāti paripphandeyya. Kampeyyāti
analyzed: pariyāyehi pakāsento caleyya ati ādim āha tattha caleyya ati paripphandeyya kampeyya ati
translated: After saying “it would not bear,” he shows by synonyms that very non-bearing, saying “it would shake,” etc. Therein, “it would shake” means it would tremble. “It would quake” means it would quake violently.

original: pavedheyya. Nameyyāti ekapassena natā bhaveyya. Oṇameyyāti osīdeyya. Vinameyyāti
analyzed: pavedheyya nameyya ati eka passena natā bhaveyya oṇameyya ati osīdeyya vinameyya ati
translated: would be bent. Would be bowed down: would be bent down. Would be broken:

original: vividhā ito cito ca nameyya. Vikireyyāti vātena bhusamuṭṭhi viya vippakireyya. Vidhameyyāti
analyzed: vividhāḥ itas citas ca nameyya vikireyya ati vātena vippakireyya vidhameyya ati
translated: would be broken in two. Would be scattered: would be scattered about like a handful of chaff by the wind. Would be destroyed:

original: vinasseyya. Viddhaṃseyyāti sabbaso viddhastā bhaveyya. Tathābhūtā ca na katthaci
analyzed: vinasseyya viddhaṃseyya ati sabbasas viddhastā bhaveyya tathābhūtā ca na katthaci
translated: would be annihilated. Would be smashed: would be completely smashed. And being such, it would not stand anywhere:

original: tiṭṭheyyāti āha “na ṭhānaṃ upagaccheyyā”ti.🔽Idāni tattha nidassanaṃ dassento “yathā mahārājā”tiādimāha. Tattha samupādikāti samaṃ
analyzed: tiṭṭheyya iti āha na ṭhānam upagaccheyya iti  idāni tattha nidassanam dassentaḥ yathā mahā rāja ati ādim āha tattha samupādikā ati samam
translated: thus he said, “It would not come to stand.”

original: uddhaṃ pajjati pavattatīti samupādikā, udakassa upari samaṃgāminīti attho. Vaṇṇenāti
analyzed: uddham pajjati pavattati iti samupādikā udakassa upari samaṃgāminī iti atthaḥ vaṇṇena ati
translated: Now, showing the illustration there, he said, “Just as, great king,” and so on. Herein, it is level-going: it goes level-upwards, thus it is level-going; the meaning is that it goes level on the water’s surface. In colour:

original: saṇṭhānena. Pamāṇenāti ārohena. Kisathūlenāti kisathūlabhāvena, pariṇāhenāti attho.
analyzed: saṇṭhānena pamāṇena ati ārohena kisathūlena ati kisathūla bhāvena pariṇāhena ati attho
translated: in shape. In size: in height. In thickness: in thickness, that is to say, in circumference.

original: Dvinnampīti dvepi, dvinnampi vā sarīrabhāraṃ.
analyzed: dvinnam pi iti dve api dvinnam api vā sarīra bhāram
translated: Of both: of both two, or of the two bodies’ weight.

original: Chādentanti rocentaṃ ruciṃ uppādentaṃ. Tandīkatoti tena bhojanena tandībhūto. Anoṇamitadaṇḍajātoti
analyzed: rocentam rucim uppādentam tandīkatoti tena bhojanena tandībhūtaḥ an oṇamita daṇḍa jātaḥ iti
translated: Would cover: would conceal, would arouse approval. Would be satisfied: would be satisfied with that food. Would not be afflicted with hunger:🔽would not be afflicted with hunger.

original: yāvadatthabhojanena oṇamituṃ asamatthatāya anoṇamitadaṇḍo viya jāto. Sakiṃ bhuttovāti🔽ekaṃ vaḍḍhitakaṃ bhuttamattova mareyyāti. Atidhammabhārenāti dhammena nāma pathavī
analyzed: yāvadattha bhojanena oṇamitum asamattha tāya an oṇamita daṇḍaḥ viya jātaḥ sa kim  ekam vaḍḍhitakam bhutta mattaḥ uva mareyya ati ati dhamma bhārena ati dhammena nāma pathavī
translated: and it was as if it had become a punishment for not being bowed to because of its inability to be bowed to by being filled with as much food as it could hold.🔽If it were eaten once: if it were eaten just once, it would die.

original: tiṭṭheyya, sakiṃ teneva calati vinassatīti adhippāyena pucchati. Puna thero ratanaṃ
analyzed: tiṭṭheyya sa kim tena iva calati vinassati iti adhippāyena pucchati puna theraḥ ratanaṃ
translated: By the weight of the Dhamma: the intention is this: “The earth would stand by the Dhamma, but it shakes and is destroyed by that very thing.”

original: nāma loke kuṭumbaṃ sandhārentaṃ, abhimatañca lokena; taṃ attano garusabhāvatāya sakaṭabhaṅgassa
analyzed: nāma loke kuṭumbam sandhārentam abhimatam ca lokena tam garusa bhāvatāya sakaṭabhaṅgassa
translated: The Elder replied: “Jewel” is a name for a family that supports the world and is approved by the world.🔽Because of its great value, it was seen as the cause of the cart’s breaking.

original: kāraṇaṃ atibhārabhūtaṃ diṭṭhamevaṃ dhammo ca hitasukhavisesehi taṃsamaṅginaṃ dhārento,
analyzed: kāraṇam atibhāra bhūtam diṭṭham evam dhammo ca hita sukha visesehi taṃ samaṅginam dhārento
translated: And the Dhamma, which supports those who are its companions with the special benefits of welfare and pleasure,

original: abhimato ca viññūnaṃ gambhīrappameyyabhāvena garusabhāvattā atibhārabhūto pathavicalanassa🔽kāraṇaṃ hotīti dassento “idha mahārāja dve sakaṭā”tiādimāha, eteneva tathāgatassa
analyzed: abhimataḥ ca viññūnam gambhīra ppameyya bhāvena garusa bhāva ttā atibhāra bhūtaḥ patha vicalanassa  kāraṇam hoti iti dassentaḥ idha mahā rāja dve sakaṭāti ādim āha etena iva tathāgatassa
translated: is approved by the wise because of its great value due to its profundity and its being beyond measure. Therefore it is the cause of the earth’s trembling.🔽To show this, he said: “Here, great king, there were two carts.” By this he also praised the cause of the earth’s trembling at the time of the Tathāgata’s descent from the Tusita heaven and so on.

original: mātukucchiokkamanādikāle pathavikampanakāraṇaṃ saṃvaṇṇitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ekassāti
analyzed: mātukucchi ukkamana ādi kāle pathavi kampana kāraṇam saṃvaṇṇitan ti daṭṭhabbam ekassa ati
translated: One cart:

original: ekasmā, ekassa vā sakaṭassa ratanaṃ tasmā sakaṭato gahetvāti attho.
analyzed: ekasmai ekassa vā sakaṭassa ratanam tasmai sakaṭataḥ gahetvā ati atthaḥ
translated: and from one cart, or from one of the carts, he took the jewel.

original: Osāritanti uccāritaṃ, kathitanti attho.
analyzed: osāritanti uccāritam kathitanti attho
translated: Proclaimed: uttered; announced is the meaning.

original: Aggoti sabbasattehi aggo.🔽Sabhāvapakatikāti sabhāvabhūtā akittimā pakatikā. Kāraṇamahantattāti kāraṇānaṃ mahantatāya,
analyzed: aggo ti sabba sattehi aggaḥ  sabhāva pakatikā ati sabhāva bhūtā akittimā pakatikā kāraṇa mahanta ttā ati kāraṇānam mahanta tāyai
translated: Foremost: chief of all beings.🔽Naturally: by nature, not by way of mere title.

original: mahantehi buddhakaradhammehi pāramisaṅkhātehi kāraṇehi buddhaguṇānaṃ nibbattitoti
analyzed: mahantehi buddha kara dhammehi pārami saṅkhātehi kāraṇehi buddha guṇānam nibbattitaḥ ti
translated: Because of the greatness of the cause: because of the greatness of the cause, which is called the perfection of the factors of the Buddha. The meaning is: the Buddha qualities are produced by great causes, which are the factors of the Buddha.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Pathaviādīni mahantāni vatthūni, mahantā ca sakkabhāvādayo attano attano🔽visaye ekekāva, evaṃ sammāsambuddhopi mahanto attano visaye eko eva. Ko ca tassa
analyzed: vuttam hoti pathavi ādīni mahantāni vatthūni mahantā ca sakka bhāva ādayo attanaḥ attanaḥ  visaye evam sammāsambuddhaḥ api mahantaḥ attanaḥ visaye ekaḥ eva kaḥ ca tassa
translated: The earth, etc., are great bases, and the great states of Sakka, etc., are great only in their respective spheres.🔽So too, the Fully Enlightened One is great only in his own sphere.🔽And what is his sphere? The plane of the Buddhas, or the knowable.

original: visayo? Buddhabhūmi, yāvatakaṃ vā ñeyyamevaṃ “ākāso viya anantavisayo bhagavā eko🔽eva hotī”ti vadanto “ekissā lokadhātuyā”ti vuttalokadhātuto aññesupi cakkavāḷesu
analyzed: visayaḥ buddha bhūmi yāvatakam vā ākāsaḥ viya ananta visayaḥ bhagavā ekaḥ  eva hoti iti vadantaḥ ekissā lokadhātuyā ti vutta lokadhātutaḥ aññesu pi cakkavāḷesu
translated: “The Blessed One is great in his sphere, like space,🔽which is infinite in its extent.”

original: aparassa buddhassa abhāvaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: aparassa buddhassa abhāvam dasseti
translated: “In one world-sphere” shows that there is no other Buddha in any other world-sphere.

original: “Sammukhā meta”ntiādinā pavattitaṃ attano byākaraṇaṃ aviparītatthatāya satthari pasāduppādanena
analyzed: sammukhāḥ mā etat ti ādinā pavattitam attanaḥ byākaraṇam a viparīta attha tāya satthari pasād uppādanena
translated: “Face to face with me” : the answer given by the Elder, which was correct, aroused confidence in the Teacher.

original: sammāpaṭipajjamānassa anukkamena lokuttaradhammāvahampi hotīti āha “dhammassa…pe…
analyzed: sammā paṭipajjamānassa anukkamena lokuttara dhamma āvaham pi hoti iti āha dhammassape
translated: And it led to the attainment of the supramundane states by one who was practising rightly.

original: paṭipada”nti. Vādassa anupatanaṃ anuppavatti vādānupātoti āha “vādoyevā”ti.
analyzed: paṭipadanti vādassa anupatanam anuppavatti vādānupāto ti āha
translated: “The practice of the Dhamma” : the practice of the Dhamma is the same as the practice of the doctrine.

original: Acchariyaabbhutavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the wonderful and marvellous

original: 162. Udāyīti nāmaṃ, mahāsarīratāya pana thero mahāudāyīti paññāyittha, yassa vasena
analyzed: udāyī iti nāmam mahā sarīra tāya pana theraḥ mahā udāyī iti paññāyittha yassa vasena
translated: Udāyī was his name. Because of his great body he was known as the Elder Mahā-Udāyī, on account of whom

original: vinaye nisīdanassa dasā anuññātā. Pañcavaṇṇāti khuddikādibhedato pañcappakārā. Pītisamuṭṭhānehi
analyzed: vinaye nisīdanassa dasā anuññātā pañca vaṇṇā ati khuddika ādi bhedato pañca ppakārā pīti samuṭṭhānehi
translated: in the Vinaya the use of a sitting mat of a certain size was permitted. “Five colours” : of five kinds, as khuddaka, etc.🔽His body was suffused with the most excellent forms of rapture that arose from the jhāna. Therefore he is said to have had “his body suffused with rapture and joy.”

original: paṇītarūpehi atibyāpitadeho “nirantaraṃ pītiyā phuṭasarīro”ti vutto, tato evassā🔽pariyāyato pharaṇalakkhaṇampi vuttaṃ. Appa-saddo “appakasirenevā”tiādīsu viya idha
analyzed: paṇīta rūpehi ati byāpita dehaḥ nirantaram pītiyā phuṭa sarīraḥ ti vuttaḥ tatas eva assā 🔽pariyāyataḥ pharaṇa lakkhaṇam pi vuttam appa saddaḥ appa kasirena iva āti ādīsu viya idha
translated: And for that very reason, it is said by way of a simile that his rapture “pervaded” his body.

original: abhāvatthoti āha “appicchatāti nittaṇhatā”ti. Tīhākārehīti yathālābhayathābalayathāsāruppappakārehi.
analyzed: abhāva attho ti āha appicchatā ati nittaṇhatā ati tīhākārehi iti yathā lābha yathā bala yathā sāruppa ppakārehi
translated: “The meaning of non-existence” is what is meant by “the meaning of fewness of wishes as non- grasping.” “In three ways”: in the way of what is obtained, in the way of what is possible, and in the way of what is suitable.

original: Na na katheti kathetiyeva. Cīvarādihetunti cīvaruppādādihetubhūtaṃ payuttakathaṃ
analyzed: na na kathā iti cīvara ādi hetunti cīvara uppāda ādi hetu bhūtam payutta katham
translated: He does not not speak; he speaks. “About the requisites, etc.”: he does not speak about talk that is connected with the requisites, etc.

original: na katheti. Veneyyavasenāti vinetabbapuggalavasena. Katheti “evamayaṃ vinayaṃ upagacchatī”ti.
analyzed: na kathā iti veneyya vasena ati vinetabba puggala vasena kathā iti evam ayam vinayam upagacchati iti
translated: “According to the dispositions of those to be trained”: according to the dispositions of the persons to be disciplined. He speaks, thinking: “In this way he will take up the discipline.”

original: “Sabbābhibhū sabbavidūhamasmī”tiādikā gāthāpi “dasabalasamannāgato, bhikkhave, tathāgato”tiādikā suttantāpi.
analyzed: sabba abhibhū sabba vidū ham asmi itiādikā gāthā api dasa bala samannāgataḥ bhikkhave tathāgataḥ iti ādikā suttantā api
translated: The verses beginning with “I am the one who has overcome all, who knows all” and the sutta passages beginning with “Bhikkhus, the Tathāgata has the ten powers” are also “answers to questions.”🔽“Repeatedly”: often. It is called “an exposition” because it is without verse and because it occurs by way of question and answer. The rest is all easily understandable.

original: 163. Abhikkhaṇanti abhiṇhaṃ. Niggāthakattā, pucchanavissajjanavasena pavattitattā ca “veyyākaraṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbaṃ suviññeyyaṃ evāti.🔽Sampasādanīyasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.
analyzed: abhikkhaṇam ti abhiṇham niggāthaka ttā pucchana vissajjana vasena ca veyyākaraṇam ti vuttam sesam sabbam su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: The elucidation of the meaning of “dispassion” is finished.

original: 6. Pāsādikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pāsādika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Pāsādika Sutta

original: Nigaṇṭhanāṭaputtakālaṅkiriyavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the adornment of Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta

original: 164. Lakkhassa saravedhaṃ avirajjhitvāna vijjhanavidhiṃ jānantīti vedhaññā. Tenāha
analyzed: lakkhassa sara vedham a virajjhitvāna vijjhana vidhim jānanti iti vedhaññā tena āha
translated: She knew the method of shooting without letting go of the bowstring after piercing the hundred-target array, thus she was a “markswoman.”🔽Hence it was said: “She was trained in the bow.”

original: “dhanumhi katasikkhā”ti. Sippaṃ uggahaṇatthāyāti dhanusippādisippassa uggahaṇatthāya.
analyzed: dhanumhi kata sikkhā ati sippam uggahaṇa atthāya ati dhanu sippa ādi sippassa uggahaṇa atthāya
translated: As to the training in the craft: for the purpose of learning the craft of archery, etc.

original: Majjhimena pamāṇena sarapātayogyatāvasena katattā dīghapāsādo.
analyzed: majjhimena pamāṇena sara pāta yogya tā vasena dīgha pāsādaḥ
translated: The long-range target was so called because it was set at a distance of a medium arrow-shot.🔽Recently made: made not long before.

original: Sampati kālaṃ katoti acirakālaṃ kato. Dvedhikajātāti jātadvedhikā sañjātabhedā. Dvejjhajātāti
analyzed: kālam acira kālam
translated: Two-ridged: with two ridges, that is, with two cleavages.🔽Two-ridged: having become two-ridged.

original: duvidhabhāvappattā. Bhaṇḍanti paribhāsanti etenāti bhaṇḍanaṃ, viruddhacittaṃ. Tanti
analyzed: duvidha bhāva ppattāḥ bhaṇḍanti paribhāsanti etena ati bhaṇḍanam viruddha cittam tanti
translated: Quarrel: they quarrel, they disagree, by means of this, thus it is quarrelling, a state of disagreement.🔽Quarrel: “This bathing, etc., should not be done,” is a rule.

original: bhaṇḍanaṃ. “Idaṃ nahānādi na kattabba”nti paññattavattaṃ paṇṇatti. Dhammavinayanti🔽pāvacanaṃ siddhantaṃ. Vijjhantā mukhasattīhi. Sahitaṃ meti mayhaṃ vacanaṃ sahitaṃ
analyzed: bhaṇḍanam idam nahāna ādi na kattabbanti paññatta vattam paṇṇatti dhamma vinayanti  siddhantam mukhasattīhi sahitam mā iti mayham vacanam sahitam
translated: Rule: the tradition, the doctrine, the discipline.🔽They shot with their mouths: they shot with their mouths.

original: siliṭṭhaṃ pubbāparasambandhaṃ atthayuttaṃ kāraṇayuttaṃ. Tenāha “atthasaṃhita”nti.
analyzed: siliṭṭham pubba apara sambandham attha yuttam kāraṇa yuttam tena āha attha saṃhitam ti
translated: My speech is coherent: my speech is coherent, connected, with a continuity of phrasing, relevant, and to the point. Hence it was said: “Relevant.”

original: Adhiciṇṇanti āciṇṇaṃ. Viparāvattanti virodhadassanavasena parāvattitaṃ, parāvattaṃ
analyzed: adhiciṇṇanti āciṇṇam viparāvattanti virodha dassana vasena parāvattitam parāvattam
translated: ‘Adhiciṇṇa’ means ‘practised’. ‘Turned away from’ means ‘turned away by showing opposition’, ‘turned away’

original: dūsitanti attho. Tenāha “cirakālavasena paguṇaṃ, taṃ mama vādaṃ āgamma nivatta”nti.
analyzed: dūsitanti attho tena āha cira kāla vasena paguṇam tam mama vādam āgamma nivattanti
translated: means ‘corrupted’, is the meaning. Hence he said: ‘After a long time it has become stale, it has turned away from my doctrine.’

original: Pariyesamāno vicara tattha gantvā sikkhāti attho. Sace sakkosi, idāniyeva mayā veṭhitaṃ
analyzed: pariyesamānaḥ vicara tattha gantvā sikkha ati attho sace sakko si idāniyā iva mayā veṭhitam
translated: ‘Searching’ means ‘going there and investigating’, is the meaning. If you can, now,

original: dosaṃ nibbeṭhehi. Maraṇamevāti aññamaññaghātanavasena maraṇameva. Nāṭaputtassa imeti
analyzed: dosam nibbeṭhehi maraṇam evā ti aññamañña ghātana vasena maraṇam eva nāṭa puttassa ime ti
translated: ‘untie the fault’ I have tied. ‘Death itself’ means death by mutual slaughter. ‘These of the son of Nāṭa’

original: nāṭaputtiyā, te pana tassa sissāti āha “antevāsikesū”ti. Purimapaṭipattito paṭinivattanaṃ
analyzed: nāṭa puttiyā te pana tassa sissā ti āha antevāsikesu iti purima paṭipattitaḥ paṭinivattanam
translated: means of the daughter of Nāṭa, but they are his pupils, therefore he said: ‘among his pupils’. Turning away from the former practice

original: paṭivānaṃ, taṃ rūpaṃ sabhāvo etesanti paṭivānarūpā. Tenāha “nivattanasabhāvā”ti.
analyzed: paṭivānam tam rūpam sabhāvaḥ etesanti paṭivāna rūpā tena āha nivattana sabhāvā iti
translated: is ‘turning away’, that form is the nature of these, therefore he said: ‘having the nature of turning away’.

original: Kathanaṃ atthassa ācikkhanaṃ. Pavedanaṃ hetudāharaṇāni āharitvā bodhanaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: kathanam atthassa ācikkhanam pavedanam hetu dāharaṇāni āharitvā bodhanam tena āha
translated: ‘Telling’ is the explanation of the meaning. ‘Revealing’ is the teaching by bringing up reasons and examples. Therefore he said:

original: “duppavediteti duviññāpite”ti. Na upasamāya saṃvattatīti anupasamasaṃvattanaṃ, tadeva
analyzed: du paveditā iti du viññāpitā iti na upasamāya saṃvattati iti an upasama saṃvattanam tat eva
translated: ‘in what is difficult to reveal’ means ‘in what is difficult to understand’. ‘Does not lead to peace’ means ‘does not lead to calm’, that itself

original: anupasamasaṃvattanikaṃ, tasmiṃ. Samussitaṃ hutvā patiṭṭhāhetubhāvato thūpaṃ, patiṭṭhāti
analyzed: an upasama saṃvattanikam tasmin samussitam hutvā patiṭṭhā hetu bhāvataḥ thūpam patiṭṭhāti
translated: The monument is established by the establishment of the relics.

original: āha “bhinnathūpeti bhinnapatiṭṭhe”ti, thūpoti vā dhammassa niyyānabhāvo veditabbo
analyzed: āha bhinna thūpā iti bhinna patiṭṭhā iti thūpo ti vā dhammassa niyyāna bhāvaḥ veditabbo
translated: The commentary explains “bhinnathūpa” as “a monument with a broken establishment.” But the word thūpa should be understood as the going out of the Dhamma.🔽It is a monument in the sense of being raised above other dhammas.

original: aññe dhamme abhibhuyya samussitaṭṭhena, so nigaṇṭhassa samaye. Kehici abhinnasammatopi
analyzed: aññe dhamme abhibhuyya samussita ṭṭhena so nigaṇṭhassa samaye kehici abhinna sammataḥ api
translated: At the time of the Nigaṇṭha, it was considered unbroken by some,🔽but it was broken, destroyed, completely and totally non-existent.

original: bhinno vinaṭṭho eva sabbena sabbaṃ abhāvatoti so bhinnathūpo, so eva niyyānabhāvo
analyzed: bhinnaḥ vinaṭṭhaḥ eva sabbena sabbam abhāvato ti saḥ bhinna thūpaḥ saḥ eva niyyāna bhāvaḥ
translated: That monument is a broken monument.

original: vaṭṭadukkhato muccitukāmānaṃ paṭisaraṇaṃ, tamettha natthīti appaṭisaraṇo, tasmiṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ muccitu kāmānam paṭisaraṇam tam ettha natthi iti appaṭisaraṇaḥ tasmiṃ
translated: The going out of the Dhamma is a refuge for those who wish to be free from the suffering of the round. But that is not here.

original: bhinnathūpe appaṭisaraṇeti evamettha attho veditabbo.🔽Ācariyappamāṇanti ācariyamuṭṭhi hutvā pamāṇabhūtaṃ. Nānānīhārenāti nānākārena.
analyzed: bhinna thūpe appaṭisaraṇā iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo  ācariya ppamāṇam ti ācariya muṭṭhi hutvā pamāṇa bhūtam nānā nīhārena ati nānā ākārena
translated: Therefore it is a broken monument without a refuge. This is how the meaning should be understood here.🔽The measure of the teacher is the measure of the teacher’s pupils.🔽In the same way, they acted in the past.

original: 165. Tatheva samudācariṃsu bhūtapubbagatiyā. Sāmākānanti sāmākadhaññānaṃ.
analyzed: tathā iva samudācariṃsu bhūta pubba gatiyā sāmākānam ti sāmāka dhaññānam
translated: The rice of the Sāma people is the rice of the Sāma people.

original: “Yenassa upajjhāyo”ti vatvā yathāssa āyasmato cundassa dhammabhaṇḍāgāriko upajjhāyo🔽ahosi, taṃ vitthārena dassetuṃ “buddhakāle kirā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha buddhakāleti
analyzed: yena assa upajjhāyaḥ iti vatvā yathā assa āyasmataḥ cundassa dhammabhaṇḍāgārikaḥ upajjhāyo  ahosi tam vitthārena dassetum buddha kāle kirāti ādi vuttam tattha buddha kāle iti
translated: “In whose presence his preceptor was” means in whose presence his preceptor was the custodian of the Dhamma-store.

original: bhūtakathanametaṃ, na visesanaṃ. Satthu parinibbānato puretarameva hi dhammasenāpati parinibbuto.
analyzed: bhūta kathanam etam na visesanam satthu parinibbānataḥ puretaram eva hi dhammasenāpati parinibbutaḥ
translated: In order to show in detail how the venerable Cunda’s preceptor was the custodian of the Dhamma-store, it is said: “In the time of the Buddha, it seems” and so on. Herein, in the time of the Buddha is a statement of fact, not a specification. For the General of the Dhamma passed away before the Master’s final extinction.

original: Dhammaratanapūjāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Worship of the True Dhamma

original: Saddhivihārikaṃ adāsīti saddhivihārikaṃ katvā adāsi.
analyzed: saddhivihārikam adāsi iti saddhivihārikam katvā adāsi
translated: He gave him to be his co-resident means he gave him to be his pupil.

original: Kathāya mūlanti bhagavato santikā labhitabbadhammakathāya kāraṇaṃ. Samuṭṭhāpetīti
analyzed: kathāya mūlanti bhagavato santikā labhitabba dhamma kathāya kāraṇam samuṭṭhāpeti iti
translated: The cause of the talk means the talk on the Dhamma that can be obtained in the presence of the Blessed One. He instigated means

original: uṭṭhāpeti, dāliddiyapaṅkato uddharatīti adhippāyo. Sandhamanti sammadeva dhamanto.
analyzed: uṭṭhāpeti dāliddiya paṅkataḥ uddharati iti adhippāyo sandhamanti sammad eva dhamanto
translated: he instigated, the meaning is that he lifted him out of the class of the poor. He was a regular means he was a regular worker.

original: Ekekasmiṃ pahāreyeva tayo tayo vāre katvā divā navavāre rattiṃ navavāre. Upaṭṭhānameva
analyzed: ekekasmin tayo tayo vāre katvā divā nava vāre rattim nava vāre upaṭṭhānam eva
translated: In each blow he made three or four strokes, so that he made nine strokes by day and nine at night. He went only to the service

original: gacchati buddhupaṭṭhānavasena, pañhāpucchanādivasena pana antarantarāpi gacchateva,
analyzed: gacchati buddha upaṭṭhāna vasena pañhā pucchanā ādi vasena pana antar antarā api gacchatā iva
translated: in the sense of service to the Enlightened One, but he also went from time to time to ask questions and so on.

original: gacchanto ca divasassa…pe… gacchati. Ñātuṃ icchitassa atthassa uddharaṇabhāvato pañhova🔽pañhuddhāro, taṃ gahetvāva gacchati attano mahāpaññatāya, satthu ca dhammadesanāyaṃ akilāsubhāvato.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ ca divasassape gacchati ñātum icchitassa atthassa uddharaṇa bhāvato pañhaḥ uva  pañhuddhāraḥ tam gahetvā ava gacchati attanaḥ mahā pañña tāya satthu ca dhamma desanāyam a kilāsu bhāvato
translated: The “questioning” is the questioner’s going to the Blessed One and asking him the question.🔽The “questioning-answer” is the Blessed One’s answering the question.

original: Asammāsambuddhappaveditadhammavinayavaṇṇanā
analyzed: asammāsambuddha ppavedita dhamma vinaya vaṇṇanā
translated: The “exposition” is the Blessed One’s exposition of the question.

original: 166. Ārocitepi tasmiṃ atthe. Sāmiko hoti, tassa sāmikabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “sova tassā🔽ādimajjhapariyosānaṃ jānātī”ti āha. Evanti vacanasampaṭicchanaṃ. Cundattherena hi🔽ānītaṃ kathāpābhataṃ bhagavā sampaṭicchanto “eva”nti āha. “Eva”nti durakkhāte dhammavinaye
analyzed: ārocite pi tasmin atthe sāmikaḥ hoti tassa sāmika bhāvam dassetum saḥ uva tassā  ādi majjha pariyosānam jānāti iti āha evam ti vacana sampaṭicchanam cundattherena hi  ānītam kathāpābhatam bhagavā sampaṭicchantaḥ evam iti āha evam iti durakkhāte dhamma vinaye
translated: The “questioning-answer-exposition” is the Blessed One’s answering the question and then expounding the matter further.🔽The “questioning-answer-exposition-further-exposition” is the Blessed One’s answering the question, expounding the matter further, and then expounding it further still.🔽The “questioning-answer-exposition-further-exposition-conclusion” is the Blessed One’s answering the question, expounding the matter further, expounding it further still, and then concluding the exposition.

original: sāvakānaṃ dvedhikādibhāvena viharaṇakiriyāparāmasanañhetaṃ.
analyzed: dvedhika ādi bhāvena viharaṇa kiriyā parāmasanam hetam
translated: The “questioning-answer-exposition-further-exposition-conclusion-recollection” is the Blessed One’s answering the question, expounding the matter further, expounding it further still, concluding the exposition, and then recollecting a past event.

original: Yasmā …pe… pākaṭaṃ hoti byatirekamukhena ca neyyassa atthassa vibhūtabhāvāpattito.
analyzed: yasmā pākaṭam hoti byatireka mukhena ca na iyyassa atthassa vibhūta bhāva āpattitaḥ
translated: The “questioning-answer-exposition-further-exposition-conclusion-recollection-recounting” is the Blessed One’s answering the question, expounding the matter further, expounding it further still, concluding the exposition, recollecting a past event, and then recounting a past event.🔽The “questioning-answer-exposition-further-exposition-conclusion-recollection-recounting-instruction” is the Blessed One’s answering the question, expounding the matter further, expounding it further still, concluding the exposition, recollecting a past event, recounting a past event, and then instructing the bhikkhus.

original: Atha vā yasmā…pe… pākaṭaṃ hoti dosesu ādīnavadassanena tappaṭipakkhesu guṇesu ānisaṃsassa
analyzed: atha vā pākaṭam hoti dosesu ādīnava dassanena tad paṭipakkhesu guṇesu ānisaṃsassa
translated: Or alternatively, since the defilements are the opposite of the path, the path is not evident as long as the defilements are, just as the color white is not evident in a piece of cloth where black predominates.🔽But when the defilements are abandoned, then the path becomes evident, like the white color in the cloth when the black has been removed.

original: vibhūtabhāvāpattito. Vokkammāti apasakketvā. Āmeḍitalopena cāyaṃ niddeso, vokkamma
analyzed: vibhūta bhāva āpattitaḥ vokkamma ati apasakketvā āmeḍita lopena ca ayam niddesaḥ vokkamma
translated: “Or else” is by way of the abandoning of the defilements.🔽“Having gone beyond” means having passed beyond.

original: vokkammāti vuttaṃ hoti, tena tassa vokkamanassa antarantarāti ayamattho labbhatīti🔽āha “na nirantara”ntiādi. Dhammānudhammapaṭipattiādayoti tena satthārā vuttamuttidhammassa
analyzed: vokkamma iti vuttam hoti tena tassa vokkamanassa antarantarā ti ayam attho labbhati iti  āha na nirantara ntiādi dhamma anudhamma paṭipatti ādayaḥ ti tena satthārā vutta mutti dhammassa
translated: This is a demonstrative compounding, and it is said that “having gone beyond” is the meaning.🔽“Not uninterruptedly” is said because the meaning of “from time to time” is obtained.🔽“The practice in conformity with the Dhamma, etc.,” means the non-practice in conformity with the Dhamma, etc., of the Dhamma that has been taught by the Master.

original: anudhammaṃ appaṭipajjanādayo. Ādi-saddena pāḷiyaṃ āgatā asāmīcipaṭipadādayo ca saṅgayhanti.
analyzed: anudhammam appaṭipajjana ādayaḥ ādi saddena pāḷiyam āgatāḥ asāmīci paṭipad ādayo ca saṅgayhanti
translated: The word “etc.” includes the wrong practices mentioned in the texts.

original: Manussattampīti pi-saddena “vicāraṇapaññāya asambhavo, dosesu anabhinivesitā, asandiṭṭhiparāmāsitā”ti
analyzed: manussattam pi iti pi saddena vicāraṇa paññāya asambhavaḥ dosesu anabhinivesi tā asandiṭṭhi parāmāsi tā ati
translated: “Even as a human being” : the word “even” should be understood to include the impossibility of becoming a wheel-turning monarch, the impossibility of attaining the analytical knowledges, the non-adherence to the defilements, and the non-adherence to false views.

original: evamādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. “Tathā eva”nti padehi yathākkamaṃ pakārassa kāmaṃ tirokkhatā,
analyzed: evamādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ tathā evanti padehi yathākkamam pakārassa kāmam tirokkha tā
translated: “In the same way” : the words “in the same way” should be understood to include the concealment of one’s own faults, the disclosure of the faults of others, the lack of shame and lack of compunction.

original: paccakkhatā vuccati, tathāpi yathā “tathā paṭipajjatū”ti padena paṭipajjanākāro niyametvā
analyzed: paccakkhatā vuccati tathā api yathā tathā paṭipajjatu iti padena paṭipajjana ākāraḥ niyametvā
translated: “He is called one who has gone forth” is said.

original: vihito, tathā “evaṃ paṭipajjatū”ti imināpīti idaṃ tassa atthadassanabhāvena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vihitaḥ tathā evam paṭipajjatu uti iminā api iti idam tassa attha dassana bhāvena vuttam
translated: And just as the mode of practice is determined by the words “Let him practice thus,” so too it is determined by the words “Let him practice in such a way.” This is said to show the meaning of that.

original: Samādapitattā micchāpaṭipadāya apuññaṃ pasavati.
analyzed: micchā paṭipadāya apuññam pasavati
translated: He produces demerit by his wrong practice.

original: 167. Ñāyati muttidhammo etenāti ñāyo, tena satthārā vutto dhammānudhammo, taṃ paṭipannoti
analyzed: ñāyati mutti dhammaḥ etena ati ñāyo tena satthārā vuttaḥ dhammānudhammo tam paṭipannaḥ ti
translated: “The way” is that by which the state of deliverance is known. The way stated by the Master is the conformity to the Dhamma. He who practices that way is

original: ñāyappaṭipanno, so pana yasmā tassa muttidhammassa adhigame kāraṇasammato, tasmā
analyzed: so pana yasmā tassa mutti dhammassa adhigame kāraṇa sammataḥ tasmā
translated: one who practices the way. But since he is considered the cause for the attainment of that state of deliverance,

original: vuttaṃ “kāraṇappaṭipanno”ti. Nipphādessatīti sādhessati, siddhiṃ gamissatīti vuttaṃ
analyzed: vuttam kāraṇa paṭipannaḥ ti nipphādessati iti sādhessati siddhim gamissati iti vuttam
translated: it is said that he practices the cause. “He will make it come about” : he will accomplish it, he will reach perfection, is what is meant.

original: hoti. Dukkhanibbattakanti sampati, āyatiñca dukkhassa nibbattakaṃ. Vīriyaṃ karoti micchāpaṭipannattā.
analyzed: hoti dukkha nibbattakanti sampati āyatim ca dukkhassa nibbattakam vīriyam karoti micchā paṭipanna ttā
translated: “The origin of suffering” : the origin of suffering in the present life and in the future. He makes an effort wrongly, because of his wrong practice.

original: Sammāsambuddhappaveditadhammavinayādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Dhamma and Discipline taught by the Fully Enlightened One, etc.

original: 168. Niyyātīti vattati, saṃvattatīti vā attho.
analyzed: niyyāti iti vattati saṃvattati iti vā atthaḥ
translated: “It proceeds” : it occurs, or it comes about, is the meaning.

original: 170. Idha sāvakassa sammāpaṭipattiyā ekantikaapassayadassanatthaṃ satthu sammāsambuddhatā,
analyzed: idha sāvakassa sammā paṭipattiyā ekantika apassaya dassana attham satthu sammāsambuddha tā
translated: Herein, the fact that the Master is a Perfect Supremely Enlightened One and that the Dhamma is well proclaimed and seen here and now by the wise is stated in order to show the praise of a clansman who has entered upon the right way,

original: dhammassa ca svākkhātatā kittitāti “sammāpaṭipannassa kulaputtassa pasaṃsaṃ dassetvā”ti
analyzed: dhammassa ca su ākkhāta tā kitti tā ati sammā paṭipannassa kula puttassa pasaṃsam dassetvā ati
translated: since it is by the right way of a disciple that the fact that the Master is a Perfect Supremely Enlightened One and that the Dhamma is well proclaimed is demonstrated.

original: vuttaṃ. Evañhi imissā desanāya saṃkilesabhāgiyabhāvena uṭṭhitāya vodānabhāgiyabhāvena
analyzed: vuttam evam hi imissā desanāya saṃkilesa bhāgiya bhāvena uṭṭhitāya vodāna bhāgiya bhāvena
translated: For in this way the occurrence of the penetration of the four noble Truths in the ultimate sense, which is the purification of virtue, etc.,🔽is shown by the penetration of the four noble Truths in the conventional sense, which is the purification of view.

original: yathānusandhinā pavatti dīpitā hoti. Abodhitatthāti appaveditatthā, paramatthaṃ catutthasaccapaṭivedhaṃ
analyzed: yathā anusandhinā dīpitā hoti a bodhita tthā ati appavedita tthā paramattham catuttha sacca paṭivedham
translated: The meaning of “not made known” is the meaning of “not penetrated” .

original: apāpitāti attho. Pāḷiyaṃ “assā”ti padaṃ “sāvakā saddhamme”ti dvīhi padehi yojetabbaṃ
analyzed: a pāpitā iti attho pāḷiyam assa ati padam sāvakā saddhammā iti dvīhi padehi yojetabbam
translated: The words “his disciples” should be construed with the two words “in the true Dhamma” .

original: “assa sammāsambuddhassa sāvakā, assa saddhamme”ti. Sabbasaṅgahapadehi katanti sabbassa
analyzed: assa sammāsambuddhassa sāvakāḥ assa saddhamma iti sabba saṅgaha padehi katanti sabbassa
translated: The meaning is: “the disciples of the Perfect Supremely Enlightened One, in the true Dhamma.”🔽“Made into a unity” : made into a unity by the words that include all.

original: sāsanatthassa saṅgaṇhanapadehi ekajjhaṃ kataṃ. Tenāha “sabbasaṅgāhikaṃ kataṃ na hotīti
analyzed: sāsana atthassa saṅgaṇhana padehi ekajjham katam tena āha sabba saṅgāhikam katam na hoti iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “It is not made into a unity by including all” .

original: attho”ti. Pubbenāparaṃ sambandhatthabhāvena saṅgahetabbatāya vā saṅgahāni padāni🔽katāni etassāti saṅgahapadakataṃ, brahmacariyaṃ. Tappaṭikkhepena na ca saṅgahapadakatanti🔽yojanā. Rāgādipaṭipakkhaharaṇaṃ, yathānusiṭṭhaṃ vā paṭipajjamānānaṃ vaṭṭadukkhato🔽paṭiharaṇaṃ nibbānapāpanaṃ paṭihāro, so eva ā-kārassa i-kāraṃ katvā paṭihiro, paṭihiro
analyzed: atthaḥ iti pubbena aparam sambandha ttha bhāvena saṅgahetabbatāya vā saṅgahāni padāni  katāni etassa ati saṅgaha pada katam brahmacariyam tad paṭikkhepena na ca saṅgaha pada katam ti  yojanā rāga ādi paṭipakkha haraṇam yathānusiṭṭham vā paṭipajjamānānam vaṭṭa dukkhato  paṭiharaṇam nibbāna pāpanam paṭihāro saḥ eva ākārassa ikāram katvā paṭihiraḥ paṭihiraḥ
translated: and the meaning.” Or alternatively, the words are called “having the meaning of inclusion” because they can be included by the subsequent meaning as the meaning of inclusion.🔽The word “brahmacariya” is not “having the words of inclusion” because of the prohibition of austerity.🔽This is the construction. The removal of greed, etc., or the removal of the suffering of the round of rebirths of those who practice in accordance with the instruction is the “removal” . The “removal” is the “removal” with the i-sign in place of the a-sign.

original: eva pāṭihiro, saha pāṭihirenāti sappāṭihiraṃ, tathā suppaveditatāya sappāṭihiraṃ🔽katanti sappāṭihirakataṃ. translated: ‘Not standing in the assembly’: not standing in the assembly in such talk. The meaning is that their nature is not standing in that. Hence he said ‘we have tongues’ . Though it is said ‘with five eyes’, the four eyes should be understood by the method of taking what is not stated as stated. For the knowledge of omniscience is the ‘all-seeing eye’. Or the word ‘knowing’ is said with reference to the occurrence of that knowledge by way of knowing the states that are to be known. analyzed: bhagavā iti anattha saṃhitanti ayam ettha atthaḥ iti āha na idha loka ttham vā para loka ttham  vā nissitam ti yam pana sattānam anattha āvahattā anattha saṃhitam tattha setughātaḥ
translated: “The Blessed One is not concerned with this world’s welfare or with the welfare of the world beyond” : this is the meaning here. Herein, the Blessed One is concerned with the welfare of beings, for he is the one who has come into the world for the sole purpose of bringing welfare to the whole world. He is not concerned with this world’s welfare or with the welfare of the world beyond, for he is not dependent on the welfare of this world or the welfare of the world beyond.

original: tathāgatassa. “Bhāratayuddhasītāharaṇasadisa”nti iminā tassā kathāya yebhuyyena abhūtatthataṃ🔽dīpeti. Sahetukanti ñāpakena hetunā sahetukaṃ. So pana hetu yena nidassanena sādhīyati,🔽taṃ tassa kāraṇanti tena sakāraṇaṃ katvā. Yathā hi paṭiññātatthasādhanato hetu, evaṃ🔽sādhakaṃ nidassananti. Yuttapattakāleyevāti yuttānaṃ pattakāle eva. Ye hi veneyyā
analyzed: tathāgatassa bhārata yuddha sītā haraṇa sadisanti iminā tassā kathāya yebhuyyena  dīpeti sa hetukanti ñāpakena hetunā sa hetukam saḥ pana hetu yena nidassanena sādhīyati  tam tassa kāraṇam ti tena sa kāraṇam katvā yathā hi paṭiññāta ttha sādhanataḥ hetu evam  sādhakam nidassananti yutta patta kāleya iva ati yuttānam patta kāle eva ye hi veneyyā
translated: “The Blessed One is not concerned with this world’s welfare or that world’s welfare” : this is the meaning here. But what is not concerned with the welfare of beings is “not concerned with welfare.” The Blessed One’s bridge is broken in that respect. “Like the Bharata war and the abduction of Sita” : by this he shows that the story is for the most part untrue. “With a reason” : with a reason that is a proof. But that reason is the demonstration by which it is established,🔽and that is its cause. Therefore it is “with a cause” in the sense of “having a cause.” For just as the reason is the proof of the meaning of the proposition, so the demonstration is the proof of the reason.

original: tassā kathāya yuttā anucchavikā, tesaṃyeva yojane sandhāya vā kathāya patto upakārāvaho🔽kālo, tadā eva kathetīti attho.
analyzed: tassā kathāya yuttā anucchavikā yojane sandhāya vā kathāya patto upakāra āvahaḥ 🔽kālo tadā eva kathā iti iti attho
translated: “At the right time” : at the time when it is appropriate. For those who are disciples are suitable and fit for that story. With reference to their guidance, or with reference to the time when the story is helpful, which is the time when it is appropriate, he tells it just then. This is the meaning.

original: 188. “Tathā tatheva gadanato”ti iminā “tathāgato”ti āmeḍitalopenāyaṃ niddesoti dasseti.

translated: “Because he has proclaimed it thus and thus” : by this phrase he shows that the word “tathāgata” is a descriptive designation based on the two terms “tathā” and “āgata.”

translated: The meaning of “tathā” is in accordance with the nature of things and of the meaning of the Dhamma, and in accordance with the dispositions of those who need training.

original: Diṭṭhanti rūpāyatanaṃ daṭṭhabbato, tena yaṃ diṭṭhaṃ, yaṃ dissati, yaṃ dakkhati, yaṃ
