original: pucchitapaṭivacanaṃ viya icchitabbaṃ evāti dasseti viññūnaṃ atthikānaṃ cittamaddavakaraṇato.
analyzed: pucchita paṭivacanam viya icchitabbam eva ati dasseti viññūnam atthikānam citta maddava karaṇato
translated: He shows that it should be wished for as a reply to a question, since it softens the hearts of the wise who want it.

original: “Purebhattaṃ paribhuñjitabbaka”nti idaṃ yāvakālike eva āmisabhāvassa niruḷhatāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: purebhattam paribhuñjitabbakan ti idam yāvakālike eva āmisa bhāvassa niruḷha tāya vuttam
translated: “Should be used before meals”: this is said because the nature of the material food is well known.

original: “Sabbe sattā”ti idaṃ tesaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ ajjhāsayasampattidassanaṃ pakkhapātābhāvadīpanato,
analyzed: sabbe sattā ti idam tesam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam ajjhāsaya sampatti dassanam pakkhapāta abhāva dīpanato
translated: “All beings”: this shows the excellence of their intentions, since it shows the absence of any partiality,🔽and because it is possible to pervade them with loving-kindness in a specific way.

original: odhiso pharaṇāyapi mettābhāvanāya labbhanato. Yāya kusalābhivaḍḍhiākaṅkhāya tesaṃ
analyzed: mettā bhāvanāya labbhanataḥ tesam
translated: The fact that they enter their houses with the wish for an increase of merit

original: upaṭṭhākānaṃ, tathā nesaṃ gehapavisanaṃ, taṃ sandhāyāha “pavisantāpi kalyāṇena cetasā🔽anukampanti nāmā”ti. Sutassa pariyodāpanaṃ nāma tassa yāthāvato atthaṃ vibhāvetvā
analyzed: upaṭṭhākānam tathā geha pavisanam tam sandhāya āha pavisantā api kalyāṇena cetasā  anukampanti nāma ati sutassa pariyodāpanam nāma tassa yāthāvataḥ attham vibhāvetvā
translated: and that they enter with a good mind and have compassion is said in reference to their attendants.🔽The purification of the Dhamma is the clearing of it by removing doubt after revealing its meaning as it truly is.

original: vicikicchātamavidhamanena visodhananti āha “atthaṃ kathetvā kaṅkhaṃ vinodentī”ti.
analyzed: āha attham kathetvā kaṅkham vinodenti iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “They explain the meaning and remove doubt.”

original: Savanaṃ nāma dhammassa yāvadeva sammāpaṭipajjanāya asati tasmiṃ tassa niratthakabhāvato,
analyzed: savanam nāma dhammassa yāvat eva sammā paṭipajjanāya asati tasmim tassa niratthaka bhāvato
translated: The hearing of the Dhamma is only for the purpose of right practice. In the absence of that, it is useless.

original: tasmā sutassa pariyodāpanaṃ nāma sammāpaṭipajjāpananti āha “tathattāya vā paṭipajjāpentī”ti.
analyzed: tasmā sutassa pariyodāpanam nāma sammā paṭipajjāpananti āha tathattāya vā paṭipajjāpenti iti
translated: So the “purification of the disciple’s view” is called “right practice.”

original: 273. Alamattoti samatthasabhāvo, so ca atthato samattho evāti “agāraṃ ajjhāvasanasamattho”ti
analyzed: alam atto ti samattha sabhāvo so ca atthataḥ samatthaḥ eva ati agāram ajjhāvasana samatthaḥ ti
translated: “Is able”: has the nature of being able. And that is in the sense of being able to live in a house.

original: vuttaṃ. Disānamassanaṭṭhāneti yathāvuttadisānaṃ paccupaṭṭhānasaññite namassanakāraṇe.
analyzed: vuttam disānam assana ṭṭhāne iti yathā vutta disānam paccupaṭṭhāna saññite namassana kāraṇe
translated: “Reason for paying homage to the directions”: the reason for paying homage in the sense of presenting oneself to the directions as described.🔽“The wise man, being wise, skilled, clever, obtains fame”: the construction is this.

original: Paṇḍito hutvā kusalo cheko labhate yasanti yojanā. Saṇhaguṇayogato saṇho, saṇhaguṇoti
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ hutvā kusalaḥ chekaḥ labhate yojanā saṇha guṇa yogataḥ saṇhaḥ saṇha guṇaḥ iti
translated: “Gentle” because of the possession of gentle qualities.🔽Herein, gentle qualities are subtle, fine, and clever understanding.

original: panettha sukhumanipuṇapaññā, muduvācāti dassento “sukhuma…pe… bhaṇanena vā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Disānamassanaṭṭhānenāti yena ñāṇena yathāvuttā cha disā vuttanayena paṭipajjanto
analyzed: pana ittha sukhuma nipuṇa paññā mudu vācā iti dassento bhaṇanena vā ti vuttam  disānam assana ṭṭhānena ati yena ñāṇena yathā vuttā cha disāḥ vutta nayena paṭipajjanto
translated: “Gentle in speech” is said showing gentleness.🔽“Reason for paying homage to the directions”: by means of which knowledge one who practices in the way described pays homage to the directions in the way described, that knowledge is the reason for paying homage to the directions.

original: namassati nāma, taṃ ñāṇaṃ disānamassanaṭṭhānaṃ, tena paṭibhānavā. Tena hi taṃtaṃkiccayuttapattavasena
analyzed: namassati nāma tam ñāṇam disā namassana ṭṭhānam tena paṭibhānavā tena hi taṃ taṃ kicca yutta patta vasena
translated: By that he is endowed with ready speech. For by that he has attained the state of being fit for this and that task.

original: paṭipajjanto idha “paṭibhānavā”ti vutto. Nivātavuttīti paṇipātasīlo. Atthaddhoti
analyzed: paṭipajjantaḥ idha paṭibhānavāti vuttaḥ nivāta vuttī iti paṇipāta sīlaḥ atthaddho ti
translated: One who practices it is called “eloquent” here. “Of good character” means of good conduct. “Not obstinate” means

original: na thaddho thambharahitoti cittassa uddhumātalakkhaṇena thambhitabhāvena virahito.
analyzed: na thaddhaḥ thambha rahito ti cittassa uddhumāta lakkhaṇena thambhita bhāvena virahitaḥ
translated: not obstinate, not stiff. He is free from the stiffness that is a characteristic of the swelling up of the mind.

original: Uṭṭhānavīriyasampannoti kāyikena vīriyena samannāgato. Nirantarakaraṇavasenāti āraddhassa🔽kammassa satatakāritāvasena. Ṭhānuppattiyā paññāyāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ atthakicce upaṭṭhite
analyzed: uṭṭhāna vīriya sampannaḥ ti kāyikena vīriyena samannāgataḥ nirantara karaṇa vasena ati āraddhassa  kammassa satata kāri tā vasena ṭhāna uppattiyā paññāyāti tasmim tasmim attha kicce upaṭṭhite
translated: “Endowed with energy” means endowed with bodily energy. “By uninterrupted performance” means by performing what has been begun continuously.

original: ṭhānaso taṅkhaṇe eva uppajjanakapaññāya.
analyzed: ṭhānaso taṅkhaṇe eva uppajjanaka paññāya
translated: “By the arising of understanding in the right place” means by the arising of understanding at that very moment when the matter to be understood has presented itself.

original: Saṅgahakaroti yathārahaṃ sattānaṃ saṅgaṇhanako. Mittakaroti mittabhāvakaro, so pana🔽atthato mitte pariyesanako nāma hotīti vuttaṃ “mittagavesano”ti. Yathāvuttaṃ vadaṃ
analyzed: saṅgaha karoti yathāraham sattānam saṅgaṇhanakaḥ mitta karoti mitta bhāva karaḥ saḥ pana  atthataḥ mitte pariyesanakaḥ nāma hoti iti vuttam mitta gavesanaḥ ti yathāvuttam
translated: “A conciliator” means one who conciliates beings as is fitting. “A maker of friends” means one who makes friends. But in the sense of the search for friends,🔽he is called “one who seeks friends.”

original: vacanaṃ jānātīti vadaññūti āha “pubbakārinā vuttavacanaṃ jānātī”ti. Idāni tamevatthaṃ
analyzed: vacanam jānāti iti āha pubba kārinā vutta vacanam jānāti iti idāni tam eva attham
translated: “One who remembers what has been said” means one who knows what has been said as it was said. He says this: “One who remembers what has been said knows what has been said by one who has gone before.” Now, this very matter

original: saṅkhepena vuttaṃ vitthāravasena dassetuṃ “sahāyakassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Pubbe yathāpavattāya🔽vācāya jānane vadaññutaṃ dassetvā idāni ākārasallakkhaṇena appavattāya vācāya jānanepi🔽vadaññutaṃ dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Yena yena vā panā”tiādinā vacanīyatthataṃ
analyzed: saṅkhepena vuttam vitthāra vasena dassetum sahāyakassa atiādi vuttam pubbe yathā pavattāya  vācāya jānane vadaññutam dassetvā idāni ākāra sat lakkhaṇena appavattāya vācāya jānane pi  dassetum api ca itiādi vuttam yena yena vā pana iti ādinā vacanīya ttha tam
translated: In order to show what was said in brief in detail, he said “To a friend” and so on.🔽Having shown his willingness to speak by knowing what was said in the past in the way it occurred, he now said “But also” and so on in order to show his willingness to speak by knowing what was not said in the way it occurred by discerning the mode.🔽By “But also by whatever means” and so on he shows the meaning of what should be spoken in the word “willingness to speak.”

original: vadaññū-saddassa dasseti. Netāti yathādhippetamatthaṃ paccakkhato pāpetā. Tenāha
analyzed: vadaññū saddassa dassa iti netā iti yathā adhippetam attham paccakkhataḥ tena āha
translated: “Guide”: he leads to the meaning as intended. Therefore he said🔽“He is a guide by wisdom, showing that meaning.”

original: “taṃ tamatthaṃ dassento paññāya netā”ti. Neti taṃ tamatthanti ānetvā sambandho. Punappunaṃ
analyzed: tam tam attham dassento paññāya netā ati na iti tam tam attham ti ānetvā sambandhaḥ punappunam
translated: The connection is “He is a guide, that meaning.”

original: netīti anu anu neti, taṃ tamatthanti ānetvā yojanā.
analyzed: na iti iti anu anu na iti tam ānetvā yojanā
translated: “He leads again and again”: he leads on and on. The construction is “that meaning.”🔽“In this and that”: in this and that person to be helped by means of the help of generosity and so on.

original: Tasmiṃ tasminti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ dānādīhi saṅgahehi saṅgahetabbe puggale. Āṇiyāti akkhasīsagatāya
analyzed: tasmin tasmin ti tasmin tasmin dāna ādīhi saṅgahehi saṅgahetabbe puggale āṇiyā ati akkha sīsa gatāya
translated: “With a goad”: with a goad on the head of the horse.🔽“While going”: while going.

original: āṇiyā. Yāyatoti gacchato. Puttakāraṇāti puttanimittaṃ. Puttahetukañhi puttena kattabbaṃ mānaṃ vā pūjaṃ vā.
analyzed: āṇiyā yāyato ti gacchato putta kāraṇā ati putta nimittam putta hetukam hi puttena kattabbam mānam vā pūjam vā
translated: “For the sake of his son”: for the sake of his son. For the respect or honour that should be done by a son is indeed for the sake of the son.

original: Upayogavacaneti upayogatthe. Vuccatīti vacanaṃ, attho. Upayogavacane vā vattabbe.
analyzed: upayoga vacanā iti upayoga tthe vuccati iti vacanam atthaḥ upayoga vacane vā vattabbe
translated: In the expression “in the sense of use” : in the sense of use. “Is said” : the word is said. “In the sense of use” : in the sense of what is to be said.

original: Paccattanti paccattavacanaṃ. Sammā pekkhantīti sammadeva kātabbe pekkhanti. Pasaṃsanīyāti
analyzed: paccattanti paccatta vacanam sammā pekkhanti iti sammat eva kātabbe pekkhanti pasaṃsanīyā ati
translated: “Individually” : the word is individually. “Looking on” : looking on at what is to be done correctly. “Are worthy of praise” :

original: pasaṃsitabbā. Bhavanti ete saṅgahetabbe tattha puggale yathārahaṃ pavattentāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: pasaṃsitabbāḥ bhavanti ete saṅgahetabbe tattha puggale yathāraham pavattentā ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: are worthy of praise. The intention is that these are to be included in the person who is to be treated in the appropriate way.

original: 274. “Iti bhagavā”tiādi nigamanaṃ. Yā disāti yā mātāpituādilakkhaṇā puratthimādidisā.
analyzed: iti bhagavān atiādi nigamanam yā disā ati yā mātā pitu ādi lakkhaṇā puratthima ādi disā
translated: “Thus the Exalted One” : the conclusion. “In whatever direction” : in whatever direction beginning with the east, which is characterized by mother, father, etc.

original: Namassāti namasseyyāsīti attho “yathā kathaṃ panā”tiādikāya gahapatiputtassa pucchāya
analyzed: namassā ati namasseyyāsi iti atthaḥ yathā katham pana atiādikāya gahapati puttassa pucchāya
translated: “Should honour” : should pay homage. The meaning is: should pay respect. “But how?” : in the sense of the householder’s son’s question beginning with “But how?”

original: vasena desanāya āraddhattā “pucchāya ṭhatvā”ti vuttaṃ. Akathitaṃ natthi gihīhi kattabbakamme
analyzed: vasena desanāya āraddha ttā pucchāya ṭhatvā ati vuttam a kathitam na atthi gihīhi kattabba kamme
translated: Since the teaching was begun in the sense of the question, it is said: “standing in the question.” There is nothing that is not told

original: appamādapaṭipattiyā anavasesato kathitattā. Mātāpituādīsu hi tehi ca paṭipajjitabbapaṭipattiyā
analyzed: appamāda paṭipattiyāḥ anavasesataḥ kathita ttā mātā pitu ādīsu hi tehi ca paṭipajjitabba paṭipattiyā
translated: because the practice of heedfulness is told without remainder. For in the case of mother, father, etc., and the practice to be practised by them,

original: niravasesato kathaneneva rājādīsupi paṭipajjitabbavidhi atthato kathito eva hotīti.
analyzed: niravasesataḥ kathanena iva rāja ādīsu pi paṭipajjitabba vidhi atthataḥ kathitaḥ eva hoti iti
translated: The method of practice in regard to kings, etc., is stated in fact by the mere statement of the method of practice in regard to the teacher, etc., without remainder.

original: Gihino vinīyanti, vinayaṃ upenti etenāti gihivinayo. Yathānusiṭṭhanti yathā idha
analyzed: gihinaḥ vinīyanti vinayam upenti etena ati gihi vinayaḥ yathā anusiṭṭhanti yathā idha
translated: The training for householders: householders are trained by this, they approach the training, thus it is the training for householders.

original: satthārā anusiṭṭhaṃ gihicārittaṃ, tathā tena pakārena taṃ avirādhetvā. Paṭipajjamānassa
analyzed: satthārā anusiṭṭham gihi cārittam tathā tena pakārena tam a virādhetvā paṭipajjamānassa
translated: As instructed: as instructed here by the Teacher in the conduct of householders, in that way, in that manner, without violating it.🔽Practicing: for one practicing

original: vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhāti diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthehi vuddhiyeva icchitabbā avassambhāvinīti.
analyzed: vuddhiyā iva pāṭikaṅkhā ati diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthehi vuddhiyā iva icchitabbā avassambhāvinī ti
translated: prosperity is to be expected: prosperity in the highest good of this very life and in the future life is to be desired, is to be expected.

original: Siṅgālasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.
translated: The elucidation of the literal meaning of the Sigālaka Sutta is ended.

original: 9. Āṭānāṭiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āṭānāṭiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Āṭānāṭiya Sutta

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā
translated: The first recitation section

original: 275. “Catuddisaṃ rakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā”ti idaṃ dvīsu ṭhānesu catūsu disāsu ṭhapitaṃ rakkhaṃ
analyzed: catuddisam rakkham ṭhapetvā ti idam dvīsu ṭhānesu catūsu disāsu ṭhapitam rakkham
translated: “Having placed protection in the four directions” : this is said with reference to the protection placed in the four directions in two places.

original: sandhāya vuttanti tadubhayaṃ dassetuṃ “asurasenāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Attano hi adhikāre,
analyzed: sandhāya vuttanti tat ubhayam dassetum asura senāya itiādi vuttam attanaḥ hi adhikāre
translated: In order to show both of these, “in the Asura army” is said.

original: attano rakkhāya ca appamajjanena tesaṃ idaṃ dvīsu ṭhānesu catūsu disāsu ārakkhaṭṭhapanaṃ.
analyzed: attanaḥ rakkhāya ca appamajjanena tesam idam dvīsu ṭhānesu catūsu disāsu ārakkha ṭṭhapanam
translated: and by his own non-negligence in guarding himself, he established their guarding of the four directions in two places.

original: Yañhi taṃ asurasenāya paṭisedhanatthaṃ devapure catūsu disāsu sakkassa devānamindassa🔽ārakkhaṭṭhapanaṃ, taṃ attano adhikāre appamajjanaṃ. Yaṃ pana nesaṃ bhagavato santikaṃ
analyzed: yañhi tam asura senāya paṭisedhana ttham devapure catūsu disāsu sakkassa devānamindassa  ārakkha ṭṭhapanam tam attanaḥ adhikāre appamajjanam yam pana na īsam bhagavataḥ santikam
translated: For the guarding of the four directions in the city of the gods which Sakka, Lord of the Gods, established in the four directions for the purpose of warding off the Asura army,🔽that is his own non-negligence in his own domain. But the guarding of the four directions which he established for their coming into the presence of the Exalted One,

original: upasaṅkamane catūsu disāsu ārakkhaṭṭhapanaṃ, taṃ attano katā rakkhāya appamajjanaṃ.🔽Tena vuttaṃ “asurasenāya nivāraṇattha”ntiādi. Pāḷiyaṃ catuddisanti bhummatthe upayogavacananti
analyzed: upasaṅkamane catūsu disāsu ārakkha ṭṭhapanam tam attanaḥ katāḥ rakkhāya appamajjanam  tena vuttam asura senāya nivāraṇa attha ntiādi pāḷiyam catuddisanti bhumma tthe upayoga vacananti
translated: that is his own non-negligence in the guarding of them.🔽Therefore it was said: “for the purpose of warding off the Asura army,” and so on. In the text it is said: “in the four directions,” and this is a locative case expressing location.

original: bhummavasena tadatthaṃ dassento “catūsu disāsū”ti āha. Ārakkhaṃ ṭhapetvāti vessavaṇādayo
analyzed: bhumma vasena tad attham dassento catūsu disāsu iti āha ārakkham ṭhapetvā iti vessavaṇa ādayo
translated: Showing the meaning of that by way of location, he said: “in the four directions.” Having established the guarding, the four Great Kings, Vessavaṇa, and so on,

original: cattāro mahārājāno attanā attanā rakkhitabbadisāsu ārakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā guttiṃ sammadeva
analyzed: cattāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ attanā attanā rakkhitabba disāsu ārakkham ṭhapetvā guttim sammad eva
translated: having established the guarding in the directions which they themselves should guard, having made the protection very firm,

original: vidahitvā. Balagumbaṃ ṭhapetvāti yakkhasenādisenābalasamūhaṃ ṭhapetvā. Ovaraṇaṃ ṭhapetvāti
analyzed: vidahitvā balagumbam ṭhapetvā ati yakkha senā ādi senā bala samūham ṭhapetvā ovaraṇam ṭhapetvā ati
translated: Having placed a guard: having placed a multitude of armies such as the army of the Yakkhas. Having placed a protection:

original: paṭipakkhanisedhanasamatthaṃ āvaraṇaṃ ṭhapetvā. Iti tīhi padehi yathākkamaṃ paccekaṃ🔽devanagaradvārassa anto, dvārasamīpe, dvārato bahi, disārakkhāvasanoti tividhāya
analyzed: paṭipakkha nisedhana samattham āvaraṇam ṭhapetvā iti tīhi padehi yathākkamam paccekam  deva nagara dvārassa antaḥ dvāra samīpe dvārataḥ bahi disā rakkhā vasanaḥ ti tividhāya
translated: having placed a protection capable of repelling the opposition. Thus, by the three phrases, the placing of the protection

original: rakkhāya ṭhapitabhāvo vā dīpito. Tenāha “evaṃ sakkassa…pe… katvā”ti. Satta buddhe
analyzed: rakkhāya ṭhapita bhāvaḥ vā dīpitaḥ tena āha evam sakkassape katvā ati satta buddhe
translated: is shown in three ways, namely, inside the city gate, near the gate, outside the gate, and as a protection for the regions. Therefore it is said: “Having done this to Sakka’s city, etc.”

original: ārabbhāti ettha satteva buddhe ārabbha paribandhanakāraṇaṃ mahāpadānaṭīkāyaṃ vuttanayeneva
analyzed: ārabbha ati ettha sattā iva buddhe ārabbha paribandhana kāraṇam mahā padāna ṭīkāyam vutta nayena iva
translated: With reference to the seven Buddhas: the reason for the binding should be understood in the same way as it is stated in the Mahāpadāna-aṭṭhakathā.

original: veditabbaṃ. Dhammaāṇanti dhammamayaṃ āṇaṃ, satthu dhammacakkanti attho. “Parisato
analyzed: veditabbam dhammaāṇam ti dhamma mayam āṇam satthu dhammacakkam ti attho parisataḥ
translated: The Dhamma-order: the order consisting of the Dhamma; the meaning is: the Dhamma-wheel of the Teacher. “The people of the city will be outside the assembly;

original: bāhirabhāvo, asambhogo”ti evamādiṃ idañcidañca vivajjanakaraṇaṃ karissāmāti. Sāvananti
analyzed: bāhirabhāvaḥ evamādim vivajjana karaṇam karissāma ati sāvananti
translated: there will be no association,” and so on. This and that avoidance will be done. The proclamation:

original: catunnampi parisānaṃ tikkhattuṃ parivārena anusāvanaṃ, yathā sakko devānamindo asurasenāya
analyzed: catunnam pi parisānam tikkhattum parivārena anusāvanam yathā sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ asura senāya
translated: the proclamation by the four assemblies with a triple repetition, just as Sakka, the lord of the gods, proclaimed to the army of the Asuras:

original: nivāraṇatthaṃ catūsu disāsu ārakkhaṃ ṭhapāpeti, evaṃ mahārājānopi tādise kiccavisese
analyzed: nivāraṇa attham catūsu disāsu ārakkham evam mahā rājānaḥ api tādise kicca visese
translated: and he sets up guards in the four directions to prevent them,🔽so too, great kings, in such special duties

original: attano ārakkhaṃ ṭhapenti. Imesampi hi tato sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayanti. Tena vuttaṃ “attanopī”tiādi.🔽Abhikkantāti atikkantā, vigatāti atthoti āha “khaye dissatī”ti. Teneva hi “nikkhanto🔽paṭhamo yāmo”ti anantaraṃ vuttaṃ. Abhikkantataroti ativiya kantataro. Tādiso ca sundaro
analyzed: attanaḥ ārakkham ṭhapenti imesam pi hi tatas sa āsaṅkam sa paṭibhayanti tena vuttam attanaḥ pi itiādi  abhikkantā ati atikkantā vigatā ati attho ti āha khaye dissati iti tena iva hi nikkhantaḥ  paṭhamaḥ yāmaḥ ti anantaram vuttam abhikkantataro ti ativiya kantataro tādiso ca sundaro
translated: He sets up a guard in the four directions for the purpose of protection. So too, great kings and nobles set up their own protection in such special duties. For these too are apprehensive and fearful of that. Hence it was said above, “Even the great kings and nobles” .🔽“Gone beyond”: gone beyond, departed. “Is seen in destruction”: thus it is said. For it is immediately after this that it is said, “The first watch of the night has passed” .

original: bhaddako nāma hotīti āha “sundare dissatī”ti.🔽Koti devanāgayakkhagandhabbādīsu ko katamo. Meti mama. Pādānīti pāde. Iddhiyāti imāya
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ nāma hoti iti āha sundare dissati iti  kaḥ iti deva nāga yakkha gandhabba ādīsu kaḥ katamaḥ me iti mama pādāni iti pāde iddhiyā ati imāya
translated: “More gone beyond”: gone beyond even more. And such a one is called beautiful, good. Thus it is said, “Is seen in the beautiful” .

original: evarūpāya deviddhiyā. “Yasasā”ti iminā edisena parivārena, paricchedena ca. Jalanti
analyzed: evarūpāya deviddhiyā iminā edisena parivārena paricchedena ca jalanti
translated: “Which”: which of the gods, nāgas, yakkhas, gandhabbas, etc.? “Mine”: of me. “By my power”: by this kind of divine power. “By my glory”: by such a kind of retinue and delimitation. “Shining”: shining with light.

original: vijjotamāno. Abhikkantenāti ativiya kantena kamanīyena abhirūpena. Vaṇṇenāti sarīravaṇṇanibhāya.
analyzed: vijjotamānaḥ abhikkantena ati ativiya kantena kamanīyena abhirūpena vaṇṇena ati sarīra vaṇṇa nibhāya
translated: “By the gone beyond”: by the gone beyond that is, by the beautiful, the lovely, the handsome. “By the colour”: by the complexion of the body.

original: Sabbā obhāsayaṃ disāti dasapi disā pabhāsento cando viya, sūriyo viya ca ekobhāsaṃ
analyzed: sabbā obhāsayam disā ati dasa api disā pabhāsento candaḥ viya sūriyaḥ viya ca ekobhāsam
translated: Like the moon illuminating all directions, like the sun, he makes a single radiance, a single light.🔽The meaning is: he makes a single radiance, a single light, illuminating all directions.

original: ekālokaṃ karontoti gāthāya attho. Abhirūpeti uḷārarūpe sampannarūpe. Abbhanumodaneti
analyzed: ekālokam karonto ti gāthāya attho abhirūpā iti uḷāra rūpe sampanna rūpe
translated: “Beautiful” means endowed with a very beautiful form.🔽“Praise” means approval.🔽“Here” means in the phrase “when the night had passed.”

original: sampahaṃsane. Idha panāti “abhikkantāya rattiyā”ti etasmiṃ pade. Tenāti khayapariyāyattā.
analyzed: sampahaṃsane idha panāti abhikkantāya rattiyā ati etasmin pade tenāti khaya pariyāyattā
translated: “By that” means by the term “destruction.”🔽“The base of the visible-form element, etc.”: the word “etc.” should be seen as including syllables, etc.

original: Rūpāyatanādīsūti ādi-saddena akkharādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Suvaṇṇavaṇṇoti suvaṇṇacchavīti
analyzed: rūpa āyatana ādīsu iti ādi saddena akkhara ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo suvaṇṇa vaṇṇaḥ ti suvaṇṇa chavī iti
translated: “Golden-colored” means having a golden complexion.🔽The meaning here is “complexion,” thus it is said “complexion.”

original: ayamettha atthoti āha “chaviya”nti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “kañcanasannibhattaco”ti saññūḷhāti
analyzed: ayam ettha attho ti āha chaviyanti tathā hi vuttam saññūḷhā ti
translated: For it is said: “Having a body like burnished gold.”🔽“Adorned” means bound together.

original: saṅganthitā. Vaṇṇāti guṇavaṇṇanāti āha “thutiya”nti, thomanāyanti attho. Kulavaggeti
analyzed: saṅganthitā vaṇṇā ati guṇa vaṇṇanā iti āha thutiyanti thomanāyanti kula vagge ti
translated: “Praise” means the praise of good qualities. Thus it is said “praise.” The meaning is: extolling.🔽“Family” means the categories of families such as the khattiya, etc.

original: khattiyādikulakoṭṭhāse. Tattha “accho vippasanno”tiādinā vaṇṇitabbaṭṭhena vaṇṇo,
analyzed: khattiya ādi kula koṭṭhāse tattha acchas vippasannaḥ iti ādinā vaṇṇitabba ṭṭhena vaṇṇaḥ
translated: Here, “clear and bright” is praise in the sense of what is to be praised,

original: chavi. Vaṇṇanaṭṭhena vaṇṇo, thuti. Abhitthavanaṭṭhena vaṇṇo, thuti, aññamaññaṃ asaṅkarato
analyzed: chavi vaṇṇana ṭṭhena vaṇṇo thuti abhitthavana ṭṭhena vaṇṇo thuti aññamaññam asaṅkarato
translated: complexion. “Praise” is praise in the sense of praising. “Praise” is praise in the sense of extolling. Not mixing each other,

original: vaṇṇitabbato ṭhapetabbato vaṇṇo, khattiyādikulavaggo. Vaṇṇīyati ñāpīyati etenāti
analyzed: vaṇṇitabbataḥ ṭhapetabbataḥ vaṇṇaḥ khattiya ādi kula vaggo vaṇṇīyati ñāpīyati etena ati
translated: It is a class of the Khattiya, etc., because it is to be praised and because it is to be set up.🔽It is a reason because it is what causes to be known.

original: vaṇṇo, ñāpakaṃ kāraṇaṃ. Vaṇṇanato thūlarassādibhāvena upaṭṭhānato vaṇṇo, saṇṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ñāpakam kāraṇam vaṇṇanataḥ thūla rassa ādi bhāvena upaṭṭhānataḥ vaṇṇaḥ saṇṭhānam
translated: It is shape because it appears as thick, long, etc.,

original: “Mahantaṃ khuddakaṃ, majjhima”nti vaṇṇetabbato pamāṇetabbato vaṇṇo, pamāṇaṃ. Vaṇṇīyati
analyzed: mahantam khuddakam majjhimanti vaṇṇetabbataḥ pamāṇetabbataḥ vaṇṇo pamāṇam vaṇṇīyati
translated: It is measure because it is to be measured by colour, as “large,” “small,” “medium.”🔽It is visible form because it is seen by the eye.

original: cakkhunā vivarīyatīti vaṇṇo, rūpāyatananti evaṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ atthe vaṇṇa-saddassa🔽pavatti veditabbā. Soti vaṇṇasaddo. Chaviyaṃ daṭṭhabbo rūpāyatane gayhamānassa chavimukheneva
analyzed: cakkhunā vivarīyati iti vaṇṇaḥ rūpa āyatanam ti evam tasmin tasmin atthe vaṇṇa saddassa  pavatti veditabbā sā ti vaṇṇa saddo chaviyam daṭṭhabbo rūpa āyatane gayhamānassa chavi mukhena iva
translated: The word “colour” should be understood to occur in this way in these various senses.🔽It is to be seen in the skin, because when visible form is apprehended it is apprehended only by way of the door of the skin.

original: gahetabbato. “Chavigatā pana vaṇṇadhātu eva suvaṇṇavaṇṇoti ettha vaṇṇaggahaṇena gahitā”ti apare.🔽Kevalaparipuṇṇanti ekadesampi asesetvā niravasesatova paripuṇṇanti ayamettha atthoti
analyzed: gahetabbataḥ chavi gatā pana vaṇṇa dhātu eva suvaṇṇa vaṇṇo ti ettha vaṇṇa ggahaṇena gahitā ati apare  kevala paripuṇṇanti eka desam pi a sesetvā niravasesataḥ va paripuṇṇanti ayam ettha atthaḥ ti
translated: But others say that the colour element in the skin is what is meant by “golden colour” here, and it is apprehended by the apprehension of colour.🔽Complete in every way: the meaning here is that it is complete without any deficiency, without anything lacking.

original: āha “anavasesatā attho”ti. Kevalakappāti kappa-saddo nipāto padapūraṇamattaṃ, kevalaṃ
analyzed: āha anavasesa tā attho ti kevala kappā ti kappa saddaḥ nipātaḥ pada pūraṇa mattam kevalam
translated: The word “only” is a particle here, merely filling out the line.

original: icceva attho. Kevala-saddo bahulavācīti āha “yebhuyyatā attho”ti. Keci pana “īsakaṃ
analyzed: icca iva atthaḥ kevala saddaḥ bahula vācī iti āha yebhuyyatā attho ti keci pana īsakam
translated: But some say that ‘only’ is a term for the incomplete.

original: asamattā kevalakappā”ti vadanti. Evaṃ sati anavasesattho eva kevala-saddattho siyā,
analyzed: asamattā kevalakappā ti vadanti evam sati anavasesa atthaḥ eva kevala sadda tthaḥ siyā
translated: If that is so, then the meaning of the word ‘only’ would be ‘without remainder’,

original: anatthantarena pana kappa-saddena padavaḍḍhanaṃ kataṃ kevalameva kevalakappanti.
analyzed: anattha antarena pana kappa saddena pada vaḍḍhanam katam kevalam eva kevala kappa nti
translated: but the addition of the word ‘only’ is made with the word ‘part’ which is not a different meaning, and so ‘only part’ means ‘only a firm (part)’.

original: Atha vā kappanīyatā, paññāpetabbatā kevalakappā. Abyāmissatā vijātiyena asaṅkarā
analyzed: atha vā kappanīya tā paññāpetabba tā kevalakappā a byāmissa tā vijātiyena asaṅkarā
translated: Or else, ‘only part’ means ‘that which should be made firm’, ‘that which should be made known’, ‘that which should be made manifest’, ‘that which should be made to be without remainder’, ‘that which should be made to be without a second’, ‘that which should be made to be unmixed’,

original: suddhatā. Anatirekatā taṃparamatā visesābhāvo. Kevalakappanti kevalaṃ daḷhaṃ katvāti
analyzed: suddha tā anatireka tā taṃparama tā visesa abhāvaḥ kevalam daḷham katvā ati
translated: ‘that which should be made pure’, ‘that which should be made to be without excess’, ‘that which should be made to be without another beyond it’, ‘that which should be made to be without distinction’.🔽‘Only part’ means ‘only made firm’.

original: attho. Kevalaṃ vuccati nibbānaṃ sabbasaṅkhatavivittattā. Taṃ etassa adhigataṃ atthīti🔽kevalī, sacchikatanirodho khīṇāsavo.
analyzed: atthaḥ kevalam vuccati nibbānam sabba saṅkhata vivitta ttā tam etassa adhigatam atthi iti  kevalī sacchikata nirodhaḥ khīṇa āsavaḥ
translated: The meaning is ‘only’. Nibbāna is said to be ‘only’ because it is devoid of all that is formed. He has attained that,🔽therefore he is ‘only a part-attainer’, ‘one who has realized cessation’, ‘one who has destroyed the pollutants’.

original: Kappa-saddo panāyaṃ sa-upasaggo, anupasaggo cāti adhippāyena okappaniyapade labbhamānaṃ
analyzed: kappa saddo pana ayam sa upasaggaḥ an upasaggaḥ ca ati adhippāyena okappaniya pade labbhamānam
translated: But this word ‘part’ is used with a prefix and without a prefix. With the intention of showing this, the word ‘part’ is found in the phrase ‘to be made firm’.

original: kappaniyasaddamattaṃ nidasseti, aññathā kappa-saddassa atthuddhāre okappaniyapadaṃ
analyzed: kappa niya sadda mattam nidasseti aññathā kappa saddassa attha uddhāre okappaniya padam
translated: he shows the mere sound of the word ‘kappati’, otherwise, in the explanation of the meaning of the word ‘kappa’, the word ‘okappaniya’

original: anidassanameva siyā. Samaṇakappehīti vinayakkamasiddhehi samaṇavohārehi. Niccakappanti
analyzed: a nidassanam eva siyā samaṇa kappehi iti vinaya kkama siddhehi samaṇa vohārehi niccakappanti
translated: would not be shown. By the word ‘samaṇakappehi’ is meant: by the words of the ascetic which are established by the Vinaya. By the word ‘niccakappa’

original: niccakālaṃ. Paññattīti nāmañhetaṃ tassa āyasmato, yadidaṃ kappoti. Kappitakesamassūti
analyzed: niccakālam paññattī iti tassa āyasmataḥ yat idam kappoti kappita kesa massu iti
translated: is meant: at all times. This is the name of that venerable one, that is to say, ‘kappa’. By the word ‘kappitakesamassu’ is meant:

original: kattariyā cheditakesamassu. Dvaṅgulakappoti majjhanhikavelāya vītikkantāya dvaṅgulatāvikappo.
analyzed: kattariyā chedita kesa massu dvaṅgula kappo ti majjhanhika velāya vītikkantāya dvaṅgula tā vikappo
translated: having had the hair and beard cut by a barber. By the word ‘dvaṅgulakappiya’ is meant: the measure of two fingers’ breadth after midday.

original: Lesoti apadeso. Anavasesaṃ pharituṃ samatthassa obhāsassa kenaci kāraṇena ekadesapharaṇampi
analyzed: lesaḥ ti apadesaḥ anavasesam pharitum samatthassa obhāsassa kenaci kāraṇena eka desa pharaṇam pi
translated: By the word ‘lesa’ is meant: a part. Even though the light which is able to pervade without remainder may be pervaded by some cause in one part,

original: siyā, ayaṃ pana sabbasova pharīti dassetuṃ samantattho kappa-saddo gahitoti āha “anavasesaṃ samantato”ti.
analyzed: siyā ayam pana sabbaso va phari iti dassetum samanta ttho kappa saddo gahitaḥ iti āha anavasesam samantataḥ ti
translated: this (light) is taken by the word ‘kappa’ which has the meaning of ‘all round’ in order to show that it pervades all of it, therefore it is said: “without remainder all round”.

original: Yasmā devatānaṃ sarīrappabhā dvādasayojanamattaṃ ṭhānaṃ, tato bhiyyopi pharitvā tiṭṭhati,
analyzed: yasmai devatānam sarīra ppabhā dvādasa yojana mattam ṭhānam tatas bhiyyas api pharitvā tiṭṭhati
translated: Because the radiance of the bodies of the Divinities stands in a place measuring twelve leagues, and after pervading more than that it stands,

original: tathā vatthābharaṇādīhi samuṭṭhitā pabhā, tasmā vuttaṃ “candimā viya, sūriyo viya
analyzed: tathā vattha ābharaṇa ādīhi samuṭṭhitā pabhā tasmā vuttam candimā viya sūriyaḥ viya
translated: Therefore it is said, “like the moon, like the sun,🔽and made a single radiance, a single illumination.”

original: ca ekobhāsaṃ ekaṃ pajjotaṃ karitvā”ti. Kasmā ete mahārājāno bhagavato santike nisīdiṃsu?
analyzed: ca eka ubhāsam ekam pajjotam karitvā ati kasmai ete mahā rājānaḥ bhagavataḥ santike nisīdiṃsu
translated: Why did these great kings sit down in the presence of the Blessed One?

original: Nanu yebhuyyena devatā bhagavato santikaṃ upagatā ṭhatvāva kathetabbaṃ kathentā gacchantīti?
analyzed: nanu yebhuyyena devatāḥ bhagavatoḥ santikam upagatāḥ ṭhatvā ava kathetabbam kathentā gacchanti iti
translated: Didn’t most of the deities who approached the Blessed One speak while standing?

original: Saccametaṃ, idha pana nisīdane kāraṇaṃ atthi, taṃ dassetuṃ “devatāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saccam etam idha pana nisīdane kāraṇam atthi tam dassetum devatānam ti ādi vuttaṃ
translated: That is true, but here there is a reason for sitting down, and to show that reason it is said, “of the deities,” etc.

original: “Idaṃ parittaṃ nāma sattabuddhapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ garu, tasmā na amhehi ṭhatvā gahetabba”nti
analyzed: idam parittam nāma satta buddha paṭisaṃyuttam garu tasmā na amhehi ṭhatvā gahetabbanti
translated: “This paritta is weighty, being connected with the seven Buddhas. Therefore it should not be received by us while standing.”

original: cintetvā parittagāravavasena nisīdiṃsu.
analyzed: cintetvā paritta gārava vasena nisīdiṃsu
translated: Thinking thus, they sat down out of respect for the paritta.

original: 276. Kasmā panettha vessavaṇo eva kathesi, na itaresu yo kocīti? Tattha kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha vessavaṇaḥ eva kathesi na itaresu yaḥ koci iti tattha kāraṇam dassetuṃ
translated: But why did only Vessavana speak here, and not anyone else? To show the reason for that it is said,

original: “kiñcāpī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vissāsiko abhiṇhaṃ upasaṅkamanena. Byattoti visārado, tañcassa
analyzed: kiñcā api itiādi vuttam vissāsikaḥ abhiṇham upasaṅkamanena byattaḥ ti visāradaḥ
translated: “Although,” etc. He was confident because of his frequent visits. He was bold, and he was

original: veyyattiyaṃ suṭṭhu sikkhitabhāvenāti āha “susikkhito”ti. Manussesu viya hi devesupi🔽kocideva purimajātiparicayena susikkhito hoti, tatrāpi kocideva yathādhippetamatthaṃ🔽vattuṃ samattho paripuṇṇapadabyañjanāya poriyā vācāya samannāgato. “Mahesakkhā”ti
analyzed: veyyattiyam suṭṭhu sikkhita bhāvena ati āha su sikkhitaḥ ti manussesu viya hi devesu pi  kocid eva purima jāti paricayena su sikkhitaḥ hoti tatra api kocid eva yathā adhippetam attham  vattum samatthaḥ paripuṇṇa pada byañjanāya poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ mahesakkhā ati
translated: He is well trained in the art of speaking, in the sense of being well trained in the art of speaking well. For just as among human beings,🔽so among the gods too, there are some who are well trained by virtue of their previous births. Among them too, there are some who are able to speak on the subject as intended,🔽who are endowed with the correct words and syllables of the Pāli language. “Of great influence” means🔽

original: imassa atthavacanaṃ “ānubhāvasampannā”ti, mahesakkhāti vā mahāparivārāti attho. Pāṇātipāte🔽ādīnavadassaneneva taṃ vipariyāyato tato veramaṇiyaṃ ānisaṃso pākaṭo hotīti “ādīnavaṃ🔽dassetvā” icceva vuttaṃ. Tesu senāsanesūti yāni “araññavanappatthānī”tiādinā vuttāni🔽bhikkhūnaṃ vasanaṭṭhānabhūtāni araññāyatanāni, tesu bhikkhūhi sayitabbato, āsitabbato
analyzed: imassa attha vacanam ānubhāva sampannā ati mahesakkhā ati vā mahā parivārā ati attho pāṇātipāte  ādīnava dassanena iva tam vipariyāyataḥ tatas veramaṇiyam ānisaṃsaḥ pākaṭaḥ hoti iti ādīnavam  dassetvā iccā iva vuttam tesu senāsanesu iti yāni arañña vana ppatthāni iti ādinā vuttāni  bhikkhūnam vasana ṭṭhāna bhūtāni arañña āyatanāni tesu bhikkhūhi sayitabbataḥ āsitabbataḥ
translated: He is well trained in the sense that he is well trained in the duties of a deity. “Well trained” means that he is well trained in the duties of a deity. For just as among human beings there are some who are well trained by virtue of their previous practice, so too among the deities there are some who are well trained. And among them, too, there are some who are able to speak on the subject as intended, who are endowed with the correct words and phrases. “Powerful” is a synonym for “influential.” Or else “powerful” means “having a great retinue.”🔽The danger in killing living beings is evident by the mere fact that it is prohibited. The benefit in refraining from killing is evident by the mere fact that it is enjoined. Therefore the Exalted One said, “having shown the danger in killing living beings.”🔽Among the abodes of beings means among the forest abodes, etc., which are the dwelling places of the bhikkhus, as stated in the passage beginning, “The forest … a lodging at the foot of a tree” . They are called “abodes” because the bhikkhus lie down and sit there.

original: ca senāsanasaññitesu. Nibaddhavāsinoti rukkhapabbatapaṭibaddhesu vimānesu niccavāsitāya
analyzed: ca senāsana saññitesu nibaddha vāsinaḥ ti rukkha pabbata paṭibaddhesu vimānesu nicca vāsi tāya
translated: The deities who are bound to a particular tree or rock or cave are called “dwellers in a fixed abode.”

original: nibaddhavāsino. Baddhattāti gāthābhāvena ganthitattā sambandhitattā.
analyzed: nibaddha vāsinaḥ baddha ttā ati gāthā bhāvena ganthi tattā sambandhi tattā
translated: and the residents of the city. “The binding” : by way of the verse, the binding together, the connection.

original: “Uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā”ti attanā vuccamānaṃ parittaṃ bhagavantaṃ uggaṇhāpetukāmo
analyzed: uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā ati attanā vuccamānam parittam bhagavantam uggaṇhā petu kāmaḥ
translated: “May the Blessed One learn it” : wishing to have the Blessed One learn the protection which he himself was reciting,

original: vessavaṇo avocāti adhippāyena codako “kiṃ pana bhagavato appaccakkhadhammo nāma atthī”ti
analyzed: vessavaṇaḥ avoca ati adhippāyena codakaḥ kim pana bhagavataḥ appaccakkha dhammo nāma atthi iti
translated: Vessavana said. The accuser, with the intention of saying, “But is there anything not directly known to the Blessed One?”

original: codesi. Ācariyo sabbattha appaṭihatañāṇacārassa bhagavato na kiñci appaccakkhanti
analyzed: codesi ācariyaḥ sabbattha appaṭihata ñāṇa cārassa bhagavataḥ na kiñci
translated: accuses. The teacher, showing that there is nothing not directly known to the Blessed One whose knowledge and deeds are unobstructed,

original: dassento “natthī”ti vatvā “uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā”ti vadato vessavaṇassa adhippāyaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ natthi iti vatvā uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā ati vadataḥ vessavaṇassa adhippāyam
translated: says, “No.” Then, in order to reveal the intention of Vessavana who says, “May the Blessed One learn it,”

original: vivaranto “okāsakaraṇattha”ntiādimāha. Yathā hi pañcasikho gandhabbadevaputto devānaṃ
analyzed: vivarantaḥ okāsa karaṇa ttha nti ādim āha yathā hi pañcasikhaḥ gandhabbadeva putto devānam
translated: he says, “For the purpose of making a place,” etc. For just as the gandhabba deity Pancasikha,

original: tāvatiṃsānaṃ, brahmuno ca sanaṅkumārassa sammukhā attano yathāsutaṃ dhammaṃ bhagavato
analyzed: tāvatiṃsānam brahmuno ca sanaṅkumārassa sammukhāḥ attanaḥ yathāsutam dhammam bhagavataḥ
translated: having gone to the Blessed One and announced to him in the presence of the Thirty-three gods and Brahma Sanaṅkumara the Dhamma which he had heard

original: santikaṃ upagantvā pavedeti, evamayampi mahārājā itarehi saddhiṃ āṭānāṭanagare gāthāvasena
analyzed: santikam upagantvā evam ayam pi mahā rājā itarehi saddhim āṭānāṭa nagare gāthā vasena
translated: from them, so this great king, together with the others, in the city of Atana, by way of the verse,

original: bandhitaṃ parittaṃ bhagavato pavedetuṃ okāsaṃ kārento “uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā”ti🔽āha, na naṃ tassa pariyāpuṇane niyojento. Tasmā uggaṇhātūti yathidaṃ parittaṃ mayā🔽paveditamattameva hutvā catunnaṃ parisānaṃ cirakālaṃ hitāvahaṃ hoti, evaṃ uddhaṃ🔽ārakkhāya gaṇhātu, sampaṭicchatūti attho. Satthu kathiteti satthu ārocite, catunnaṃ
analyzed: bandhitam parittam bhagavataḥ pavedetum okāsam kārentaḥ uggaṇhātu bhante bhagavā ati  āha na nam tassa pariyāpuṇane niyojentaḥ tasmai uggaṇhātu uti yathā idam parittam mayā  pavedita mattam eva hutvā catunnam parisānam cirakālam hita āvaham hoti evam  ārakkhāya gaṇhātu sampaṭicchatu uti attho satthu kathitā iti satthu ārocite catunnam
translated: and he said, “May the Blessed One learn it,” not urging him to master it. Therefore “May the Blessed One learn it” means “May he take it up for the sake of protection above, so that it may be for the welfare of the four assemblies for a long time, just as it has been for me by merely being told.” The meaning is: “May he consent to it.” When the Blessed One had spoken: when the Blessed One had announced it,

original: parisānaṃ satthu kathane vāti attho. Sukhavihārāyāti yakkhādīhi avihiṃsāya laddhabbasukhavihārāya.
analyzed: parisānam satthu kathane vā ti attho sukha vihārāya ati yakkha ādīhi avihiṃsāya laddhabba sukha vihārāya
translated: and he said, “Let the Blessed One learn it,” not urging him to master it. Therefore the meaning of “Let him learn it” is this: “As this safeguard, which I have merely recited, will be for the welfare and welfare of the four assemblies for a long time, let him take it up for the protection of the future, let him consent to it.” “When it is recited by the Master”: when it is recited by the Master, the meaning is. “When it is recited by the four assemblies.” “For the sake of a pleasant abiding”: for the sake of a pleasant abiding without molestation by demons, etc.

original: 277. Sattapi buddhā cakkhumanto pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhumabhāve visesābhāvato. Tasmāti
analyzed: buddhā cakkhumanto pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhuma bhāve visesa abhāvato tasmā iti
translated: The seven Enlightened Ones, the Visionary Ones, are equal in the quality of vision because of the absence of any distinction in the five kinds of vision. Therefore,

original: yasmā cakkhumabhāvo viya sabbabhūtānukampitādayo sabbepi visesā sattannampi buddhānaṃ
analyzed: yasmā cakkhuma bhāvaḥ viya sabba bhūta anukampita ādayo sabbe pi visesā sattannam pi buddhānam
translated: since the quality of vision and all the other distinctions, such as compassion for all beings, are common to all the seven Buddhas,

original: sādhāraṇā, tasmā, guṇanemittakāneva vā yasmā buddhānaṃ nāmāni nāma, na liṅgikāvatthikayādicchakāni,
analyzed: tasmai vā yasmai buddhānam nāmāni nāma na
translated: the names of the Enlightened Ones are the causes of their special qualities, not names formed according to the rules of grammar.

original: tasmā buddhānaṃ guṇavisesadīpanāni “cakkhumantassā”tiādinā vuttāni etāni ekekassa
analyzed: tasmā buddhānam guṇa visesa dīpanāni cakkhumantassa ati ādinā vuttāni etāni ekekassa
translated: Therefore, the names beginning with “The Enlightened One” are given in order to show the special qualities of the Buddhas.🔽Each of these names is the name of one of the seven Buddhas.

original: satta satta nāmāni honti. Tesaṃ nāmānaṃ sādhāraṇabhāvaṃ atthavasena yojetabbāti dassetuṃ
analyzed: satta satta nāmāni honti tesam nāmānam sādhāraṇa bhāvam attha vasena yojetabbā iti dassetuṃ
translated: The commonness of these names should be understood according to the meaning.

original: “sabbepī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sabbabhūtānukampinoti anaññasādhāraṇamahākaruṇāya sabbasattānaṃ
analyzed: sabbe pi itiādi vuttam sabba bhūta anukampinaḥ ti anañña sādhāraṇa mahā karuṇāya sabba sattānam
translated: “All beings” means all living beings. “Compassionate” means having great compassion not shared by others, which is the cause of the arising of the thought of enlightenment.

original: anukampikā. Nhātakilesattāti aṭṭhaṅgikena ariyamaggajalena saparasantānesu niravasesato🔽dhotakilesamalattā. Mārasenāpamaddinoti saparivāre pañcapi māre pamadditavanto. Vusitavantoti
analyzed: anukampikā nhāta kilesa ttā ti aṭṭhaṅgikena ariya magga jalena sa para santānesu niravasesato  sa parivāre māra senā pamaddinoti sa parivāre māre pamadditavantaḥ vusitavantaḥ iti
translated: “Cleansed of defilements” means cleansed of all defilements without exception by the water of the eight-factored noble path in the mental continuities of all beings.

original: maggabrahmacariyavāsaṃ, dasavidhaṃ ariyavāsañca vusitavanto. Vusitavantatāya eva
analyzed: magga brahmacariya vāsam dasavidham ariya vāsam ca vusitavantaḥ vusitavanta tāyai eva
translated: “Vanquisher of Mara’s army” means one who has vanquished the five Maras together with their retinue. “Accomplished” means accomplished in the life of purity of the path and in the tenfold noble life.

original: bāhitapāpatā vuttā hotīti “brāhmaṇassā”ti padaṃ anāmaṭṭhaṃ. Vimuttāti anaññasādhāraṇānaṃ
analyzed: bāhitapāpatā vuttā hoti iti brāhmaṇassa ati padam vimuttā ati
translated: Because of being accomplished, he is said to be “one who has put away evil.”

original: pañcannampi vimuttīnaṃ vasena niravasesato muttā. Aṅgatoti sarīraṅgato, ñāṇaṅgato
analyzed: pañcannam api vimuttīnam vasena niravasesataḥ muttāḥ aṅgataḥ ti sarīra aṅgataḥ ñāṇa aṅgataḥ
translated: “Liberated” means liberated in every way by means of the five kinds of liberation not shared by others. “In every way” means in every part of the body and in every way by means of knowledge.

original: ca, dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇa- asītianubyañjanehi nikkhamanappabhā, byāmappabhā,
analyzed: ca dvattiṃsa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa asīti anubyañjanehi nikkhamana ppabhā byāma ppabhā
translated: and the thirty-two marks of a Great Man and the eighty minor characteristics, the radiance that issues from the body, the radiance that spreads out,

original: ketumālāuṇhīsappabhā ca sarīraṅgato nikkhamanakarasmiyo, yamakamahāpāṭihāriyādīsu
analyzed: ketumālā auṇhīsappabhā ca sarīraṅgataḥ nikkhamanaka rasmiyaḥ yamaka mahāpāṭihāriya ādīsu
translated: the radiance of the crest and the halo, and the radiance that issues from the knowledge of the twin miracle, etc.,

original: uppajjanakappabhā ñāṇaṅgato nikkhamanakarasmiyo. Na etāneva “cakkhumā”tiādinā vuttāni🔽satta nāmāni, atha kho aññānipi bahūni aparimitāni nāmāni. Kathanti āha “asaṅkhyeyyāni
analyzed: uppajjanaka ppabhāḥ ñāṇa aṅgataḥ nikkhamanaka rasmiyaḥ na etān eva cakkhumā iti ādinā vuttāni  satta nāmāni atha kho aññāni api bahūni aparimitāni nāmāni kathanti āha asaṅkhyeyyāni
translated: are the radiance of the body. The seven names beginning with “The Visionary” are not the only names of the Great Man.🔽There are many other names besides, countless in number. How so? “It is said that the names of the Great Man together with his special qualities are beyond number.”

original: nāmāni saguṇena mahesinoti vutta”nti. Kena vuttaṃ? Dhammasenāpatinā.
analyzed: nāmāni saguṇena mahesino ti vuttanti kena vuttam dhammasenāpatinā
translated: By whom is it said? By the General of the Dhamma .

original: Yadi evaṃ kasmā vessavaṇo etāneva gaṇhīti āha “attano pākaṭanāmavasenā”ti. Khīṇāsavā🔽janāti adhippetā. Te hi kammakilesehi jātāpi evaṃ na puna jāyissantīti iminā atthena
analyzed: yadi evam kasmai vessavaṇaḥ etān eva gaṇhi iti āha attanaḥ pākaṭa nāma vasena ati khīṇa āsavā  janāti adhippetā te hi kamma kilesehi jātā api evam na puna jāyissanti iti iminā atthena
translated: If that is so, why did Vessavaṇa take only these names? “According to his own well-known name.”🔽The term “people” refers to those who are free from cankers . Although they are born by way of kamma and defilements, they are not born again in this way. This is the meaning of “people.”

original: janā. Yathāha “yo ca kālaghaso bhūto”ti desanāsīsamattanti nidassanamattanti attho,
analyzed: janāḥ yathā āha yaḥ ca kāla ghasaḥ bhūtaḥ ti attho
translated: As it is said: “The one who has become the destroyer of time” .🔽The peak of the teaching: the meaning is “the mere illustration.”

original: avayavena vā samudāyupalakkhaṇametaṃ. Sati ca pisuṇavācappahāne pharusavācā pahīnāva
analyzed: avayavena vā samudāya upalakkhaṇam etam sati ca pisuṇa vāca pahāne pharusa vācā
translated: Or else the characteristic of a collection is a part. And when there is abstention from malicious speech, there is also abstention from harsh speech,🔽not to speak of abstention from false speech. So it is said: “They are not malicious.”

original: hoti, pageva ca musāvādoti “apisuṇā” icceva vuttā. Mahattāti mahā attā sabhāvo etesanti
analyzed: hoti pagā iva ca musāvādo ti apisuṇāḥ iccā iva vuttāḥ mahattā ati mahā attā sabhāvaḥ etesan ti
translated: They have a great self, a great nature, thus they are

original: mahattā. Tenāha “mahantabhāvaṃ pattā”ti. Mahantāti vā mahā antā, parinibbānapariyosānāti
analyzed: mahattā tena āha mahanta bhāvam pattā ati mahantā ati vā mahā antā parinibbāna pariyosānā ti
translated: great. Hence it is said: “They have attained greatness.” Or else they are great because they have a great end, their end is final Nibbāna, is what is meant.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Mahantehi vā sīlādīhi samannāgatā. Ayaṃ tāva aṭṭhakathāyaṃ āgatanayena
analyzed: vuttam hoti mahantehi vā sīla ādīhi samannāgatā ayam tāva aṭṭhakathā ayam āgata nayena
translated: Or else they are endowed with great virtue, etc. This is the meaning according to the method of the commentary.

original: attho. Itaresaṃ pana matena buddhādīhi ariyehi mahanīyato pūjanīyato mahaṃ nāma nibbānaṃ,🔽mahamanto etesanti mahantā, nibbānadiṭṭhāti attho. Nissāradāti sārajjarahitā, nibbhayāti
analyzed: atthaḥ itaresam pana matena buddha ādīhi ariyehi mahanīyato pūjanīyato maham nāma nibbānam  mahamantaḥ etesanti mahantā nibbāna diṭṭhā ti attho nissāra dā ati sārajja rahitā nibbhayā ati
translated: But according to the other method, Nibbāna is called great because it is to be revered by the noble ones, the Buddhas, etc., and because it is to be honoured.🔽They have the great, thus they are great, that is, they have seen Nibbāna, is the meaning.

original: attho. Tenāha “vigatalomahaṃsā”ti.
analyzed: tena āha vigata loma haṃsā iti
translated: They are fearless, free from fear and trembling, is the meaning. Hence it is said: “They are free from horripilation.”

original: Hitanti hitacittaṃ, sattānaṃ hitesīti attho. Yathābhūtaṃ vipassisunti pañcupādānakkhandhesu
analyzed: hitam ti hita cittam sattānam hitesī iti atthaḥ yathābhūtam vipassisuḥ ti pañca upādānakkhandhesu
translated: They are beneficent, they have a beneficent mind, they are benefactors of beings, is the meaning. They have seen the five aggregates as they really are,

original: samudayādito yāthāvato vividhenākārena passiṃsu. “Ye cāpī”ti pubbe paccattabahuvacanena
analyzed: samudaya āditaḥ yāthāvataḥ vividhena ākārena passiṃsu ye ca api iti pubbe paccatta bahuvacanena
translated: they saw in accordance with reality, in various ways, from the beginning. “Those who” is a plural,

original: aniyamato vutte tesampīti atthaṃ sampadānabahuvacanavasena niyametvā “namatthū”ti
analyzed: aniyamataḥ vutte tesam pi iti attham sampadāna bahuvacana vasena niyametvā
translated: but it is not definite. In order to make it definite by means of the plural of inclusion, the word “they” is brought in,

original: ca padaṃ ānetvā yojeti yaṃ taṃ-saddānaṃ abyabhicāritasambandhabhāvato. Vipassiṃsu
analyzed: ca padam ānetvā yoja iti yam abyabhicārita sambandha bhāvataḥ vipassiṃsu
translated: because of the invariable connection between the words “yaṃ” and “te.” The construction is: “They who”

original: namassantīti vā yojanā. Paṭhamagāthāyāti “ye cāpi nibbutā loke”ti evaṃ vuttagāthāya.
analyzed: namassanti iti vā yojanā paṭhama gāthāya ati ye ca api nibbutāḥ loke iti evam vutta gāthāya
translated: or “they who worshipped.” In the first verse: in the verse stated thus: “Those who have attained Nibbāna in the world.”

original: Dutiyagāthāyāti tadantaragāthāya. Tattha desanāmukhamattanti itaresampi buddhānaṃ
analyzed: dutiya gāthāya ati tad antara gāthāya tattha itaresam pi buddhānam
translated: In the second verse: in the intermediate verse. Herein, the mere beginning of the teaching: when the names of the other Buddhas

original: nāmaggahaṇe patte imasseva bhagavato nāmaggahaṇaṃ tathā desanāya mukhamattaṃ, tasmā
analyzed: nāma ggahaṇe patte imassa iva bhagavataḥ nāma ggahaṇam tathā desanāya mukha mattam tasmā
translated: are mentioned, the mention of the name of this Blessed One is the mere beginning of the teaching in the same way, therefore

original: tepi atthato gahitā evāti adhippāyo. Tenāha “ayampi hī”tiādi. Tattha ayanti ayaṃ
analyzed: te pi atthataḥ gahitāḥ evā ti adhippāyaḥ tena āha ayam pi hi itiādi tattha ayanti ayam
translated: the meaning of those (other Buddhas) is included. This is the intention. Therefore he said “this verse,” etc. Herein, this: this

original: gāthā. Purimayojanāyaṃ tassāti visesitabbatāya abhāvato “yanti nipātamatta”nti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: gāthā purima yojanā ayam tassa ati visesitabba tāya abhāvataḥ yanti nipāta mattan ti vuttam
translated: verse. In the first construction, because of the absence of anything to be distinguished, it is said: “the word ‘yaṃ’ is merely a🔽particle.”

original: idha pana “tassa namatthū”ti evaṃ sambandhassa ca icchitattā “ya”nti nāmapadaṃ upayogekavacananti
analyzed: idha pana tassa evam sambandhassa ca icchita ttā yanti nāmapadam upayoga ekavacanam ti
translated: But here, since the connection is wanted in the way beginning “To him homage,” the word “who” is a name-declensional-word in the sense of “use” .

original: dassento “yaṃ namassanti gotama”nti āha.
analyzed: dassentaḥ yam namassanti gotaman ti āha
translated: Showing this, he said “To whom the Yakkhas pay homage, Gotama” .

original: 278. “Yato uggacchati sūriyo”tiādikaṃ kasmā āraddhaṃ? Yaṃ ye yakkhādayo satthu dhammaāṇaṃ,
analyzed: yatas uggacchati sūriya uti ādikam kasmai āraddham yam ye yakkha ādayo
translated: Why did he begin with “From where the sun arises” , etc.? Those who, namely, the Yakkhas, etc., do not accept the Master’s teaching

original: attano ca rājāṇaṃ nādiyanti, tesaṃ “idañcidañca niggahaṃ karissāmā”ti sāvanaṃ kātukāmā
analyzed: attano ca rājāṇam na ādiyanti tesam idam ca idam ca niggaham karissāma ati sāvanam kātu kāmā
translated: and do not accept their own king, when they want to make a proclamation in order to carry out a suppression here and there,

original: tattha tattha dvisahassaparittadīpaparivāresu catūsu mahādīpesu attano āṇāya vattānaṃ
analyzed: tattha tattha dvi sahassa paritta dīpa parivāresu catūsu mahā dīpesu attanaḥ āṇāya vattānam
translated: in the four great continents surrounded by the Dviṭṭhaṃsa and Dīpaṃsa oceans, of those who are under their own king’s rule,🔽of their own sons, and of the twenty-eight Yakkha generals, etc.,

original: attano puttānaṃ, aṭṭhavīsatiyā yakkhasenāpatiādīnañca satthari pasādagāravabahumānañca🔽pavedetvā niggahārahānaṃ santajjanatthaṃ āraddhaṃ. Tattha “yato uggacchatī”tiādīsu
analyzed: attano puttānam aṭṭhavīsatiyā yakkha senāpati ādīnam ca satthari pasāda gārava bahu mānam ca  pavedetvā niggahāra hānam āraddham tattha yatas uggacchati iti ādīsu
translated: and to make known their own faith, respect, and high esteem for the Master,🔽and to frighten those who are to be suppressed, he began with “From where the sun arises” , etc. Herein, in the passage beginning “From where the sun arises” ,

original: “yato ṭhānato udetī”ti vuccati, kuto pana ṭhānato udetīti vuccati? Pubbavidehavāsīnaṃ
analyzed: yatas ṭhānataḥ udeti iti vuccati kutas pana ṭhānataḥ udeti iti vuccati pubbavideha vāsīnam
translated: it is said “From what place does it rise?” But from what place is it said to rise? It is said to rise from the east,

original: tāva majjhanhikaṭṭhāne ṭhito jambudīpavāsīnaṃ udetīti vuccati, uttarakurukānaṃ pana
analyzed: tāva majjhanhika ṭṭhāne ṭhitaḥ jambudīpa vāsīnam udeti iti vuccati uttarakurukānam pana
translated: He is said to “rise” for those in Jambudīpa while he is still in the middle of the sky.

original: oggacchatīti iminā nayena sesadīpesupi sūriyassa uggacchanoggacchanapariyāyo veditabbo.
analyzed: oggacchati iti iminā nayena sesa dīpesu pi sūriyassa uggacchana uggacchana pariyāyaḥ veditabbo
translated: But for those in Uttarakuru he is said to “set.” The way in which the sun rises and sets in the other continents should be understood in the same way.🔽This matter has already been explained in the commentary to the Aggivacchagotta Sutta .

original: Ayañca attho heṭṭhā aggaññasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ pakāsito eva. Aditiyā puttoti lokasamudācāravasena
analyzed: ayam ca atthaḥ heṭṭhā aggañña sutta vaṇṇanāyam pakāsitaḥ eva aditiyā putto ti loka samudācāra vasena
translated: The son of Aditi: this is said according to worldly usage.

original: vuttaṃ. Lokiyā hi deve aditiyā puttā, asure atithiyā puttāti vadanti. Ādippanato
analyzed: vuttam lokiyāḥ hi deve aditiyā puttāḥ asure atithiyā puttā ati vadanti ādippanato
translated: For worldly people say that the gods are the sons of Aditi and the asuras the sons of Diti.

original: pana ādicco, ekappahāreneva tīsu dīpesu ālokavidaṃsanena samujjalanatoti attho. Maṇḍalīti
analyzed: pana ādiccaḥ eka pahārena iva tīsu dīpesu āloka vidaṃsanena samujjalanato ti attho maṇḍalī iti
translated: But the sun is so called because it shines forth , the meaning being that it illuminates the three continents with its light all at once.

original: ettha ī-kāro bhusatthoti āha “mahantaṃ maṇḍalaṃ assāti maṇḍalī”ti. Mahantaṃ hissa🔽vimānamaṇḍalaṃ paññāsayojanāyāmavitthārato. “Saṃvarīpi nirujjhatī”ti imināva divasopi
analyzed: ettha īkāraḥ bhusattho ti āha mahantam maṇḍalam assa ati maṇḍalī iti mahantam hissa  vimāna maṇḍalam paññāsa yojana āyāma vitthārato nirujjhati iti
translated: The sun is called “the disk” : the syllable ī in the Pāli word maṇḍala is a particle meaning “great.”🔽The meaning is that its great celestial disk is fifty leagues in extent.

original: jāyatīti ayampi attho vuttoti veditabbo. Ratti antaradhāyatīti sinerupacchāyālakkhaṇassa
analyzed: jāyati iti ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ ti veditabbaḥ
translated: “The night ends” : by this it should be understood that the day also comes into existence.🔽“The night disappears” : the meaning is that the night disappears, having the characteristic of the shadow of Sineru.

original: andhakārassa vigacchanato.🔽Udakarahadoti jaladhi. “Tasmiṃ ṭhāne”ti idaṃ puratthimasamuddassa uparibhāgena sūriyassa🔽gamanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tathā hi jambudīpe ṭhitānaṃ puratthimasamuddato sūriyo uggacchanto🔽viya upaṭṭhāti. Tenāha “yato uggacchati sūriyo”ti. Samuddanaṭṭhena attani patitassa
analyzed: andhakārassa vigacchanataḥ  udakarahado ti jaladhi tasmim ṭhāne ti idam puratthima samuddassa upari bhāgena sūriyassa  gamanam sandhāya vuttam tathā hi jambudīpe ṭhitānam puratthima samuddataḥ sūriyaḥ uggacchantaḥ  viyaḥ upaṭṭhāti tena āha yatas uggacchati sūriyaḥ iti samudda naṭṭhena attani patitassa
translated: and the darkness disappears.

original: sammadeva, sabbaso ca undanaṭṭhena kiledanaṭṭhena samuddo. Samuddo hi kiledanaṭṭho
analyzed: sammad eva sabbaso ca undana ṭṭhena kiledana ṭṭhena samuddaḥ samuddaḥ hi kiledana ṭṭhaḥ
translated: The ocean is the great ocean. “In that place” is said in reference to the sun’s movement above the eastern ocean. For the sun rises as if from the eastern ocean for those standing in Jambudīpa. Therefore it is said: “where the sun rises.” The ocean is so called because it is a great mass of water, because it is a great mass of water that has fallen on itself, and because it is a great mass of water that has been churned up. For the ocean is a great mass of water that has fallen on itself, a great mass of water that has been churned up, and a great mass of water that has been mixed up. It is a great mass of water that has fallen on itself because it is a great mass of water that has fallen on itself. It is a great mass of water that has been churned up because it is a great mass of water that has been churned up. It is a great mass of water that has been mixed up because it is a great mass of water that has been mixed up.

original: rahado. Sāritodakoti anekāni yojanasahassāni vitthiṇṇodako, saritā nadiyo udake etassāti vā saritodako.
analyzed: rahadaḥ sārita udakaḥ ti anekāni yojana sahassāni vitthiṇṇa udakaḥ saritā nadiyaḥ udake etassa ati vā sarita udakaḥ
translated: The water-bearer is the great ocean. It is a water-bearer because it bears water. It is a water-bearer because it bears water.

original: Sinerupabbatarājā cakkavāḷassa vemajjhe ṭhito, taṃ padhānaṃ katvā vattabbanti adhippāyena
analyzed: sineru pabbata rājā cakkavāḷassa vemajjhe ṭhitaḥ tam padhānam katvā vattabbanti adhippāyena
translated: The king of mountains, Sineru, stands in the middle of the world-sphere. With the intention of saying that,

original: “itoti sineruto”ti vatvā tathā pana disāvavatthānaṃ anavaṭṭhitanti “tesaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānato
analyzed: itas iti vatvā tathā pana disāvavatthānam anavaṭṭhitanti tesam nisinna ṭṭhānato
translated: having said “from here, from Sineru,” he did not specify the directions in that way.

original: vā”ti vuttaṃ. Tesanti catunnaṃ mahārājānaṃ. Nisinnaṭṭhānaṃ āṭānāṭanagaraṃ. Tattha
analyzed: vā ti vuttam tesam ti catunnam mahā rājānam nisinna ṭhānam āṭānāṭa nagaram tattha
translated: “They” are the Four Great Kings. The “place where they sit” is the city of Āṭānāṭa.

original: hi nisinnā te imaṃ parittaṃ bandhiṃsu. Tesaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānatoti vā satthu santike
analyzed: hi nisinnā te imam parittam bandhiṃsu tesam nisinna ṭṭhānataḥ ti vā satthu santike
translated: For it was there that they sat down and bound this protection. “From their sitting place” means

original: tesaṃ nisinnaṭṭhānato. Ubhayathāpi sūriyassa udayaṭṭhānā puratthimā disā nāma hoti.
analyzed: tesam nisinna ṭṭhānato ubhayathā api sūriyassa udaya ṭṭhānā puratthimā disā nāma hoti
translated: from their sitting place in the presence of the Teacher. In both cases the eastern direction is the direction of the rising sun.

original: Purimapakkhaṃyevettha vaṇṇenti. Tena vuttaṃ “ito sā purimā disā”ti. Sūriyo, pana
analyzed: purima pakkham yeva ittha vaṇṇenti tena vuttam itas sā purimā disā ati sūriyaḥ pana
translated: Here they explain the first fortnight only. Therefore it is said, “This is the eastern direction from here.” But the sun

original: candanakkhattādayo ca sineruṃ dakkhiṇato, cakkavāḷapabbatañca vāmato katvā parivattenti.
analyzed: candanakkhatta ādayo ca sinerum dakkhiṇatas cakkavāḷa pabbatam ca vāmatas katvā parivattenti
translated: and the moon and the stars revolve with Sineru to the south and the Cakkavāḷa mountain to the left.

original: Yattha ca nesaṃ uggamanaṃ paññāyati, sā puratthimā disā. Yattha okkamanaṃ paññāyati,
analyzed: yattha ca nesam uggamanam paññāyati sā puratthimā disā yattha okkamanam paññāyati
translated: The direction in which their rising is seen is the eastern direction. The direction in which their setting is seen is the

original: sā pacchimā disā. Dakkhiṇapasse uttarā disā, vāmapasse dakkhiṇā disāti catumahādīpavāsīnaṃ
analyzed: sā pacchimā disā dakkhiṇa passe uttarā disā vāma passe dakkhiṇā disā ati catu mahā dīpa vāsīnam
translated: western direction. The direction to the south is the southern direction, and the direction to the left is the northern direction.🔽In the case of the inhabitants of the four great continents, Sineru is in the north, etc., and therefore the directions are not fixed.

original: paccekaṃ sineru uttarādisāyameva, tasmā anavaṭṭhitā disāvavatthāti āha “iti naṃ ācikkhati
analyzed: paccekam sineru uttarādisāyam eva tasmai an avaṭṭhitā āha iti nam ācikkhati
translated: Therefore it is said, “He describes it thus:

original: jano”ti. Yaṃ disanti yaṃ puratthimadisaṃ yasassīti mahāparivāro. Koṭisatasahassaparimāṇā🔽hi devatā abhiṇhaṃ parivārenti. Candananāgarukkhādīsu osadhitiṇavanappatisugandhānaṃ
analyzed: janoti yam yam puratthima disam yasassī iti mahā parivāraḥ koṭi sata sahassa parimāṇā  hi devatāḥ abhiṇham parivārenti candana nāga rukkha ādīsu osadhi tiṇa vanappati sugandhānam
translated: “People” : the people of the East. “Famous” : he had a great retinue. Deities numbering in the hundreds of thousands of koṭis🔽constantly attended on him. Because of the spreading of the sweet scents of medicinal herbs, grasses, and forest trees such as the sandalwood and the nāga tree,

original: abbanato, tehi dittabhāvūpagamanato “gandhabbā”ti laddhanāmānaṃ cātumahārājikadevānaṃ
analyzed: abbanataḥ tehi ditta bhāva upagamanataḥ gandhabbā ati laddha nāmānam cātumahārājika devānam
translated: and because of his acceptance of the offerings made by them, he was called “Gandhabba” . He was the overlord of the deities of the Four Great Kings.

original: adhipati bhāvato. Me sutanti ettha meti nipātamattaṃ. Sutanti vissutanti attho. Ayañhettha
analyzed: adhipati bhāvataḥ me sutanti ettha mā iti nipāta mattam sutanti vissutanti atthaḥ ayam ha ittha
translated: “I have heard” : here the word “I” is merely a particle. The meaning is “it is well known.” This is the construction here:

original: yojanā – tassa dhataraṭṭhamahārājassa puttāpi bahavo. Kittakā? Asīti, dasa eko ca.
analyzed: yojanā tassa dhataraṭṭha mahā rājassa puttāḥ api bahavaḥ kittakāḥ asīti dasa ekaḥ ca
translated: That Great King Dhataraṭṭha had many sons. How many? Eighty, ten, and one.

original: Ekanāmā. Kathaṃ? Indanāmā. “Mahapphalā”ti ca sutaṃ vissutametaṃ loketi.🔽Ādicco gotamagotto, bhagavāpi gotamagotto, ādiccena samānagottatāya ādicco bandhu
analyzed: eka nāmā katham inda nāmā ca sutam vissutam etam loka iti  ādiccaḥ gotama gottaḥ bhagavā api gotama gottaḥ ādiccena samāna gotta tāya ādiccaḥ bandhu
translated: They were all named “Inda.” “Mahapphalā” is well known and famous in the world.🔽The sun is of the Gotama clan, and the Exalted One is also of the Gotama clan. Because he has the same clan as the sun, he is the sun’s kinsman.

original: etassātipi ādiccabandhu, ādiccassa vā bandhūti ādiccabandhu, taṃ ādiccabandhunaṃ.
analyzed: ādiccabandhu ādiccassa vā bandhu iti ādiccabandhu tam ādiccabandhunam
translated: Or he is the kinsman of the sun’s kinsman, the sun’s friend.

original: Anavajjenāti avajjapaṭipakkhena brahmavihārena. Samekkhasi odhiso, anodhiso ca pharaṇena🔽olokesiāsayānusayacariyādhimuttiādivibhāgāvabodhavasena. Vatvā vandantīti “lokassa
analyzed: anavajjena ati avajja paṭipakkhena brahmavihārena samekkhasi odhisaḥ anodhisaḥ ca pharaṇena  olokesi āsaya anusaya cariyā adhimutti ādi vibhāga avabodha vasena vatvā vandanti iti lokassa
translated: “You look with equanimity upon the high and the low” : by means of the equanimity of the fourth jhāna.🔽“Having spoken, they pay homage” : they pay homage after praising him as “the compassionate one of the world” .

original: anukampako”ti kittetvā vandanti. Sutaṃ netanti sutaṃ nanūti etasmiṃ atthe nu-saddo.
analyzed: anukampakā uti vandanti sutam sutam nanu iti etasmin atthe nu saddaḥ
translated: “They lead the heard to the known” : the word nu in the expression sutaṃ nanūti has the meaning of attha .

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana nokāroyanti adhippāyena amhehīti attho vutto. Etanti etaṃ tathā
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam pana adhippāyena amhehi iti atthaḥ vuttaḥ etat ti etam tathā
translated: But in the commentary the word nu is used in the sense of okāraya .

original: parikittetvā amanussānaṃ devatānaṃ vandanaṃ. Vadanti dhataraṭṭhamahārājassa puttā.🔽279. Yena petā pavuccantīti ettha vacanasesena attho veditabbo, na yathārutavasenevāti
analyzed: parikittetvā amanussānam devatānam vandanam vadanti dhataraṭṭha mahārājassa puttāḥ  yena petā pavuccanti iti ettha vacana sesena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ na yathā ruta vasena iva ati
translated: The word etaṃ refers to the homage paid by the non-human beings, the deities, after praising him in this way.🔽The word vadanti is used in the sense of vacana sesa .🔽The word yena is used in the sense of yassa disābhāge nīharīyantūti vuccantī .

original: dassento “yena disābhāgena nīharīyantūti vuccantī”ti āha. Ḍayhantu vāti pete sandhāya
analyzed: dassentaḥ yena disā bhāgena nīharīyantu uti vuccanti iti āha ḍayhantu vā ati pete sandhāya
translated: The word dayhantu is used in the sense of pete sandhāya vadati .🔽The word chijjantu is used in the sense of hatthapādādike pisuṇā piṭṭhimaṃsikā .

original: vadati. Chijjantu vā hatthapādādike pisuṇā piṭṭhimaṃsikā. Haññantu pāṇātipātinotiādikā.
analyzed: vadati chijjantu vā hattha pāda ādike pisuṇā piṭṭhi maṃsikā haññantu pāṇa atipātino ti ādikā
translated: The word haññantu is used in the sense of pāṇātipātino .

original: Pavuccantīti vā samuccanti, “alaṃ tesa”nti samācinīyantīti attho. Evañhi vacanasesena
analyzed: pavuccanti iti vā samuccanti alam samācinīyanti iti atthaḥ evam hi vacana sesena
translated: “They are called” means they are collected together, the meaning being that they are collected together with the thought “They are enough for them.”🔽For the meaning is established even without the words.

original: vinā eva attho siddho hoti. Rahassaṅganti bījaṃ sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: vinā eva atthaḥ siddho hoti bījam sandhāya vadati
translated: “The secret place” is said with reference to the seed.

original: 280. Yasmiṃ disābhāge sūriyo atthaṃ gacchatīti ettha “yato ṭhānato udetī”ti ettha vuttanayānusārena attho veditabbo.
analyzed: yasmin disā bhāge sūriyaḥ attham gacchati iti ettha yatas ṭhānataḥ udeti iti ettha vutta naya anusārena atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: “The direction in which the sun sets” should be understood in the way stated in the passage “from the place where it rises” .

original: 281. Yena disābhāgena uttarakuru rammo avaṭṭhito, ito sā uttarā disāti yojanā. Mahānerūti
analyzed: yena disā bhāgena uttarakuru rammo avaṭṭhito itas sā uttarā disā ati yojanā mahāneru iti
translated: The direction in which Uttarakuru is situated is the northern direction.🔽“The great Neru” is a mountain called Neru, which is great and lofty.

original: mahanto, mahanīyo ca nerusaṅkhāto pabbato. Tenāha “mahāsineru pabbatarājā”ti. Rajatamayaṃ.
analyzed: mahantaḥ mahanīyaḥ ca neru saṅkhāto pabbato tena āha mahā sineru pabbata rājāti rajata mayam
translated: Therefore it is said: “The great Sineru, king of mountains.” It is made of silver.

original: Tathā hi tassa pabhāya ajjhotthataṃ tassaṃ disāyaṃ samuddodakaṃ khīraṃ viya paññāyati.
analyzed: tathā hi tassa pabhāya ajjhotthatam tassam disāyam samudda udakam khīram viya paññāyati
translated: For the ocean water in that direction appears like milk because it is covered by its radiance.🔽“Made of gems” means made of sapphires.

original: Maṇimayanti indanīlamayaṃ. Tathā hi dakkhiṇadisāya samuddodakaṃ yebhuyyena nīlavaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: maṇi mayanti inda nīla mayam tathā hi dakkhiṇa disāya samudda udakam yebhuyyena nīla vaṇṇam
translated: For the ocean water in the southern direction appears mostly blue in color,🔽and the sky appears so too.

original: hutvā paññāyati, tathā ākāsaṃ. Manussā jāyanti. Kathaṃ jāyanti? Amamā apariggahāti
analyzed: hutvā paññāyati tathā ākāsam manussāḥ jāyanti katham jāyanti amamāḥ a pariggahā ati
translated: “People are born” means how are they born? “Without mother, without being received” .

original: yojanā. Mamattavirahitāti “idaṃ mama idaṃ mamā”ti mamaṅkāravirahitāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: yojanā mamatta virahitā ati idam mama idam mama ati mamaṅkāra virahitā ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning intended is that they are free from the notion of ‘mine’ in the sense of ‘this is mine, that is mine.’

original: Yadi tesaṃ “ayaṃ mayhaṃ bhariyā”ti pariggaho natthi, “ayaṃ me mātā, ayaṃ bhaginī”ti
analyzed: yadi tesam ayam mayham bhariyā ati pariggahaḥ na atthi ayam me mātā ayam bhaginī iti
translated: If they have no such notion of ownership as ‘this is my wife,’ ‘this is my mother, this is my sister,’

original: evarūpā idha viya mariyādāpi na siyā mātuādibhāvassa ajānanatoti codanaṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: evarūpā na siyā mātu ādi bhāvassa a jānanato ti codanam sandhāya āha
translated: then there will be no such distinction as there is here, and they will not know the difference between mother and the rest. Anticipating this objection, he says

original: “mātaraṃ vā”tiādi. Chandarāgo nuppajjatīti ettha “dhammatāsiddhassa sīlassa ānubhāvena
analyzed: mātaram vā ati ādi chanda rāgaḥ nu pajjati iti ettha dhamma tā siddhassa sīlassa ānubhāvena
translated: ‘mother’ and so on. ‘Desire and lust do not arise’: some say that ‘by the power of virtue, which is established by nature,

original: putte diṭṭhamatte eva mātu thanato thaññaṃ paggharati, tena saññāṇena nesaṃ mātari
analyzed: putte diṭṭha matte eva mātu thanataḥ thaññam paggharati tena saññāṇena na īsam mātari
translated: milk flows from the breasts of the mother as soon as she sees her child. By that sign, the notion of ‘mother’ is established in the child

original: puttassa mātusaññā, mātu ca putte puttasaññā paccupaṭṭhitā”ti keci.
analyzed: puttassa mātu saññā mātu ca putte putta saññā paccupaṭṭhitā ati keci
translated: and the notion of ‘child’ in the mother.’

original: Naṅgalāti liṅgavipallāsena vuttanti āha “naṅgalānipī”ti. Akaṭṭheti akasite akatakasikamme.🔽Taṇḍulāva tassa phalanti sattānaṃ puññānubhāvahetukā thusādiabhāvena taṇḍulā eva
analyzed: naṅgalā iti liṅga vipallāsena vuttanti āha naṅgalāni pi iti akaṭṭhe iti a kasite a kata kasi kamme 🔽taṇḍulāḥ ava tassa phalanti sattānam puñña anubhāva hetukāḥ thusa ādi abhāvena taṇḍulāḥ eva
translated: ‘The ploughs’ : some say that this is a reference to the change of sex.

original: tassa sālissa phalaṃ. Tuṇḍikiranti pacanabhājanassa nāmanti vuttaṃ “ukkhaliya”nti.
analyzed: tassa sālissa phalam tuṇḍikiranti pacana bhājanassa nāmanti vuttam ukkhaliyanti
translated: The fruit of that tree. A frying-pan is a name for a cooking vessel.

analyzed: ākiritvā ti taṇḍulāni pakkhipitvā niddhūma aṅgārena ati dhūma aṅgāra rahitena kevalena agginā
translated: Having filled it: having put in the rice. With embers that are free from smoke: with fire that is free from embers and smoke.

original: Jotikapāsāṇato aggimhi uṭṭhahante kuto dhūmaṅgārānaṃ sambhavo. Bhojananti odanamevādhippetanti
analyzed: jotika pāsāṇataḥ aggimhi uṭṭhahante kutas dhūma aṅgārānam sambhavaḥ bhojanam ti odanam eva adhippetanti
translated: When the fire arises from the Jotika stone, how can there be embers and smoke? Food: only rice is intended.

original: “bhojanamevā”ti avadhāraṇaṃ katvā tena nivattetabbaṃ dassento “añño sūpo vā byañjanaṃ
analyzed: bhojanam eva ati avadhāraṇam katvā tena nivattetabbam dassento aññaḥ sūpaḥ vā byañjanam
translated: Having made the restriction “food only,” he shows that it should be rejected by that, saying, “There is no other curry or condiment.”

original: vā na hotī”ti āha. Yadi evaṃ rasavisesayutto tesaṃ āhāro na hotīti? Noti dassento🔽“bhuñjantānaṃ…pe… raso hotī”ti āha. Macchariyacittaṃ nāma na hotīti dhammatāsiddhassa
analyzed: vā na hoti iti āha yadi evam rasa visesa yutto tesam āhāro na hoti iti no ti dassento  rasaḥ hoti iti āha macchariya cittam nāma na hoti iti dhamma tā siddhassa
translated: If that is so, is their food not mixed with a special flavor? Showing that it is not, he says,🔽“When they eat … it becomes flavor.” There is no miserly mind: by the power of virtue, which is established by nature,

original: sīlassa ānubhāvena. Tathā hi te katthacipi amamā pariggahāva hutvā vasanti.
analyzed: sīlassa ānubhāvena tathā hi te katthacipi amamā hutvā vasanti
translated: for they live nowhere with ownership and hoarding.

analyzed: apica tattha uttarakurukānam puñña anubhāva siddho ayam pi visesaḥ veditabbaḥ tattha
translated: Moreover, this distinction should be understood as established by the power of their merit,

analyzed: kira tesu tesu padesesu ghana cita patta sañchanna sākhā apasākhā kūṭāgāra upamā manoramā
translated: In various places there are trees with branches and twigs covered with thick foliage, like a pavilion, delightful,

analyzed: rukkhāḥ tesam manussānam nivesana kiccam sādhenti yattha sukham nivasanti aññe api
translated: which serve the purpose of houses for those people, in which they live happily. Moreover,
