analyzed: disvā api parassa kathayamānassa vacanam sutvā api ācariya santike uggahetvā api paṭiladdhā
translated: and also what is learnt by hearing another speak, and also what is learnt by learning from a teacher.🔽All this is what is learnt from another.

original: sabbā parato sutvā paṭiladdhanāmāti veditabbā. Samāpannassāti samāpattisamaṅgissa,
analyzed: sabbā paratas sutvā paṭiladdha nāmā ati veditabbā samāpannassa ati samāpatti samaṅgissa
translated: ‘One who has attained’: one who possesses attainment.

original: nidassanamattametaṃ. Vipassanāmaggapaññā hi idha “bhāvanāpaññā”ti visesato icchitāti.
analyzed: nidassanam attam etam vipassanā magga paññā hi idha bhāvanā paññā ati visesataḥ icchitā ati
translated: This is merely an illustration. For it is the understanding of insight and the path that are intended here as ‘understanding consisting in development.’

original: Āvudhaṃ nāma paṭipakkhavimathanatthaṃ icchitabbaṃ, rāgādisadiso ca paṭipakkho natthi,🔽tassa ca vimathanaṃ buddhavacanamevāti “sutameva āvudha”nti vatvā “taṃ atthato tepiṭakaṃ
analyzed: āvudham nāma paṭipakkha vimathana attham icchitabbam rāga ādi sadisaḥ ca paṭipakkhaḥ natthi  tassa ca vimathanam buddha vacanam eva ati sutam eva āvudhanti vatvā tam atthato tepiṭakam
translated: A weapon is what is needed for the destruction of an opponent, and there is no opponent like greed, etc.,🔽and the destruction of that is only by the Buddha’s word. So after saying ‘The weapon is only the heard,’ he said ‘The meaning of that is the three baskets’

original: buddhavacana”nti āha. Idāni tamatthaṃ vivaranto “taṃ hī”ti ādiṃ vatvā “sutāvudho”tiādinā
analyzed: buddha vacanam ti āha idāni tam attham vivaranto tam hi iti ādim vatvā sutāvudhā iti ādinā
translated: in order to show that the Buddha’s word is the three baskets. Now, in order to explain that meaning, he said ‘The heard’ and so on,

original: suttapadena samattheti. Tattha akusalaṃ pajahatīti tadaṅgādivasena akusalaṃ pariccajati.
analyzed: sutta padena samatthā iti tattha akusalam pajahati iti tad aṅga ādi vasena akusalam pariccajati
translated: and ‘The heard is the weapon’ and so on. Herein, ‘He abandons the unprofitable’ means he rejects the unprofitable by the means of the abandoning of the ideas associated therewith, and so on.

original: Kusalaṃ bhāvetīti samathavipassanādikusalaṃ dhammaṃ uppādeti vaḍḍheti ca. Suddhaṃ
analyzed: kusalam bhāveti iti samatha vipassanā ādi kusalam dhammam uppādeti vaḍḍheti ca suddham
translated: ‘He develops the profitable’ means he generates and increases the profitable ideas consisting in serenity, insight, and so on.

original: attānaṃ pariharatīti tena akusalappahānena, tāya ca kusalabhāvanāya rāgādisaṃkilesato
analyzed: attānam pariharati iti tena akusala ppahānena tāya ca kusala bhāvanāya rāga ādi saṃkilesato
translated: He maintains himself : by abandoning the unprofitable and by developing the profitable, he maintains his self by keeping it free from defilement by lust, etc.

original: visuddhaṃ attabhāvaṃ pavatteti.
analyzed: visuddham atta bhāvam pavatta iti
translated: He keeps his self going.

original: Vivekaṭṭhakāyānanti gaṇasaṅgaṇikaṃ vajjetvā tato apakaḍḍhitakāyānaṃ. Svāyaṃ kāyaviveko
analyzed: viveka ṭṭha kāyānam ti gaṇa saṅgaṇikam vajjetvā tatas apakaḍḍhita kāyānam su ayam kāya vivekaḥ
translated: With their bodies secluded : having avoided the society of the multitude, they keep their bodies secluded.🔽This bodily seclusion is not merely being alone; it is also the renunciation of the first jhāna, etc.

original: na kevalaṃ ekākībhāvo, atha kho paṭhamajjhānādi nekkhammayogatoti āha “nekkhammābhiratāna”nti.
analyzed: na kevalam ekākībhāvaḥ atha kho paṭhama jhāna ādi nekkhamma yogato ti āha
translated: That is why he said “delighting in renunciation.”🔽With their minds secluded : having abandoned the society of defilements, their minds are secluded.

original: Cittavivekoti kilesasaṅgaṇikaṃ pahāya tato cittassa vivittatā. Sā pana jhānavimokkhādīnaṃ
analyzed: citta vivekaḥ ti kilesa saṅgaṇikam pahāya tatas cittassa vivitta tā sā pana jhāna vimokkha ādīnam
translated: But that is in the sense of the jhānas, the liberations, etc.🔽That is why he said “with their minds purified, attained to the supreme development.”

original: vasena hotīti āha “parisuddhacittānaṃ paramavodānappattāna”nti. Upadhivivekoti nibbānaṃ.
analyzed: vasena hoti iti āha parisuddha cittānam parama vodāna pattānam ti upadhi vivekaḥ iti nibbānam
translated: With the destruction of the taints : Nibbāna is the destruction of the taints.🔽For when it is attained, a person’s selfhood is without remainder.🔽That is why he said “with the destruction of the taints, become taint-free.”

original: Tadadhigamena hi puggalassa nirupadhitā. Tenāha “nirupadhīnaṃ puggalāna”nti, visaṅkhāragatānaṃ
analyzed: tad adhigamena hi puggalassa nirupadhi tā tena āha nirupadhīnam puggalānam ti visaṅkhāra gatānam
translated: With the destruction of the cankers : with the attainment of Nibbāna, which is the destruction of the cankers.🔽The meaning is that they have attained Nibbāna and are endowed with the fruition attainment.

original: adhigatanibbānānaṃ, phalasamāpattisamaṅgīnañcāti attho. Sutampi avassayaṭṭheneva
analyzed: adhigata nibbānānam phala samāpatti samaṅgīnam ca ati atthaḥ sutam pi avassaya ṭṭhena iva
translated: The word “heard” is also used in the sense of “received” .

original: āvudhaṃ vuttanti āha “ayampī”ti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “tañhi nissāyā”ti. Kāmañcettha sutapavivekāpi
analyzed: āvudham vuttanti āha ayam pi iti tathā hi vuttam tat hi nissāya ati kāmam ca ittha suta pavivekā api
translated: The weapon is stated thus: “This too is a weapon” . For it is said: “For it is by depending on that” .

original: paññāvaseneva yathādhippetaāvudhattasādhakā, paññā pana sutena, ekaccapavivekena🔽vā vināpi idhādhippetaāvudhattasādhanīti tato paññā sāmatthiyadassanatthaṃ visuṃ
analyzed: paññā vasena iva paññā pana sutena ekacca pavivekena  vā vinā api tatas paññā sāmatthiya dassana ttham visum
translated: If it be said that the wisdom consisting in the development of insight is also a weapon in the sense of accomplishing the purpose intended, namely, the destruction of the defilements, still wisdom is a weapon in the sense of accomplishing the purpose intended only when it is accompanied by learning and the development of the first absorption,

original: āvudhabhāvena vuttā. Tenāha “yassa sā atthi, so na kutocī”tiādi.
analyzed: āvudha bhāvena vuttā tena āha yassa sā atthi saḥ na kutoci itiādi
translated: or by the development of the first absorption alone. Therefore, in order to show the efficacy of wisdom, it is stated separately as a weapon. Hence it is said: “He who has that is not from anywhere” , and so on.

original: Nāññātaṃ aviditaṃ dhammanti anamatagge saṃsāravaṭṭe na aññātaṃ aviditaṃ amatadhammaṃ,
analyzed: na aññātam aviditam an amatagge saṃsāra vaṭṭe na aññātam aviditam amata dhammaṃ
translated: The Dhamma that is not known, not understood, is the deathless Dhamma that is not known, not understood, in the beginningless round of rebirths.

original: catusaccadhammameva vā jānissāmīti paṭipannassa iminā pubbābhogena uppannaṃ indriyaṃ.
analyzed: catu sacca dhammam eva vā jānissāmi iti paṭipannassa iminā pubbābhogena uppannam indriyam
translated: Or it is the Dhamma of the four truths that one will know by undertaking the practice. This is the faculty that arises through the prior practice.

original: Yaṃ pāḷiyaṃ saṅgahavāre “nava indriyāni hontī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ pubbābhogasiddhaṃ pavattiākāravisesaṃ
analyzed: yam pāḷiyam saṅgaha vāre nava indriyāni honti iti vuttam tam pubba ābhoga siddham pavatti ākāra visesam
translated: In the text, in the section on the summary, it is said: “There are nine faculties” . This is said in order to show the special mode of occurrence of the prior practice,

original: dīpetuṃ vuttaṃ, atthato pana maggasammādiṭṭhi eva sāti āha “sotāpattimaggañāṇassetaṃ
analyzed: dīpetum vuttam atthataḥ pana magga sammādiṭṭhi eva sā ti āha sotāpatti magga ñāṇassa etam
translated: but in the sense of the path, it is the right view of the path of stream-entry. Therefore it is said: “This is the faculty of wisdom of the path of stream-entry.

original: adhivacana”nti. Aññindriyanti ājānanakaindriyaṃ, paṭhamamaggena ñātamariyādaṃ anatikkamitvā
analyzed: adhivacanam ti aññindriyam ti ājānanaka aindriyam paṭhama maggena ñāta mariyādam an atikkamitvā
translated: and the meaning of the word is ‘the faculty of understanding.’

original: tesaṃyeva tena maggena ñātānaṃ catusaccadhammānaṃ jānanakaindriyanti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: tesam yeva tena maggena ñātānam catu sacca dhammānam jānanaka aindriyam ti vuttam hoti
translated: The ‘understanding faculty’ is the faculty of knowing. It is said that it is the faculty of knowing the four noble truths that have been known by the first path without overstepping the noble ones’ limit that has been known by that path.

original: Tenāha “aññābhūtaṃ ājānanabhūtaṃ indriya”nti. Ājānātīti añño, aññassa bhūtaṃ, ājānanavasena
analyzed: tena āha aññābhūtam ājānana bhūtam indriyanti ājānāti iti aññaḥ aññassa bhūtam ājānana vasena
translated: Hence it is said, ‘The meaning of the word is “the faculty of understanding that has become another, that is, the faculty of understanding that has become the known.”’🔽It understands, thus it is another; it is what has become of the other, or it is what has become by way of understanding.

original: vā bhūtanti aññabhūtaṃ. Aññātāvīsūti jānitabbaṃ catuariyasaccaṃ ājānitvā ṭhitesu.
analyzed: vā bhūtanti añña bhūtam aññātāvīsu iti jānitabbam catuariyasaccam ājānitvā ṭhitesu
translated: The ‘twenty understanding’ are those who have stood by understanding the four noble truths that have to be understood.

original: Tenāha “jānanakiccapariyosānappattesū”ti, pariññādibhedassa jānanakiccassa pariniṭṭhānappattesu.🔽Maṃsacakkhu cakkhupasādoti maṃsacakkhu nāma catasso dhātuyo, vaṇṇo, gandho, raso,
analyzed: tena āha jānana kicca pariyosāna ppattesu iti pariññā ādi bhedassa jānana kiccassa pariniṭṭhāna ppattesu  maṃsacakkhu cakkhupasādo ti maṃsacakkhu nāma catasso dhātuyaḥ vaṇṇaḥ gandho raso
translated: Hence it is said, ‘in those who have reached the end of the function of understanding, which is of the kind classed as full-understanding, etc.’🔽The ‘fleshly eye’ is the four elements, colour, odour, flavour,

original: ojā, sambhavo, saṇṭhānaṃ, jīvitaṃ, bhāvo, kāyappasādo, cakkhupasādoti evaṃ cuddasasambhāro maṃsapiṇḍo.
analyzed: ojā sambhavaḥ saṇṭhānam jīvitam bhāvo kāya ppasādo cakkhu pasādo ti evam cuddasa sambhāraḥ maṃsa piṇḍaḥ
translated: nutriment, origination, configuration, life, state, bodily sensitivity, eye sensitivity—thus it is a lump of flesh with fourteen components.

original: Kasiṇālokaṃ vaḍḍhetvā tattha rūpadassanato “dibbacakkhu ālokanissitaṃ ñāṇa”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Dibbacakkhupaññāvinimuttā eva lokiyapaññā paññācakkhūti ayamattho avuttasiddho dibbacakkhussa
analyzed: kasiṇa ālokaṃ vaḍḍhetvā tattha rūpa dassanato dibba cakkhu āloka nissitam ñāṇan ti vuttaṃ  dibba cakkhu paññā vinimuttā eva lokiya paññā paññācakkhu iti ayam attho a vutta siddhaḥ dibba cakkhussa
translated: The divine eye is said to be knowledge based on light because the seeing of materiality there is due to the extension of the light of the kasiṇa.🔽The meaning of the words “the eye of wisdom” is established by implication as being mundane wisdom other than the divine eye,

original: visuṃ gahitattāti vuttaṃ “paññācakkhu lokiyalokuttarapaññā”ti.
analyzed: visum gahita ttā ti vuttam paññācakkhu lokiya lokuttara paññā ti
translated: which is why it is said that “the eye of wisdom is mundane and supramundane wisdom.”

original: Adhikaṃ visiṭṭhaṃ sīlanti adhisīlaṃ. Sikkhitabbatoti āsevitabbato. Adhisīlaṃ nāma🔽anavasesakāyikavācasikasaṃvarabhāvato, maggasīlassa padaṭṭhānabhāvato ca. Adhicittaṃ
analyzed: adhikam visiṭṭham sīlanti adhisīlam sikkhitabbataḥ ti āsevitabbataḥ adhisīlam nāma  anavasesa kāyika vācasika saṃvara bhāvataḥ magga sīlassa padaṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ ca adhicittam
translated: “Superior” means “exalted.” “Training” means “to be practised.” The virtue that is to be practised is called “the training in the higher virtue”🔽because it is the virtue of restraint by the whole body and speech, and because it is the foundation for the virtue of the path. The training in the higher consciousness is called “the training in the higher consciousness”

original: maggasamādhissa adhiṭṭhānabhāvato. Adhipaññā maggapaññāya adhiṭṭhānabhāvato. Idāni
analyzed: magga samādhissa adhiṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ adhipaññā magga paññāya adhiṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ idāni
translated: because it is the basis for the concentration of the path. The training in the higher wisdom is called “the training in the higher wisdom”

original: nesaṃ adhisīlādibhāvaṃ kāraṇena paṭipādetuṃ “anuppannepi hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: adhi sīla ādi bhāvam kāraṇena paṭipādetum anuppanne pi hi itiādi vuttam tattha
translated: because it is the basis for the wisdom of the path. Now, in order to demonstrate the reason for their being called “the training in the higher virtue,” etc., it is said: “Even when the Buddha had not arisen” and so on. Herein,

original: anuppanneti appavatte. Adhisīlameva nibbānādhigamassa paccayabhāvato. Samāpannāti
analyzed: anuppannā iti appavatte adhisīlam eva nibbāna adhigamassa paccaya bhāvataḥ samāpannā ati
translated: “when the Buddha had not arisen” means when he had not attained enlightenment. “The training in the higher virtue” is the cause for the attainment of Nibbāna because it is a condition for the attainment of Nibbāna. “When he had entered upon it” means

original: ettha “nibbānaṃ patthayantenā”ti padaṃ ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ.
analyzed: ettha nibbānam patthayantena ati padam ānetvā sambandhitabbam
translated: “By one who seeks Nibbāna” is to be construed with the words “Herein, by one who seeks Nibbāna.”

original: “Kalyāṇakārī kalyāṇaṃ, pāpakārī ca pāpakaṃ;
analyzed: kalyāṇa kārī kalyāṇam pāpa kārī ca pāpakam
translated: “The doer of good experiences good, The doer of evil, evil too;

original: Anubhoti dvayampetuṃ, anubandhañhi kāraka”nti. ;
analyzed: anubhoti dvayam petum
translated: Both kinds of doer go together, For the doer is never cut off.”

original: Evaṃ atīte, anāgate ca vaṭṭamūlakadukkhasallakkhaṇavasena saṃvegavatthutāya vimuttiākaṅkhāya
analyzed: evam atīte anāgate ca vaṭṭa mūlaka dukkha sat lakkhaṇa vasena saṃvega vatthu tāya vimutti ākaṅkhāya
translated: So it is in the past and future.🔽“Understanding of the ownership of kamma is higher understanding” .

original: paccayabhūtā kammassakatāpaññā adhipaññā”ti vadanti. Lokiyasīlādīnaṃ adhisīlādibhāvo
analyzed: paccaya bhūtā kammassaka tā paññā adhipaññā ti vadanti lokiya sīla ādīnam adhi sīla ādi bhāvaḥ
translated: The mundane kinds of virtue, etc., are called “higher” because they are the basis for the supramundane kinds of virtue, etc.

original: pariyāyenāti nippariyāyameva taṃ dassetuṃ “sabbaṃ vā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pariyāyena āti nippariyāyam eva tam dassetum sabbam vā tiādi vuttam
translated: “In every way” : this is said in order to show that it is not only in one way.

original: Pañcadvārikakāyoti pañcadvāresu kāyo phassādidhammasamūho. Kāyo ca so bhāvitabhāvena
analyzed: pañcadvārika kāyo ti pañca dvāresu kāyo phassa ādi dhamma samūho kāyo ca so bhāvita bhāvena
translated: “The five-door-body”: the body is a collection of states such as contact that occur in the five doors. The body is also a development ,🔽and that is why it is called “the development of the body.”

original: bhāvanā cāti kāyabhāvanā nāma. Yasmā khīṇāsavānaṃ aggamaggādhigamanena sabbasaṃkilesā
analyzed: bhāvanā ca ati kāya bhāvanā nāma yasmā khīṇa āsavānam agga magga adhigamanena sabba saṃkilesā
translated: Since the taints are abandoned in the arahant by the attainment of the supramundane paths,

original: pahīnāti pahīnakālato paṭṭhāya sabbaso āsevanābhāvato natthi tesaṃ bhāviniyāpi cakkhusotaviññeyyā
analyzed: pahīnā ti pahīna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya sabbaso āsevana abhāvataḥ natthi tesam bhāviniyā api cakkhu sota viññeyyā
translated: from the time they are abandoned they are never again to be developed, since there is no repetition of them.

original: dhammā, pageva kāḷakā, tasmā pañcadvārikakāyo subhāvito eva hoti. Tena vuttaṃ “khīṇāsavassa🔽hi…pe… subhāvito hotī”ti. Na aññesaṃ viya dubbalā dubbalabhāvakarānaṃ kilesānaṃ sabbaso pahīnattā.
analyzed: dhammā pagā iva kāḷakā tasmā pañcadvārika kāyo su bhāvito eva hoti tena vuttam khīṇāsavassa  su bhāvito hoti iti na aññesam viya dubbalāḥ dubbala bhāva karānam kilesānam sabbaso pahīna ttā
translated: So it is well developed in one whose cankers are destroyed.

original: Vipassanā dassanānuttariyaṃ aniccānupassanādivasena saṅkhārānaṃ sammadeva dassanato.
analyzed: vipassanā dassana anuttariyam anicca anupassanā ādi vasena saṅkhārānam sammat eva dassanato
translated: Insight is the highest in seeing, because formations are seen correctly by means of the contemplation of impermanence, etc.

original: Maggo paṭipadānuttariyaṃ taduttaripaṭipadāya abhāvato. Phalaṃ vimuttānuttariyaṃ akuppabhāvato.
analyzed: maggo paṭipada anuttariyam tad uttari paṭipadāya abhāvataḥ phalam vimutta anuttariyam a kuppa bhāvataḥ
translated: The path is the highest in practice because there is no other practice higher than it. The fruition is the highest in liberation because it is unshakable.

original: Phalaṃ vā dassanānuttariyaṃ divasampi nibbānaṃ paccakkhato disvā pavattanato. Nibbānaṃ
analyzed: phalam vā dassana anuttariyam divasam pi nibbānam paccakkhataḥ disvā pavattanataḥ nibbānam
translated: Or alternatively, the fruition is the highest in seeing because it proceeds after seeing Nibbāna face to face for a day. Nibbāna

original: vimuttānuttariyaṃ sabbasaṅkhatavinissaṭattā. Dassana-saddaṃ kammasādhanaṃ gahetvā
analyzed: vimutta anuttariyam sabba saṅkhata vinissaṭa ttā dassana saddam kamma sādhanam gahetvā
translated: is the highest in liberation because it is the escape from all formed things.🔽Taking “seeing” and “hearing” as the means of accomplishment,🔽he shows that Nibbāna is said to be the highest in seeing.

original: nibbānassa dassanānuttariyatā vuttāti dassento “tato uttarañhi daṭṭhabbaṃ nāma natthī”ti
analyzed: nibbānassa dassana anuttariya tā vuttā ati dassento tatas uttaran hi daṭṭhabbam nāma natthi iti
translated: “For there is nothing further to be seen”

original: āha. Natthi ito uttaranti anuttaraṃ, anuttarameva anuttariyanti āha “uttamaṃ jeṭṭhaka”nti.🔽Sesoti vuttāvaseso pañcakanayena, catukkanayena ca tividho samādhi, iminā eva ca
analyzed: āha natthi itas uttaranti anuttaram anuttaram eva anuttariyanti āha uttamam jeṭṭhakam ti  seso ti vutta avaseso pañcaka nayena catukka nayena ca tividhaḥ samādhi iminā eva ca
translated: “There is nothing higher than this” is “unsurpassed” . “Unsurpassed” is “supreme, best” .🔽The “rest” is the threefold concentration classed as fivefold and fourfold.

original: samādhittayāpadesena suttantesupi pañcakanayo āgato evāti veditabbaṃ. Tattha yaṃ🔽vattabbaṃ, taṃ paramatthamañjūsāyaṃ visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttameva, tasmā tattha
analyzed: samādhi tayā apadesena suttantesu pi pañcaka nayaḥ āgataḥ evā ti veditabbam tattha yam  vattabbam tam paramatthamañjūsāyam visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanāyam vuttam eva tasmai tattha
translated: And it should be understood that the fivefold method is also found in the texts in the description of the three kinds of concentration.

original: vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.🔽Āgacchati nāmaṃ etasmāti āgamanaṃ, tato āgamanato. Saguṇatoti sarasato. Ārammaṇatoti🔽ārammaṇadhammato. Anattato abhinivisitvāti “sabbe saṅkhārā anattā”ti vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: vutta nayena iva veditabbam  āgacchati nāma etasmā iti āgamanam tatas āgamanataḥ sa guṇataḥ ti sa rasataḥ ārammaṇato ti  ārammaṇa dhammataḥ anattataḥ abhinivisitvā ati sabbe saṅkhārāḥ anattā ati vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā
translated: Herein, what is to be said has been said in the Paramattha-mañjūsā in the description of the Path of Purification , so it should be understood in the way stated there.🔽“Comes from” : the coming is from that. “From the source” : from the essence. “From the object” : from the object-state of the object. “Having defined it as not-self” : having begun insight by discerning formations as “not-self.”

original: Anattato disvāti paṭhamaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ “anattā”ti anattalakkhaṇaṃ paṭivijjhitvā. Anattato
analyzed: anattataḥ disvā iti paṭhamam anattā anattā ati anatta lakkhaṇam paṭivijjhitvā anattataḥ
translated: “Having seen it as not-self” : first penetrating the characteristic of not-self in formations by discerning them as “not-self.”

original: vuṭṭhātīti vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanāya anattākārato pavattāya maggavuṭṭhānaṃ pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhāti iti vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanāya anatta ākārataḥ pavattāya magga vuṭṭhānam pāpuṇāti
translated: He emerges: he reaches the emergence of the path by means of insight that ends in emergence, which occurs as the aspect of not-self.

original: Asuññatattakārakānaṃ kilesānaṃ abhāvāti attābhinivesapaccayānaṃ diṭṭhekaṭṭhānaṃ kilesānaṃ
analyzed: asuñña tatta kārakānam kilesānam abhāvāti atta abhinivesa paccayānam diṭṭha ekaṭṭhānam kilesānam
translated: Because there are no defilements that make a non-empty self: because there is suppression of the defilements that have the view of self as their object and that are of one kind as regards their appearance.

original: vikkhambhanato vipassanā suññatā nāma attasuññatāya yāthāvato gahaṇato. Nanu evaṃ
analyzed: vikkhambhanato vipassanā suññatā nāma atta suññatāya yāthāvataḥ gahaṇato nanu evam
translated: Insight is called “void” because it is the voiding of self. It is “void” in the sense of void of self because it takes as its object the fact that there is no self.

original: vipassanāya saguṇato suññatā, na āgamanatoti nippariyāyato natthīti? Saccametaṃ nāmalābhe,
analyzed: vipassanāya saguṇataḥ suñña tā na āgamanato ti nippariyāyataḥ natthi iti saccam etam nāmalābhe
translated: But is not insight void in the sense of void of its own special qualities, not in the sense of void of what is extraneous to it?🔽That is so in the sense of a mere name, but not in the sense of a designation.

original: na pana nāmadāneti nāyaṃ doso. Atha vā suttantakathā nāma pariyāyakathā, na abhidhammakathā
analyzed: na pana nāma dāne iti na ayam dosaḥ atha vā suttanta kathā nāma pariyāya kathā na abhidhamma kathā
translated: And this is no defect. Or alternatively, the teaching of the suttas is a teaching by way of terms of expression; it is not a teaching by way of the ultimate sense as is the teaching of the Abhidhamma.

original: viya nippariyāyāti bhiyyopi na koci doso.
analyzed: viya nippariyāyāti bhiyyas api na koci doso
translated: So there is no defect at all.

original: Yasmā saguṇato, ārammaṇato ca nāmalābhe saṅkaro hoti ekasseva nāmantaralābhasambhavato.
analyzed: yasmā sa guṇataḥ ārammaṇato ca nāma lābhe saṅkaraḥ hoti ekassa iva nāma antara lābha sambhavato
translated: For there is confusion in the sense of a mere name, in the sense of an object, because it is possible for one and the same thing to have several names.

original: Āgamanato pana nāmalābhe saṅkaro natthi nāmantaralābhābhāvato, asambhavato ca, tasmā
analyzed: āgamanato pana nāma lābhe saṅkaraḥ natthi nāma antara lābha abhāvataḥ asambhavato ca tasmā
translated: But there is no confusion in the sense of a designation, because there is no such thing as a second name, and because it is impossible.

original: “aparo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nimittakārakakilesābhāvāti niccanimittādiggāhakapaccayānaṃ kilesānaṃ🔽vikkhambhanato. Kāmañcāyaṃ vipassanā niccanimittādiṃ ugghāṭentī pavattati, saṅkhāranimittassa
analyzed: aparaḥ tiādi vuttam nimitta kāraka kilesa abhāvāti nicca nimitta ādi gāhaka paccayānam kilesānam  vikkhambhanato kāmañca ayam vipassanā nicca nimitta ādim ugghāṭentī pavattati saṅkhāra nimittassa
translated: “Another” is said, etc. Because of the absence of defilements that make a sign: because of the suppression of the defilements that are conditions for the grasping of a permanent sign, etc.

original: pana avissajjanato na nippariyāyato animittanāmaṃ labhatīti. Pariyāyena panetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pana a vissajjanataḥ na nippariyāyataḥ animitta nāmam labhati iti pariyāyena pana itam vuttam
translated: And although this insight proceeds to remove the permanent sign, etc., it does not receive the name signless in the ultimate sense because it does not relinquish the sign of formations. But it is said figuratively.

original: Tathā hi nippariyāyadesanattā abhidhamme maggassa animittanāmaṃ uddhaṭaṃ. Sutte ca –
analyzed: tathā hi nippariyāya desana ttā abhidhamme maggassa animitta nāmam uddhaṭam sutte ca
translated: For the path is called signless in the Abhidhamma because of the teaching in the ultimate sense:

original: “Animittañca bhāvehi, mānānusayamujjaha;
analyzed: animittam ca bhāvehi māna anusayam ujjaha
translated: “Develop the signless, abandon the underlying tendency to conceit;

original: Tato mānābhisamayā, upasanto carissasī”ti. ;🔽Animittapariyāyo āgato. Paṇidhikārakakilesābhāvāti sukhapaṇidhiādipaccayānaṃ kilesānaṃ vikkhambhanato.
analyzed: tatas māna abhisamayā upasantaḥ carissasi iti  animitta pariyāyaḥ āgataḥ paṇidhi kāraka kilesa abhāvā ti sukha paṇidhi ādi paccayānam kilesānam vikkhambhanato
translated: Then, with the full penetration of conceit, you will go your way in peace” .🔽And it is called signless in the Suttas because of the teaching in the figurative sense.🔽Because of the absence of defilements that make a wish: because of the suppression of the defilements that are conditions for the wish for pleasure, etc.

original: Rāgādīhi suññattāti samucchedavasena pajahanato rāgādīhi vivittattā. Rāgādayo eva
analyzed: rāga ādīhi suññattā ati samuccheda vasena pajahanataḥ rāga ādīhi vivitta ttā rāga ādayaḥ eva
translated: Because of emptiness of lust, etc.: because of the relinquishment by way of eradication, and because of the seclusion from lust, etc.

original: rāganimittādīni. Purimuppannā hi rāgādayo parato uppajjanakarāgādīnaṃ kāraṇaṃ hoti.🔽Rāgādayo eva tathā paṇidhānassa paccayabhāvato rāgapaṇidhiādayo. Nibbānaṃ visaṅkhārabhāveneva
analyzed: rāga nimitta ādīni purima uppannāḥ hi rāga ādayaḥ paratas uppajjanaka rāga ādīnam kāraṇam  rāga ādayaḥ eva tathā paṇidhānassa paccaya bhāvataḥ rāga paṇidhi ādayaḥ nibbānam visaṅkhāra bhāvena iva
translated: The “signs of lust” and so on are the lust, etc., arisen previously. For they are the cause of the lust, etc., that arise later.🔽Lust, etc., themselves are the “lust-proclivity,” etc., because they are the condition for the corresponding proclivity.

original: sabbasaṅkhāravinissaṭattā rāgādīhi suññaṃ, rāgādinimittapaṇidhivirahitañcāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāra vinissaṭa ttā rāga ādīhi suññam rāga ādi nimitta paṇidhi virahitam ca ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: Nibbāna is “void” because it is devoid of formations and because it is devoid of lust, etc., since it is free from the signs of lust, etc., and from the proclivities.

original: Ettha ca saṅkhārupekkhā sānulomā vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā, sā suññato vipassantī “suññatā”ti
analyzed: ettha ca saṅkhāra upekkhā sa anulomā vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā sā suññatas vipassantī suññatā ati
translated: Herein, equanimity about formations is insight leading to conformity and to penetration. It is called “void” when it sees voidness,

original: vuccati, dukkhato passantī taṇhāpaṇidhisosanato “appaṇihitā”ti. Sā maggādhigamāya
analyzed: vuccati dukkhato passantī taṇhā paṇidhi sosanato appaṇihitā ati sā magga adhigamāya
translated: and “desireless” when it sees suffering, since craving, proclivities, and disturbance are absent.

original: āgamanapaṭipadāṭhāne ṭhatvā maggassa “suññataṃ animittaṃ appaṇihita”nti nāmaṃ deti.
analyzed: āgamana paṭipadā ṭhāne ṭhatvā maggassa suññatam animittam appaṇihitam ti nāmam deti
translated: It gives the name “void,” “signless,” and “desireless” to the path when it reaches the path by standing on the footing of the way of arrival.

original: Āgamanato ca nāme laddhe saguṇato ca ārammaṇato ca nāmaṃ siddhameva hoti, na pana
analyzed: āgamanato ca nāme laddhe saguṇato ca ārammaṇato ca nāmam siddham eva hoti na pana
translated: And when the name is obtained by way of arrival, the names “with specific negations” and “with object” are established too.

original: saguṇārammaṇehi nāmalābhe sabbattha āgamanato nāmaṃ siddhaṃ hotīti paripuṇṇanāmasiddhihetuttā,
analyzed: sa guṇa ārammaṇehi nāma lābhe sabbattha āgamanataḥ nāmam siddham hoti iti paripuṇṇa nāma siddhi hetu ttā
translated: Since the name is obtained everywhere when the object with its special quality is obtained, the name is established as the cause for the establishment of the complete name.

original: “saguṇārammaṇehi sabbesampi nāmattayayogo, na āgamanato”ti vavatthānakarattā ca nippariyāyato
analyzed: sa guṇa ārammaṇehi sabbesam pi nāma ttaya yogaḥ na āgamanato ti vavatthānakara ttā ca nippariyāyato
translated: Since the commentator, who is the one who defines, defines the name as follows: “The combination of all three names is with the object with its special quality, not by way of the coming in,”

original: āgamanatova nāmalābho padhānaṃ, na itarehi, pariyāyato pana tidhā nāmalābho icchitabboti
analyzed: āgamanataḥ vai nāma lābhaḥ padhānam na itarehi pariyāyataḥ pana tidhā nāma lābhaḥ icchitabbo ti
translated: the obtaining of the name by way of the coming in is the principal way, not by the other two ways. But the obtaining of the name in the three ways should be accepted as the secondary way.

original: aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “tividhā kathā”tiādinā ayaṃ vicāro katoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam tividhā kathā iti ādinā ayam vicāro kato ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this discussion is given in the commentary by the words “The discussion is threefold.”

original: Sucibhāvoti kilesāsucivigamena suddhabhāvo asaṃkiliṭṭhabhāvo. Tenāha “tiṇṇaṃ sucaritānaṃ vasena veditabbo”ti.🔽Munino etānīti moneyyāni. Yehi dhammehi ubhayahitamunanato muni nāma hoti, te evaṃ
analyzed: suci bhāvaḥ ti kilesa asuci vigamena suddha bhāvaḥ asaṃkiliṭṭha bhāvaḥ tena āha tiṇṇam su caritānam vasena veditabbo ti  munino etāni iti yehi dhammehi muni nāma hoti te evam
translated: The state of purity: the state of being pure, the state of being uncorrupted, by the removal of the impurity of defilements. Therefore it is said: “It should be understood by way of the three kinds of good conduct.”

original: vuttāti āha “munibhāvakarā moneyyapaṭipadā dhammā”ti. Tattha yasmā kāyena akattabbassa
analyzed: vuttā iti āha muni bhāva karāḥ dhammā ti tattha yasmā kāyena a kattabbassa
translated: The things of the Sage: the things of the Muni. The Sage is so called because he is one who has attained the state of being Muni by means of these things. Therefore it is said: “The things of the Muni are the practices that cause the state of being Muni.” Herein, since there is nothing to be done by way of body,

original: akaraṇaṃ, kattabbassa ca karaṇaṃ, “atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā”tiādinā kāyasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: akaraṇam kattabbassa ca karaṇam atthi imasmin kāye kesāti ādinā kāya saṅkhātassa
translated: and the non-doing of what should not be done, and the doing of what should be done, “There are in this body head-hairs, body-hairs, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone-marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, contents of the stomach, excrement, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovic fluid, urine” .

original: ārammaṇassa jānanaṃ, kāyassa ca samudayato atthaṅgamato assādato ādīnavato nissaraṇato🔽ca yāthāvato parijānanaṃ, tathā parijānanavasena pavatto vipassanāmaggo, tena ca🔽kāye chandarāgassa pajahanaṃ, kāyasaṅkhāraṃ nirodhetvā pattabbasamāpatti cāti sabbe
analyzed: ārammaṇassa jānanam kāyassa ca samudayataḥ atthaṅgamataḥ assādataḥ ādīnavataḥ nissaraṇato  ca yāthāvataḥ parijānanam tathā parijānana vasena pavattaḥ vipassanā maggo tena ca  kāye chanda rāgassa pajahanam kāya saṅkhāram nirodhetvā pattabba samāpatti ca ati sabbe
translated: The non-doing of what should not be done, the doing of what should be done, the knowing of the object called the body as “This body has hair of the head, . . . ,” etc., and the full understanding of the body as it actually is in its rise, fall, gratification, danger, and escape,

original: ete kāyamukhena pavattā moneyyapaṭipadā dhammā kāyamoneyyaṃ nāma. Tasmā tamatthaṃ
analyzed: ete kāya mukhena pavattā moneyya paṭipadāḥ dhammāḥ kāyamoneyyam nāma tasmā tam attham
translated: is the path of insight that occurs by way of that full understanding. And the abandoning of will and lust in regard to the body, and the attainment of the jhāna that should be attained by the cessation of bodily determinations, are all states that occur with the body as their domain. They are called the “body as the domain of the mind’s range.”

original: dassetuṃ “tividhakāyaduccaritassa pahāna”ntiādinā pāḷi āgatā. Sesadvayepi eseva nayo.🔽Tattha copanavācañceva saddavācañca ārabbha pavattā paññā vācārammaṇe ñāṇaṃ. Tassa
analyzed: dassetum tividha kāya duccaritassa pahāna nti ādinā āgatā sesa dvaye pi esā iva nayo  tattha copana vācam ca iva sadda vācam ca ārabbha pavattā paññā vācā ārammaṇe ñāṇam tassa
translated: Therefore, in order to show that meaning, the text of the sutta is stated thus: “The abandoning of the three kinds of bodily misconduct” . The same method applies to the other two cases.🔽Herein, the knowledge that occurs in regard to the low and the loud is the knowledge of the object of speech.

original: vācāya samudayādito parijānanaṃ vācāpariññā. Ekāsītividhaṃ lokiyacittaṃ ārabbha pavattañāṇaṃ
analyzed: vācāya samudaya āditas parijānanam vācā pariññā ekāsītividham lokiya cittam ārabbha pavatta ñāṇam
translated: The full understanding of speech is the full understanding of that knowledge as to its rise, etc. The knowledge that occurs in regard to the eighty-one kinds of mundane consciousness is the knowledge of the object of the mind.

original: manārammaṇe ñāṇaṃ. Tassa samudayādito parijānanaṃ manopariññāti ayameva viseso.🔽Ayanti ito sampattiyoti āyo, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ abhibuddhīti āha “āyoti vuḍḍhī”ti.
analyzed: manā ārammaṇe ñāṇam tassa samudaya āditaḥ parijānanam manas pariññā ti ayam eva viseso  ayanti itas sampattiyaḥ ti āyo kusalānam dhammānam abhibuddhī iti āha āyo ti vuḍḍhī iti
translated: Knowledge of the mind as object. The full understanding of its origin, etc., is full understanding of the mind. This is the difference.🔽“The increase of profitable ideas” is what is meant by “increase” .

original: Apenti sampattiyo etenāti apāyo, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ hānīti āha “apāyoti avuḍḍhī”ti.
analyzed: apenti sampattiyaḥ etena ati apāyaḥ kusalānam dhammānam hāni iti āha apāyaḥ iti avuḍḍhi iti
translated: “The decrease of profitable ideas” is what is meant by “decrease” .🔽“Of that and that” : of increase and decrease.

original: Tassa tassāti āyassa ca apāyassa ca. Kāraṇaṃ upāyo upeti upagacchati etena āyo, apāyo
analyzed: tassa tassa ati āyassa ca apāyassa ca kāraṇam upāyaḥ upeti upagacchati etena āyaḥ apāyaḥ
translated: “The means” is the way. One goes by it, thus it is a means.

original: cāti. Tattha duvidhā vuḍḍhi anatthahānito, atthuppattito ca, tathā avuḍḍhi atthahānito,
analyzed: ca ati tattha duvidhā vuḍḍhi anattha hānito attha uppattito ca tathā avuḍḍhi attha hānito
translated: Increase is twofold as the abandoning of what is unprofitable and the obtaining of what is profitable. So too with decrease.

original: anatthuppattito ca. Tesaṃ pajānanāti tesaṃ āyāpāyasaññitānaṃ yathāvuttappabhedānaṃ🔽vuḍḍhiavuḍḍhīnaṃ yāthāvato pajānanā. Kosallaṃ kusalatā nipuṇatā. Tadubhayampi pāḷivaseneva
analyzed: anattha uppattitaḥ ca tesam pajānanā ati tesam āya apāya saññitānam yathāvutta ppabhedānam  vuḍḍhi a vuḍḍhīnam pajānanā kosallam kusala tā nipuṇa tā tat ubhayam pi pāḷi vasena iva
translated: “The understanding of that” is the understanding of that increase and decrease as described.

original: dassetuṃ “vuttañheta”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dassetum vuttam hetat tiādi vuttam
translated: “Skill” is cleverness. In order to show both these in the text itself he said “It is said” .

original: Tattha idaṃ vuccatīti yā imesaṃ akusaladhammānaṃ anuppattinirodhesu, kusaladhammānañca🔽uppattibhiyyobhāvesu paññā, idaṃ āyakosallaṃ nāma vuccati. Idāni apāyakosallampi🔽pāḷivaseneva dassetuṃ “tattha katama”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha idaṃ vuccatīti yā imesaṃ🔽kusaladhammānaṃ anuppajjananirujjhanesu, akusaladhammānañca uppattibhiyyobhāvesu🔽paññā, idaṃ apāyakosallaṃ nāma vuccatīti. Etthāhaāyakosallaṃ tāva paññā hotu, apāyakosallaṃ🔽kathaṃ paññā nāma jātāti evaṃ maññati “apāyuppādanasamatthatā apāyakosallaṃ nāmā”ti,🔽taṃ pana tassa matimattaṃ. Paññavā eva hi “mayhaṃ evaṃ manasi karoto anuppannā kusalā
analyzed: tattha idam vuccati iti yāḥ imesam akusala dhammānam anuppatti nirodhesu kusala dhammānam ca  uppatti bhiyyobhāvesu paññā idam āyakosallam nāma vuccati idāni apāyakosallam pi  pāḷi vasena iva dassetum tattha katamat tiādi vuttam tattha idam vuccati iti yāḥ imesam  kusala dhammānam anuppajjana nirujjhanesu akusala dhammānam ca uppatti bhiyyobhāvesu  paññā idam apāyakosallam nāma vuccati iti ettha āha āyakosallam tāva paññā hotu apāyakosallam  katham paññā nāma jātā ati evam maññati apāya uppādana samattha tā apāyakosallam nāma ati  tam pana tassa matimattam paññavā eva hi mayham evam manasi karotaḥ anuppannā kusalā
translated: Herein, it is said that this is skill in arrival: understanding of the non-arising and cessation of these unprofitable ideas and of the increase and abundance of these profitable ideas is called skill in arrival. Now, in order to show skill in non-arrival by means of the text itself, the following is said: “Herein, what is skill in non-arrival? “ Herein, it is said that this is skill in non-arrival: understanding of the non-arising and cessation of these profitable ideas and of the increase and abundance of these unprofitable ideas is called skill in non-arrival. Herein, it may be asked: “Let skill in arrival be understanding; but how is skill in non-arrival called understanding? “ He thinks thus: “ Skill in non-arrival is the ability to cause non-arrival “ . But that is only his opinion. For it is only one who has understanding that can think “ When I give attention thus, unprofitable ideas do not arise in me

original: dhammā nuppajjanti, uppannā nirujjhanti. Anuppannā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti, uppannā
analyzed: dhammā nuppajjanti uppannāḥ nirujjhanti anuppannāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannā
translated: Herein, it is said that this is skill in arrival: understanding of the non-arising and cessation of these unprofitable ideas and of the increase and abundance of these profitable ideas is called skill in arrival. Now, in order to show skill in non-arrival by means of the text, the following is said: Herein, what is skill in non-arrival? It is said that this is skill in non-arrival: understanding of the non-arising and cessation of these profitable ideas and of the increase and abundance of these unprofitable ideas is called skill in non-arrival. Herein, it may be asked: Let skill in arrival be understanding; but how is skill in non-arrival called understanding? He thinks thus: “Skill in non-arrival is the ability to prevent non-arrival “ . But that is only his opinion. For it is only one who is possessed of understanding who thinks thus: “When I give attention in this way, unprofitable ideas that have not arisen do not arise, and those that have arisen are abandoned. Unprofitable ideas that have not arisen do arise, and those that have arisen are not abandoned.

original: vaḍḍhantī”ti pajānāti, so evaṃ ñatvā anuppanne akusale dhamme na uppādeti, uppanne🔽pajahati. Anuppanne kusale dhamme uppādeti, uppanne bhāvanāpāripūriṃ pāpeti. Evaṃ
analyzed: vaḍḍhanti iti pajānāti saḥ evam ñatvā anuppanne akusale dhamme na uppādeti uppanne  pajahati anuppanne kusale dhamme uppādeti uppanne bhāvanā pāripūrim pāpeti evam
translated: He understands thus: ‘Evil unwholesome states are on the decrease in me.’ Having understood thus, he arouses no desire to abandon unarisen unwholesome states, and he abandons unwholesome states that have arisen. He arouses desire for the arising of unarisen wholesome states, and he consolidates unarisen wholesome states by development.🔽Thus understanding, he arouses desire for the arising of unarisen wholesome states, and he consolidates unarisen wholesome states by development.

original: apāyakosallampi paññā evāti. Sabbāpīti āyakosallapakkhikāpi apāyakosallapakkhikāpi.
analyzed: apāya kosallam pi paññā eva ati sabbā api iti āya kosalla pakkhikā api apāya kosalla pakkhikā api
translated: Thus understanding, he arouses desire for the arising of unarisen wholesome states, and he consolidates unarisen wholesome states by development.

original: Tatrupāyāti tatra tatra karaṇīye upāyabhūtā.
analyzed: tatra upāyāti tatra tatra karaṇīye upāya bhūtā
translated: The means for that is the means for that.🔽For the purpose of treating that is for the purpose of avoiding the more important task or danger.

original: Tassa tikicchanatthanti accāyikassa kiccassa, bhayassa vā pariharaṇatthaṃ ṭhānuppattiyakāraṇajānanavasenevāti
analyzed: tassa ti kicchana ttham ti accāyikassa kiccassa bhayassa vā pariharaṇa attham ṭhāna uppattiyā kāraṇa jānana vasena iva āti
translated: By the means of knowing the reason for the occurrence of a state is by the means of knowing the reason for the occurrence of a state at that place and at that time.

original: ṭhāne taṅkhaṇe eva uppatti etassa atthīti ṭhānuppattikaṃ, ṭhānaso uppajjanakakāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: ṭhāne taṅkhaṇe eva uppatti etassa atthi iti ṭhānuppattikam ṭhānasaḥ uppajjanaka kāraṇam
translated: The reason for the occurrence of a state at that place and at that time is a reason for the occurrence of a state at that place.

original: tassa jānanavaseneva.
analyzed: tassa jānana vasena iva
translated: By the means of knowing that.

original: Majjanākāravasena pavattamānāti attano vatthuno madanīyatāya madassa āpajjanākārena
analyzed: majjana ākāra vasena pavattamānā ati attanaḥ vatthunaḥ madanīya tāya madassa āpajjana ākārena
translated: Occurring by the mode of floating is occurring by the mode of the arising of intoxication due to the intoxicating nature of one’s own object.🔽The elevations are the elevations of the mind.

original: pavattamānā uṇṇatiyo. Nirogoti arogo. Mānakaraṇanti mānassa uppādanaṃ. Yobbane ṭhatvāti
analyzed: pavattamānā uṇṇatiyaḥ nirogo ti arogaḥ māna karaṇam ti mānassa uppādanam yobbane ṭhatvā ati
translated: The end is health. The making of conceit is the arousing of conceit. Standing in youth is standing in youth.

original: yobbane patiṭṭhāya, yobbanaṃ apassāyāti attho. Sabbesampi jīvitaṃ nāma maraṇapabhaṅguraṃ
analyzed: yobbane patiṭṭhāya yobbanam a passāya ati attho sabbesam pi jīvitam nāma maraṇa pabhaṅguram
translated: The life of all is fragile and perishable in death,🔽and it is followed by suffering. Without looking at both of these,

original: dukkhānubandhañca, tadubhayaṃ anoloketvā, pabandhaṭṭhitipaccayā sulabhatañca nissāya
analyzed: dukkha anubandham ca tat ubhayam anoloketvā pabandha ṭṭhiti paccayā sulabha tat ca nissāya
translated: and relying on the ease of obtaining the conditions for the duration of life,

original: uppajjanakamado jīvitamadoti dassetuṃ “ciraṃ jīvi”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: uppajjanaka madaḥ jīvita madaḥ ti dassetum ciram jīvin tiādi vuttam
translated: the lust that arises is called the intoxication of life. To show this, it is said: “Long-lived” and so on.

original: Adhipati vuccati jeṭṭhako, issaroti attho. Tato adhipatito āgataṃ ādhipateyyaṃ. Kiṃ
analyzed: adhipati vuccati jeṭṭhako issaro ti attho tatas adhipatitaḥ āgatam ādhipateyyam kim
translated: The chief is called the lord, the meaning is the ruler. From that chief comes the lordship. What is that?

original: taṃ? Pāpassa akaraṇaṃ. Tenāha “ettakomhī”tiādi. Tattha sīlādayo lokiyā eva daṭṭhabbā,
analyzed: tam pāpassa akaraṇam tena āha ettako mhi itiādi tattha sīla ādayaḥ lokiyāḥ eva daṭṭhabbā
translated: The non-doing of evil. Therefore it is said: “I am so much” and so on. Therein, morality and so on should be seen as only worldly,

original: tasmā vimuttiyāti lokiyavimuttiyā. Jeṭṭhakanti issaraṃ, garunti attho. Ettha ca attānaṃ,
analyzed: tasmai vimuttiyā ti lokiya vimuttiyā jeṭṭhakam ti issaram garun ti attho ettha ca attānam
translated: therefore “liberation” means worldly liberation. The chief is the ruler, the meaning is the elder. Herein,🔽having made oneself and

original: dhammañca adhipatiṃ katvā pāpassa akaraṇaṃ hiriyā vasena veditabbaṃ. Lokaṃ adhipatiṃ
analyzed: dhammañca adhipatim katvā pāpassa akaraṇam hiriyā vasena veditabbam lokam adhipatim
translated: the Dhamma the chief, the non-doing of evil should be understood by way of shame. Having made the world

analyzed: katvā a karaṇam ottappassa vasena
translated: the chief, the non-doing is by way of fear of wrongdoing.🔽The topics of discussion are the bases for the occurrence of discussion. Since discussion does not occur without them,

analyzed: kathā vatthūni iti kathāya pavatti ṭṭhānāni yasmā tehi vinā kathā na ppavattati tasmā
translated: therefore

analyzed: kathā kāraṇāni iti vuttam addhāna saddassa atthaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ eva saḥ pana atthato

analyzed: dhamma ppavattimattam dhammā ca ittha khandhāḥ eva tad binimuttā ca tesam gati natthi iti
translated: it is merely the occurrence of states. And here the states are the aggregates, and apart from them there is no destiny for them.

original: āha “atītaṃ dhammaṃ, atītakkhandheti attho”ti. Ayañca addhā nāma disādi viya atthato
analyzed: āha atītam dhammam atīta kkhandha iti attho ti ayam ca addhā nāma disa ādi viya atthato
translated: Therefore it is said: ‘The meaning is: a past state, past aggregates.’ And this ‘period’ is a mere designation based on the occurrence of states, like the directions, etc.,

original: dhammappavattiṃ upādāya paññattimattaṃ, na upādā na bhūtadhammoti tamatthaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: dhamma ppavattim upādāya paññattimattam na upādā na bhūta dhammo ti tam attham dassetuṃ
translated: in the sense of a part of space. It is not a real entity. In order to show that meaning,

original: “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: apica itiādi vuttam
translated: ‘Moreover, etc.,’ is said.

original: “Tamavijjhanaṭṭhena viditakaraṇaṭṭhenā”ti saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vivarituṃ “pubbenivāsā”tiādi
analyzed: tam avijjhana ṭhena vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena ati saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vivaritum pubbenivāsa ātiādi
translated: In order to explain the meaning briefly stated as ‘in the sense of the destruction of the darkness of ignorance, in the sense of the making known,’ ‘The knowledge of past lives’ is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Pubbenivāsanti pubbe nivutthakkhandhe. Tamanti mohatamaṃ. Vijjhatīti vihanati,
analyzed: vuttam pubbenivāsanti pubbe nivuttha kkhandhe tamanti moha tamam vijjhatīti vihanati
translated: Past lives: the aggregates that lived in the past. The darkness of ignorance: the darkness of delusion. It destroys ,

original: pajahatīti attho. Teneva ca paṭicchādakatamavijjhanena pubbenivāsañca viditaṃ pākaṭaṃ
analyzed: pajahati iti attho tena iva ca pubbenivāsam ca viditam pākaṭam
translated: it abandons, is the meaning. And because it destroys the darkness of ignorance that conceals the past lives, it makes known, makes evident,

original: karotīti vijjāti. Tanti cutūpapātaṃ.
analyzed: karoti iti cutūpapātam
translated: the past lives, thus it is knowledge . The knowledge of future occurrence: the future death and rebirth of beings.

original: Upapattidevavisesabhāvāvaho vihāroti katvā dibbo vihāro. Nanu evaṃ aññamaññānampi🔽dibbavihārabhāvo āpajjatīti? Na tāsaṃ sattesu hitūpasaṃhārādivasena pavattiyā savisesaṃ
analyzed: upapatti deva visesa bhāva āvahaḥ vihāraḥ ti katvā dibbaḥ vihāraḥ nanu evam aññamaññānam pi  dibba vihāra bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti na tāsam sattesu hitu upasaṃhāra ādi vasena pavattiyā sa visesam
translated: The divine abiding is the divine life, since it is the cause of the special state of being in the divine abodes of the gods.🔽But is not the divine life also found in the other jhānas?🔽It is not, because they do not occur with the special quality of being free from hate, etc., and because they are not established by the name “divine abiding” in the way that these are.

original: niddosaṭṭhena, seṭṭhaṭṭhena ca brahmavihārasamaññāya niruḷhabhāvato. Suvisuddhito
analyzed: niddosa ṭhena seṭṭha ṭṭhena ca brahmavihāra samaññāya niruḷha bhāvataḥ su visuddhitaḥ
translated: Because it is very pure,

original: paṭipakkhasamucchindanavasena araṇīyato pattabbato, ariyabhāvappattiyā vā anantaraṃ
analyzed: paṭipakkha samucchindana vasena araṇīyataḥ pattabbataḥ ariya bhāva ppattiyāḥ vā anantaram
translated: because it is worthy of being an object of the noble ones’ choice, or because it is the immediate cause of the attainment of the noble state,

original: ariyo. Ariyānaṃ ayanti vā ariyo vihāro.
analyzed: ariyaḥ ariyānam ayanti vā ariyaḥ vihāraḥ
translated: it is noble . Or the noble life is so called because the noble ones go by it.

original: Sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.
analyzed: sesam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva
translated: The rest is as already stated.

original: Tikavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Catukkavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tika vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  catukka vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the triads is ended.🔽The tetrads

original: 306. Pubbeti heṭṭhā mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ.🔽Yo chandoti yo chandiyanavasena chando. Chandikatāti chandabhāvo, chandikaraṇākāro
analyzed: pubba iti heṭṭhā mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanāyam  yaḥ chandaḥ iti chanda bhāvaḥ chandi karaṇa ākāraḥ
translated: The “former” is the great fourfold foundation of mindfulness .

original: vā. Kattukamyatāti kattukāmatā. Kusaloti cheko kosallasambhūto. Dhammacchandoti sabhāvacchando.
analyzed: vā kattu kamya tā ati kattu kāma tā kusalaḥ iti chekaḥ kosalla sambhūtaḥ dhamma chando ti sabhāva chando
translated: “Interest” is the kind of interest called “desire to act” . “Inclination” is the state of being inclined, or the mode of inclining, that is called “interest” . “Willingness” is the desire to act. “Skill” is the ability born of the skill . “Interest in the True Idea” is the kind of interest called “desire to act” .

original: Ayañhi chando nāma taṇhāchando, diṭṭhichando, vīriyachando, dhammacchandoti bahuvidho.
analyzed: ayan hi chandaḥ nāma taṇhā chandaḥ diṭṭhi chandaḥ vīriya chandaḥ dhamma chandaḥ iti bahuvidhaḥ
translated: For this “desire” is of many kinds: desire as craving, desire as view, desire as energy, desire as the True Idea.

original: Idha kattukamyatākusaladhammacchando adhippeto. Chandaṃ janetīti taṃ chandaṃ uppādeti.
analyzed: idha kattu kamya tā kusala dhamma chandaḥ adhippetaḥ chandam janeti iti tam chandam uppādeti
translated: Herein, the desire intended is the unwholesome desire to act. He generates desire: he arouses that desire.

original: Taṃ pavattento hi janeti nāma. Vāyāmaṃ karotīti payogaṃ parakkamaṃ karoti. Vīriyaṃ🔽ārabhatīti kāyikacetasikavīriyaṃ pavatteti. Cittaṃ upatthambhetīti teneva sahajātavīriyena
analyzed: tam pavattentaḥ hi janeti nāma vāyāmam karoti iti payogam parakkamam karoti vīriyam  ārabhati iti kāyika cetasika vīriyam pavatteti cittam upatthambheti iti tena iva sahajāta vīriyena
translated: For one who arouses it is said to “generate” it. He makes an effort: he makes an attempt, makes exertion.🔽He exerts energy: he sets going bodily and mental energy.🔽He steadies his cognizance: he raises his cognizance by means of that energy that is conascent with it.

original: cittaṃ ukkhipati. Padahatīti padhānaṃ vīriyaṃ karoti. Paṭipāṭiyā panetāni padāni
analyzed: cittam ukkhipati padahati iti padhānam vīriyam karoti paṭipāṭiyā pana itāni padāni
translated: He strives: he makes striving, makes exertion.🔽But these terms should be construed with the “repeated practice” and the “contemplation of turning away” , and so on.

original: uppādanāsevanābhāvanābahulīkammasātaccakiriyāhi yojetabbāni. Vitthāraṃ pariharanto
analyzed: uppādana āsevana bhāvanā bahulīkamma sātacca kiriyāhi yojetabbāni vitthāram pariharantaḥ
translated: Avoiding elaboration,

original: “ayamettha saṅkhepo”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ayam ettha saṅkhepa iti ādim āha
translated: he says “Here is a brief account of it” .

original: Chandaṃ nissāyāti “chandavato cetosamādhi hoti, mayhaṃ evaṃ hotī”ti evaṃ chandaṃ
analyzed: chandam nissāya ati chandavataḥ cetaḥ samādhi hoti mayham evam hoti iti evam chandam
translated: Depending on desire: “For one who has desire, cognizance becomes concentrated thus: ‘May I be like this or may I attain this’” .

original: nissāya chandaṃ dhuraṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ katvā pavatto samādhi chandasamādhi.🔽Padhānabhūtāti padhānajātā, padhānabhāvaṃ vā pattā. Saṅkhārāti catukiccasādhakaṃ
analyzed: nissāya chandam dhuram jeṭṭhakam pubbaṅgamam katvā pavattaḥ samādhi chanda samādhi  padhāna bhūtā ati padhāna jātā padhāna bhāvam vā pattā saṅkhārā ati catu kicca sādhakam
translated: Concentration that has arisen making zeal its support, its mainstay, its chief, its forerunner, is concentration due to zeal.🔽“With the jhāna factors as its basis”: with the jhāna factors as its origin, or having reached the state of being a jhāna factor. “With formations as its source”:

original: sammappadhānavīriyaṃ vadati. Tehi dhammehīti yathāvuttasamādhivīriyehi upetaṃ sampayuttaṃ.🔽Iddhiyā pādanti nipphattipariyāyena ijjhanaṭṭhena, ijjhanti etāya sattā iddhā vuddhā
analyzed: sammappadhāna vīriyam vadati tehi dhammehi iti yathā vutta samādhi vīriyehi upetam sampayuttam  iddhiyā pādanti nipphatti pariyāyena ijjhana ṭṭhena ijjhanti etāya sattāḥ iddhāḥ vuddhā
translated: it has the energy of the right endeavour that accomplishes the fourfold task as its source. “Endowed with these things”: endowed with, provided with, furnished with, supplied with, the concentration and energy mentioned above.🔽“The basis for success”: in the sense of succeeding, of succeeding through it, beings succeed, they grow, they increase, they are pre-eminent, or in the sense that it is the basis, the support, the foundation, for the success called “success” and “great success” ,

original: ukkaṃsagatā hontīti iminā vā pariyāyena “iddhī”ti saṅkhyaṃ gatānaṃ upacārajjhānādikusalacittasampayuttānaṃ🔽chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārānaṃ adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena pādabhūtaṃ. Yasmā purimā iddhi pacchimāya
analyzed: ukkaṃsa gatāḥ honti iti iminā vā pariyāyena iddhi iti saṅkhyam gatānam upacāra jhāna ādi kusala citta sampayuttānam  adhiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena pāda bhūtam yasmai purimā id hi pacchimāya
translated: which is reckoned as such because it is associated with the profitable consciousnesses beginning with access concentration.🔽Because the earlier success is the basis, the support, the foundation, for the later success,

original: iddhiyā pādo pādakaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ hoti, tasmā “iddhibhūtaṃ vā pāda”nti ca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: iddhiyā pādaḥ pādakam padaṭṭhānam hoti tasmai iddhi bhūtam vā ca vuttam
translated: therefore it is said, “It is the basis for success.”

original: Sesesupīti dutiyaiddhipādādīsu. Kāmañcettha janavasabhasuttepi iddhipādavicāro āgato,
analyzed: sesesu pi iti dutiya eddhipāda ādīsu kāmañca ittha janavasabha sutte pi iddhipāda vicāraḥ āgataḥ
translated: In the rest, i.e. in the second factor of success, etc. Although the investigation of the factors of success is given in the Janavasabha Sutta,

analyzed: saḥ api saṅkhepataḥ eva ati āha vitthāro dīpito ti
translated: it is given there in brief, too, so he says, “The detail, however, is shown in the Paṭisambhidā. ”

original: 307. Diṭṭhadhammo vuccati paccakkhabhūto attabhāvoti āha “imasmiṃyeva attabhāve”ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammaḥ vuccati paccakkha bhūtaḥ atta bhāvaḥ ti āha imasmin yeva atta bhāve ti
translated: The visible here and now is the visible state of one’s own person. So he says, “in this very person. ”

original: Sukhavihāratthāyāti nikkilesatāya nirāmisena sukhena viharaṇatthāya. Phalasamāpattijhānānīti
analyzed: sukha vihāra atthāya ati nikkilesa tāya nirāmisena sukhena viharaṇa tthāya phala samāpatti jhānāni iti
translated: For the sake of pleasant abiding: for the sake of abiding in the happiness of the deathless due to the absence of defilements. The jhānas that are attainments and fruits:

analyzed: cattāri pi phala samāpatti jhānāni aparabhāge iti āsava khaya adhigamataḥ aparabhāge nibbattita jhānāni iti
