translated: A bedstead and a chair are the two kinds of “stead.” A dwelling is the whole monastery surrounded by a fence.🔽Some say: “A long-fronted pavilion.”🔽A gabled house is a long pavilion. Some say: “A dwelling with a roof-cover on one side.” A pavilion is a square pavilion.

original: “Āyatacaturassapāsādo”ti keci. Hammiyaṃ muṇḍacchadanapāsādo. Guhāti kevalā pabbataguhā.
analyzed: āyata catur assa pāsādaḥ ti keci hammiyam muṇḍacchadana pāsādaḥ guhā ati kevalā pabbata guhā
translated: Some say: “A long square pavilion.” A stilt house is a house built on posts. A cave is a mere mountain cave.

original: Leṇaṃ dvārabandhaṃ. Aṭṭo bahalabhittikaṃ gehaṃ, yassa gopānasiyo aggahetvā iṭṭhakāhi🔽eva chadanaṃ hoti. “Aṭṭālakākārena kariyatī”tipi vadanti. Māḷo ekakūṭasaṅgahito anekakoṇo
analyzed: leṇam dvāra bandham aṭṭaḥ bahala bhittikam geham yassa gopānasiyaḥ aggahetvā  eva chadanam aṭṭālaka ākārena vadanti māḷaḥ eka kūṭa saṅgahitaḥ aneka koṇaḥ
translated: A leṇa is a door-frame. Aṭṭa is a house with thick walls, the roof of which is made of bricks without using rafters.🔽Some say that it is made in the shape of a beehive. Māḷa is a kind of multi-storied building with many corners,

original: patissayaviseso “vaṭṭākārena katasenāsana”nti keci.
analyzed: patissaya visesaḥ vaṭṭa ākārena katasena āsananti keci
translated: which is a special kind of living quarters. Some say that it is a building made in the shape of a circle.

original: Piṇḍapāte vuttanayenevāti “sādako bhikkhu ‘ajja kattha vasissāmī’ti vitakketī”tiādinā🔽yathārahaṃ piṇḍapāte vuttanayena veditabbā, “tato paraṃ vitakkento ariyavaṃsā cuto
analyzed: piṇḍapāte vutta nayena iva ati sādakaḥ bhikkhu ajja kattha vasissāmi iti vitakketi itiādinā  yathāraham piṇḍapāte vutta nayena veditabbā tatas param vitakkentaḥ ariya vaṃsā cutaḥ
translated: As in the case of alms food: “A monk who is a good hand at living in the open air thinks, ‘Where shall I stay tonight?’

original: hoti paribāhiro”ti, “senāsanaṃ gavesantenāpi’kuhiṃ labhissāmī’ti acintetvā kammaṭṭhānasīseneva
analyzed: senāsanam gavesantena apikuhim labhissāmi iti a cintetvā kammaṭṭhāna sīsena iva
translated: He should understand it in the way appropriate to alms food, as described in the way beginning, ‘He is fallen from the noble lineage, outside, a sectarian,’ and ‘He should go with the meditation subject as his heading, without thinking, “Where shall I get a living?”’

original: gantabba”nti ca evamādi sabbaṃ purimanayeneva.
analyzed: gantabbanti ca evamādi sabbam purima nayena iva
translated: All this should be understood in the way already described.

original: Kasmā panettha paccayasantosaṃ dassentena mahātherena gilānapaccayasantoso na gahitoti?
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha paccaya santosam dassentena mahā therena gilāna paccaya santosaḥ na gahito ti
translated: But why did the great Elder, when showing contentment with requisites, not include contentment with the requisite of medicine for the sick?

original: Na kho panetaṃ evaṃ daṭṭhabbanti dassento “gilānapaccayo pana piṇḍapāte eva paviṭṭho”ti
analyzed: na kho pana itam evam daṭṭhabbanti dassento gilāna paccayaḥ pana piṇḍapāte eva paviṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: The intention is that the alms-food is included in the requisite of medicine as cure for the sick.

original: āha, āharitabbatāsāmaññenāti adhippāyo. Yadi evaṃ tattha piṇḍapāte viya vitakkasantosādayopi🔽pannarasa santosā icchitabbāti? Noti dassento āha “tatthā”tiādi. Nanu cettha dvādaseva
analyzed: āha āharitabba tā sāmaññena ati adhippāyaḥ yadi evam tattha piṇḍapāte viya vitakka santosa ādayaḥ api  pannarasa santosāḥ icchitabbā ati no ti dassento āha tattha atiādi nanu ca ittha dvādasā iva
translated: If that is so, then contentment with the kinds of resting places should be included in the alms-food too, since they are similar in being things to be brought?🔽No, he shows that it should not be so included, saying “There” , etc.

original: dhutaṅgāni viniyogaṃ gatāni, ekaṃ pana nesajjikaṅgaṃ na katthaci viniyuttanti āha
analyzed: dhutaṅgāni viniyogam gatāni ekam pana nesajjikaṅgam na katthaci viniyuttan ti āha
translated: But are not only twelve of the ascetic practices actually included in the requisites, while the one called the “no-couch ascetic practice” is not included anywhere?

original: “nesajjikaṅgaṃ bhāvanārāmaariyavaṃsaṃ bhajatī”ti. Ayañca attho aṭṭhakathāruḷho evāti
analyzed: nesajji kaṅgam bhāvanā ārāma ariya vaṃsam bhajati iti ayaṃ ca atthaḥ aṭṭhakathā āruḷhaḥ evā ti
translated: “The no-couch ascetic practice,” he says, “is included in the noble one’s heritage consisting in development” .🔽And this meaning is to be found in the commentaries,

original: dassento “vuttampi ceta”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: dassentaḥ vuttam pi cetan ti ādim āha
translated: so he says “It is said” , etc.

original: “Pathaviṃ pattharamāno viyā”tiādi ariyavaṃsadesanāya sudukkarabhāvadassanaṃ mahāvisayatāya
analyzed: pathavim pattharamānaḥ viyāti ādi ariya vaṃsa desanāya su dukkara bhāva dassanam mahā visaya tāya
translated: “As though desiring a wide earth” , etc., is said to show that the teaching of the noble heritage is difficult to do because of its vast scope.

original: tassā desanāya. Yasmā nayasahassapaṭimaṇḍitā hoti ariyamaggādhigamāya vitthārato
analyzed: tassāḥ desanāya yasmā naya sahassa paṭimaṇḍitā hoti ariya magga adhigamāya vitthārato
translated: For the noble heritage is adorned with a thousand modes of practice and is the means to the attainment of the noble path in detail.

original: pavattiyamānā desanā yathā taṃ cittuppādakaṇḍe, ayañca bhāvanārāmaariyavaṃsakathā
analyzed: desanā yathā tam cittuppāda kaṇḍe ayam ca bhāvanā ārāma ariya vaṃsa kathā
translated: The teaching given in the way already stated in the Cittuppādakanda is the same as that given in the Ariyavaṃsa in the way about to be stated.🔽But it is given in detail in the Ariyavaṃsa for the purpose of attaining the noble path.

original: ariyamaggādhigamāya vitthārato pavattiyamānā evaṃ hotīti vuttaṃ “sahassanayappaṭimaṇḍitaṃ…pe…
analyzed: ariya magga adhigamāya vitthārato evam hoti iti vuttam
translated: That is why it is said: “Adorned with a thousand doors of method …

original: desanaṃ ārabhī”ti. Paṭipakkhavidhamanato abhimukhabhāvena ramaṇaṃ āramaṇaṃ ārāmoti
analyzed: desanam ārabhi iti paṭipakkha vidhamanataḥ abhimukha bhāvena ramaṇam āramaṇam ārāmo ti
translated: he began the teaching.”

original: āha “abhiratīti attho”ti. Byadhikaraṇānampi padānaṃ vasena bhavati bāhiratthasamāso🔽yathā “urasilomo, kaṇṭhekāḷoti āha “pahāne ārāmo assāti pahānārāmo”ti. Āramitabbaṭṭhena
analyzed: āha abhirati iti byadhikaraṇānam pi padānam vasena bhavati bāhirattha samāsaḥ  yathā urasilomaḥ kaṇṭhekāḷaḥ ti āha pahāne ārāmaḥ assa ati pahāna ārāmaḥ ti āramitabba ṭṭhena
translated: The meaning of the word ārāma is “delight” in the sense of delighting by facing towards, by confronting, what is contrary to the opposite qualities.🔽That is why it is said: “The meaning is: delighting” .🔽The compound pahānārāma is a bahubbīhi compound in the sense of “having as its object the abandoning of” .🔽That is why it is said: “He is one who has delight in the abandoning of” .🔽Or alternatively, ārāma has the meaning of “to be gone to” .

original: vā ārāmo, pahānaṃ ārāmo assāti pahānārāmoti evamettha samāsayojanā veditabbā. “Pajahanto
analyzed: vā ārāmaḥ pahānam ārāmaḥ assa ati pahāna ārāmaḥ ti evam ettha samāsa yojanā veditabbā pajahantaḥ
translated: That is why it is said: “He is one who has delight in the abandoning of” .🔽This is how the compound should be construed here.

original: ramatī”ti etena pahānārāmasaddānaṃ kattusādhanataṃ, kammadhārayasamāsañca dasseti.
analyzed: ramati iti etena pahāna ārāma saddānam kattu sādhana tam kammadhāraya samāsam ca dasseti
translated: By the words “he delights in abandoning” he shows that the word pahānārāma is a gerundive and a tatpurisa compound.

original: “Bhāvento ramatī”ti vuttattā bhāvanārāmoti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: bhāventaḥ ramati iti vutta ttā bhāvanā ārāmaḥ ti ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: The same method of explanation applies to the word bhāvanārāma, since it is said “he delights in developing.”

original: Kāmaṃ “nesajjikaṅgaṃ bhāvanārāmaariyavaṃsaṃ bhajatī”ti vuttaṃ bhāvanānuyogassa anucchavikattā,
analyzed: kāmam nesajjika aṅgam bhāvanā ārāma ariya vaṃsam bhajati iti vuttam bhāvanā anuyogassa anucchavika ttā
translated: “He resorts to the noble lineage of delight in development” is said because it is suitable for the practice of development.

original: nesajjikaṅgavasena pana nesajjikassa bhikkhuno ekaccāhi āpattīhi anāpattibhāvoti
analyzed: nesajjika aṅga vasena pana nesajjikassa bhikkhuno ekaccāhi āpattīhi anāpatti bhāvaḥ ti
translated: But the fact that a monk who is a non-idler is not guilty of certain offenses is

original: tampi saṅgaṇhanto “terasannaṃ dhutaṅgāna”nti vatvā “vinayaṃ patvā garuke ṭhātabba”nti
analyzed: tam pi saṅgaṇhantaḥ vatvā vinayam patvā garuke ṭhātabbanti
translated: included in the thirteen ascetic practices. Therefore, after saying “thirteen ascetic practices,” he said “in the Vinaya it should be taken as weighty.”

original: icchitattā sallekhassa apariccajanavasena paṭipatti nāma vinaye ṭhitassevāti āha
analyzed: icchita ttā sallekhassa a pariccajana vasena paṭipatti nāma vinaye ṭhitassa iva āti āha
translated: Because he wants it to be so, the practice is only for one who is established in the Vinaya, since he does not abandon austerity.

original: “terasannaṃ…pe… kathitaṃ hotī”ti. Kāmaṃ suttābhidhammapiṭakesupi tattha tattha sīlakathā
analyzed: kathitam hoti iti kāmam sutta abhidhamma piṭakesu pi tattha tattha sīla kathā
translated: “The rest of the two Piṭakas is said to be by the lineage of delight in development.” Although in the Suttas and Abhidhamma Piṭakas there are also discussions of virtue here and there,

original: āgatā eva, yehi pana guṇehi sīlassa vodānaṃ hoti, tesu kathitesu yathā sīlakathābāhullaṃ
analyzed: āgatāḥ eva yehi pana guṇehi sīlassa vodānam hoti tesu kathitesu yathā sīla kathā bāhullam
translated: when the qualities by which virtue is purified are discussed, then the Vinaya Piṭaka is said to be a discussion of virtue in detail,

original: vinayapiṭakaṃ kathitaṃ hoti, evaṃ bhāvanākathābāhullaṃ suttantapiṭakaṃ, abhidhammapiṭakañca
analyzed: vinaya piṭakam kathitam hoti evam bhāvanā kathā bāhullam suttanta piṭakam abhidhamma piṭakam ca
translated: and the Suttanta Piṭaka and the Abhidhamma Piṭaka are said to be a discussion of development in detail.

original: catutthena ariyavaṃsena kathitameva hotīti vuttaṃ “bhāvanārāmena avasesaṃ piṭakadvayaṃ
analyzed: catutthena ariya vaṃsena kathitam eva hoti iti vuttam bhāvanā ārāmena avasesam piṭaka dvayam
translated: So it is said that the rest of the two Piṭakas is said to be by the fourth noble lineage of delight in development.

original: kathitaṃ hotī”ti. “So nekkhammaṃ bhāvento ramatī”ti nekkhammapadaṃ ādiṃ katvā tattha
analyzed: kathitam hoti iti saḥ nekkhammam bhāvento ramati iti nekkhamma padam ādim katvā tattha
translated: “He delights in developing renunciation” : the term “renunciation” is stated first, because the teaching proceeds in that way.

original: desanāya pavattattā, sabbesampi vā samathavipassanāmaggadhammānaṃ yathāsakaṃpaṭipakkhato
analyzed: desanāya pavatta ttā sabbesam pi vā samatha vipassanā magga dhammānam yathāsakam paṭipakkhato
translated: Or else, because all the profitable dhammas of serenity and insight, which are called “renunciation” since they go forth from their opposites, are included there.

original: nikkhamanena nekkhammasaññitānaṃ tattha āgatattā so pāṭho “nekkhammapāḷī”ti vuccatīti
analyzed: nikkhamanena nekkhamma saññitānam tattha āgata ttā saḥ pāṭhaḥ nekkhammapāḷī iti vuccati iti
translated: That reading is called “the renunciation section” .

original: āha “nekkhammapāḷiyā kathetabbo”ti. Tenāha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “sabbepi kusalā dhammā nekkhammanti🔽pavuccare”ti. Dasuttarasuttanta pariyāyenāti dasuttarasuttantadhammena, dasuttarasuttante
analyzed: āha nekkhamma pāḷiyā kathetabbaḥ ti tena āha aṭṭhakathā ayam sabbe pi kusalāḥ dhammāḥ nekkhammanti  pavuccara iti dasuttara suttanta pariyāyena ati dasuttara suttanta dhammena dasuttara suttante
translated: That is why it is said in the commentary: “All profitable dhammas are called ‘renunciation’ .🔽” In the method of the Dasuttarasutta : in the way of the Dasuttarasutta .🔽Or the meaning is: in the method stated in the Dasuttarasutta .

original: āgatanayenāti vā attho. Sesadvayepi eseva nayo.🔽Soti jāgariyaṃ anuyutto bhikkhu. Nekkhammanti kāmehi nikkhantabhāvato nekkhammasaññitaṃ
analyzed: āgata nayena ati vā attho sesa dvaye pi esa iva nayo  saḥ ti jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ bhikkhu nekkhammanti kāmehi nikkhanta bhāvataḥ nekkhamma saññitam
translated: The same method applies to the other two.🔽“He” : the bhikkhu devoted to wakefulness.🔽“Renunciation” : access concentration associated with renunciation, which is called “renunciation” because it goes forth from sense desires.

original: paṭhamajjhānūpacāraṃ. “So abhijjhaṃ loke pahāyā”tiādinā āgatā paṭhamajjhānassa pubbabhāgabhāvanāti
analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna upacāram so abhijjham loke pahāya ati ādinā āgatā paṭhamajjhānassa pubbabhāga bhāvanā ti
translated: “He abandons covetousness in the world” : the development that is the forerunner of the first jhana.

original: idhādhippetā, tasmā “abyāpāda”ntiādīsupi evameva attho veditabbo. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ,
analyzed: idha adhippetā tasmai evam eva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ yam pana ittha vattabbam
translated: So the meaning should be understood in the same way in the case of “non-ill will” and the rest.

original: taṃ brahmajālaṭīkāyaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ. Saupāyāsānañhi aṭṭhannaṃ samāpattīnaṃ,
analyzed: tam brahmajāla ṭīkāyam vutta nayena veditabbam sa upāyāsānam hi aṭṭhannam samāpattīnam
translated: And what has to be said here can be understood from the method of explanation in the Brahmajāla Commentary.🔽For the teaching here proceeds by way of the eight attainments with thought-conception and discursive thinking,

original: aṭṭhārasannaṃ mahāvipassanānaṃ, catunnaṃ ariyamaggānañca vasenettha desanā pavattāti.
analyzed: mahāvipassanānam catunnam ariya maggānam ca vasena ittha desanā pavattā ti
translated: the eighteen principal insights, and the four noble paths.

original: “Ekaṃ dhammaṃ bhāvento ramati, ekaṃ dhammaṃ pajahanto ramatī”ti ca na idaṃ dasuttarasutte
analyzed: ekam dhammam bhāventaḥ ramati ekam dhammam pajahantaḥ ramati iti ca na idam dasuttara sutte
translated: “He delights in developing one idea, he delights in abandoning one idea” . This is not stated in the way it is stated in the Dasuttara Sutta .

original: āgataniyāmena vuttaṃ, tattha pana “eko dhammo bhāvetabbo, eko dhammo pahātabbo”ti
analyzed: āgata niyāmena vuttam tattha pana ekaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ ekaḥ dhammo pahātabbaḥ ti
translated: But there the teaching is stated in the way beginning, “One idea to be developed … one idea to be abandoned” .

original: ca desanā āgatā. Evaṃ santepi yasmā atthato bhedo natthi, tasmā paṭisambhidāmagge
analyzed: ca desanā āgatā evam sante pi yasmai atthataḥ bhedaḥ na atthi tasmai paṭisambhidā magge
translated: And even though that is so, still, since there is no difference in the meaning,

original: nekkhammapāḷiyaṃ āgatanīhāreneva “ekaṃ dhammaṃ bhāvento ramati, ekaṃ dhammaṃ pajahanto
analyzed: nekkhamma pāḷiyam āgata nīhārena iva ekam dhammam bhāventaḥ ramati ekam dhammam pajahantaḥ
translated: in the Paṭisambhidā it is stated in the same way as in the Nekkhamma pāḷi, namely, “He delights in developing one idea, he delights in abandoning one idea” .🔽And so too in the rest of the tetrads.

original: ramatī”ti vuttaṃ. Esa nayo sesavāresupi. Yasmā cāyaṃ ariyavaṃsadesanā nāma satthu
analyzed: ramati iti vuttam esa nayo sesa vāresu pi yasmā ca ayam ariya vaṃsadesanā nāma satthu
translated: And this teaching of the Noble Ones’ Heritages is called “the Blessed One’s own presentation of the Dhamma” because it is stated in the way he himself presented it.

original: paññattāva satthārā hi desitaṃ desanaṃ āyasmā dhammasenāpati sāriputtatthero saṅgāyanavasena🔽idhānesi, tasmā mahāariyavaṃsasutte satthudesanānīhārena nigamanaṃ dassento “evaṃ
analyzed: paññattā ava satthārā hi desitam desanam āyasmā dhammasenāpati sāriputta thero saṅgāyana vasena  idha anesi tasmai mahāariyavaṃsa sutte satthu desanā nīhārena nigamanam dassento evam
translated: For the venerable Sāriputta, the Master’s chief disciple, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bhāvanārāmo hotī”ti āha. Eseva nayo ito paresu satipaṭṭhānapariyāyaabhidhammaniddesapariyāyesupi.🔽Kāmañcettha kāyānupassanāvaseneva saṅkhipitvā yojanā katā, ekavīsatiyā pana ṭhānānaṃ
analyzed: kho bhikkhave bhikkhu bhāvanā ārāmaḥ hoti iti āha esa eva nayaḥ itas paresu sati paṭṭhāna pariyāya abhidhamma niddesa pariyāyesu pi  kāmam ca ittha kāya anupassanā vasena iva saṅkhipitvā yojanā katā ekavīsatiyā pana ṭhānānam
translated: Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: vasena vitthārato yojanā veditabbā. “Aniccato” tiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāsu🔽vuttanayena veditabbaṃ.🔽310. Saṃvarādīnaṃ sādhanavasena padahati ettha, etehīti ca padhānāni. Uttamavīriyānīti
analyzed: vasena vitthārataḥ yojanā veditabbā aniccataḥ ti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanāsu  vutta nayena veditabbam  saṃvara ādīnam sādhana vasena padahati ettha ca padhānāni uttama vīriyāni iti
translated: Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.🔽Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: seṭṭhavīriyāni visiṭṭhassa atthassa sādhanato. Saṃvarantassa uppannavīriyanti yathā
analyzed: seṭṭha vīriyāni visiṭṭhassa atthassa sādhanataḥ saṃvarantassa uppanna vīriyanti yathā
translated: Therefore, in the Great Forty Discourse, the Master’s chief disciple, the Elder Sāriputta, has brought down the teaching of the Master as it is expounded in the Great Forty Discourse by way of the recitation of the Dhamma.

original: abhijjhādayo na uppajjanti, evaṃ satiyā upaṭṭhāpane cakkhādīnaṃ pidahane analasassa
analyzed: abhijjhā ādayaḥ na uppajjanti evam satiyāḥ upaṭṭhāpane cakkha ādīnam pidahane analasassa
translated: When there is such mindfulness, the eye, etc., are not crowded, and the energy of one who is not idle arises.

original: uppannavīriyaṃ. Pajahantassāti vinodentassa. Uppannavīriyanti tasseva pajahanassa
analyzed: uppanna vīriyam pajahantassa ati vinodentassa uppanna vīriyam ti tassa iva pajahanassa
translated: The energy that arises in one who is abandoning is the energy that occurs in the mode of accomplishing that abandoning.🔽The energy that arises in one who is developing is the energy that occurs in the mode of accomplishing that development.

original: sādhanavasena pavattavīriyaṃ. Bhāventassa uppannavīriyanti etthāpi eseva nayo. Samādhinimittanti
analyzed: sādhana vasena pavatta vīriyam bhāventassa uppanna vīriyam ti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ samādhi nimittan ti
translated: The sign of concentration is concentration itself.

original: samādhi eva. Purimuppannasamādhi hi parato uppajjanakasamādhipavivekassa kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: samādhi eva purima uppanna samādhi hi paratas uppajjanaka samādhi pavivekassa kāraṇam
translated: For the concentration that has arisen previously is the cause for the seclusion of the concentration that is to arise later.

original: hotīti “samādhinimitta”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: hoti iti samādhi nimittam ti vuttam
translated: That is why it is called the sign of concentration.

original: Upadhivivekattāti khandhūpadhiādiupadhīhi vivittattā vinissaṭattā. Taṃ āgammāti taṃ
analyzed: upadhi viveka ttā ati khandhūpadhi ādi upadhīhi vivitta ttā vinissaṭa ttā tam āgamma iti tam
translated: By seclusion from acquisitions: by seclusion from the acquisitions of aggregates, etc., by separation from them.🔽By arriving at that: by arriving at that Nibbāna by means of the path.

original: nibbānaṃ maggena adhigamahetu. Rāgādayo virajjanti ettha, etenāti vā virāgo. Evaṃ
analyzed: nibbānam maggena adhigama hetu rāga ādayaḥ virajjanti ettha etena ati vā virāgaḥ evam
translated: Or alternatively, by that means, here, greed, etc., fade away, thus it is fading away of greed, etc.;🔽and so too with cessation.

original: nirodhopi daṭṭhabbo. Yasmā idha bojjhaṅgā missakavasena icchitā, tasmā “ārammaṇavasena
analyzed: nirodhaḥ api daṭṭhabbaḥ yasmai idha bojjhaṅgā missaka vasena icchitā tasmai ārammaṇa vasena
translated: Here the factors of enlightenment are intended in the sense of a mixture.

original: adhigantabbavasena vā”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha adhigantabbavasenāti taṃninnatāvasena. Vossaggapariṇāminti
analyzed: adhigantabba vasena vā ti vuttam tattha adhigantabba vasena āti tad ninna tā vasena vossagga pariṇāmin ti
translated: Herein, as the object to be penetrated is as the object to be inclined to.

original: vossajjanavasena pariṇāmitaṃ pariccajanavasena ceva pakkhandanavasena ca pariṇamanasīlaṃ.
analyzed: vossajjana vasena pariṇāmitam pariccajana vasena ca iva pakkhandana vasena ca pariṇamana sīlam
translated: It is the kind of turning that is a turning by giving up, a turning by relinquishing, a turning by letting go.

original: Tenāha “dve vossaggā”tiādi. Khandhānaṃ pariccajanaṃ nāma tappaṭibaddhakilesappahānavasenāti🔽yenākārena vipassanā kilese pajahati, tenevākārena taṃnimittake, khandhe ca “pajahatī”ti🔽vattabbataṃ arahatīti āha “vipassanā…pe… pariccajatī”ti. Yasmā vipassanā vuṭṭhānagāminibhāvaṃ
analyzed: tena āha dve vossagga ati ādi khandhānam pariccajanam nāma tad paṭibaddha kilesa ppahāna vasena ati  yena ākārena vipassanā kilese pajahati tena iva ākārena tad nimittake khandhe ca pajahati iti  vattabba tam arahati iti āha vipassanā pe pariccajati iti yasmai vipassanā vuṭṭhāna gāmini bhāvam
translated: Hence he said “There are two kinds of giving up” , etc. The relinquishing of the aggregates is the abandoning of the defilements bound up with them.🔽So it is of the aggregates that it is said that they are relinquished in the way in which the defilements are relinquished by insight.🔽Hence he said “Relinquishing is a term for insight” , etc.

original: pāpuṇantī ninnapoṇapabbhārabhāvena ekaṃsato nibbānaṃ “pakkhandatī”ti vattabbataṃ
analyzed: pāpuṇantī ninna poṇa pabbhāra bhāvena ekaṃsataḥ nibbānam pakkhandati iti vattabbatam
translated: Since insight reaches the state of being the way out, it is said that it “lets go” of Nibbāna in the sense of inclining to it exclusively by inclining to it with a leaning that is ever so little.

original: labhati, maggo ca samucchedavasena kilese, khandhe ca pariccajati, tasmā yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: labhati maggaḥ ca samuccheda vasena kilese khandhe ca pariccajati tasmai yathākkamam
translated: And since the path relinquishes defilements and aggregates by cutting them off,🔽it is said that it “lets go” of them in the sense of giving them up.

original: vipassanāmaggānaṃ vasena pakkhandanapariccāgavossaggāpi veditabbā. Vossaggatthāyāti🔽pariccāgavossaggatthāya ceva pakkhandanavossaggatthāya ca. Pariṇamatīti paripaccati.
analyzed: vipassanā maggānam vasena pakkhandana pariccāga vossaggā api veditabbā vossagga tthāya ati  pariccāga vossagga tthāya ca iva pakkhandana vossagga tthāya ca pariṇamati iti paripaccati
translated: And the surrenders of insight and of the path should be understood as the surrenders of penetration and of relinquishment. For the sake of the surrenders:🔽for the sake of the relinquishments of penetration and of relinquishment. It comes to maturity: it comes to ripening.

original: Taṃ pariṇamanaṃ vuṭṭhānagāminibhāvappattiyā ceva ariyamaggabhāvappattiyā ca icchitanti🔽āha “vipassanābhāvañceva maggabhāvañca pāpuṇātī”ti. Sesapadesūti “dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṃ
analyzed: tam pariṇamanam vuṭṭhāna gāmini bhāva ppattiyā ca iva ariya magga bhāva ppattiyā ca icchitan ti  āha vipassanā bhāvañ ca iva magga bhāvañca pāpuṇāti iti sesa padesu iti dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaṃ
translated: And that coming to maturity is desirable as the attainment of the state of being that ends in emergence and as the attainment of the state of being that is the noble path.🔽Hence it is said: “it comes to maturity as the state of being that ends in emergence and as the state of being that is the noble path” .

original: bhāvetī”tiādīsu sesasambojjhaṅgakoṭṭhāsesu.🔽Bhaddakanti abhaddakānaṃ nīvaraṇādipāpadhammānaṃ vikkhambhanena rāgavidhamanena ekantahitattā,
analyzed: bhāveti iti ādīsu sesa sambojjhaṅga koṭṭhāsesu  bhaddakam ti abhaddakānam nīvaraṇa ādi pāpa dhammānam vikkhambhanena rāga vidhamanena ekanta hita ttā
translated: In the remaining passages: in the remaining sections of the enlightenment factors beginning with “He develops the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor” .🔽Excellent: it is excellent because it is entirely beneficial through the suppression of the unprofitable states beginning with the hindrances, and because it is hard to obtain.

original: dullabhattā ca bhaddakaṃ sundaraṃ. Na hi aññaṃ samādhinimittaṃ evaṃdullabhaṃ, rāgassa
analyzed: dullabha ttā ca bhaddakam sundaram na hi aññam samādhi nimittam evaṃdullabham rāgassa
translated: For there is no other object of concentration so hard to obtain and so directly opposed to greed as this.

original: ca ujuvipaccanīkabhūtaṃ atthi. Anurakkhatīti ettha anurakkhanā nāma adhigatasamādhito
analyzed: ca uju vipaccanīka bhūtam atthi anurakkhati iti ettha anurakkhanā nāma adhigata samādhito
translated: He guards it: here the guarding is the guarding of the concentration that has been obtained.

original: yathā na parihāni hoti, evaṃ paṭipatti, sā pana tappaṭipakkhavidhamanenāti āha “samādhī”tiādi.
analyzed: yathā na hoti evam paṭipatti sā pana tad paṭipakkha vidhamanena ati āha samādhi itiādi
translated: The practice is in such a way that there is no falling away. But that is by the clearing away of its opposite. Hence he said “concentration” and so on.

original: Aṭṭhikasaññādikāti aṭṭhikajjhānādikā. Saññāsīsena hi jhānaṃ vadati.
analyzed: aṭṭhika saññā ādikā ti aṭṭhikajjhāna ādikā saññā sīsena hi jhānam vadati
translated: The perception of a skeleton, etc., is the jhāna of the skeleton, and so on. For he speaks of jhāna by way of the perception.

original: Ekapaṭivedhavasena catusaccadhamme ñāṇanti catūsu ariyasaccesu ekābhisamayavasena🔽pavattañāṇaṃ, maggañāṇanti attho. Catusaccantogadhattā catusaccabbhantare nirodhadhamme
analyzed: eka paṭivedha vasena catu sacca dhamme catūsu ariya saccesu eka abhisamaya vasena  pavatta ñāṇam magga ñāṇanti attho nirodha dhamme
translated: Knowledge of the four noble truths by a single penetration: knowledge occurring by a single act of realizing the four noble truths.🔽The meaning is: path knowledge. Because the four truths are penetrated together, knowledge of the state of cessation, which is the truth of cessation,

original: nibbāne ñāṇaṃ, tena phalañāṇaṃ vadati. Yasmā maggānantarassa phalassa maggānuguṇā
analyzed: nibbāne ñāṇam tena phala ñāṇam vadati yasmā magga anantarassa phalassa magga anuguṇā
translated: occurs in the four truths. Hence he speaks of fruition knowledge.

original: pavatti, yato taṃsamudayapakkhiyesu dhammesu paṭippassaddhippahānavasena pavattati,🔽tasmā nirodhasaccepi yo maggassa sacchikiriyābhisamayo, tadanuguṇā pavattīti phalañāṇasseva
analyzed: tasmā nirodha sacce pi yaḥ maggassa sacchikiriyā abhisamayaḥ tad anuguṇā pavatti iti phala ñāṇassa iva
translated: Because the fruition, which is next to the path, occurs in conformity with the path, since it occurs by the tranquilizing and abandoning of the states belonging to its origin,🔽therefore, since the act of realizing the path is the act of realizing the truth of the path, and since the occurrence of the fruition is in conformity with that, the knowledge of the states is said to belong

original: dhamme ñāṇatā vuttā, na yassa kassaci nibbānārammaṇassa ñāṇassa. Tena vuttaṃ “yathāhā”tiādi.
analyzed: dhamme ñāṇa tā vuttā na yassa kassaci nibbāna ārammaṇassa ñāṇassa tena vuttam yathā āha atiādi
translated: to the fruition knowledge, not to any knowledge whatever that has Nibbāna as its object. Hence he said “as stated” and so on.

original: Ettha ca maggapaññā tāva catusaccadhammassa paṭivijjhanato dhammeñāṇaṃ nāma hotu,
analyzed: ettha ca magga paññā tāva catu sacca dhammassa paṭivijjhanataḥ dhammeñāṇam nāma hotu
translated: And here firstly understanding of the path is knowledge of ideas since it penetrates the four noble truths.

original: phalapaññā pana kathanti codanā sodhitā hoti nirodhadhammaṃ ārabbha pavattanato.🔽Duvidhāpi hi paññā aparappaccayatāya attapaccakkhato ariyasaccadhamme kiccato ca
analyzed: phala paññā pana kathanti codanā sodhitā hoti nirodha dhammam ārabbha pavattanato  duvidhā api hi paññā apara ppaccaya tāya atta paccakkhataḥ ariya sacca dhamme kiccato ca
translated: But understanding of fruition is so called since it occurs in dependence on the idea of cessation.🔽For understanding of both kinds is called “knowledge of ideas” since it is independent of others, since it is each man’s own concern, and since it occurs in respect of the ideas that are the four noble truths in their aspect as function and in their aspect as object.

original: ārammaṇato ca pavattattā “dhammeñāṇa”nti veditabbā. Ariyasaccesu hi ayaṃ dhamma-saddo
analyzed: ārammaṇato ca pavatta ttā dhammeñāṇan ti veditabbā ariya saccesu hi ayam dhamma saddo
translated: For the word “idea” in the four noble truths is used

original: tesaṃ aviparītasabhāvattā, saṅkhatappavaro vā ariyamaggo, tassa ca phaladhammo. Tattha
analyzed: tesam aviparīta sabhāva ttā saṅkhata ppavaraḥ vā ariya maggo tassa ca phala dhammo tattha
translated: in the sense of their unperverted individual essences, or else in the sense of the noble path, which is the best of all formed ideas, and in the sense of the fruition idea that is the state of the path. Herein,

original: paññā taṃsahagatā dhammeñāṇaṃ.
analyzed: paññā tad sahagatā dhamma iñāṇam
translated: understanding associated with that is knowledge of ideas.

original: Anvayeñāṇanti anugamanañāṇaṃ. Paccakkhato disvāti cattāri saccāni maggañāṇena paccakkhato
analyzed: anvaye ñāṇam ti anugamana ñāṇam paccakkhataḥ disvā iti cattāri saccāni magga ñāṇena paccakkhataḥ
translated: Knowledge of the way is knowledge of the way of arriving at the four truths. Having seen with understanding: having penetrated with the knowledge of the path the four truths as each one’s own concern,🔽just as they are now: just as the five aggregates as objects of clinging are the truth of suffering now,

original: paṭivijjhitvā. Yathā idānīti yathā etarahi pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhasaccaṃ, evaṃ
analyzed: paṭivijjhitvā yathā idāni iti yathā etarahi pañca upādāna kkhandhāḥ dukkha saccam evam
translated: so too they were in the past and so too they will be in the future.

original: atītepi anāgatepi pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhasaccamevāti ca sarikkhaṭṭhena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: atīte api anāgate api pañca upādānakkhandhāḥ dukkha saccam eva ati ca sarikkhaṭṭhena vuttam
translated: And the five aggregates as objects of clinging in the past and future are the truth of suffering too, so it is said in terms of similarity.

original: Esa nayo samudayasacce, maggasacce ca. Ayamevāti avadhāraṇe. Nirodhasacce pana sarikkhaṭṭho
analyzed: esa nayo samudaya sacce magga sacce ca ayam eva ati avadhāraṇe nirodha sacce pana sarikkhaṭṭho
translated: The same method applies to the truth of origin and the truth of the path. But in the case of the truth of cessation there is no similarity,

original: natthi tassa niccattā, ekasabhāvattā ca. Evaṃ tassa ñāṇassa anugatiyaṃ ñāṇanti tassa🔽dhammeñāṇassa “evaṃ atītepī”tiādinā anugatiyaṃ anugamane anvaye ñāṇaṃ. Idaṃ anvaye
analyzed: natthi tassa nicca ttā eka sabhāva ttā ca evam tassa ñāṇassa anugatiyam tassa  dhammeñāṇassa evam atīte pi iti ādinā anugatiyam anugamane anvaye ñāṇam idam anvaye
translated: because it is permanent and of one nature. So it is the knowledge of the way of entry into that knowledge

original: ñāṇanti yojanā. “Tenāhā”tiādinā yathāvuttamatthaṃ pāḷiyā vibhāveti. Soti dhammañāṇaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇam ti yojanā tena āha ati ādinā yathāvuttam attham pāḷiyā vibhāveti saḥ ti dhamma ñāṇam
translated: that is called knowledge of the way of access. This is the construction here. “Knowledge of the way of access”: the knowledge of the way of entry into the knowledge of the truths by means of the knowledge of the law of conditionality, which is called “knowledge of the way of access” because it is the way of access to the knowledge of the truths.🔽“He thus”: he who, having reached the knowledge of the law of conditionality, is established in it.

original: patvā ṭhito bhikkhu. Iminā dhammenāti dhammagocarattā gocaravohārena “dhammo”ti vuttenamaggañāṇena,🔽upayogatthe vā karaṇavacanaṃ, iminā dhammena ñātenāti imaṃ catusaccadhammaṃ ñāṇena
analyzed: patvā ṭhitaḥ bhikkhu iminā dhammena ati dhamma gocara ttā gocara vohārena dhammaḥ ti vuttena magga ñāṇena  upayoga atthe vā karaṇa vacanam iminā dhammena ñātena ati imam catu sacca dhammam ñāṇena
translated: “By this idea”: by the path knowledge called “idea” in the sense of “range” because it has the truths for its range.🔽Or the ablative case is used in the sense of instrument: “By this idea, by this knowledge.” The meaning is: by the path knowledge that is established by knowing the idea, the truth of the four truths, by knowing it.

original: jānitvā ṭhitena maggañāṇenāti attho. Diṭṭhenāti dassanena saccadhammaṃ passitvā ṭhitena.
analyzed: jānitvā ṭhitena magga ñāṇena ati atthaḥ diṭṭhena ati dassanena sacca dhammam passitvā ṭhitena
translated: “By what is seen”: by what is established by seeing the truth of the four truths by means of seeing.

original: Pattenāti saccānaṃ patvā ṭhitena. Viditenāti saccāni viditvā ṭhitena. Pariyogāḷhenāti
analyzed: pattena ati saccānam patvā ṭhitena viditena ati saccāni viditvā ṭhitena pariyogāḷhena ati
translated: ‘By the path’ means by having reached the truths by means of the path. ‘By the knowledge’ means by having reached the truths by means of the knowledge. ‘By the penetration’ means by having penetrated the four noble truths.

original: catusaccadhammaṃ pariyogāhetvā ṭhitenāti evaṃ tāvettha abhidhammaṭṭhakathāyaṃ attho
analyzed: catu sacca dhammam pariyogāhetvā ṭhitena ati evam tāva ettha abhidhamma ṭṭhakathā ayam attho
translated: This, in the first place, is the meaning stated in the Abhidhamma Commentary here.

original: vutto. Duvidhampi pana maggaphalañāṇaṃ dhammeñāṇaṃ. Paccavekkhaṇāya ca mūlaṃ, kāraṇañca
analyzed: vuttaḥ duvidham pi pana magga phala ñāṇam dhamma ñāṇam paccavekkhaṇāya ca mūlam kāraṇañca
translated: But the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of fruition are both knowledge of things as they are. And they are the root and the cause of reviewing.

original: nayanayanassāti duvidhenāpi tena dhammenāti na na yujjati. Tathā catusaccadhammassa
analyzed: naya nayanassa ati duvidhena api tena dhammena ati na na yujjati tathā catu sacca dhammassa
translated: So it is not improper to say that it is by the knowledge of things as they are by means of the two kinds of knowledge that he ‘guides the guidable’ .🔽And likewise it is not improper to say that it is by the knowledge of things as they are by means of the four noble truths that he ‘guides the guidable’ ,

original: ñātattā, maggaphalasaṅkhātassa vā dhammassa saccapaṭivedhasampayogaṃ gatattā nayanayanaṃ
analyzed: ñāta ttā magga phala saṅkhātassa vā dhammassa sacca paṭivedha sampayogam gata ttā naya nayanam
translated: either because the four noble truths have been known or because the knowledge called path and fruition has been reached that is associated with penetration of the truths.

original: hotīti tena iminā dhammena ñāṇavisayabhāvena, ñāṇasampayogena vā ñātenāti ca attho
analyzed: hoti iti tena iminā dhammena ñāṇa visaya bhāvena ñāṇa sampayogena vā ñātena ati ca attho
translated: So the meaning is that it is not improper to say that it is by this knowledge of things as they are, either as the province of knowledge or as associated with knowledge, that he ‘guides the guidable’ .

original: na na yujjatīti. Atītānāgate nayaṃ netīti atīte, anāgate ca nayaṃ neti harati peseti.
analyzed: na na yujjati iti atīta anāgate nayam neti iti atīte anāgate ca nayam neti harati peseti
translated: ‘He guides the guidable by the path’: he guides the guidable in the past and in the future.

original: Idaṃ pana na maggañāṇassa kiccaṃ, paccavekkhaṇañāṇakiccaṃ, satthārā pana maggañāṇaṃ
analyzed: idam pana na magga ñāṇassa kiccam paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇa kiccam satthārā pana magga ñāṇam
translated: But this is not a function of path knowledge; it is a function of reviewing knowledge. The function of path knowledge is

original: atītānāgate nayanayanasadisaṃ kataṃ maggamūlakattā. Bhāvitamaggassa hi paccavekkhaṇā
analyzed: atīta anāgate naya nayana sadisam katam magga mūlaka ttā bhāvita maggassa hi paccavekkhaṇā
translated: It is like the eye of the past and the future because it is made the root of the path. For when the path is developed, there is what is called reviewing.

original: nāma hoti. Nayidaṃ aññaṃ ñāṇuppādanaṃ nayanayanaṃ, ñāṇasseva pana pavattivisesoti.🔽Paresaṃ cetaso parito ayanaṃ paricchindanaṃ pariyo, tasmiṃ pariye. Tenāha “paresaṃ
analyzed: nāma hoti nayidam aññam ñāṇa uppādanam naya nayanam ñāṇassa iva pana pavatti viseso ti  paresam cetasaḥ paritas ayanam paricchindanam tasmin pariye tena āha paresam
translated: This is not the eye of the eye of knowledge, but it is a special occurrence of knowledge.

original: cittaparicchede”ti. Avasesaṃ sammutimhiñāṇaṃ nāma “ñāṇa”nti sammatattā. Vacanatthato
analyzed: citta pariccheda iti avasesam sammutimhi ñāṇam nāma ñāṇam ti sammata ttā vacana tthato
translated: The meaning of the word is this. The knowledge called knowledge of language is so called because it is agreed upon as “knowledge.”

original: pana sammutimhi ñāṇanti sammutimhiñāṇaṃ. Dhammeñāṇādīnaṃ viya hi sātisayassa paṭivedhakiccassa
analyzed: pana sammutimhi ñāṇanti sammutimhiñāṇam dhamme ñāṇa ādīnam viya hi sa atisayassa paṭivedha kiccassa
translated: For just as the knowledge of ideas, etc., have the function of penetrating what is outstanding,

original: abhāvā visayobhāsanasaṅkhātajānanasāmaññena “ñāṇa”nti sammatesu antogadhanti attho.🔽Sammutivasena vā pavattaṃ sammutimhiñāṇaṃ sammutidvārena atthassa gahaṇato. Avasesaṃ
analyzed: abhāvāḥ sammatesu antogadham ti attho  sammuti vasena vā pavattam sammutimhiñāṇam sammuti dvārena atthassa gahaṇataḥ avasesam
translated: so this is included among those agreed upon as “knowledge” because it has the common property of knowing, which is called “illuminating the object.”🔽Or alternatively, the knowledge that occurs by way of agreement is knowledge of language because it apprehends the meaning by way of the agreement.

original: vā itarañāṇattayavisabhāgaṃ ñāṇaṃ tabbisabhāgasāmaññena sammutimhiñāṇamhi paviṭṭhattā
analyzed: vā itara ñāṇa ttaya visa bhāgam ñāṇam tad bisa bhāga sāmaññena sammutimhi ñāṇamhi paviṭṭha ttā
translated: The rest is knowledge that is unlike the other three kinds of knowledge. It is included among the kinds of knowledge that are agreed upon as “knowledge” because it has the common property of being unlike them.

original: sammutimhiñāṇaṃ nāma hotīti.
analyzed: sammutimhiñāṇam nāma hoti iti
translated: Knowledge of the conventional is knowledge of the conventional as the conventional.

original: Kāmaṃ sotāpattimaggañāṇādīni dukkhañāṇādīniyeva, ukkaṭṭhaniddesena panevamāha “arahattaṃ
analyzed: kāmam sotāpatti magga ñāṇa ādīni dukkha ñāṇa ādīni yeva ukkaṭṭha niddesena pana evam āha arahattam
translated: The path of stream-entry and the rest are indeed knowledge of suffering and the rest, but it is said thus with reference to the highest instance.

original: pāpetvā”ti. Vaṭṭato niggacchati etenāti niggamanaṃ, catusaccakammaṭṭhānaṃ. Purimāni
analyzed: pāpetvā iti vaṭṭataḥ niggacchati etena ati niggamanam catu sacca kammaṭṭhānam purimāni
translated: “Having brought to”: the four noble truths are the “departure” since it is by means of them that one departs from the round of rebirths.

original: dve saccāni vaṭṭaṃ pavattipavattihetubhāvato. Itarāni pana dve vivaṭṭaṃ nivattinivattihetubhāvato.🔽Abhinivesoti vipassanābhiniveso hoti lokiyassa ñāṇassa visabhāgūpagamanato. No vivaṭṭeti
analyzed: dve saccāni pavatti pavatti hetu bhāvataḥ itarāni pana dve vivaṭṭam nivatti nivatti hetu bhāvataḥ  abhiniveso ti vipassanā abhinivesaḥ hoti lokiyassa ñāṇassa visa bhāga upagamanataḥ no vivaṭṭeti
translated: The first two truths are the cause of the revolution of the round of rebirths by occurrence and non-occurrence. But the other two are the cause of the revolution of the round of rebirths by cessation and non-arising.

original: vivaṭṭe abhiniveso no hoti avisayabhāvato. Pariyattīti kammaṭṭhānatanti. Uggahetvāti
analyzed: vivaṭṭe abhinivesaḥ no hoti avisaya bhāvato pariyatti iti uggahetvā ati
translated: “Enters upon” : he enters upon insight. “Does not enter upon” : he does not enter upon the revolution of the round of rebirths. “Contemplates” : he contemplates the meditation subject.

original: vācuggataṃ katvā. Uggahetvāti vā pāḷito, atthato ca yathārahaṃ savanadhāraṇaparipucchanamanasānupekkhanādivasena
analyzed: vāc uggatam katvā uggahetvā ati vā pāḷitaḥ atthato ca yathāraham savana dhāraṇa paripucchana manasā anupekkhanā ādi vasena
translated: “Having learned” : having made it his own by learning. “Having learned” is by the text and by the meaning. Having learned it by listening, memorizing, questioning, and reviewing it with the mind, etc., as is fitting,

original: cittena uddhaṃ uddhaṃ gaṇhitvā. Kammaṃ karotīti nāmarūpapariggahādikkamena yogakammaṃ karoti.
analyzed: cittena uddham uddham gaṇhitvā kammam karoti iti nāma rūpa pariggaha ādi kkamena yoga kammam karoti
translated: “he does the work” : he does the work of development by the work of knowledge consisting in the discernment of mind and matter, etc.

original: Yadi purimesu dvīsu eva vipassanābhiniveso, tesu eva uggahādi, kathamidaṃ catusaccakammaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: yadi purimesu dvīsu eva vipassanā abhiniveso tesu eva uggaha ādi katham idam catu sacca kammaṭṭhānam
translated: If the insistence on insight is only in the first two, and the learning is only in the first two, how is it that the four truths are called the object of insight?

original: jātanti āha “dvīsū”tiādi. Kāmaṃ pacchimānipi dve saccāni abhiññeyyāni, pariññeyyatā
analyzed: āha dvīsu iti ādi kāmam dve saccāni abhiññeyyāni pariññeyya tā
translated: He said “In the first two” and so on. Although the last two truths are to be directly known, there is no full understanding in them,

original: pana tattha natthīti na vipassanābyāpāro. Kevalaṃ pana anussavamatte ṭhatvā accantapaṇītabhāvato
analyzed: pana tattha natthi iti na vipassanā byāpāraḥ kevalam pana anussava matte ṭhatvā accanta paṇīta bhāvato
translated: so there is no function of insight. But he directs attention to them as mere report, thinking “The truth of cessation is desirable because it is extremely peaceful,

original: iṭṭhaṃ, ātappakanirāmisapītisañjananato kantaṃ, uparūpari abhirucijananena manassa
analyzed: iṭṭham ātappaka nirāmisa pīti sañjananato kantam upari upari abhiruci jananena manassa
translated: agreeable because it generates a happiness that is not mixed with the material, and pleasing because it causes the mind to expand by generating a liking for it more and more.”

original: vaḍḍhanato manāpanti manasikāraṃ pavatteti. Tenāha “nirodhasaccaṃ nāmā”tiādi. Dvīsu🔽saccesūti dvīsu saccesu visayabhūtesu, tāni ca uddissa asammohapaṭivedhavasena pavattamāno
analyzed: vaḍḍhanataḥ manāpanti manasikāram tena āha nirodha saccam nāma atiādi dvīsu  saccesu iti dvīsu saccesu visaya bhūtesu tāni ca uddissa asammoha paṭivedha vasena pavattamāno
translated: He said “The truth of cessation is called” and so on.🔽In the first two truths: in the first two truths that are the objective fields. And the path that occurs by way of penetrating non-delusion with reference to them is called “occurred with reference to them.”

original: hi maggo te uddissa pavatto nāma hotīti. Tīṇi dukkhasamudayamaggasaccāni. Kiccavasenāti
analyzed: hi maggo te uddissa pavattaḥ nāma hoti iti tīṇi dukkha samudaya magga saccāni kicca vasena ati
translated: The three truths of suffering, origin, and path.

original: asammuyhanavasena. Ekanti nirodhasaccaṃ. Ārammaṇavasenāti ārammaṇakaraṇavasenapi
analyzed: asammuyhana vasena ekam ti nirodha saccam ārammaṇa vasena ati ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena api
translated: By way of object: by way of making the object,

original: asammuyhanakiccavasenapi tattha paṭivedho labbhateva. Dve saccānīti dukkhasamudayasaccāni.
analyzed: tattha paṭivedhaḥ labbhateva dve saccāni iti dukkha samudaya saccāni
translated: and by way of the function of non-delusion, penetration is obtained. Two truths: the truths of suffering and of origin.

original: Duddasattāti daṭṭhuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā. Oḷārikā hi dukkhasamudayā, tiracchānagatānampi🔽dukkhaṃ, āhārādīsu ca abhilāso pākaṭo. Pīḷanādiāyūhanādivasenapi “idaṃ dukkhaṃ, idaṃ
analyzed: duddasa ttā ati daṭṭhum a sakkuṇeyya ttā oḷārikā hi dukkha samudayā tiracchāna gatānam pi  dukkham āhāra ādīsu ca abhilāsaḥ pākaṭaḥ idam dukkham idam
translated: Hard to see: because they cannot be seen. For suffering and origin are gross,🔽and craving for food, etc., is obvious even to animals. And because they cannot be penetrated by knowledge of actuality as “This is suffering, this is

original: assa kāraṇa”nti yāthāvato ñāṇena ogāhituṃ asakkuṇeyyattā tāni gambhīrāni. Dveti nirodhamaggasaccāni.
analyzed: assa kāraṇam ti yāthāvataḥ ñāṇena ogāhitum tāni gambhīrāni dve ti nirodha magga saccāni
translated: its cause,” by way of affliction, etc., and accumulation, etc., they are deep. Two are the truths of cessation and of the path.

original: Tāni saṇhasukhumabhāvato sabhāveneva gambhīratāya yāthāvato ñāṇena durogāhattā “duddasānī”ti.
analyzed: tāni saṇha sukhuma bhāvataḥ sa bhāvena iva gambhīra tāya yāthāvataḥ ñāṇena durogāhattā duddasāni iti
translated: Because they are subtle and fine by nature, they are deep in themselves. Because they are hard to penetrate by knowledge of actuality, they are “hard to see.”

original: Sotāpattiyaṅgādicatukkavaṇṇanā
translated: The four sections on the factors of stream-entry, etc.

original: 311. Soto nāma ariyasoto purimapadalopena, tassa ādito sabbapaṭhamaṃ pajjanaṃ sotāpatti,
analyzed: sotaḥ nāma ariya soto purima pada lopena tassa āditaḥ sabba paṭhamam pajjanam sotāpatti
translated: Stream is the noble stream, with the omission of the first syllable. The first generation of that is stream-entry,

original: paṭhamamaggapaṭilābho. Tassa aṅgāni adhigamūpāyabhūtāni kāraṇāni sotāpattiyaṅgāni.🔽Tenāha “sotā…pe… attho”ti. Santakāyakammāditāya santadhammasamannāgamato, santadhammapavedanato🔽ca santo purisāti sappurisā. Tattha yesaṃ vasena catusaccasampaṭivedhāvahaṃ saddhammassavanaṃ
analyzed: paṭhama magga paṭilābhaḥ tassa aṅgāni adhigama upāya bhūtāni kāraṇāni sa utāpattiyaṅgāni  tena āha attho ti santa kāya kamma āditāya santa dhamma samannāgamataḥ santa dhamma pavedanataḥ  ca santaḥ purisā ti sappurisā tattha yesam vasena catu sacca sampaṭivedha āvaham saddhamma ssavanam
translated: The acquisition of the first path. Its factors are the factors of stream-entry, which are the causes that are the means to its acquisition.🔽Hence it is said: “Stream-entry, etc., is the meaning” . The good persons are those who are good because they possess the good Dhamma, i.e., because they have the good Dhamma in them, and because they have entered into the good Dhamma.

original: labbhati, te eva dassento “buddhādīnaṃ sappurisāna”nti āha. Santo sataṃ vā dhammoti🔽saddhammo. So hi yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjamāne apāyadukkhe, saṃsāradukkhe ca apatante
analyzed: labbhati te eva dassentaḥ buddha ādīnam sappurisānam ti āha santaḥ satam vā dhammaḥ ti  saddhammo saḥ hi yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjamāne apāya dukkhe saṃsāra dukkhe ca a patante
translated: Herein, the good persons are the Buddha, etc., in virtue of whom the hearing of the good Dhamma, which leads to the penetration of the Four Truths,

original: dhāretīti evamādi guṇātisayayogavasena santo saṃvijjamāno, pasattho, sundaro vā dhammo,
analyzed: dhāreti iti evamādi guṇa atisaya yoga vasena santaḥ saṃvijjamānaḥ pasatthaḥ sundaraḥ vā dhammo
translated: is possible. The good Dhamma is the good Dhamma of the good persons. It is good because it is found, approved, and beautiful in virtue of the excellence of its special qualities, such as being the bearer of the one who practices in accordance with the teaching,🔽and because it bears the one who practices in accordance with the teaching from the suffering of the states of loss and from the suffering of the round.

original: sataṃ vā ariyānaṃ dhammo, tesaṃ vā tabbhāvasādhako dhammoti saddhammo, “idha bhikkhu
analyzed: satam vā ariyānam dhammo tesam vā tad bhāva sādhako dhammo ti saddhammaḥ idha bhikkhu
translated: It is the Dhamma of the good persons, or it is the Dhamma that is the means of attaining their state. Hence it is the good Dhamma. “Here, bhikkhus, a noble disciple considers thus:

original: dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇātī”tiādinā vuttā pariyatti. Sā pana mahāvisayatāya na sabbā sabbassa
analyzed: dhammam pariyāpuṇāti iti ādinā vuttā pariyatti sā pana mahā visaya tāya na sabbā sabbassa
translated: “He learns the Dhamma” . This is the learning described in the passage. But since it has a vast scope, it is not all of it the proximate cause for the arising of insight.

original: visesāvahāti tassa tassa anucchavikameva dassento āha “sappāyassa tepiṭakadhammassa
analyzed: visesa āvahā ti tassa tassa anucchavikam eva dassentaḥ āha sappāyassa tepiṭaka dhammassa
translated: Showing only that which is suitable for that purpose, he said: “listening to the Dhamma of the three Pitakas which is suitable.”🔽The “wise attention” has already been explained above.

original: savana”nti. Yonisomanasikāro heṭṭhā vutto eva. Pubbabhāgapaṭipattiyāti vipassanānuyogassa.
analyzed: savanam ti yoniso manasikāro heṭṭhā vuttaḥ eva pubbabhāga paṭipattiyā ti vipassanā anuyogassa
translated: The “preliminary part of practice” is the practice of insight.

original: Aveccappasādenāti saccasampaṭivedhavasena buddhādīnaṃ guṇe ñatvā uppannappasādena,
analyzed: avecca ppasādena ati sacca sampaṭivedha vasena buddha ādīnam guṇe ñatvā uppanna ppasādena
translated: The “unshakable confidence” is the confidence that arises through the penetration of the truths, after one has known the qualities of the Buddha, etc.

original: so pana pasādo devādīsu kenacipi akampiyatāya niccaloti āha “acalappasādenā”ti. Etthāti🔽etasmiṃ catukkattaye āhāracatukke. Lūkhapaṇītavatthuvasenāti odanakummāsādikassa🔽lūkhassa ceva paṇītassa ca vatthuno vasena. Sā panāyaṃ āhārassa oḷārikasukhumatā
analyzed: so pana pasādaḥ deva ādīsu kenacipi a kampiya tāya niccalaḥ ti āha acala ppasādena ati ettha ati  etasmin catukkattaye āhāra catukke lūkha paṇīta vatthu vasena ati odana kummāsa ādikassa  lūkhassa ca iva paṇītassa ca vatthunaḥ vasena sā pana ayam āhārassa oḷārika sukhuma tā
translated: “Unshakable” means unmoved by any other conditions.🔽“In this” refers to the fourfold nutriment.🔽“According to the coarseness and excellence of the object” means according to the coarseness and excellence of the object consisting of rice, kidney bean curry, etc.

original: “kumbhilānaṃ āhāraṃ upādāya morānaṃ āhāro sukhumo”tiādinā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vitthārato āgatā eva.
analyzed: āhāram upādāya morāṇam āhāro sukhumaḥ ti ādinā aṭṭhakathā ayam vitthārato āgatā eva
translated: This coarseness and excellence of nutriment is explained in detail in the commentary: “Compared to the nutriment of the earth-worms, the nutriment of the peacocks is excellent.”

original: Ārammaṇaṭṭhitivasenāti ārammaṇasaṅkhātassa pavattipaccayaṭṭhānassa vasena. Tiṭṭhati
analyzed: ārammaṇa ṭṭhiti vasena āti ārammaṇa saṅkhātassa pavatti paccaya ṭṭhānassa vasena tiṭṭhati
translated: By way of the twenty-four bases of objective support: by way of the twenty-four bases of objective support, which are the conditions for the occurrence of consciousness.🔽It stands in it,

original: etthāti ṭhiti, ārammaṇameva ṭhiti ārammaṇaṭṭhiti. Tenevāha “rūpārammaṇa”ntiādi. Ārammaṇattho
analyzed: ettha ati ṭhiti ārammaṇam eva ṭhiti ārammaṇa ṭhiti tena iva āha rūpa ārammaṇa ntiādi ārammaṇa atthaḥ
translated: thus it is a base . The base itself is the objective support. Hence he said “with visible data as the objective support” and so on.

original: cettha upatthambhanattho veditabbo, na visayalakkhaṇova. Upatthambhanabhūtaṃ rūpaṃ
analyzed: ca ittha upatthambhana atthaḥ veditabbaḥ na visaya lakkhaṇaḥ uva upatthambhana bhūtam rūpam
translated: The meaning of objective support should be understood here as the meaning of “that which is stood upon” , not as the meaning of “object.”🔽The visible-data base is that which is stood upon as the objective support.🔽It is the visible-data base because it is that which is stood upon as the objective support.

original: upetīti rūpūpāyaṃ. Tenāha “rūpaṃ upagataṃ hutvā”tiādi. Rūpakkhandhaṃ nissāya tiṭṭhati
analyzed: upeti iti rūpa upāyam tena āha rūpam upagatam hutvā atiādi rūpa kkhandham nissāya tiṭṭhati
translated: It stands by depending on the materiality aggregate,🔽because it does not occur without it.🔽The occurrence of the standing is by depending on the materiality aggregate.

original: tena vinā appavattanato. Tanti rūpakkhandhaṃ nissāya ṭhānappavattanaṃ. Etanti “rūpūpāya”nti
analyzed: tena vinā appavattanataḥ tanti rūpa kkhandham nissāya ṭhāna ppavattanam etanti
translated: The words “the visible-data base”🔽are the words “the visible-data base.”

original: etaṃ vacanaṃ. Rūpakkhandho gocaro pavattiṭṭhānaṃ paccayo etassāti rūpakkhandhagocaraṃ
analyzed: etam vacanam rūpa kkhandho gocaraḥ pavatti ṭṭhānam paccayaḥ etassa ati rūpa kkhandha gocaram
translated: The visible-data base is the domain, the occurrence-base, the condition, of this.🔽The visible-data base is the support of this.

original: rūpaṃ sahakārīkāraṇabhāvena patiṭṭhā etassāti rūpappatiṭṭhaṃ. Iti tīhi padehi abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ
analyzed: rūpam sahakārī kāraṇa bhāvena patiṭṭhā etassa ati rūpa ppatiṭṭham iti tīhi padehi abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇam
translated: Thus by the three terms the consciousness that is a formation

original: pati rūpakkhandhassa sahakārīkāraṇabhāvoyevettha vutto. Upasittaṃ viya upasittaṃ,
analyzed: pati rūpa kkhandhassa vuttaḥ upasittam viya upasittam
translated: Here the condition is stated as the condition by way of co-nascence for the materiality aggregate.

original: yathā byañjanehi upasittaṃ sinehitaṃ odanaṃ rucitaṃ, pariṇāmayogyañca, evaṃ nandiyā
analyzed: yathā byañjanehi upasittam sinehitam odanam rucitam pariṇāma yogyam ca evam
translated: “Smeared with” means smeared with, anointed with, as rice is smeared with curry and is thus made to be relished and fit to be eaten. So too, by means of delight,

original: upasittaṃ sinehitaṃ kammaviññāṇaṃ abhirucitaṃ hutvā vipākayogyaṃ hotīti. Itaranti
analyzed: upasittam sinehitam kamma viññāṇam abhirucitam hutvā vipāka yogyam hoti iti itaranti
translated: the kamma-process consciousness is smeared with, anointed with, relished, and made fit for ripening. “The other” means

original: dosasahagatādiakusalaṃ, kusalañca upanissayakoṭiyā upasittaṃ hutvāti yojanā. Evaṃ
analyzed: dosa sahagata ādi akusalam kusalam ca upanissaya koṭiyā upasittam hutvā iti yojanā evam
translated: the unprofitable and the profitable, which are smeared with by way of decisive support. Thus

original: pavattamānanti evaṃ rūpūpāyanti desanābhāvena pavattamānaṃ. Vipākadhammatāya vuddhiṃ…pe…🔽āpajjati. Tatthāpi nippariyāyaphalanibbattanavasena vuddhiṃ, pariyāyaphalanibbattanavasena🔽viruḷhiṃ, nissandaphalanibbattanavasena vepullaṃ. Diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaphalanibbattanena
analyzed: pavattamānanti evam desanā bhāvena pavattamānam vipāka dhamma tāya  āpajjati tattha api nippariyāya phala nibbattana vasena vuddhim pariyāya phala nibbattana vasena  viruḷhim nissanda phala nibbattana vasena vepullam diṭṭhadhamma vedanīya phala nibbattanena
translated: it occurs. “Thus” means occurring in this way as the teaching of the mode of the object of the materiality aggregate. “It reaches growth” by way of the ripening state, and so on.

original: vā vuddhiṃ, upapajjavedanīyaphalanibbattanavasena viruḷhiṃ, aparāpariyāyaphalanibbattanavasena
analyzed: vā vuddhim upapajja vedanīya phala nibbattana vasena viruḷhim apara apariyāya phala nibbattana vasena
translated: Herein, it reaches growth by the production of the fruit without interval; it reaches development by the production of the fruit with interval; it reaches abundance by the production of the fruit of the life-continuum. Or it reaches growth by the production of the fruit to be experienced here and now; it reaches development by the production of the fruit to be experienced after rebirth; it reaches abundance by the production of the fruit in a subsequent becoming.

original: vepullaṃ āpajjatīti yojanā. Ekantato vedanupāyādivasena patti nāma arūpabhave yevāti
analyzed: vepullam āpajjati iti yojanā ekantataḥ vedan upāya ādi vasena nāma arūpa bhave
translated: and it is the meaning that is extended. The name “attainment” is only in the immaterial world, and that is by way of the object of the attainment, the jhāna factor, the feeling, and so on.

original: āha “imehi panā”tiādi. Evañca katvā pāḷiyaṃ kataṃ vā-saddaggahaṇañca samatthitaṃ
analyzed: āha imehi pana atiādi evañca katvā pāḷiyam katam vāsadda gahaṇam ca samatthitam
translated: So he says, “But these” and so on. And that being so, the inclusion of the word “and” in the text is justified.

original: hoti. “Rūpūpāya”ntiādinā yathā abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇassa upanissayabhūtā rūpādayo gayhanti,
analyzed: hoti rūpa upāyanti ādinā yathā abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇassa upanissaya bhūtāḥ rūpa ādayaḥ gayhanti
translated: And the intention in saying “The object of materiality” and so on is that just as materiality, etc., are stated as the decisive-support condition for the resultant consciousness,

original: evaṃ tena nibbattetabbāpi te gayhantīti adhippāyena “catukkavasena…pe… na vutta”nti
analyzed: evam tena nibbattetabbā api te gayhanti iti adhippāyena na vuttam ti
translated: so too the states that can be generated by that are also stated. He says, “By the fourfold method … are not stated,”

original: āha. Vipākopi hi dhammo vipākadhammaviññāṇaṃ upagataṃ nāma hoti tathā nandiyā upasittattā.
analyzed: āha vipākaḥ api hi dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma viññāṇam upagatam nāma hoti tathā nandiyā upasitta ttā
translated: for a resultant state is called “present” when it has come into association with resultant consciousness, and so too it is called “present” when it has been brought up-to-date by delight.

original: Tenāha “nandūpasecana”nti. Vitthāritāneva siṅgālasutte.
analyzed: tena āha siṅgāla sutte
translated: So he says, “By the bringing up-to-date of delight.” They are given in detail in the Sigālaka Sutta .

original: Bhavati etena ārogyanti bhavo, gilānapaccayo. Parivuddho bhavo abhavo. Vuddhiattho
analyzed: bhavati etena ārogyanti bhavaḥ gilāna paccayo parivuddhaḥ bhavaḥ abhavaḥ vuddhi attho
translated: “Existence” is a condition for sickness, and “non-existence” is the absence of a condition for sickness. “Existence” is “non-existence” because of the absence of a condition for sickness.🔽For this letter a has the meaning of increase,

original: hi ayaṃ akāro yathā “saṃvarāsaṃvaro, phalāphalaṃ”ti ca. Telamadhuphāṇitādīnīti ādi-saddena
analyzed: hi ayam akāraḥ yathā ca tela madhu phāṇita ādīni iti ādi saddena
translated: as in “restraint and non-restraint” and “fruit and non-fruit” . “Oil, honey, molasses, etc.” The word “etc.”

original: sappinavanītānaṃ gahaṇaṃ, telādīnaṃ gahaṇañcettha nidassanamattaṃ. Sabbassāpi gilānapaccayassa
analyzed: sappi navanītānam gahaṇam tela ādīnam gahaṇam ca ittha nidassanam attam sabbassa api gilāna paccayassa
translated: The inclusion of all requisites for the sick should be understood.

original: saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Atha vā bhavābhavoti khuddako ceva mahanto ca upapattibhavo veditabbo.🔽Evañca sati “imesaṃ panā”tiādivacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti. Bhavūpapattipahānattho hi
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo atha vā bhava abhavo ti khuddako ca iva mahanto ca upapatti bhavo veditabbo  evam ca sati imesam pana ati ādi vacanam samatthitam hoti bhava upapatti pahāna atthaḥ hi
translated: Or alternatively, “existence” should be understood as the minor and major parts of rebirth-linking.🔽And in that case the words “But these” and so on are justified. For the fourth noble tradition is specifically intended to bring about the abandoning of rebirth-linking and existence.

original: visesato catutthaariyavaṃso. Taṇhuppādānanti taṇhuppattīnaṃ, cīvarādihetu uppajjanakataṇhānanti
analyzed: visesataḥ catuttha ariya vaṃso taṇhā uppādānam ti taṇhā uppattīnam cīvara ādi hetu uppajjanaka taṇhānam ti
translated: “The arising of craving” is the arising of craving for robes, etc., that is to say, the craving that arises with robes, etc., as object.🔽“The time of making the effort” is the time of application to development.

original: attho. Padhānakaraṇakāleti bhāvanānuyogakkhaṇe. Sītādīni na khamatīti bhāvanāya pubbabhāgakālaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ padhāna karaṇa kāle iti bhāvanā anuyoga kkhaṇe sītā ādīni na khamati iti bhāvanāya pubbabhāga kālam
translated: “He cannot endure cold and so on” is said with reference to the time of the earlier stage of development.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Khamatīti sahati abhibhavati. Vitakkasamananti nidassanamattaṃ.
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam khamati iti sahati abhibhavati vitakka samanam ti nidassana mattam
translated: “He can endure” means he is capable of, he can overcome. “Thoughts” is mentioned only by way of illustration.

original: Sabbesampi kilesānaṃ samanavasena pavattā paṭipadā.
analyzed: sabbesam pi kilesānam samana vasena pavattā paṭipadā
translated: The practice that occurs with the concurrence of all defilements.

original: Samādhijhānādibhedo dhammo pajjati paṭipajjīyati etenāti dhammapadaṃ. Anabhijjhāva
analyzed: samādhi jhāna ādi bhedaḥ dhammo pajjati paṭipajjīyati etena ati dhamma padam
translated: The state of dhammas is called “dhammāpada” because the dhammas classed as jhāna, etc., are practised by means of it. Non-greed is the opposite of greed.

original: dhammapadaṃ anabhijjhādhammapadaṃ. Ayaṃ tāva alobhapakkhe nayo, itarapakkhe pana
analyzed: dhamma padam anabhijjhā dhamma padam ayam tāva alobha pakkhe nayaḥ itara pakkhe pana
translated: The “state of things consisting in non-greed” is the “state of things consisting in the profitable root non-greed” . This is the method in the case of the profitable side. But in the case of the unprofitable side

original: anabhijjhāpadhāno dhammakoṭṭhāso anabhijjhādhammapadaṃ. Akopoti adoso, mettāti attho.
analyzed: anabhijjhā padhānaḥ dhammakoṭṭhāsaḥ anabhijjhā dhamma padam akopo ti adosaḥ mettā ati attho
translated: the “state of things consisting in non-greed” is the “state of things consisting in the unprofitable root non-greed” . “Non-ill-will” is non-hate, which is what “loving-kindness” means.

original: Suppaṭṭhitasatīti kāyādīsu sammadeva upaṭṭhitā sati. Satisīsenāti satipadhānamukhena.
analyzed: su ppaṭṭhita satī iti kāya ādīsu sammat eva upaṭṭhitā sati sati sīsena ati sati padhāna mukhena
translated: “Well-established mindfulness”: mindfulness well established in the body, etc.,🔽“By the head of mindfulness”: by the head of the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: Samādhipadhānattā jhānānaṃ “samāpatti vā”ti vuttaṃ. Kāmaṃ saviññāṇakaasubhepi jhānabhāvanā
analyzed: samādhi padhāna ttā jhānānam samāpatti vā ti vuttam kāmam sa viññāṇaka asubhe api jhāna bhāvanā
translated: “Or attainment”: this is said because the jhānas have concentration as their head.

original: alobhappadhānā hoti kāyassa jigucchanena, paṭikkūlākāraggahaṇavasena ca pavattanato,🔽sattavidhauggahakosallādivasena panassā pavatti satipadhānāti tatiyadhammapadeneva
analyzed: a lobha ppadhānā hoti kāyassa jigucchanena paṭikkūla ākāra ggahaṇa vasena ca pavattanato  sattavidha oggaha kosalla ādi vasena pana assā pavatti sati padhānā āti tatiya dhamma padena iva
translated: Of course, the meditation subject consisting of foulness with consciousness is also a “state of things consisting in non-greed” since it is a meditation subject consisting in disgust with the body,🔽but its practice is by the head of mindfulness since it is undertaken by means of the seven kinds of skill in learning, etc.,

original: naṃ saṅgaṇhitukāmo “dasa asubhavasena vā”ti āha. Hitūpasaṃhārādivasena pavattanato
analyzed: saṅgaṇhitu kāmaḥ asubha vasena vā āti āha hitu upasaṃhāra ādi vasena pavattanato
translated: and so the meditator who wants to include it in the third “state of things” says “Or by the ten kinds of foulness.”

original: brahmavihārabhāvanā byāpādavirodhinī abyāpādappadhānāti āha “catubrahma…pe… dhammapada”nti.
analyzed: brahmavihāra bhāvanā byāpāda virodhinī a byāpāda ppadhānā ti āha catu brahmape dhamma padanti
translated: The meditation subject consisting of the divine abidings is a “state of things consisting in non-hate” since it is a meditation subject that is opposed to ill will and has non-hate as its head.

original: Tattha adhigatāni jhānādīnīti yojanā. Gamanādito āhārassa paṭikkūlabhāvasallakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: tattha adhigatāni jhāna ādīni iti yojanā gamana āditaḥ āhārassa paṭikkūla bhāva sat lakkhaṇam
translated: Here the interpretation is that the jhānas, etc., are attained.

original: saññāya thirabhāveneva hoti tassā thirasaññāpadaṭṭhānattāti āhāre paṭikkūlasaññāpi🔽tatiyadhammapade eva saṅgahaṃ gatā. Āruppasamādhiabhiññānaṃ adhiṭṭhānabhāvato kasiṇabhāvanā,
analyzed: saññāya thira bhāvena iva hoti tassā thira saññā padaṭṭhāna ttā ati āhāre paṭikkūla saññā api  tatiya dhamma pade eva saṅgaham gatā āruppa samādhi abhiññānam adhiṭṭhāna bhāvato kasiṇa bhāvanā
translated: The contemplation of the repulsiveness of food is only possible when perception is firm, since it is the support for the perception of repulsiveness.🔽So the perception of repulsiveness in nutriment is included in the third section on things.

original: sattavidhabojjhaṅgavijjāvimuttipāripūrihetuto ānāpānesu paṭhamaānāpānabhāvanā visesato
analyzed: sattavidha bojjhaṅga vijjā vimutti pāripūri hetutaḥ ānāpānesu paṭhama ānāpāna bhāvanā visesataḥ
translated: The kasiṇa development is included in the fourth section on things, since it is the basis for the higher lences and direct knowledges, and since it is the cause for the fulfilment of the seven factors of enlightenment and of the three true knowledges.

original: samādhipadhānāti sā catutthadhammapadena saṅgahitā. Catudhātuvavatthānavasena adhigatānipi
analyzed: samādhi padhānā ti sā catuttha dhamma padena saṅgahitā catu dhātu vavatthāna vasena
translated: The first mindfulness of breathing is included in the fourth section on things, since it is the basis for concentration and is the chief thing.

original: ettheva saṅgahetabbāni siyuṃ, paññāpadhānatāya pana na saṅgahitāni.
analyzed: ettha iva saṅgahetabbāni siyum paññā apadhāna tāya pana na saṅgahitāni
translated: The fourfold discernment of the four elements should be included here, but it is not, because it is not the chief thing.

original: Dhammasamādānesu paṭhamaṃ acelakapaṭipadā etarahi ca dukkhabhāvato, anāgatepi apāyadukkhavaṭṭadukkhāvahato.
analyzed: dhamma samādānesu paṭhamam acelaka paṭipadā etarahi ca dukkha bhāvataḥ anāgate pi apāya dukkha vaṭṭa dukkha āvahato
translated: Among the ways of undertaking things, the first, the practice of the naked ascetics, is included in the fourth section on things, since it is painful now and will lead to suffering in the unhappy destinies in the future.

original: Acelakapaṭipadāti ca nidassanamattaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ channaparibbājakānampi ubhayadukkhāvahapaṭipattidassanato.
analyzed: acelaka paṭipadā iti ca nidassana mattam daṭṭhabbam channa paribbājakānam pi ubhaya dukkha āvaha paṭipatti dassanato
translated: And the way of the naked ascetics should be regarded as merely an illustration, since the wanderers of other sects also have a way that brings suffering in both ways.

original: Dutiyaṃ…pe… brahmacariyacaraṇaṃ etarahi satipi dukkhe āyatiṃ sukhāvahattā. Kāmesu
analyzed: brahmacariya caraṇam etarahi sati pi dukkhe āyatim sukha āvaha tā kāmesu
translated: The second … and so on with the third and fourth … the life of purity is the practice of the path. It is the cause of future happiness even though there is suffering now.

original: pātabyatā yathākāmaṃ kāmaparibhogo. Alabhamānassāpīti pi-saddena ko pana vādo labhamānassāti dasseti.🔽Dussīlyādipāpadhammānaṃ khambhanaṃ paṭibandhanaṃ khandhaṭṭho, so pana sīlādi evāti
analyzed: pātabya tā yathākāmam kāma paribhogaḥ a labhamānassa api iti pi saddena kaḥ pana vādaḥ labhamānassa ati dasseti  dussīlya ādi pāpa dhammānam khambhanam paṭibandhanam khandhaṭṭho so pana sīla ādi eva ati
translated: The word “even” in the phrase “even though he does not obtain” shows that there is no need to mention his obtaining.🔽The meaning of “mass” is the meaning of “heap” . But the heaps are the virtues, etc., themselves.

original: āha “guṇaṭṭho khandhaṭṭho”ti. Guṇavisayatāya khandha-saddassa guṇatthatā veditabbā.
analyzed: āha guṇa ṭṭho khandha ṭṭho ti guṇa visaya tāya khandha saddassa guṇa ttha tā veditabbā
translated: Therefore it is said: “The meaning of ‘mass’ is the meaning of ‘heap.’ ” The meaning of “heap” should be understood as the meaning of “mass” because the word “mass” has the characteristic of a collection of qualities.

original: Vimuttikkhandhoti paṭipakkhato suṭṭhu vimuttā guṇadhammā adhippetā, na avimuttā,
analyzed: vimutti kkhandho ti paṭipakkhataḥ suṭṭhu vimuttāḥ guṇa dhammāḥ adhippetāḥ na a vimuttā
translated: The “mass of deliverance” is the qualities that are completely delivered from their opposites, not those that are not delivered or are being delivered.

original: nāpi vimuccamānāti tehi saha desanaṃ āruḷhā sīlakkhandhādayopi tayoti āha “phalasīlaṃ
analyzed: nā api vimuccamānā ati tehi saha desanam āruḷhā sīla kkhandha ādayaḥ api tayā iti āha phala sīlam
translated: The virtues, etc., that accompany them are also “masses” in the sense of fruit. Therefore it is said: “The virtue of fruit,

original: adhippetaṃ, catūsupi ṭhānesu phalameva vutta”nti ca. Eteneva cettha vimuttikkhandhoti
analyzed: adhippetam catūsu pi ṭhānesu phalam eva vuttan ti ca etena iva ca ittha vimutti khandho ti
translated: and the fruit is stated in all four instances.

original: phalapariyāpannā sammāsaṅkappavāyāmasatiyo adhippetāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: phala pariyāpannā sammāsaṅkappa vāyāma satiyaḥ adhippetā iti veditabbam
translated: And by this it should be understood that the aggregate of emancipation is intended here as right thought, right effort, and right mindfulness, which are included in the fruit.

original: Upatthambhanaṭṭhena sampayuttadhammānaṃ tattha thirabhāvena pavattanato, eteneva
analyzed: upatthambhana ṭṭhena sampayutta dhammānam tattha thira bhāvena pavattanataḥ etena iva
translated: because they occur by the stability of the associated states in that state by way of support.🔽By this it should be understood that the meaning of power in the domain of non-conscience and shamelessness is established.

original: ahirikaanottappānampi savisaye balaṭṭho siddho veditabbo. Na hi tesaṃ paṭipakkhehi
analyzed: ahirika anottappānam pi sa visaye balaṭṭhaḥ siddhaḥ veditabbaḥ na hi tesam paṭipakkhehi
translated: For the meaning of unshakability by their opposites is not absolute.

original: akampiyaṭṭho ekantiko. Hirottappānañhi akampiyaṭṭho sātisayo kusaladhammānaṃ mahābalabhāvato,
analyzed: akampiya ṭhaḥ ekantikaḥ hira uttappānam hi akampiya ṭṭhaḥ sa atisayaḥ kusala dhammānam mahā bala bhāvato
translated: For the meaning of unshakability by conscience and shame is excessive because of the great power of the wholesome states and

original: akusalānañca dubbalabhāvato. Tenāha bhagavā “abalā naṃ balīyanti, maddante naṃ parissayā”ti
analyzed: akusalānam ca dubbala bhāvataḥ tena āha bhagavā abalāḥ nam balīyanti maddante nam
translated: the weakness of the unwholesome states. Therefore the Blessed One said: “The weak are overcome by the strong, and the heedless are overcome by the heedful” .

original: bodhipakkhiyadhammavasenāyaṃ desanāti “samathavipassanāmaggavasenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bodhi pakkhiya dhamma vasena ayam desanā ati samatha vipassanā magga vasena ati vuttam
translated: This teaching is by way of the states that are factors of enlightenment. Therefore it is said: “by way of the path of serenity and insight.”

original: Adhīti upasaggamattaṃ, na “adhicitta”ntiādīsu viya adhikārādiatthaṃ. Karaṇādhikaraṇabhāvasādhanavasena
analyzed: adhi iti upasagga mattam na adhicittam ti ādīsu viya adhikāra ādi attham karaṇa adhikaraṇa bhāva sādhana vasena
translated: The prefix adhi has the mere sense of prefix, not the sense of predominance, etc., as in the case of adhicitta .

original: adhiṭṭhāna-saddassa atthaṃ dassento “tena vā”tiādimāha. Tena adhiṭṭhānena tiṭṭhanti
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna saddassa attham dassento tena vā ti ādim āha tena adhiṭṭhānena tiṭṭhanti
translated: Pointing out the meaning of the word “basis” he says “by that” and so on. By that basis they stand,

original: attano sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ guṇādhikā purisā, te eva tattha adhiṭṭhāne tiṭṭhanti sammāpattiyā,
analyzed: attano sammāpaṭipattiyam guṇa adhikā purisā te eva tattha adhiṭṭhāne tiṭṭhanti sammāpattiyā
translated: those who are superior in virtue by their own right practice, they stand in that basis by right practice,

original: ṭhānameva adhiṭṭhānameva sammāpaṭipattiyanti yojanā. Paṭhamena adhiṭṭhānena. Aggaphalapaññāti
analyzed: ṭhānam eva adhiṭṭhānam eva sammā paṭipattiyanti yojanā paṭhamena adhiṭṭhānena agga phala paññā ti
translated: the meaning is that the basis is the right practice. By the first basis. The highest fruit of wisdom

original: ukkaṭṭhaniddesoyaṃ. Kilesūpasamoti kilesānaṃ accantavūpasamo. Paṭhamena nayena adhiṭṭhānāni🔽ekadesatova gahitāni, na nippadesatoti nippadesatova tāni dassetuṃ “paṭhamena cā”tiādi
analyzed: ukkaṭṭha niddeso yam kilesūpasamo ti kilesānam paṭhamena nayena adhiṭṭhānāni  eka desataḥ iva gahitāni na nippadesato ti nippadesataḥ iva tāni dassetum paṭhamena ca atiādi
translated: is a description of the highest. The complete subsiding of defilements is the complete subsiding of defilements. By the first method the bases

original: vuttaṃ. “Ādiṃ katvā”ti etena jhānābhiññāpaññañceva maggapaññañca saṅgaṇhāti. Vacīsaccaṃ🔽ādiṃ katvāti ādi-saddena viratisaccaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Tatiyena ādi-saddena kilesānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam ādim katvā iti etena jhāna abhiññā paññañca iva magga paññañca saṅgaṇhāti vacī saccam  ādim katvā iti ādi saddena virati saccam saṅgaṇhāti tatiyena ādi saddena kilesānam
translated: are taken only in part, not in full, therefore in order to show them in full he says “by the first” and so on. By the word “first” he includes the wisdom of the jhānas and the higher knowledges and the wisdom of the path. The truth of speech

original: vītikkamapariccāgaṃ, pariyuṭṭhānapariccāgaṃ, heṭṭhimamaggehi anusayapariccāgañca
analyzed: vītikkama pariccāgam pariyuṭṭhāna pariccāgam heṭṭhima maggehi anusaya pariccāgam ca
translated: is the first. By the word “first” he includes the truth of virtue. By the third use of the word “first” he includes the complete surmounting and abandoning of defilements, the complete giving up of obsessions, and the complete giving up of underlying tendencies by the lower paths.

original: saṅgaṇhāti. “Vikkhambhite kilese”ti etena samāpattīhi kilesānaṃ vikkhambhanavasena🔽vūpasamaṃ vatvā ādi-saddena heṭṭhimamaggehi kātabbaṃ tesaṃ samucchedavasena vūpasamaṃ
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti vikkhambhite kilese iti etena samāpattīhi kilesānam vikkhambhana vasena  vūpasamam vatvā ādi saddena heṭṭhima maggehi kātabbam tesam samuccheda vasena vūpasamam
translated: he includes their subsidence by their eradication through the lower paths by the word “etc.”

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Arahattaphalapaññā kathitā ukkaṭṭhaniddesatova, aññathā vacīsaccādīnampi🔽gahaṇaṃ siyā. Nibbānañca asammosadhammatāya uttamaṭṭhena saccaṃ, sabbasaṃkilesapariccāganimittatāya
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti arahatta phala paññā kathitā ukkaṭṭha niddesato va aññathā vacī sacca ādīnam pi  gahaṇam siyā nibbānam ca asammosa dhamma tāya uttama aṭṭhena saccam sabba saṃkilesa pariccāga nimitta tāya
translated: The knowledge of the fruit of arahantship is stated by the word “truth” in the sense of the highest, because it is the highest fruit of knowledge. Otherwise, truthfulness of speech, etc.,🔽would also have to be included. And nibbāna is worthy of being stated in particular as truth in the sense of the highest, because it is the truth that is not subject to destruction, as

original: cāgo, sabbasaṅkhārūpasamabhāvato upasamoti ca visesato vattabbataṃ arahatīti therassa🔽adhippāyo. Pakaṭṭhajānanaphalatāya paññā, anavasesato kilesānañcajante ca vūpasante🔽ca uppannattā cāgo, upasamoti ca visesato aggaphalañāṇaṃ vuccatīti thero āha “sesehi
analyzed: cāgaḥ sabba saṅkhāra upasama bhāvataḥ upasamaḥ ti ca visesataḥ vattabba tam arahati iti therassa  adhippāyo pakaṭṭha jānana phala tāya paññā anavasesato ca vūpasante  ca uppanna ttā cāgaḥ upasamaḥ ti ca visesataḥ agga phala ñāṇam vuccati iti theraḥ āha sesehi
translated: abandonment, because it is the sign of the relinquishing of all defilements and of the abandoning of all suffering, and as peace, because it is the stilling of all formations. This is the Elder’s intention.

original: arahattaphalapaññā kathitā”ti.
analyzed: arahatta phala paññā kathitā ati
translated: The knowledge of the fruit of arahantship is stated by the word “abandonment” in particular, because it is the fruit of knowledge that is manifest, and because it is the abandonment of defilements without remainder, and because it is the stilling of both the arising and the subsiding of defilements.
