translated: These have a dwelling that is not fixed, namely pupils. Having taken up a meditation subject, they seek a suitable lodging and

original: yaṃ kiñci disaṃ gacchantīti disāgamanīyā. Idāni tamatthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “buddhakāle”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yam kiñci disam gacchanti iti disāgamanīyāḥ idāni tam attham vitthārataḥ dassetum buddha kāla itiādi vuttam
translated: go in any direction. Now in order to show that meaning in detail he said “ In the time of the Enlightened One” , and so on.

original: Asubhakammaṭṭhānanti ekādasavidhaṃ asubhakammaṭṭhānaṃ. Tatthāpi puggalavemattataṃ
analyzed: asubha kammaṭṭhānan ti ekādasavidham asubha kammaṭṭhānam tattha api puggala vemattataṃ
translated: The meditation subject of foulness: the eleven foulnesses as a meditation subject. Here too, after discerning the difference in temperament,🔽he gives the appropriate one, the appropriate one.

original: ñatvā tadanurūpaṃ tadanurūpameva deti. Mohacaritassapi kāmaṃ ānāpānassatikammaṭṭhānaṃ🔽sappāyaṃ, kammaṭṭhānabhāvanāya pana bhājanabhūtaṃ kātuṃ sammohavigamāya paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: ñatvā tad anurūpam tad anurūpam eva deti moha caritassa api kāmam āna apāna ssati kammaṭṭhānam  sappāyam kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanāya pana bhājana bhūtam kātum sammoha vigamāya paṭhamam
translated: Though the meditation subject of mindfulness of breathing is suitable for one of greedy temperament,🔽still, in order to make him a fit vessel for developing the meditation subject, he should first be instructed in the following:

original: uddesaparipucchādhammassavanadhammasākacchāsu niyojetabboti vuttaṃ “mohacaritassa…pe…
analyzed: uddesa paripucchā dhamma ssavana dhamma sākacchāsu niyojetabbaḥ iti vuttam mohacaritassape
translated: the recitation and interrogation in the summary, the listening to the Dhamma, and the discussion of the Dhamma, which is why it is said, “One of deluded temperament … he should advise him …

original: ācikkhatī”ti. Saddhācaritassa visesato purimā cha anussatiyo sappāyā, tāsaṃ pana
analyzed: ācikkhati iti saddhā caritassa visesataḥ purimāḥ cha anussatiyaḥ sappāyā tāsam pana
translated: to recite.” The six recollections are particularly suitable for one of faithful temperament,🔽but in order to show that the preliminary practice for undertaking them is the “Trust” chapter,

original: anuyuñjane ayaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipattīti dassetuṃ “pasādanīyasuttante”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: anuyuñjane ayam pubbabhāga paṭipatti iti dassetum pasādanīya suttanta itiādi vuttam
translated: “he should advise him to listen to and discuss the ‘Trust’ chapter.”

original: Ñāṇacaritassāti buddhicaritassa, tassa pana maraṇassati, upasamānussati, catudhātuvavatthānaṃ,
analyzed: ñāṇa caritassa ati buddhi caritassa tassa pana maraṇa sati catu dhātu vavatthānam
translated: One of intelligent temperament: one of understanding temperament. The recollection of death, the recollection of peace, the defining of the four elements,🔽and the perception of the repulsiveness of food are particularly suitable for him, but in order to show that they are helpful qualities,

original: āhārepaṭikūlasaññā visesato sappāyā, tesaṃ pana upakāradhammadassanatthaṃ “aniccatādi…pe…
analyzed: āhāre paṭikūla saññā visesato sappāyā tesam pana upakāra dhamma dassana attham
translated: “impermanence, etc., …

original: kathetī”ti vuttaṃ. Tatthevāti satthu santike eva. Temāsikaṃ paṭipadanti tīhi māsehi🔽sanniṭṭhāpetabbaṃ paṭipadaṃ.🔽Ime bhikkhūti imissā dhammadesanāya bhājanabhūtā bhikkhū. “Evaṃ āgantvā gacchante
analyzed: kathā iti iti vuttam tattha iva ati satthu santike eva temāsikam paṭipadanti tīhi māsehi  sanniṭṭhāpetabbam paṭipadam  ime bhikkhū iti imissā dhamma desanāya bhājana bhūtāḥ bhikkhū evam āgantvā gacchante
translated: “The three-month practice” is the practice to be completed in three months.🔽“These bhikkhus” are the bhikkhus who are vessels for this teaching of the Dhamma.

original: pana bhikkhū”ti idaṃ “buddhakāle”tiādinā taduddesikavasena vuttabhikkhū sandhāya
analyzed: pana bhikkhū iti idam buddha kāle iti ādinā tad uddesika vasena vutta bhikkhū sandhāya
translated: “But when the bhikkhus come and go in this way” is said with reference to the bhikkhus mentioned in the passage beginning with “in the Buddha’s time,”

original: vuttaṃ, na “ime bhikkhū”ti anantaraṃ vuttabhikkhū. Tenāha “pesetī”ti. Apalokethāti
analyzed: vuttam na ime bhikkhū iti anantaram vutta bhikkhū tena āha peseti iti apaloketha ati
translated: not with reference to the bhikkhus mentioned immediately before in the passage beginning with “these bhikkhus.” Therefore it is said: “He sends them away.”🔽“He asks” means he inquires. “The wise ones” and so forth are the reasons for associating with and serving .

original: āpucchatha. “Paṇḍitā”tiādi sevanabhajanesu kāraṇavacanaṃ. “Sotāpattiphale vinetī”tiādi🔽yebhuyyavasena vuttaṃ. Āyasmā hi dhammasenāpati bhikkhū yebhuyyena sotāpattiphalaṃ
analyzed: āpucchatha paṇḍita atiādi sevana bhajanesu kāraṇa vacanam sa utāpatti phale vinā iti itiādi  yebhuyya vasena vuttam āyasmā hi dhammasenāpati bhikkhū yebhuyyena sotāpatti phalam
translated: “He guides them to the fruit of stream-entry” and so forth is said in the majority of cases.

original: pāpetvā vissajjeti “evamete niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā”ti. Āyasmā pana mahāmoggallāno
analyzed: pāpetvā vissajja iti evam ete niyatā sambodhi parāyaṇā ti āyasmā pana mahāmoggallāno
translated: For the Venerable Sariputta, the General of the Dhamma, sends away the bhikkhus after guiding them in the majority of cases to the fruit of stream-entry, saying: “Thus they are destined for the supreme goal.”

original: “sabbāpi bhavūpapatti jigucchitabbāvā”ti bhikkhū yebhuyyena uttamatthaṃyeva pāpeti.
analyzed: sabbā api bhava upapatti jigucchitabbā avāti bhikkhū yebhuyyena uttamattham yeva pāpā iti
translated: But the Venerable Maha Moggallana sends away the bhikkhus after guiding them in the majority of cases to the supreme goal, saying: “All forms of existence and rebirth should be despised.”

original: Sāvakehi vinetuṃ sakkuṇeyyā sāvakaveneyyā nāma na sāvakeheva vinetabbāti dassento🔽āha “sāvakaveneyyā nāmā”tiādi. Dasadhā mātikaṃ ṭhapetvāti ekakato paṭṭhāya yāva dasakā
analyzed: sāvakehi vinetum sakkuṇeyyā sāvakaveneyyā nāma na sāvakehi iva vinetabbā ati dassento  āha sāvaka veneyyā nāma ati ādi dasadhā mātikam ṭhapetvā ati ekakataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva dasakā
translated: He shows that the kind called “to be trained by disciples” is not to be trained by disciples only.🔽He says, “The kind called ‘to be trained by disciples’ is not to be trained by disciples only. It is to be trained by disciples and by the Master.”🔽Having set out the list in the tenfold way, beginning with the single question, up to the tenfold question,

original: dasadhā dasadhā mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā vibhattoti dasuttaro. Dasuttaro gatotipi dasuttaroti
analyzed: dasadhā dasadhā mātikam ṭhapetvā vibhattaḥ iti dasuttaraḥ dasuttaraḥ gataḥ iti pi dasuttaraḥ iti
translated: he is called “the one with ten questions” because he is classified in the tenfold way.

original: ekakato paṭṭhāya yāva dasakā dasahi uttaro adhiko hutvā gato pavattotipi dasuttaro.
analyzed: ekakataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva dasakāḥ dasahi uttaraḥ adhikaḥ hutvā gataḥ dasuttaro
translated: He is called “the one with ten questions” because he has gone to the ten questions, beginning with the single question, up to the tenfold question, and has exceeded, has gone beyond, the ten.

original: Ekekasmiṃ pabbeti ekakato paṭṭhāya yāva dasakā dasasu pabbesu ekekasmiṃ pabbe. Dasa
analyzed: ekekasmim pabbe ti ekakataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva dasakāḥ dasasu pabbesu ekekasmim pabbe dasa
translated: In each of the ten questions, beginning with the single question, up to the tenfold question, in each of the ten questions.

original: dasa pañhāti “katamo dhammo bahukāro appamādo kusalesu dhammesū”tiādinā dasa dasa🔽pañhā. Visesitāti vissajjitā. Dasuttaraṃ pavakkhāmīti desiyamānaṃ desanaṃ nāmakittanamukhena
analyzed: dasa pañhā ati katamaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāraḥ appamādaḥ kusalesu dhammesu utiādinā dasa dasa  pañhā visesitā ati vissajjitā dasuttaram pavakkhāmi iti desiyamānam desanam nāma kittana mukhena
translated: Ten times ten questions: ten times ten questions beginning with “What is the profitable thing of great fruit?”🔽Having distinguished: having answered.🔽I will expound the one with ten questions: he acknowledges the teaching that is being taught by the expression of the name of the teaching in order to praise it.🔽I will expound: I will expound by means of the ten questions.

original: paṭijānāti vaṇṇabhaṇanatthaṃ. Pavakkhāmīti pakārehi vakkhāmi. Tathā hettha paññāsādhikānaṃ
analyzed: paṭijānāti vaṇṇa bhaṇana attham pavakkhāmi iti pakārehi vakkhāmi tathā ha ittha paññā sādhikānam
translated: Herein, the ten questions are as follows:

original: pañcannaṃ pañhasatānaṃ vasena desanā pavattā. Dhammanti idha dhamma-saddo pariyattipariyāyo🔽“idha bhikkhu dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇātī”tiādīsu viya. Suttalakkhaṇo cāyaṃ dhammoti āha
analyzed: pañcannam pañha satānam vasena desanā pavattā dhammanti idha dhamma saddo pariyatti pariyāyo  idha bhikkhu dhammam pariyāpuṇāti iti ādīsu viya sutta lakkhaṇaḥ ca ayam dhammo ti āha
translated: The word “Dhamma” here is a term for the scriptures,🔽as in the passage: “Here a bhikkhu learns the Dhamma … “ . And this Dhamma has the characteristic of thread,

original: “dhammanti sutta”nti. Svāyaṃ dhammo yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjamānassa nibbānāvaho.
analyzed: dhammanti suttanti svāyam dhammaḥ yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjamānassa nibbāna āvahaḥ
translated: so he says: “The Dhamma is the Thread.” And this Dhamma leads to Nibbana for one who practices in accordance with the way of teaching.

original: Tato eva vaṭṭadukkhasamucchedāya hoti, sa cāyamassa ānubhāvo sabbesaṃ khandhānaṃ
analyzed: tatas eva vaṭṭa dukkha samucchedāya hoti sa ca ayam assa ānubhāvaḥ sabbesam khandhānam
translated: Therefore it is also the means for the cutting off of the suffering of the round of rebirths. And this is its power, since it is the means for the deliverance of all the aggregates,

original: pamocanupāyabhāvatoti dassento “nibbānappattiyā”tiādimāha. Tena vuttaṃ “nibbānappattiyā”tiādi.
analyzed: pamocana upāya bhāvato ti dassentaḥ nibbāna ppattiyā itiādim āha tena vuttam nibbāna ppattiyā itiādi
translated: so showing this he says: “for the attainment of Nibbana.” Thus he says: “for the attainment of Nibbana.”

original: Uccaṃ karontoti udaggaṃ uḷāraṃ paṇītaṃ katvā dassento, paggaṇhantoti attho. Pemaṃ
analyzed: uccam karontaḥ iti udaggam uḷāram paṇītam katvā dassento paggaṇhantaḥ iti attho pa imam
translated: “Making it high”: showing it as lofty, sublime, and excellent, making it outstanding, is the meaning.

original: janentoti bhattiṃ uppādento. Idañca desanāya paggaṇhanaṃ buddhānampi āciṇṇaṃ evāti
analyzed: janentaḥ ti bhattim uppādentaḥ idam ca desanāya paggaṇhanam buddhānam pi āciṇṇam eva ati
translated: “Arousing love”: producing devotion. And this outstanding teaching of the Dhamma is the practice of the Buddhas themselves,

original: dassento “ekāyano”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ekāyanā iti ādim āha
translated: so showing this he says: “The One Path.”

original: Ekadhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: eka dhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the one Dhamma

original: 351. (Ka) kāra-saddo upa-saddena vināpi upakāratthaṃ vadati, “bahukārā, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro puttāna”ntiādīsu viyāti āha “bahukāroti bahūpakāro”ti.
analyzed: ka kāra saddaḥ upasaddena vinā api upakāra attham vadati bahu kārāḥ bhikkhave mātā pitaraḥ puttānam ti ādīsu viya iti āha bahu kāro ti bahu upakāro ti
translated: The word kāra in the sense of “beneficial” is used without the prefix upa in such passages as “Mothers and fathers are a great help to their children, bhikkhus” .

original: (Kha) vaḍḍhane vutte nānantariyatāya uppādanaṃ vuttameva hotīti “bhāvetabboti vaḍḍhetabbo”ti
analyzed: vaḍḍhane vutte nānantariya tāya uppādanam vuttam eva hoti iti bhāvetabbaḥ iti vaḍḍhetabbaḥ iti
translated: When “development” is mentioned, “arousing” is implied because it is not separable from it, and so “should be developed” is said instead of “should be aroused” .

original: vutto. Uppādanapubbikā hi vaḍḍhanāti. Nanu ca “eko dhammo uppādetabbo”ti uppādanaṃ🔽pettha visuṃ gahitaṃ evāti? Aññavisayattā tassa nāyaṃ virodho. Tathā hi “eko dhammo
analyzed: vuttaḥ uppādana pubbikā hi vaḍḍhanā ti nanu ca ekaḥ dhammo uppādetabbaḥ ti uppādanam  pa ittha visum gahitam eva ati añña visaya ttā tassa na ayam virodho tathā hi ekaḥ dhammo
translated: For development is preceded by arousing.🔽But is not arousing mentioned separately here in the passage: “One idea should be aroused” ?

original: pariññeyyo”ti tīhipi pariññāhi pariññeyyataṃ vatvāpi “eko dhammo pahātabbo”ti pahātabbatā vuttā.
analyzed: pariññeyyaḥ ti tīhi pi pariññāhi pariññeyya tam vatvā api ekaḥ dhammo pahātabbo ti pahātabba tā vuttā
translated: There is no contradiction here, because that refers to a different subject. For although it is said that “One idea should be penetrated” by the three kinds of full-understanding, still “One idea should be abandoned” is said.

original: (Ga) tīhi pariññāhīti ñātatīraṇapahānapariññāhi.
analyzed: ga tīhi pariññāhi iti ñāta tīraṇa pahāna pariññāhi
translated: By the three kinds of full-understanding: by the full-understanding of the known, the full-understanding of the investigated, and the full-understanding of abandoning.

original: (Gha) pahānānupassanāyāti pajahanavasena pavattāya anupassanāya. Missakavasena cetaṃ anupassanāgahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: pahāna anupassanāya ati pajahana vasena pavattāya anupassanāya missaka vasena ca itam anupassanā gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam
translated: By the contemplation of abandoning: by the contemplation that occurs by way of abandoning.

original: (Ṅa) sīlasampadādīnaṃ parihānāvaho parihānāya saṃvattanako.
analyzed: ṅaḥ sīla sampad ādīnam parihāna āvahaḥ parihānāya saṃvattanakaḥ
translated: It is a source of loss, a cause of loss, of the perfection of virtue, etc.

original: (Ca) jhānādivisesaṃ gametīti visesagāmī.
analyzed: ca jhāna ādi visesam gameti iti visesa gāmī
translated: It leads to distinction, to the distinction of jhāna, etc.

original: (Cha) duppaccakkhakaroti anupacitañāṇasambhārehi paccakkhaṃ kātuṃ asakkuṇeyyo.
analyzed: cha duppaccakkha karoti an upacita ñāṇa sambhārehi paccakkham kātum a sakkuṇeyyaḥ
translated: It is hard to see, hard to see by one whose equipment of knowledge is incomplete.

original: (Jha) abhijānitabboti abhimukhaṃ ñāṇena jānitabbo.
analyzed: abhijānitabbaḥ ti abhimukham ñāṇena jānitabbaḥ
translated: It is to be penetrated, to be penetrated by knowledge face to face.

original: Sabbattha mātikāsūti dukādivasena vuttāsu sabbāsu mātikāsu. Ettha ca āyasmā dhammasenāpati
analyzed: sabbattha mātikāsu iti duka ādi vasena vuttāsu sabbāsu mātikāsu ettha ca āyasmā dhammasenāpati
translated: In all the schedules: in all the schedules stated in the dyads, etc. Herein, the venerable Dhamma- sena

original: te bhikkhū bhāvanāya niyojetvā uttamatthe patiṭṭhāpetukāmo paṭhamaṃ tāva bhāvanāya
analyzed: te bhikkhū bhāvanāya niyojetvā uttama atthe patiṭṭhāpetu kāmo paṭhamam tāva bhāvanāya
translated: after setting those bhikkhus to developing, wanted to establish them in the ultimate good. So first of all he showed the quality that helps development by stating the first dyad, “One thing helps …,”

original: upakāradhammaṃ uddesavasena dassento “eko dhammo bahukāro”ti vatvā tena upakārakena
analyzed: upakāra dhammam uddesa vasena dassento ekaḥ dhammaḥ bahu kāro ti vatvā tena upakārakena
translated: and then he showed what should be helped by stating the second dyad, “One thing should be developed.”🔽And this development is intended here as insight development,

original: upakattabbaṃ dassento “eko dhammo bhāvetabbo”ti āha. Ayañca bhāvanā vipassanāvasena
analyzed: upakattabbam dassentaḥ ekaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvetabbaḥ ti āha ayañca bhāvanā vipassanā vasena
translated: so he said, “One thing should be fully understood.”🔽And full understanding is only for the purpose of abandoning what should be fully understood,

original: icchitāti āha “eko dhammo pariññeyyo”ti. Pariññā ca nāma yāvadeva pahātabbapajahanatthāti
analyzed: icchitā ati āha ekaḥ dhammo pariññeyyaḥ ti pariññā ca nāma yāvat eva pahātabba pajahana atthā ati
translated: so he said, “One thing should be abandoned.”

original: āha “eko dhammo pahātabbo”ti. Pajahantena ca hānabhāgiyaṃ nīharitvā visesabhāgiye
analyzed: āha ekaḥ dhammo pahātabbo ti pajahantena ca hāna bhāgiyam nīharitvā visesa bhāgiye
translated: He said: “One idea to be abandoned.” And when one is abandoning, one should remove what belongs to the category of what is to be dwindled away and stand in what belongs to the category of what is to be increased.

original: avaṭṭhātabbanti āha “eko dhammo hānabhāgiyo, eko dhammo visesabhāgiyo”ti. Visesabhāgiye
analyzed: avaṭṭhātabbanti āha ekaḥ dhammaḥ hāna bhāgiyaḥ ekaḥ dhammo visesa bhāgiyaḥ ti visesa bhāgiye
translated: He said: “One idea belongs to the category of what is to be dwindled away, one idea belongs to the category of what is to be increased.”

original: avaṭṭhānañca duppaṭivijjhanena, duppaṭivijjhapaṭivijjhanañce ijjhati, nipphādetabbanipphādanaṃ
analyzed: avaṭṭhānam ca duppaṭivijjhanena duppaṭivijjha paṭivijjhanam ce ijjhati nipphādetabba nipphādanam
translated: And when one is standing in what belongs to the category of what is to be increased, and when one is penetrating what is hard to penetrate, and when one is penetrating what is to be penetrated, then what is to be brought about is already brought about.

original: siddhameva hotīti āha “eko dhammo duppaṭivijjho, eko dhammo uppādetabbo”ti. Tayidaṃ
analyzed: siddham eva hoti iti āha ekaḥ dhammo duppaṭivijjhaḥ ekaḥ dhammo uppādetabbaḥ ti tayidam
translated: He said: “One idea is hard to penetrate, one idea is to be brought about.”🔽And this pair is brought about by the knowing of what is to be directly known, etc.,

original: dvayaṃ abhiññeyyādijānanena hotīti āha “eko dhammo abhiññeyyo”ti. Abhiññeyyañce abhiññātaṃ,
analyzed: dvayam abhiññeyya ādi jānanena hoti iti āha ekaḥ dhammo abhiññeyyaḥ ti abhiññeyyañce abhiññātam
translated: He said: “One idea is to be directly known.” And when what is to be directly known has been directly known,

original: sacchikātabbaṃ sacchikatameva hotīti. Ettāvatā ca niṭṭhitakiccova hoti, nāssa uttari
analyzed: sacchikātabbam sacchikatam eva hoti iti ettāvatā ca niṭṭhita kiccā uva hoti na assa uttari
translated: what is to be fully understood has been fully understood. And at this point he has done what he had to do, and there is nothing more for him to do.

original: kiñci karaṇīyanti evaṃ tāva mahāthero ekakavasena tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭipattividhiṃ
analyzed: kiñci karaṇīyanti evam tāva mahā thero ekaka vasena tesam bhikkhūnam paṭipatti vidhim
translated: So far the Elder Thera,

original: uddisanto imāni dasa padāni iminā anukkamena uddisi.
analyzed: uddisantaḥ imāni dasa padāni iminā anukkamena uddisi
translated: announcing the bhikkhus’ way of practice by ones, announced these ten terms in this sequence.

original: (Ka) evaṃ aniyamato uddiṭṭhadhamme sarūpato niyametvā dassetuṃ “katamo eko dhammo”tiādinā
analyzed: kaḥ evam aniyamataḥ uddiṭṭha dhamme sarūpataḥ niyametvā dassetum katamaḥ ekaḥ dhamma iti ādinā
translated: In order to show by way of specifying the nature of the dhammas mentioned in the above general way, the Master began the exposition with the words: “What is the one dhamma?”

original: desanaṃ ārabhi. Tena vuttaṃ “iti āyasmā sāriputto”tiādi. Esa nayo dukādīsu. Veḷukāroti
analyzed: desanam ārabhi tena vuttam iti āyasmā sāriputto tiādi esa nayaḥ duka ādīsu veḷukāro ti
translated: Therefore it is said: “Thus the venerable Sariputta” and so forth. The same method applies to the other terms beginning with “duka.”

original: veno. So hi veḷuvikārehi kilañjādikaraṇena “veḷukāro”ti vutto. Anto, bahi ca sabbagatagaṇṭhiṃ
analyzed: veno saḥ hi veḷu vikārehi kilañja ādi karaṇena veḷukāro ti vuttaḥ antar bahi ca sabba gata gaṇṭhim
translated: Veḷukāro means a bamboo-worker. He is called a “bamboo-worker” because he makes a living by working with bamboo, such as by making baskets.🔽Nigganthi means having removed the inner and outer knots.

original: nīharaṇena niggaṇṭhiṃ katvā. Ekekakoṭṭhāseti ekakādīsu dasasu koṭṭhāsesu ekekasmiṃ koṭṭhāse.
analyzed: nīharaṇena niggaṇṭhim katvā ekeka koṭṭhāsa iti ekaka ādīsu dasasu koṭṭhāsesu ekekasmin koṭṭhāse
translated: Ekekakoṭṭhāse means in each of the ten parts beginning with one.

original: Sabbatthakaṃ upakārakanti sabbatthakameva sammā paṭipattiyā upakāravantaṃ. Idāni
analyzed: sabbatthakam upakārakam ti sabbatthakam eva sammā paṭipattiyā upakāravantam idāni
translated: Sabbatthakaṃ upakārakaṃ means useful everywhere.

original: tamatthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “ayañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vipassanāgabbhaṃ gaṇhāpaneti
analyzed: tam attham vitthārataḥ dassetum ayam hi itiādi vuttam vipassanā gabbham gaṇhāpanā iti
translated: In order to show this meaning in detail, the following is said: “This is the method” and so forth.

original: yathā upari vipassanā paripaccati tikkhā visadā hutvā maggena ghaṭeti, evaṃ pubbabhāgavipassanāvaḍḍhane.
analyzed: yathā upari vipassanā paripaccati tikkhā visadā hutvā maggena ghaṭeti evam pubba bhāga vipassanā vaḍḍhane
translated: In order to take up the embryo of insight means in order to increase the insight of the preliminary stage, so that insight will ripen above, become sharp and clear, and be connected with the path.

original: Atthapaṭisambhidādīsūti atthapaṭisambhidādīsu nipphādetabbesu, tesaṃ sambhārasambharaṇanti🔽attho. Esa nayo ito paresupi. Ṭhānāṭṭhānesūti ṭhāne, aṭṭhāne ca jānitabbe. Mahāvihārasamāpattiyanti
analyzed: attha paṭisambhidā ādīsu ti attha paṭisambhidā ādīsu nipphādetabbesu tesam sambhāra sambharaṇam ti  attho esa nayaḥ itas paresu pi ṭhāna aṭṭhānesu ti ṭhāne aṭṭhāne ca jānitabbe mahāvihāra samāpattiyanti
translated: In the Atthapaṭisambhidādīsūti, in the Atthapaṭisambhidā, etc., which are to be produced. The meaning is: “The accumulation of the requisites for them.”

original: mahatiyaṃ jhānādivihārasamāpattiyaṃ. Vipassanāñāṇādīsūti ādi-saddena manomayiddhi
analyzed: mahatiyam jhāna ādi vihāra samāpattiyam vipassanā ñāṇa ādīsu iti ādi saddena manaḥ maya iddhi
translated: The same method applies to the rest. In the Ṭhānāṭṭhānesu, in the Ṭhāna and Aṭṭhānas. In the Mahāvihārasamāpattiyanti, in the great attainment of jhāna, etc. In the Vipassanāñāṇādīsūti, the word “etc.” includes the mind-made body,

original: ādikāni saṅgaṇhāti. Aṭṭhasu vijjāsūti ambaṭṭhasutte āgatanayāsu aṭṭhasu vijjāsu.
analyzed: ādikāni saṅgaṇhāti aṭṭhasu vijjāsu iti ambaṭṭha sutte āgata nayāsu aṭṭhasu vijjāsu
translated: the supernormal powers, etc. In the Aṭṭhasu vijjāsūti, in the eight vijjās found in the Ambaṭṭhasutta.

original: Teneva bhagavā thometīti yojanā. Nanti appamādaṃ.🔽Thāmasampannenāti ñāṇabalasamannāgatena. Dīpetvāti “evampi appamādo kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: tena iva bhagavā thometi iti yojanā appamādam  thāma sampannena ati ñāṇa bala samannāgatena dīpetvā ati evam pi appamādaḥ kusalānam dhammānam
translated: Thus is the construction. Nanti: heedfulness.

original: sampādane bahupakāro”ti pakāsetvā. Yaṃ kiñci anavajjapakkhikamatthaṃ appamāde pakkhipitvā
analyzed: sampādane bahu pakāraḥ ti pakāsetvā yam kiñci anavajja pakkhikam attham appamāde pakkhipitvā
translated: Thāmasampannenāti, endowed with the power of knowledge. Dīpetvāti, having shown thus: “In the accomplishment of wholesome states, heedfulness is of great help.” Having included any matter that is blameless under heedfulness,

original: kathetuṃ yuttanti dassetuṃ “yaṃ kiñcī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kathetum yuttan ti dassetum yam kiñci itiādi vuttam
translated: he said “Yaṃ kiñci” , etc., in order to show that it is proper to speak thus.

original: (Kha) kāyagatāsatīti rassaṃ akatvā niddeso, niddesena vā etaṃ samāsapadaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: kāya gatā asatī iti rassam a katvā niddesaḥ niddesena vā etam samāsa padam daṭṭhabbam
translated: “Contemplation of the body” is a short designation, or it can be regarded as a compound word with the locative case ending elided.

original: “Aṭṭhikāni puñjakitāni terovassikāni…pe… pūtīni cuṇṇikajātānī”ti evaṃ pavattamanasikāro
analyzed: aṭṭhikāni puñjakitāni pūtīni cuṇṇika jātāni iti evam pavatta manasikāro
translated: The attention given thus: “Bones, piled up like a wall of plaster, for a year, two years, three years, four years, five years, ten years, twenty years, thirty years, forty years, fifty years, a hundred years” is called

original: “cuṇṇikamanasikāro”ti vadanti. Apare pana bhaṇanti “cuṇṇikairiyāpathesu pavattamanasikāro”ti.
analyzed: cuṇṇika manasikāraḥ iti vadanti apare pana bhaṇanti cuṇṇika eriyāpathesu pavatta manasikāraḥ ti
translated: “attention given to the state of bones.” But others say that it is attention given to the state of bones in the postures.

original: Ettha uppannasatiyāti etasmiṃ yathāvutte ekūnatiṃsavidhe ṭhāne uppannāya satiyā.
analyzed: ettha uppanna satiyā iti etasmin yathā vutte ekūnatiṃsavidhe ṭhāne uppannāya satiyā
translated: “Arisen in this way”: arisen in the nineteen ways stated.

original: Sukhasampayuttāti nippariyāyato sukhasampayuttā, pariyāyato pana catutthajjhāne upekkhāpi
analyzed: sukha sampayuttā ati nippariyāyato sukha sampayuttā pariyāyato pana catuttha jhāne upekkhā api
translated: “Associated with happiness”: in the ultimate sense, associated with the happiness of the fourth jhāna. But in the conventional sense, equanimity also

original: “sukha”nti vattabbataṃ labhati santasabhāvattā.🔽(Ga) paccayabhūto ārammaṇādivisayopi ārammaṇabhāvena vaṇo viya āsave paggharati,
analyzed: sukhanti vattabbatam labhati santa sabhāva ttā  paccaya bhūtaḥ ārammaṇa ādi visayaḥ api ārammaṇa bhāvena vaṇaḥ viya āsave paggharati
translated: is called “happiness” because it has the nature of peace.🔽“The object that is the source of the defilements” is the object that is the source of the defilements, such as sensual desire, etc., in the way already stated.

original: so sampayogasambhavābhāvepi saha āsavehīti sāsavo. Tathā upādānānaṃ hitoti upādāniyo.
analyzed: sampayoga sambhava abhāve pi tathā tathā
translated: Though it is not a condition for the defilements by way of association, it is nevertheless “with defilement” because it is the source of the defilements. And it is “subject to cankers” because it is favourable to the cankers.

original: Itarathā pana paccayabhāvena vidhi paṭikkhepo.
analyzed: itarathā pana paccaya bhāvena vidhi paṭikkhepaḥ
translated: Otherwise the method would be a rejection of conditions.

original: (Gha) asmīti mānoti “asmī”ti pavatto māno.
analyzed: gha asmi iti mānaḥ asmi iti pavattaḥ mānaḥ
translated: “I am” conceit: conceit that occurs as “I am.”

original: (Ca) vipariyāyenāti “anicce anicca”ntiādinā nayena pavatto pathamanasikāro.
analyzed: ca vipariyāyena ati anicce anicca nti ādinā nayena pavatto patha manasikāro
translated: “By the opposite”: the first attention that occurs by the way beginning, “In what is impermanent, he assumes that ‘I am’” .

original: (Cha) idha pana vipassanānantaro maggo “ānantariko cetosamādhī”ti adhippeto. Kasmā?
analyzed: cha idha pana vipassanā anantaraḥ maggaḥ ānantariko cetosamādhi iti adhippeto kasmā
translated: “Here, however, the path that is next to insight is intended as ‘concentration of cognizance next to ’. Why?

original: Vipassanāya anantarattā, attano vā pavattiyā anantaraṃ phaladāyakattā. Saddatthato
analyzed: vipassanāya anantara ttā attanaḥ vā pavattiyāḥ anantaram phala dāyaka ttā saddatthato
translated: Because it is next to insight, or because it gives its fruit next to its occurrence.

original: pana anantaraṃ phalaṃ anantaraṃ, tasmiṃ anantare niyuttā, taṃ vā arahati, anantarapayojanoti vā ānantariko.
analyzed: pana anantaram phalam anantaram tasmin anantare niyuttā tam vai arahati vā ānantarikaḥ
translated: But in the sense of the word ‘next’ it is the fruit that is next, and it is next to that that it is bound up, or it is worthy of that, or it is next to what is to be done, thus it is next .

original: (Ja) phalanti phalapaññā. Paccavekkhaṇapaññā adhippetā akuppārammaṇatāya.
analyzed: phalanti phala paññā paccavekkhaṇa paññā adhippetā akuppa ārammaṇa tāya
translated: “Understanding of fruition”: understanding of reviewing is intended, because it has an unprolapsed object.

original: (Jha) attano phalaṃ āharatīti āhāro, paccayoti āha “āhāraṭṭhitikāti paccayaṭṭhitikā”ti.
analyzed: attanaḥ phalam āharati iti āhāraḥ paccayaḥ ti āha āhāra ṭṭhitikā ati paccaya ṭṭhitikā ati
translated: “Maintenance by conditions”: “maintenance by conditions” is “maintenance by nutriment” .

original: Ayaṃ eko dhammoti ayaṃ paccayasaṅkhāto eko dhammoti paccayatāsamaññena ekaṃ katvā
analyzed: ayam ekaḥ dhammo ti ayam paccaya saṅkhāto ekaḥ dhammo ti paccaya tā samaññena ekam katvā
translated: “This one idea”: this one idea called a condition, made one by the name “conditionality.”

original: vadati. Ñātapariññāya abhiññāyāti ñātapariññāsaṅkhātāya abhiññāya.
analyzed: vadati ñāta pariññāya abhiññāya ati ñāta pariññā saṅkhātāya abhiññāya
translated: He says: “By direct-knowledge as full-understanding of what is to be directly known”: by direct-knowledge called “full-understanding of what is to be directly known.”

original: (Ña) akuppā cetovimuttīti arahattaphalavimutti akuppabhāvena ukkaṃsagatattā. Aññathā sabbāpi phalasamāpattiyo akuppā eva paṭipakkhehi akopanīyattā.
analyzed: akuppā cetaḥ vimutti iti arahatta phala vimutti akuppa bhāvena ukkaṃsa gata ttā aññathā sabbā api phala samāpattiyaḥ akuppāḥ eva paṭipakkhehi a kopanīya ttā
translated: “The unshakable heart-deliverance”: the heart-deliverance consisting in Arahantship is called “unshakable” because it is outstanding in being unshakable. Otherwise all the attainments of fruition would be unshakable since they are not shaken by opposition.

original: Abhiññāyāti “abhiññeyyo”ti ettha laddhaabhiññāya. Pariññāyāti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: abhiññāya ati abhiññeyyaḥ ti ettha laddha abhiññāya pariññāya ati ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: “By direct-knowledge”: by the direct-knowledge got by the “to be directly known” . The same method of explanation applies to “by full-understanding.”

original: Pahātabbasacchikātabbehīti pahātabbasacchikātabbapadehi. Pahānapariññāva kathitā🔽pahānasacchikiriyānaṃ ekāvāratāya pariññāya saheva ijjhanato. Sacchikātabboti visesato
analyzed: pahātabba sacchikātabbehi iti pahātabba sacchikātabba padehi pahāna pariññā ava kathitā  pahāna sacchikiriyānaṃ ekāvāra tāya pariññāya saha iva ijjhanataḥ sacchikātabbaḥ ti visesato
translated: “By what is to be abandoned and by what is to be realized”: by the terms “what is to be abandoned” and “what is to be realized.” Full-understanding as abandoning is stated🔽because the realization of what is to be abandoned and what is to be realized succeeds only with full-understanding. The fruition is stated

original: phalaṃ kathitaṃ. Ekasmiṃyeva sattame eva pade labbhati. Phalaṃ pana anekesupi padesu
analyzed: phalam kathitam ekasmiṃ yeva sattame eva pade labbhati phalam pana anekesu pi padesu
translated: specifically as “what is to be realized.” It is found only in the single term “what is to be realized.” But the fruition is found

original: labbhati paṭhamaṭṭhamanavamadasamesu labbhanato. Yasmā taṃ nippariyāyato dasame eva
analyzed: labbhati paṭhama ṭṭhama navama dasamesu labbhanataḥ yasmā tam nippariyāyataḥ dasame eva
translated: in many terms, since it is found in the first, eighth, ninth, and tenth terms. Since it is found in the tenth term🔽in the primary sense,

original: labbhati, itaresu pariyāyato tasmā “labbhati evā”ti sāsaṅkaṃ vadati.
analyzed: labbhati itaresu tasmai labbhati eva ati sa āsaṅkam vadati
translated: He says this because he is doubtful, thinking, “It is possible in some instances, but not in others.”

original: Sabhāvato vijjamānāti yena bahukārādisabhāvena desitā, tena sabhāvena paramatthato🔽upalabbhamānā. Yāthāvāti aviparītā. Tathāsabhāvāti taṃsabhāvā. Na tathā na hontīti🔽avitathattā tathāva honti. Tato eva vuttappakārato aññathā na hontīti pañcahipi padehi
analyzed: sabhāvataḥ vijjamānā ati yena bahukāra ādi sabhāvena desitā tena sabhāvena paramatthato  upalabbhamānā yāthāvā ati aviparītā na tathā na honti iti  avitatha ttā tathā ava honti tatas eva vutta ppakārataḥ aññathā na honti iti pañcahi pi padehi
translated: “Exist in the ultimate sense”: exist in the ultimate sense by way of the function of being of assistance, etc., in the way in which they are taught.🔽“As they really are”: without distortion. “In that same way”: in that way. “They are not otherwise”: because they are not distorted, they are just as they are. Because of this, they are not otherwise than the way they are described.

original: tesaṃ dhammānaṃ yathābhūtameva vadati. Sammāti ñāyena. Yaṃ pana ñātaṃ, taṃ hetuyuttaṃ
analyzed: tesam dhammānam yathābhūtam eva vadati sammā ati ñāyena yam pana ñātam tam hetu yuttam
translated: By means of these five terms he describes those dhammas as they really are.

original: kāraṇayuttameva hotīti āha “hetunā kāraṇenā”ti. Okappanaṃ janesīti jinavacanabhāvena
analyzed: kāraṇa yuttam eva hoti iti āha hetunā kāraṇena ati okappanam janesi iti jinavacana bhāvena
translated: “With reason”: by means of the method. But what is known is connected with a reason, connected with a cause. Therefore he says, “with a reason, with a cause.”

original: abhippasādaṃ uppādesi.
analyzed: abhippasādam uppādesi
translated: “He generated confidence”: he aroused confidence in the words of the Victor.

original: Ekadhammavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: eka dhamma vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the one dhamma is finished.

original: Dvedhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dve dhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the two dhammas

original: 352. (Ka) “sabbatthā” ti idaṃ “sīlapūraṇādīsū”ti etena saddhiṃ sambandhitabbaṃ. “Sīlapūraṇādīsu
analyzed: ka sabbattha ti idam sīla pūraṇa ādīsu iti etena saddhim sambandhitabbam sīla pūraṇa ādīsu
translated: “Everywhere”: this should be connected with “in the Suttas on the fulfillment of virtue, etc.” “In the Suttas on the fulfillment of virtue, etc.”

original: sabbattha appamādo viya upakārakā”ti etena satisampajaññānampi appamādassa viya sabbattha🔽upakārakatā pakāsitā hoti atthato nātivilakkhaṇattā tato tesaṃ. Satiavippavāso hi
analyzed: sabbattha appamādaḥ viya upakārakā ati etena sati sampajaññānam pi appamādassa viya sabbattha  upakāraka tā pakāsitā hoti atthataḥ na ati vilakkhaṇa ttā tatas tesam sati avippavāsaḥ hi
translated: And by this it is also shown that mindfulness and full awareness are helpful everywhere, like heedfulness, since they are not essentially different from it.🔽For heedfulness is non-lapse in mindfulness, and that is in fact mindfulness itself, which is never absent anywhere. And that should be understood as associated with knowledge,

original: appamādo, so ca atthato sabbattha avijahitā sati eva, sā ca kho ñāṇasampayuttā eva🔽daṭṭhabbā, itarāya tathārūpasamatthatābhāvato.
analyzed: appamādaḥ so ca atthataḥ sabbattha a vijahitā sati eva sā ca kho ñāṇa sampayuttā eva  daṭṭhabbāḥ itarāya tathārūpa samattha tā bhāvato
translated: since the other kind of mindfulness is not capable of doing that.

original: (Kha) tesaṃ pañcasatamattānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipattivasena desitattā pubbabhāgā kathitā.
analyzed: tesam pañca satamattānam bhikkhūnam pubbabhāga paṭipatti vasena desita ttā pubbabhāgā kathitā
translated: (Kha) They are called “foreparts” because they are taught as the bhikkhus’ practice in the earlier stage.

original: (Cha) ayonisomanasikāro saṃkilesassa mūlakāraṇabhāvena pavatto hetu, paribrūhanabhāvena🔽pavatto paccayo. Yonisomanasikārepi eseva nayo. Yathā ca sattānaṃ saṃkilesāya, visuddhiyā
analyzed: a yoniso manasikāro saṃkilesassa mūla kāraṇa bhāvena pavattaḥ hetu paribrūhana bhāvena  pavatto paccayaḥ yoniso manasikāre pi esā iva nayaḥ yathā ca sattānam saṃkilesāya visuddhiyā
translated: (Cha) Wrong mental attention is a cause in the sense of being the root-cause of defilement, and it is a condition in the sense of promoting it.🔽The same method applies to right mental attention. And just as wrong mental attention is a condition for the defilement and cleansing of beings,

original: ca paccayabhūtā ayonisomanasikāro, yonisomanasikāroti “ime dve dhammā duppaṭivijjhā”ti
analyzed: ca paccaya bhūtā a yonisomanasikāro yonisomanasikāro ti ime dve dhammā
translated: so too right mental attention is a condition for the cleansing of beings. “These two things are hard to penetrate: the defilement and cleansing of beings” .

original: ettha nīharitvā vuttā, evaṃ imehi dhammā nīharitvā vattabbāti dassento “tathā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ettha nīharitvā vuttāḥ evam imehi dhammāḥ nīharitvā vattabbā ati dassentaḥ tathā iti ādim āha
translated: “Herein, having extracted” means having taken out. “Thus these ideas should be stated having extracted” means showing that.

original: Tattha asubhajjhānādayo cattāro visaṃyogā nāma kāmayogādipaṭipakkhabhāvato. “Evaṃ🔽pabhedā”ti iminā “avijjābhāgino dhammā, vijjābhāgino dhammā, kaṇhā dhammā, sukkā
analyzed: tattha asubha jjhāna ādayo cattāro visaṃyogāḥ nāma kāmayoga ādi paṭipakkha bhāvataḥ evam  iminā avijjā bhāginaḥ dhammā vijjā bhāginaḥ dhammā kaṇhāḥ dhammā sukkā
translated: Herein, the four jhanas beginning with foulness are called “dissociations” because they are the opposites of the bond of sense desire, etc. “Thus

original: dhammā”ti evamādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: dhamma ati evamādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: classified” means that the inclusion of such ideas as “ideas partaking of ignorance” and “ideas partaking of clear vision” and “dark ideas” and “bright ideas” should be seen.

original: (Jha) paccayehi samecca sambhuyya katattā pañcakkhandhā saṅkhatā dhātu. Kenaci anabhisaṅkhatattā nibbānaṃ asaṅkhatā dhātu.
analyzed: paccayehi samecca sambhuyya kata ttā pañca kkhandhā saṅkhatā dhātu kenaci an abhisaṅkhata ttā nibbānam asaṅkhatā dhātu
translated: (Jha) The five categories are the “formed element” because they are produced by being brought together from conditions. Nibbāna is the “unformed element” because it is not formed by anything.

original: (Ña) tisso vijjā vijjanaṭṭhena, viditakaraṇaṭṭhena ca vijjā. Vimuttīti arahattaphalaṃ paṭipakkhato sabbaso vimuttattā.
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjāḥ vijjana ṭṭhena vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena ca vijjā vimutti iti arahatta phalam paṭipakkhato sabbasas vimutta ttā
translated: (Ña) The three kinds of clear vision are “clear vision” in the sense of seeing and in the sense of making known. “Deliverance” is the fruit of arahantship because it is completely delivered from its opposite.

original: Abhiññādīnīti abhiññāpaññādīni. Ekakasadisāneva purimavāre viya vibhajja kathetabbato.
analyzed: abhiñā ādīni iti abhiññā paññā ādīni ekaka sadisāni eva purima vāre viya vibhajja kathetabbato
translated: “Direct-knowledge, etc.”: direct-knowledge, understanding, etc., should be explained as in the previous section, since they are the same in each case.

original: Maggo kathitoti ettha “maggova kathito”ti evamatthaṃ aggahetvā “maggo kathitovā”ti🔽evamattho gahetabbo “anuppāde ñāṇa”nti iminā phalassa gahitattā. Sacchikātabbapade🔽phalaṃ kathitanti etthāpi “phalameva kathita”nti aggahetvā “phalaṃ kathitamevā”ti
analyzed: maggo kathito ti ettha maggo iva kathito ti evamattham aggahetvā maggo kathito uva ati  evamatthaḥ gahetabbaḥ anuppāde ñāṇam ti iminā phalassa gahita ttā sacchikātabba pade  phalam kathitanti ettha api phalam eva kathitanti aggahetvā phalam kathitam eva ati
translated: “The path is stated” : here the meaning should be taken as “the path is stated” and not as “only the path is stated” because the fruition is included by the words “knowledge of non-arising.”

original: attho gahetabbo vijjāggahaṇena tadaññassa saṅgahitattā. Esa nayo ito paresupi evarūpesu ṭhānesu.
analyzed: atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ vijjā ggahaṇena tad aññassa saṅgahita ttā esa nayaḥ itas paresu pi evarūpesu ṭhānesu
translated: “The fruition is stated” : here too the meaning should be taken as “the fruition is stated” and not as “only the fruition is stated” because the other is included by the word “clear vision.” The same method applies in the other instances of this kind.

original: Dvedhammavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dvedhamma vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on two dhammas is ended.

original: Tayodhammavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tayodhamma vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on three dhammas

original: 353. (Cha) soti anāgāmimaggo. Sabbaso kāmānaṃ nissaraṇaṃ samucchedavasena pajahanato.
analyzed: cha saḥ ti anāgāmi maggaḥ sabbaso kāmānam nissaraṇam samuccheda vasena pajahanato
translated: (six) is the non-return path. It is the escape from sensual pleasures by way of their complete abandonment.

original: Āruppe arahattamaggo nāma arūpajjhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppanno aggamaggo. Puna uppattinivāraṇatoti
analyzed: āruppe arahatta maggaḥ nāma arūpa jhānam pādakam katvā uppannaḥ aggamaggaḥ punar uppatti nivāraṇato ti
translated: The path of arahatship in the immaterial sphere is the highest path arisen by making the immaterial jhana its proximate cause. It is the prevention of rebirth.

original: rūpānaṃ uppattiyā sabbaso nivāraṇato. Nirujjhanti saṅkhārā etenāti nirodho, aggamaggo.
analyzed: rūpānam uppattiyāḥ sabbasas nivāraṇataḥ nirujjhanti saṅkhārāḥ etena ati nirodhaḥ aggamaggaḥ
translated: It is the cessation of formations because it prevents the arising of materiality completely.

original: Tena hi kilesavaṭṭe nirodhite itarampi vaṭṭadvayaṃ nirodhitameva hoti. Tassa pana🔽nirodhassa pariyosānattā aggaphalaṃ “nirodho”ti vattabbataṃ labbhatīti āha “arahattaphalaṃ
analyzed: tena hi kilesa vaṭṭe nirodhite itaram pi vaṭṭa dvayam nirodhitam eva hoti tassa pana  nirodhassa pariyosāna ttā agga phalam nirodho ti vattabba tam labbhati iti āha arahatta phalam
translated: So when the round of defilements is stopped, the other two rounds are stopped too.🔽But because it is the culmination of that stopping, the foremost fruit can be called “stopping.”🔽“The fruit of arahantship is intended by ‘stopping.’ ”

original: nirodhoti adhippeta”nti. “Arahattaphalena hi nibbāne diṭṭhe” ti idaṃ arahattamaggena🔽nibbānadassanassāyaṃ nibbattīti katvā vuttaṃ. Evañca katvā “arahattasaṅkhātanirodhassa
analyzed: nirodhaḥ ti adhippetanti arahatta phalena hi nibbāne diṭṭhe ti idam arahatta maggena  nibbāna dassanassa ayam nibbattī iti katvā vuttam evam ca katvā arahatta saṅkhāta nirodhassa
translated: For it is by the path of arahantship that the seeing of Nibbāna comes about.

original: paccayattā” ti idampi vacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti.
analyzed: paccaya ttā ti idam pi vacanam samatthitam hoti
translated: And so the statement “because it is the condition for the stopping called arahantship” is also established.

original: (Ja) atītaṃ sārammaṇanti atītakoṭṭhāsārammaṇaṃ ñāṇaṃ, atītā khandhāyatanadhātuyo
analyzed: atītam sa ārammaṇa ti atīta koṭṭhāsa ārammaṇam ñāṇam atītā
translated: “With past as its object”: knowledge with the past as its domain. The meaning is: knowledge that occurs with past aggregates, bases, and elements as its object.

original: ārabbha pavattanakañāṇanti attho. “Maggo kathitovā”ti avadhāraṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, tathā
analyzed: ārabbha pavattanaka ñāṇanti atthaḥ maggaḥ kathitaḥ uvā iti avadhāraṇam daṭṭhabbam tathā
translated: “The path is stated”: the word “only” should be construed here.

original: “sacchikātabbe phalaṃ kathitamevā”ti.
analyzed: sacchikātabbe phalam kathitam eva ati
translated: “The fruit is stated in the seeing of what is to be realized.”

original: (Ña) āsavānaṃ khaye ñāṇanti ca āsavānaṃ khayante ñāṇanti adhippāyo, aññathā maggo kathito siyā.
analyzed: āsavānam khaye ca āsavānam khaya ante adhippāyaḥ aññathā maggaḥ kathitaḥ siyā
translated: “Knowledge of the destruction of the taints”: the intention is: knowledge of the destruction of the taints. Otherwise the path would be stated.

original: Tayodhammavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tayodhamma vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the three ideas is ended.

original: Catudhammavaṇṇanā🔽354. (Ka) dārumayaṃ cakkaṃ dārucakkaṃ, tathā ratanacakkaṃ. Āṇaṭṭhena dhammo eva dhammacakkaṃ. Iriyāpathānaṃ aparāparappavattito iriyāpathacakkaṃ, tathā sampatticakkaṃ veditabbaṃ.🔽Anucchavike deseti puññakiriyāya, sammāpaṭipattiyā anurūpadese. Sevanaṃ kālena kālaṃ🔽upasaṅkamanaṃ. Bhajanaṃ bhattivasena payirupāsanaṃ. Attano sammā ṭhapananti attano🔽cittasantānassa yoniso ṭhapanaṃ saddhādīsu nivesananti āha “sace”tiādi. Idamevettha

original: attānaṃ sammā ṭhapeti akatapuññassa tadabhāvato. Paṭhamo lokiyova, tatthāpi kāmāvacarova.
analyzed: attānam sammā ṭhapeti a kata puññassa tad abhāvato paṭhamaḥ lokiyaḥ uva tattha api kāmāvacaraḥ uva
translated: The first is only mundane, and here too it is of the sense sphere.

original: Idhāti imasmiṃ dasuttarasutte. Pubbabhāge lokiyāvāti maggassa pubbabhāge pavattanakā
analyzed: idha āti imasmin dasuttara sutte pubbabhāge lokiyā avāti maggassa pubbabhāge pavattanakā
translated: Herein, in this sutta with its ten sections,🔽in the earlier part it is only mundane,

original: lokiyā eva. Tattha kāraṇaṃ vuttameva.
analyzed: lokiyāḥ eva tattha kāraṇam vuttam eva
translated: and the reason for that is given.

original: (Ca) kāmayogavisaṃyogo anāgāmimaggo, diṭṭhiyogavisaṃyogo sotāpattimaggo, itare dve arahattamaggoti evaṃ anāgāmimaggādivasena veditabbā.
analyzed: ca kāma yoga visaṃyogaḥ anāgāmi maggaḥ diṭṭhi yoga visaṃyogo sotāpatti maggo itare dve arahatta maggo ti evam anāgāmi magga ādi vasena veditabbā
translated: (C) The dissociation of the first from the lust-associated is the non-return path, the dissociation of the first from the false-view associated is the stream-entry path, and the other two are the Arahant path. So they should be understood as the non-return path, etc.,

original: (Cha) paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhinti yvāyaṃ appaguṇassa paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhī,🔽taṃ. Kāmasahagatā saññāmanasikārā samudācarantīti tato vuṭṭhitaṃ ārammaṇavasena kāmasahagatā
analyzed: paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhinti yvā ayam appaguṇassa paṭhamassa jhānassa lābhī  tam kāma sahagatā saññā manasikārā samudācaranti iti tatas vuṭṭhitam ārammaṇa vasena kāma sahagatā
translated: (D) The first-jhāna-attainer is one who has attained the first jhāna of little grade.🔽Lust-born perception and attention occur in him: when he has emerged from it, lust-born perception and attention occur in him by making that jhāna the object and they assail him and oppress him.

original: hutvā saññāmanasikārā samudācaranti codenti tudenti. Tassa kāmānupakkhandānaṃ saññāmanasikārānaṃ
analyzed: hutvā saññā manasikārā samudācaranti codenti tudenti tassa kāma an upakkhandānam saññā manasikārānam
translated: Because of his inability to endure the occurrence of lust-born perception and attention,

original: vasena so paṭhamajjhānasamādhi hāyati parihāyati, tasmā “hānabhāgiyo samādhī”ti vutto.
analyzed: vasena so paṭhamajjhāna samādhi hāyati parihāyati tasmā hāna bhāgiyaḥ samādhi iti vutto
translated: It is said to be “subject to diminution” because the concentration of the first jhāna is diminished, is diminished in, by that equanimity.

original: Tadanudhammatāti tadanurūpasabhāvo. “Sati santiṭṭhatī”ti idaṃ micchāsatiṃ sandhāya
analyzed: tadanu dhammatā ati tadanurūpa sabhāvaḥ sati santiṭṭhati iti idam micchāsatim sandhāya
translated: “In conformity with that”: in conformity with that equanimity. “Mindfulness is established” is said with reference to wrong mindfulness.

original: vuttaṃ. Yassa hi paṭhamajjhānānurūpasabhāvā paṭhamajjhānaṃ santato paṇītato disvā
analyzed: vuttam yassa hi paṭhamajjhāna anurūpa sabhāvā paṭhamajjhānam santataḥ paṇītataḥ disvā
translated: For when one, after seeing the first jhāna as peaceful and sublime,

original: assādayamānā apekkhamānā abhinandamānā nikanti hoti, tassa nikantivasena so paṭhamajjhānasamādhi
analyzed: assādayamānā apekkhamānā abhinandamānā nikanti hoti tassa nikanti vasena so paṭhama jhāna samādhi
translated: has affection for it, expectation of it, and choice of it, delighting in it, then the concentration of the first jhāna

original: neva hāyati, na vaḍḍhati, ṭhitikoṭṭhāsiko hoti, tena vuttaṃ “ṭhitibhāgiyo samādhī”ti.🔽Avitakkasahagatāti avitakkaṃ dutiyajjhānaṃ santato paṇītato manasi karoto ārammaṇavasena
analyzed: na iva hāyati na vaḍḍhati ṭhiti koṭṭhāsikaḥ hoti tena vuttam ṭhiti bhāgiyaḥ samādhi iti  avitakka sahagatā ati avitakkam dutiya jhānam santataḥ paṇītataḥ manasi karoto ārammaṇa vasena
translated: neither diminishes nor increases in him but remains at the same level. Hence it is said, “Concentration is subject to stagnation.”🔽“With thought connected therewith”: when he brings to mind the second jhāna, which is free from thought, as peaceful and sublime, then perception and attention

original: avitakkasahagatā saññāmanasikārā. Samudācarantīti paguṇapaṭhamajjhānato vuṭṭhitaṃ
analyzed: avitakka sahagatā saññā manasikārā samudācaranti iti paguṇa paṭhama jhānataḥ vuṭṭhitam
translated: connected with thought occur in him. “Are active” means that, emerging from the now familiar first jhāna,

original: dutiyajjhānādhigamatthāya codenti tudenti, tassa upari dutiyajjhānupakkhandānaṃ saññāmanasikārānaṃ
analyzed: dutiya jhāna adhigama atthāya codenti tudenti tassa upari dutiya jhāna upakkhandānam saññā manasikārānam
translated: They urge and press him to attain the second jhāna.

original: vasena so paṭhamajjhānasamādhi visesabhūtassa dutiyajjhānassa uppattipadaṭṭhānatāya🔽“visesabhāgiyo samādhī”ti vutto. Nibbidāsahagatāti tameva paṭhamajjhānalābhiṃ jhānato🔽vuṭṭhitaṃ nibbidāsaṅkhātena vipassanāñāṇena sahagatā. Vipassanāñāṇañhi jhānaṅgesu
analyzed: vasena so paṭhama jhāna samādhi visesa bhūtassa dutiya jhānassa uppatti padaṭṭhāna tāya  visesa bhāgiyaḥ samādhi iti vutto nibbidā sahagatā ati tam eva paṭhamajjhāna lābhim jhānataḥ  vuṭṭhitam nibbidā saṅkhātena vipassanā ñāṇena sahagatā vipassanā ñāṇam hi jhāna aṅgesu
translated: The first-jhāna concentration is called “leading to the specific attainment” because it is the proximate cause for the arising of the second jhāna, which is a specific attainment superior to the first jhāna.🔽“Associated with dispassion”: associated with the knowledge of insight called “dispassion,” which arises in one who has attained the first jhāna and emerged from it.

original: pabhedena upaṭṭhahantesu nibbindati ukkaṇṭhati, tasmā “nibbidā”ti vuccati. Samudācarantīti🔽nibbānasacchikaraṇatthāya codenti tudenti. Virāgūpasañhitoti virāgasaṅkhātena nibbānena🔽upasañhito. Vipassanāñāṇañhi “sakkā iminā maggena virāgaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikātu”nti
analyzed: pabhedena upaṭṭhahantesu nibbindati ukkaṇṭhati tasmā nibbidā ati vuccati samudācaranti iti  nibbāna sacchikaraṇa tthāya codenti tudenti virāgu upasañhito ti virāga saṅkhātena nibbānena  upasañhitaḥ vipassanā ñāṇam hi sakkā iminā maggena virāgam nibbānam sacchikātun ti
translated: For when the jhāna factors appear in succession in the knowledge of insight, one becomes dispassionate towards the jhāna, one turns away from it, thus it is called “dispassion.”🔽They urge and press him to enter upon the practice of insight for the realization of Nibbāna.🔽“Coupled with fading away”: coupled with the fading away of lust called “fading away” .

original: pavattito “virāgūpasañhita”nti vuccati, taṃsampayuttā saññāmanasikārāpi virāgūpasañhitā
analyzed: pavattitaḥ virāga upasañhitanti vuccati tad sampayuttā saññā manasikārā api virāga upasañhitā
translated: For the knowledge of insight is called “coupled with fading away” because it occurs thus: “By this path Nibbāna, the fading away of lust, can be realized.” The associated perception and attention are also called “coupled with fading away.”

original: eva nāma. Tassa tesaṃ saññāmanasikārānaṃ vasena so paṭhamajjhānasamādhi ariyamaggapaṭivedhassa
analyzed: eva nāma tassa tesam saññā manasikārānam vasena so paṭhama jhāna samādhi ariya magga paṭivedhassa
translated: “Just” means: by means of the attention given to these perceptions, that concentration of the first jhana is called “concentration partaking of penetration” because it is the footing for the penetration of the noble path.

original: padaṭṭhānatāya “nibbedhabhāgiyo samādhī”ti vutto. Sabbasamāpattiyoti dutiyajjhānādikā
analyzed: padaṭṭhāna tāya nibbedha bhāgiyo samādhi iti vutto sabba samāpattiyaḥ ti dutiya jhāna ādikā
translated: “All attainments” : all the jhanas beginning with the second.

original: sabbā samāpattiyo. Attho veditabboti hānabhāgiyādiattho tāva vitthāretvā veditabbo.
analyzed: sabbā samāpattiyo attho veditabbo ti hānabhāgiya ādi attho tāva vitthāretvā veditabbo
translated: “The meaning should be understood” : the meaning of the “partaking of diminution” and the rest should be understood in detail.

original: Maggo kathito catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ uddhaṭattā. Phalaṃ kathitaṃ sarūpeneva.
analyzed: maggo kathito catunnam ariya saccānam phalam kathitam sarūpena iva
translated: The path has been taught because the four noble truths have been revealed. The fruition has been taught in its own nature.

original: Catudhammavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catudhamma vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the four ideas is ended.

original: Pañcadhammavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the five ideas

original: 355. (Kha) “pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhī”ti samādhiaṅgabhāvena paññā uddiṭṭhāti pītipharaṇatādivacanena🔽hi tameva vibhajati. Tenāha “pītiṃ pharamānā uppajjatī”tiādi.“So imameva kāyaṃ vivekajena
analyzed: pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhi iti samādhi aṅga bhāvena paññā uddiṭṭhā ti pīti pharaṇa tā ādi vacanena  hi tam eva vibhajati tena āha pītim imam eva kāyam viveka jena
translated: (Kha) “Right concentration with five factors” : understanding is stated as a factor of concentration.

original: pītisukhena abhisandetī”tiādinā nayena pītiyā, sukhassa ca pharaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Sarāgavirāgatādivibhāgadassanavasena
analyzed: pīti sukhena abhisandeti iti ādinā nayena pītiyā sukhassa ca pharaṇam veditabbam sa rāga virāga tā ādi vibhāga dassana vasena
translated: The “spreading of happiness” and so on is the analysis of that. Therefore he says “arises spreading happiness” and so on. “He pervades this very body with the happiness and joy born of seclusion” and so on. In this way the spreading of happiness and joy should be understood.🔽The “analysis of the state with passion, etc.” is the analysis of the state of concentration with passion, without hate, etc.

original: paresaṃ ceto pharamānā. Ālokapharaṇeti kasiṇālokassa pharaṇe sati teneva ālokena
analyzed: paresam cetaḥ āloka pharaṇā iti kasiṇa ālokassa pharaṇe sati tena iva ālokena
translated: and the penetration of the minds of others. The penetration of light is the light of the kasiṇa that has been penetrated.

original: pharitappadese. Tassa samādhissa rūpadassanapaccayattā paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ paccavekkhaṇanimittaṃ.🔽Pītipharaṇatā sukhapharaṇatāti ārammaṇe ṭhatvā catutthajjhānassa uppādanato tā “pādā
analyzed: pharita ppadese tassa samādhissa rūpa dassana paccaya ttā paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam paccavekkhaṇa nimittam  pīti pharaṇa tā sukha pharaṇa tā ti ārammaṇe ṭhatvā catuttha jhānassa uppādanato tā pādā
translated: When that has been penetrated, the place is pervaded by the light. The reviewing knowledge is the reviewing sign because it is a condition for the seeing of materiality in that concentration.

original: viyā”ti vuttā. Cetopharaṇatā ālokapharaṇatāti taṃtaṃkiccasādhanato tā “hatthā viyā”ti
analyzed: viyā ti vuttā cetaḥ pharaṇa tā āloka pharaṇa tā ati taṃ taṃ kicca sādhanato tāḥ hatthāḥ viyā ti
translated: The pervasion by happiness and the pervasion by bliss are called “the feet” because they are the cause of the arising of the fourth jhāna by standing on the object. The penetration of the mind and the penetration of light are called “the hands” because they accomplish the several tasks.

original: vuttā. Abhiññāpādakajjhānaṃ samādhānassa sarīrabhāvato “majjhimakāyo viyā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttā abhiññā pādaka jjhānam samādhānassa sarīra bhāvataḥ majjhimakāyaḥ viya iti vuttam
translated: The basic jhāna for direct knowledge is called “the middle body” because it is the body of the concentration.

original: Paccavekkhaṇanimittaṃ uttamaṅgabhāvato “sīsaṃ viyā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇa nimittam uttamaṅga bhāvataḥ sīsam viya iti vuttam
translated: The reviewing sign is called “the head” because it is the chief part.

original: (Ja) sabbaso kilesadukkhadarathapariḷāhānaṃ vigatattā lokiyasamādhissa sātisayamettha
analyzed: sabbaso kilesa dukkha daratha pariḷāhānam vigata ttā lokiya samādhissa
translated: Because of the absence of all defilements, suffering, weariness, and fever, it is said that “there is more happiness here than in any other mundane concentration.”

original: sukhanti vuttaṃ “appitappitakkhaṇe sukhattā paccuppannasukho”ti. Purimassa purimassa
analyzed: sukhanti vuttam appita ppita khaṇe sukhattā paccuppanna sukho ti purimassa purimassa
translated: Because of the happiness that arises at each stage, it is said that “it is happiness here and now.”

original: vasena pacchimaṃ pacchimaṃ laddhāsevanatāya santatarapaṇītatarabhāvappatti hotīti🔽āha “purimo purimo…pe… sukhavipāko”ti.🔽Kilesapaṭippassaddhiyāti kilesānaṃ paṭippassambhanena laddhattā. Kilesapaṭippassaddhibhāvanti🔽kilesānaṃ paṭippassambhanabhāvaṃ. Laddhattā pattattā tabbhāvaṃ upagatattā. Lokiyasamādhissa🔽paccanīkāni nīvaraṇapaṭhamajjhānanikantiādīni niggahetabbāni, aññe kilesā vāretabbā,
