translated: they spread it out.

original: Maggo kathito sarūpeneva.
analyzed: maggo kathito sarūpena iva
translated: The path is stated in its own nature.

original: Navadhammavaṇṇanā🔽359. (Kha) visuddhinti ñāṇadassanavisuddhiṃ, accantavisuddhimeva vā. Catupārisuddhisīlanti
analyzed: visuddhim ti ñāṇa dassana visuddhim accanta visuddhim eva vā catu pārisuddhi sīlam
translated: The explanation of the nine dhammas.

original: pātimokkhasaṃvarādinirupakkiliṭṭhatāya catubbidhaparisuddhivantaṃ sīlaṃ. Pārisuddhipadhāniyaṅganti
analyzed: catubbidha parisuddhivantam sīlam
translated: (Kha) Purification: purification of knowledge and vision, or absolute purification. Virtue of the fourfold purity: virtue possessing the fourfold purity because it is not defiled by transgression of the Pātimokkha, etc.

original: puggalassa parisuddhiyā padhānabhūtaṃ aṅgaṃ. Tenāha “parisuddhabhāvassa padhānaṅga”nti.
analyzed: puggalassa parisuddhiyā padhāna bhūtam aṅgam tena āha parisuddha bhāvassa padhāna aṅgam ti
translated: Factor of purification: a factor that is the basis for purification in a person. Hence he said: “A factor that is the basis for the state of purification.”

original: Samathassa visuddhibhāvo vodānaṃ paguṇabhāvena paricchinnanti āha “aṭṭha paguṇasamāpattiyo”ti.
analyzed: samathassa visuddhi bhāvaḥ vodānam paguṇa bhāvena paricchinnanti āha aṭṭha paguṇa samāpattiyo ti
translated: The state of purification of serenity is the clearing, the delimitation by mastery. Hence he said: “The eight deliverances.”

original: Vigatupakkilesañhi “paguṇa”nti vattabbataṃ labbhati, na saupakkilesaṃ hānabhāgiyādibhāvappattito.
analyzed: vigata upakkilesam hi paguṇanti vattabba tam labbhati na saupakkilesam hāna bhāgiya ādi bhāva ppattitaḥ
translated: For that which is free from defilement can be called “mastery,” not that which is accompanied by defilement, since it is subject to decline.

original: Sattadiṭṭhimalavisuddhito nāmarūpaparicchedo diṭṭhivisuddhi. Paccayapariggaho addhattayakaṅkhāmalavidhamanato
analyzed: satta diṭṭhi mala visuddhitaḥ nāma rūpa paricchedaḥ diṭṭhi visuddhi paccaya pariggahaḥ addha ttaya kaṅkhā mala vidhamanato
translated: The chapter on mentality-materiality is Purification by Overcoming Doubt because it purifies by overcoming the stain of the seven kinds of false view.🔽The investigation of conditions is Purification by Crossing Over Uncertainty because it pusifies by dispersing the stain of uncertainty about the two and a half aggregates.

original: kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi. Yasmā nāmarūpaṃ nāma sappaccayameva, tasmā taṃ pariggaṇhantena
analyzed: yasmai nāma rūpam nāma sa paccayam eva tasmai tam pariggaṇhantena
translated: Since mentality-materiality has conditions,🔽therefore when it is investigated,🔽in fact its having conditions is investigated too.

original: atthato tassa sappaccayatāpi pariggahitā eva hotīti vuttaṃ “diṭṭhivisuddhīti sappaccayaṃ
analyzed: atthataḥ tassa sappaccaya tā api pariggahitā eva hoti iti vuttam diṭṭhi visuddhī iti sappaccayam
translated: That is why it is said, “Purification by overcoming doubt is seeing mentality-materiality with its conditions” .🔽But when the conditions for mentality-materiality are investigated,

original: nāmarūpadassana”nti. Yasmā pana nāmarūpassa paccayaṃ pariggaṇhantena tīsu addhāsu🔽kaṅkhāmalavitaraṇapaccayākārāvabodhavaseneva hoti, tasmā “paccayākārañāṇa”ntiādi
analyzed: nāma rūpa dassanam ti yasmā pana nāma rūpassa paccayam pariggaṇhantena tīsu addhāsu  kaṅkhā mala vitaraṇa paccaya ākāra avabodha vasena iva hoti tasmā paccaya ākāra ñāṇa ntiādi
translated: uncertainty about the three periods of time is crossed over by the discovery of the way in which conditions occur.🔽That is why it is said, “Knowledge of the way in which conditions occur” ,🔽and so on, and why Purification by Crossing Over Uncertainty is called “Knowledge of the way things are” .

original: vuttaṃ yathā kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi “dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇa”nti vuccati. Maggāmagge ñāṇanti🔽maggāmagge vavatthapetvā ṭhitañāṇaṃ. Ñāṇanti idha taruṇavipassanā kathitā tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yathā dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇan ti vuccati magga amagge ñāṇan ti 🔽magga amagge vavatthapetvā ṭhita ñāṇam ñāṇam ti idha taruṇa vipassanā kathitā tesam bhikkhūnam
translated: Knowledge of the way and the way out is knowledge that occurs by defining the way and the way out.🔽Herein, knowledge is said to be tender insight in those bhikkhus.

original: ajjhāsayavasena “ñāṇadassanavisuddhī”ti vuṭṭhānagāminiyā vipassanāya vuccamānattā.
analyzed: ajjhāsaya vasena ñāṇa dassana visuddhī iti vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā vipassanāya vuccamāna ttā
translated: and it is called “purification by knowledge and vision” in the sense of the inclination of the mind to that insight leading to emergence.

original: Yadi “ñāṇadassanavisuddhī”ti vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā adhippetā, “paññā”ti ca arahattaphalapaññā,
analyzed: yadi ñāṇa dassana visuddhī iti vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā adhippetā paññā ati ca arahatta phala paññā
translated: If “purification by knowledge and vision” is intended as insight leading to emergence and “understanding” as the understanding of the fruit of arahantship,

original: maggo pana kathanti? Maggo bahukārapade virāgaggahaṇena gahito. Vakkhati hi “idha
analyzed: maggo pana kathanti maggaḥ bahu kāra pade virāga ggahaṇena gahito vakkhati hi idha
translated: how is the path included? It is included by the word “dispassion” as a term that has many meanings. For it is said:

original: bahukārapade maggo kathito”ti.
analyzed: bahukāra pade maggo kathito ti
translated: “Here the path is stated by the word ‘dispassion’ as a term that has many meanings.”

original: (Cha) cakkhādidhātunānattanti cakkhādirūpādicakkhuviññāṇādidhātūnaṃ vemattataṃ nissāya.
analyzed: cha cakkha ādi dhātu nānattanti cakkha ādi rūpa ādi cakkhu viññāṇa ādi dhātūnam vemattatam nissāya
translated: (6) Diversity of elements: diversity of the eye element, etc., and of the visible-data element, etc., and of the eye-consciousness element, etc.

original: Cakkhusamphassādinānattanti cakkhusamphassasotasamphassaghānasamphassādisamphassavibhāgaṃ.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa ādi nānattanti cakkhu samphassa sota samphassa ghāna samphassa ādi samphassa vibhāgam
translated: Diversity of contact: the distinction of eye-contact, ear-contact, nose-contact, etc.

original: Saññānānattanti ettha rūpasaññādisaññānānattampi labbhateva, taṃ pana kāmasaññādiggahaṇeneva
analyzed: saññā nānattanti ettha rūpa saññā ādi saññā nānattam pi labbhate iva tam pana kāma saññā ādi gahaṇena iva
translated: Diversity of perception: here the diversity of perception of visible objects, etc., is also applicable, but that is included by the word “perception of sensuality,” etc.

original: gayhati. Kāmasaññādīti ādi-saddena byāpādasaññādīnaṃ gahaṇaṃ. Saññānidānattā papañcasaṅkhānaṃ
analyzed: kāma saññā ādi iti ādi saddena byāpāda saññā ādīnam gahaṇam saññā nidāna ttā papañca saṅkhānam
translated: The word “etc.” in “perception of sensuality, etc.” includes perception of ill will and of cruelty. Because of the diversity of perceptions there is diversity of craving.

original: “saññānānattaṃ paṭicca saṅkappanānatta”nti vuttaṃ, “yaṃ saṅkappeti, taṃ papañcetī”ti
analyzed: saññā nānattam paṭicca saṅkappa nānattam ti vuttam yam saṅkappeti tam papañceti iti
translated: “The variety of perceptions is due to the variety of determinations” is said. “What one determines, that one proliferates” is said.

original: vacanato “saṅkappanānattaṃ paṭicca chandanānatta”nti vuttaṃ. Chandanānattanti ca🔽taṇhāchandassa nānattaṃ. Rūpapariḷāhoti rūpavisayo rūpābhipatthanāvasena pavatto
analyzed: vacanato saṅkappa nānattam paṭicca chanda nānattam nti vuttam chanda nānattam nti ca  taṇhā chandassa nānattam rūpa pariḷāhaḥ ti rūpa visayaḥ rūpa abhipatthanā vasena pavatto
translated: “The variety of desires is due to the variety of determinations” is said. The variety of desires is the variety of desires for sensual pleasures.

original: kilesapariḷāho. Saddapariḷāhoti etthāpi eseva nayo. Kileso hi uppajjamāno appattepi🔽ārammaṇe patto viya pariḷāhova uppajjati. Tathābhūtassa pana kilesachandassa vasena
analyzed: kilesa pariḷāho sadda pariḷāho ti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ kilesaḥ hi uppajjamānaḥ appatte pi  ārammaṇe pattaḥ viya pariḷāhaḥ uva uppajjati tathābhūtassa pana kilesa chandassa vasena
translated: The passion for material form is the defilement-passion that arises in the mode of desire for material form, in the mode of longing for material form. The passion for sound, etc., should be understood in the same way. For when a defilement arises, it arises as if it had already attained its object,

original: rūpādipariyesanā hotīti āha “pariḷāhanānattatāya rūpapariyesanādinānattaṃ uppajjatī”ti.🔽Tathā pariyesantassa sace taṃ rūpādi labbheyya, taṃ sandhāyāha “pariyesanādinānattatāya
analyzed: rūpa ādi pariyesanā hoti iti āha pariḷāha nānatta tāya rūpa pariyesana ādi nānattam uppajjati iti  tathā pariyesantassa sace tam rūpa ādi labbheyya tam sandhāya āha pariyesana ādi nānatta tāya
translated: and the search for material form, etc., is due to the passion for defilements that has arisen in such a way. Therefore it is said: “The variety of searches for material form, etc., arises due to the variety of passions for material form, etc.”

original: rūpapaṭilābhādinānattaṃ uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: rūpa paṭilābha ādi nānattam uppajjati iti
translated: If, while searching in this way, one finds that material form, etc., “The variety of acquisitions of material form, etc., arises due to the variety of searches for material form, etc.” is said with reference to that.

original: (Ja) maraṇānupassanāñāṇeti maraṇassa anupassanāvasena pavattañāṇe, maraṇānussatisahagatapaññāyāti
analyzed: maraṇa anupassanā ñāṇe ti maraṇassa anupassanā vasena pavatta ñāṇe maraṇa anussati sahagata paññāya ati
translated: Knowledge of contemplation of death: knowledge occurring as contemplation of death; understanding consisting in reflection on death is the meaning.

original: attho. Āhāraṃ pariggaṇhantassāti gamanādivasena āhāraṃ paṭikkūlato pariggaṇhantassa.
analyzed: atthaḥ āhāram pariggaṇhantassa ati gamana ādi vasena āhāram paṭikkūlato pariggaṇhantassa
translated: As he discerns the nutriment: as he discerns the nutriment by way of the repulsiveness of going forth, and so on.

original: Ukkaṇṭhantassāti nibbindantassa katthacipi asajjantassa.
analyzed: ukkaṇṭhantassa ati nibbindantassa katthacipi a sajjantassa
translated: As he becomes dispassionate: as he becomes dispassionate, as he does not cling anywhere.

original: Dasadhammavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the ten ideas is ended.🔽Causes of wearing away: causes of abandoning.

original: 360. (Jha) nijjarakāraṇānīti pajahanakāraṇāni. Imasmiṃ abhiññāpade maggo kathīyatīti🔽katvā “ayaṃ heṭṭhā..pe… puna gahitā”ti vuttaṃ. Tathā hi vakkhati “idha abhiññāpade
analyzed: nijjara kāraṇāni iti pajahana kāraṇāni imasmin abhiññā pade maggo kathīyati iti  katvā ayam heṭṭhāpe puna gahitā iti vuttam tathā hi vakkhati idha abhiññā pade
translated: The path is being taught in this section on direct-knowledge,🔽so it is said, “This is the one that was taken up again below, etc.”🔽For he says, “The path is taught in this section on direct-knowledge.

original: maggo kathito” kiñcāpi nijjiṇṇā micchādiṭṭhīti ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Yathā micchādiṭṭhi
analyzed: maggo kathito kiñcā api nijjiṇṇā micchādiṭṭhī ti ānetvā sambandhitabbam yathā micchādiṭṭhi
translated: And although wrong view has been worn away, etc., it should be construed as follows:🔽Although wrong view has been worn away by insight, it has not been eradicated.

original: vipassanāya nijjiṇṇāpi na samucchinnāti samucchedappahānadassanatthaṃ puna gahitā,
analyzed: vipassanāya nijjiṇṇā api na samucchinnā ati samuccheda ppahāna dassana ttham puna gahitā
translated: In order to show the abandoning by eradication, it is taken up again.

original: evaṃ micchāsaṅkappādayopi vipassanāya pahīnāpi asamucchinnatāya idha puna gahitāti
analyzed: evam micchāsaṅkappa ādayaḥ api vipassanāya pahīnā api asamucchinna tāya idha puna gahitā ati
translated: And so too wrong thoughts, etc., have been abandoned by insight, but they have not been eradicated. Therefore they are taken up again here.

original: ayamattho “micchāsaṅkappo”tiādīsu sabbapadesu vattabboti dasseti “evaṃ sabbapadesu🔽nayo netabbo”ti iminā.
analyzed: ayam attho micchā saṅkappa uti ādīsu sabba padesu vattabbaḥ ti dasseti evam sabba padesu  nayaḥ netabbā iti iminā
translated: This is shown by the words “The method should be understood in this way in all the passages” .

original: Ettha cāti “sammāvimuttipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti🔽etasmiṃ pāḷipade. Ettha ca samucchedavasena, paṭippassaddhivasena ca paṭipakkhadhammā🔽sammadeva vimuccanaṃ sammāvimutti, tappaccayā ca maggaphalesu aṭṭha indriyāni bhāvanāpāripūriṃ
analyzed: ettha ca ati sammāvimutti paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti iti  etasmim pāḷi pade ettha ca samuccheda vasena paṭippassaddhi vasena ca paṭipakkha dhammā  sammat eva vimuccanam sammāvimutti tad paccayā ca magga phalesu aṭṭha indriyāni bhāvanā pāripūrim
translated: “And here” : in the passage “And many profitable things reach complete development with right liberation as condition” .🔽And here the profitable things that reach complete development are the eight faculties in the path and fruition. For the path and fruition are called “right liberation” because of the complete liberation from opposing states by cutting them off and by suppressing them.

original: upagacchantīti maggasampayuttānipi saddhādīni indriyāni uddhaṭāni. Maggavasena hi
analyzed: upagacchanti iti magga sampayuttāni api saddhā ādīni indriyāni uddhaṭāni magga vasena hi
translated: And the faculties of faith, etc., associated with the path are also mentioned, for the development of the faculties of faith, etc., reaches complete development in the fruitions by means of the path.

original: phalesu bhāvanā pāripūrī nāmāti. Abhinandanaṭṭhenāti ativiya sinehanaṭṭhenidañhi.
analyzed: phalesu bhāvanā pāripūrī nāma ati abhinandana ṭhena ati
translated: For the development of the faculties of faith, etc., in the fruitions is called “complete development” by means of the path.

original: Somanassindriyaṃ ukkaṃsagatasātasabhāvaṃ sampayuttadhamme sinehantaṃ tementaṃ viya
analyzed: so manassindriyam ukkaṃsa gata sātasa bhāvam sampayutta dhamme sinehantam tementam viya
translated: By the meaning of delighting: by the meaning of extreme affection. For this faculty of joy, which has the nature of exalted satisfaction, delights in and loves the associated states as if it were embracing them.

original: pavattati. Pavattasantatiādhipateyyaṭṭhenāti vipākasantānassa jīvane adhipatibhāvena.
analyzed: pavattati pavatta santati ādhipateyya ṭṭhena ati vipāka santānassa jīvane adhipati bhāvena
translated: and it is the condition for the arising of the resultant aggregates.

original: “Eva”ntiādi vuttasseva atthassa nigamanaṃ.
analyzed: eva ntiādi vuttassa iva atthassa nigamanam
translated: “Thus” is a conclusion to the meaning already stated.

original: Addhena saha chaṭṭhāni pañhasatāni, paññāsādhikāni saha pañhasatānīti attho.
analyzed: addhena saha chaṭṭhāni pañha satāni paññāsa adhikāni saha pañha satāni iti attho
translated: The six hundred and fifty questions, together with the fifty, are the six hundred and fifty questions.

original: Ettha ca āyasmā dhammasenāpati “dasasu nāthakaraṇadhammesu patiṭṭhāya dasakasiṇāyatanāni
analyzed: ettha ca āyasmā dhammasenāpati dasasu nātha karaṇa dhammesu patiṭṭhāya dasa kasiṇa āyatanāni
translated: And here the venerable Dhamma-sena, having established himself in the ten dhammas that make for self-protection,🔽developing the ten kasiṇa-spheres,

original: bhāvento dasaāyatanamukhena pariññaṃ paṭṭhapetvā pariññeyyadhamme parijānanto dasamicchatte,
analyzed: bhāventaḥ dasa āyatana mukhena pariññam paṭṭhapetvā pariññeyya dhamme parijānantaḥ dasam icchatte
translated: having begun the full understanding of the dhammas that should be fully understood by the ten doors of full understanding, fully understanding the dhammas that should be fully understood,🔽having abandoned the ten kinds of craving,

original: dasaakusalakammapathe ca pahāya dasakusalakammapathesu ca avaṭṭhito dasasu ariyāvāsesu
analyzed: dasa akusala kamma pathe ca pahāya dasa kusala kamma pathesu ca avaṭṭhitaḥ dasasu ariya āvāsesu
translated: and having stood firm in the ten kinds of profitable action,🔽desiring to dwell in the ten noble abodes,🔽having aroused the ten perceptions, having penetrated the ten grounds for decay,

original: āvasitukāmo dasasaññā uppādento dasanijjaravatthūni abhiññāya dasaasekkhadhamme adhigacchatī”ti
analyzed: āvasitu kāmaḥ dasa saññāḥ uppādentaḥ dasa nijjara vatthūni abhiññāya dasa asekkha dhamme adhigacchati iti
translated: attains the ten dhammas of one beyond training.

original: tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ovādaṃ matthakaṃ pāpento desanaṃ niṭṭhapesi. Pamodavasena paṭiggaṇhanaṃ
analyzed: tesam bhikkhūnam ovādam matthakam pāpentaḥ desanam niṭṭhapesi pamoda vasena paṭiggaṇhanaṃ
translated: Thus he brought the exhortation to the bhikkhus to a conclusion and ended his teaching.

original: abhinandananti āha “sādhu sādhūti abhinandantā sirasā sampaṭicchiṃsū”ti. Tāya attamanatāyāti🔽tāya yathādesitadesanāgatāya pahaṭṭhacittatāya, tattha yathāladdhaatthavedadhammavedehīti🔽attho. Imameva suttaṃ āvajjamānāti imasmiṃ sutte tattha tattha āgate abhiññeyyādibhede
analyzed: āha sādhu sādhu iti abhinandantā sirasā tāya atta manatāya ati  tāya yathā desita desanā gatāya pahaṭṭha citta tāya tattha yathā laddha attha veda dhamma vedehi iti  attho imam eva suttam āvajjamānā ati imasmin sutte tattha tattha āgate abhiññeyya ādi bhede
translated: and they approved, saying “Good, good!” and they agreed with their heads,🔽“With the gladness that arose in them” means with the gladness that arose in them when the Dhamma was taught to them in this way.🔽“Having understood the meaning and the Dhamma” means having understood the meaning and the Dhamma as they were taught.

original: dhamme abhijānanādivasena samannāharantā. Saha paṭisambhidāhi…pe… patiṭṭhahiṃsūti
analyzed: dhamme abhijānana ādi vasena samannāharantā saha paṭisambhidā āhipe patiṭṭhahiṃsu iti
translated: “Contemplating this very discourse” means contemplating the Dhamma taught in this discourse, which is divided into the categories of what is to be directly known, etc.,🔽by way of directly knowing it, etc.

original: attano upanissayasampannatāya, therassa ca desanānubhāvena yathāraddhaṃ vipassanaṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ upanissaya sampanna tāya therassa ca desanā anubhāvena yathā āraddham vipassanam
translated: “They attained the analytical knowledges” means that, by virtue of their own possession of the supporting conditions and the Elder’s power of teaching, they aroused insight

original: ussukketvā paṭisambhidāparivārāya abhiññāya saṇṭhahiṃsūti.
analyzed: ussukketvā paṭisambhidā parivārāya abhiññāya saṇṭhahiṃsu iti
translated: and attained the analytical knowledges, which are surrounded by the direct knowledges.

original: Sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāya🔽Dasuttarasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca pāthikavaggaṭṭhakathāya līnatthappakāsanā.🔽Pāthikavaggaṭīkā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathāya               niṭṭhitā ca pāthika vagga ṭṭhakathāya līna attha ppakāsanā  pāthika vagga ṭīkā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the meaning of the difficult passages in the Long Discourses🔽is finished.🔽The commentary on the meaning of the difficult passages in the Pāṭika Vagga is finished.🔽The commentary on the Pāṭika Vagga is finished.

original: Nigamanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nigamana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Discourse on the Invitation” is finished.

original: Therānaṃ mahākassapādīnaṃ vaṃso paveṇī anvayo etassāti theravaṃsanvayo, tena; catumahānikāyesu theriyenāti attho.
analyzed: therānam mahākassapa ādīnam vaṃsaḥ paveṇī anvayaḥ etassa ati thera vaṃsa nvayaḥ tena catu mahā nikāyesu theriyena ati attho
translated: The lineage, the succession, the continuity of the Elders, of the Great Elders such as Kassapa, is the Theravāda. By that he means the lineage of the Elders in the four great Nikāyas.

original: Dasabalassa sammāsambuddhassa guṇagaṇānaṃ paridīpanato dasabalaguṇagaṇaparidīpanassa.
analyzed: dasabalassa sammāsambuddhassa guṇa gaṇānam paridīpanataḥ dasa bala guṇa gaṇa paridīpanassa
translated: Because it shows the multitude of qualities of the One of Ten Powers, the Fully Enlightened One, is the Dasabala-guṇa-gaṇa-paridīpana.

original: Ayañhi āgamo brahmajālādīsu, mahāpadānādīsu, sampasādanīyādīsu ca tattha tattha visesato
analyzed: ayan hi āgamaḥ brahmajāla ādīsu mahāpadāna ādīsu sampasādanīya ādīsu ca tattha tattha visesato
translated: For this tradition is found in the Brahmajāla, the Mahāpadāna, the Sampasādanīya, and so on, and in each place it is

original: buddhaguṇānaṃ pakāsanavasena pavattoti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ ādito “saddhāvahaguṇassā”ti.
analyzed: buddha guṇānam pakāsana vasena pavattaḥ ti tathā hi vuttam āditas saddhā vaha guṇassa ti
translated: preached in order to show the qualities of the Buddha. Thus it is said at the beginning: “The essence of the qualities which attract faith.”

original: Mahāṭṭhakathāya sāranti dīghanikāyamahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ atthasāraṃ.
analyzed: mahā aṭṭhakathāya dīgha nikāya mahā aṭṭhakathāyam attha sāram
translated: The essence of the meaning of the Great Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya is the Mahāṭṭhakathāya sāra.

original: Ekūnasaṭṭhimattoti thokaṃ ūnabhāvato matta-saddaggahaṇaṃ.🔽Mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāranti pubbe vuttaṃ dīghanikāyamahāaṭṭhakathāsārameva puna nigamanavasena
analyzed: thokam ūna bhāvataḥ matta sadda gahaṇam  mūlaka ṭṭhakathā sāram ti pubbe vuttam dīgha nikāya mahā aṭṭhakathā sāram eva puna nigamana vasena
translated: The word matta, “just,” is used because of the slight deficiency.🔽The essence of the meaning of the root commentary is the Mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāra. By this he repeats the essence of the Great Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya mentioned above.

original: vadati. Atha vā mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāranti porāṇaṭṭhakathāsu atthasāraṃ, tenetaṃ dasseti
analyzed: vadati atha vā mūlaka ṭṭhakathā sāram ti porāṇa aṭṭhakathāsu attha sāram tena itam dasseti
translated: Or else, the essence of the meaning of the ancient commentaries is the Mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāra. By this he shows that

original: “dīghanikāyamahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ atthasāraṃ ādāya imaṃ sumaṅgalavilāsiniṃ karonto sesamahānikāyānampi
analyzed: attha sāram ādāya imam sumaṅgalavilāsinim karonto sesa mahā nikāyānam pi
translated: “Having taken the essence of the meaning from the Great Commentary on the Long Collection, I, who am making this Sumangalavilāsinī,

original: mūlakaṭṭhakathāsu idha viniyogakkhamaṃ atthasāraṃ ādāyayeva akāsi”nti.🔽“Mahāvihāravāsīna”nti [mahāvihāre nivāsinaṃ (aṭṭhakathāyaṃ)] ca idaṃ purimapacchimapadehi
analyzed: mūlaka ṭṭhakathāsu idha viniyoga khamam attha sāram akāsinti  mahāvihāra vāsīnam ti mahāvihāre nivāsinam ca idam purima pacchima padehi
translated: “Having taken the essence of the meaning from the Great Commentary on the Dīghanikāya, he composed this Sumangalavilāsinī, and he also took the essence of the meaning from the root commentaries on the other Nikāyas, which was suitable to be applied here.”

original: saddhiṃ sambandhitabbaṃ “mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ samayaṃ pakāsayantiṃ, mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ
analyzed: saddhim sambandhitabbam mahā vihāra vāsīnam samayam pakāsayantim mahā vihāra vāsīnam
translated: “The residents of the Great Monastery” [in the commentary] should be connected with the words that precede and follow it: “announcing the time of the residents of the Great Monastery,

original: mūlakaṭṭhakathāsāraṃ ādāyā”ti ca. Tena puññena. Hotu sabbo sukhī lokoti kāmāvacarādivibhāgo
analyzed: mūlaka ṭṭhakathā sāram ādāya ati ca tena puññena hotu sabbaḥ sukhī loko ti kāmāvacara ādi vibhāgaḥ
translated: taking the essence of the root commentaries of the residents of the Great Monastery.” By that merit. May the whole world be happy: the division into the sense-sphere and so on

original: sabbopi sattaloko yathārahaṃ bodhittayādhigamanavasena sampattena nibbānasukhena
analyzed: sabbaḥ api satta lokaḥ yathāraham bodhi ttayā adhigamana vasena sampattena nibbāna sukhena
translated: may the whole world of beings be happy with the happiness of Nibbāna, which is attained according to their ability, by means of the attainment of the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: sukhito hotūti sadevakassa lokassa accantasukhādhigamāya attano puññaṃ pariṇāmeti.
analyzed: sukhitaḥ hotu uti sa devakassa lokassa accanta sukha adhigamāya attano puññam pariṇāmeti
translated: He dedicates his own merit for the attainment of supreme happiness by the world of gods and men.

original: Parimāṇato sādhikaṭṭhavīsasahassanavutibhāṇavārā niṭṭhitāti. Parimāṇato sādhikaṭṭhavīsasahassamattaganthena dīghanikāyaṭīkā racitācariyadhammapālena.
analyzed: parimāṇato sādhika ṭṭha vīsa sahassa navuti bhāṇa vārā niṭṭhitā ati parimāṇato sādhika ṭṭha vīsa sahassa matta ganthena dīgha nikāya ṭīkā racitā ācariya dhammapālena
translated: In extent it is completed with 12,340 lines.🔽The Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya has been composed by the teacher Dhammapāla, in a text of 12,340 lines.🔽For the purpose of guarding the treasure of virtue and the rest,

original: Micchādiṭṭhādicorehi, sīlādidhanasañcayaṃ;
analyzed: micchādiṭṭha ādi corehi sīla ādi dhana sañcayam
translated: which is stored up against the thieves of wrong view and the rest,

original: Rakkhaṇatthāya sakkaccaṃ, mañjūsaṃ viya kāritanti. (etthantare pāṭho pacchā likhito)🔽Niṭṭhitā sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāya līnatthappakāsanā.
analyzed: rakkhaṇa atthāya sakkaccam mañjūsam viya kāritanti etthantare pāṭhaḥ pacchā likhito  niṭṭhitā sumaṅgalavilāsiniyā dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathāya līna attha ppakāsanā
translated: it has been composed with care, as if it were a fence.🔽The explanation of the meaning of the words of the Sumangalavilāsinī Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya is finished.

original: Dīghanikāyaṭīkā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dīgha nikāya ṭīkā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya is finished.
